title: Chicken breasts pizzaiola
ingredients: ½ tsp salt, adjust to taste
½ tsp ground black pepper, adjust to taste
200 g Edam cheese or other semi-hard cheese (e.g. Gruyère, Emmental, fontina), cut in pieces
600 g chopped tomatoes, canned or fresh
1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)  o 1 heaped tsp stock paste, homemade
steps: Place chicken breasts in Varoma dish, season with salt and pepper and set aside.
Place Edam cheese in mixing bowl and grate 5-10 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Preheat oven to 200°C.
Place olive oil, onions and garlic cloves in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5, then sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add tomatoes, stock cube and sugar, set Varoma in position and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Place chicken breasts in a baking dish, cover with tomato sauce and reserved grated Edam cheese and sprinkle with oregano. Bake for 10 minutes (200°C) or until cheese becomes golden brown. Serve hot.
tips: Serve with potatoes, vegetables or rice: steam potatoes (cut in small cubes) or vegetables (e.g. broccoli, cut in florets) together with chicken in Varoma. Or cook rice in Thermomix® while chicken is baking.

title: Lasagne bolognese
ingredients: 100 - 200 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces (3 cm)
200 g mixed vegetables (celery stalk, carrots and onions), cut in pieces
800 g mixed minced meat (half pork and half beef)
½ - 1 tsp ground black pepper, to taste
250 g dried lasagne pasta, approx. 12 sheets (10 cm x 20 cm)
steps: Place Parmesan cheese in mixing bowl and grate 15 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place mixed vegetables and extra virgin olive oil in mixing bowl. Chop 5 sec/speed 7, then sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add mixed minced meat, stir using spatula to break it up if necessary and sauté 8 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add dry white wine and cook 5 min/Varoma//speed 1.
Add crushed tomatoes, salt and black pepper and cook 20 min/100°C//speed . Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place milk, butter, flour, salt and nutmeg to mixing bowl and cook 12 min/100°C/speed 3.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Lightly grease a baking dish (approx. 30 cm x 24 cm x 6 cm) and set aside.

Cover base of baking dish with a thin layer of Bolognese sauce. Place a layer of dried lasagne pasta sheets over the sauce, cover with another layer of Bolognese sauce, sprinkle with some of the Parmesan cheese and cover with a layer of béchamel sauce. Repeat this step until all ingredients are used. Finish with a layer of béchamel sauce, sprinkle with remaining Parmesan cheese and dot with small pieces of butter.
Bake for 30-40 minutes (180°C). Allow lasagne to rest for 15-20 minutes before cutting into squares and serving.
tips: This is a good dish for entertaining guests as it can be prepared ahead of time and baked when guests arrive.

Usually dried lasagne pasta sheets do not need to be boiled before baking (check packet instructions). If you prefer cooking the pasta in the traditional method, pre-cook lasagne pasta sheets in a large saucepan of salted boiling water (approx. 1 tsp salt per litre of water) for approx. 5 minutes. Drain in Varoma dish and blot excess moisture by placing lasagne pasta sheets in a single layer on top of a tea towel. Prepare the pasta while the béchamel sauce is cooking.
Leftovers keep well in the freezer.
To use freshly minced meat, freeze pieces (3 cm) of sinew-free meat in a single layer for 30 minutes. Place partially-frozen meat in mixing bowl and mince 10-15 sec/speed 6.
Instead of dried lasagne pasta sheets use homemade fresh egg pasta.

title: American-style pancakes
ingredients: 50 g butter, unsalted, plus extra for frying
steps: Place butter in mixing bowl and melt 2 min/70°C/speed 1.
Add milk, eggs, sugar, plain flour, baking powder and salt and mix 10 sec/speed 5.

To cook pancakes, heat ½ tsp butter in a frying pan over medium heat. For each pancake, pour in a ladle of batter and cook 1-2 minutes or until bubbles start bursting on pancake surface. Turn pancake over and cook for a further 1 minute. Place pancake on a serving plate and cover to keep warm. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve hot.
tips: Serve pancakes with maple syrup, whipped cream, chocolate, caramel sauce or jam.
To replace butter with oil, omit step 1 and add 50 g oil along with all other ingredients in step 2. Use oil instead of butter for frying.
Blueberry or raspberry pancakes: scatter 1 tbsp berries on each pancake right after pouring batter into pan, before bubbles start to form.
Chocolate pancakes: add 2 tsp cocoa powder in step 2.

title: Mashed potatoes
ingredients: 1000 g floury potatoes, peeled, cut in slices (0.5 cm, see tip)
steps: Insert butterfly whisk. Place potatoes, salt and milk in mixing bowl and cook without measuring cup 30-35 min/95°C//speed 1.
Add butter and nutmeg, insert measuring cup and mash 30 sec/speed 3. Remove butterfly whisk and serve hot.
tips: The best potato purée is achieved using floury potatoes.
Cooking and mashing time can be adjusted according to the variety of potatoes used and desired texture.
Check that potatoes are very tender before mashing. If they still seem firm, cook for the additional 5 minutes.
If you prefer pieces in your mashed potatoes, mash only 15-20 sec/speed 3 in step 2.
If you prefer a more liquid purée, add 100 g milk in step 2.
Italian-style potato purée: prepare the potato purée using only ½ tsp salt in step 1 and add 30 g grated Parmesan cheese in step 2.

title: Vegetable stock paste
ingredients: 50 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces (3 cm) (opcional)
200 g celery stalks, cut in pieces
6 sprigs mixed fresh herbs (e.g. basil, sage, rosemary), leaves only
30 g dry white wine  o 30 g water
steps: Place Parmesan cheese in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place celery stalks, carrots, onions, tomatoes, courgettes, garlic clove, fresh mushrooms, dried bay leaf, mixed fresh herbs and parsley in mixing bowl and chop with aid of spatula 10 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add coarse salt, dry white wine and olive oil. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid and cook 25-30 min/Varoma/speed 2. Mixture will become thick and fairly dry.

Remove simmering basket, add reserved Parmesan cheese, insert measuring cup and blend 1 min/speed 4-7, increasing speed gradually. Transfer to an air-tight jar and allow to cool before using or storing in refrigerator.
tips: If vegetables are very fresh (and therefore have a high water content), cook for 30 minutes in step 3.
1 heaped tsp stock paste is roughly equivalent to 1 shop-bought vegetable stock cube for 0.5 l.
To make vegetable stock, use 1 heaped tsp per 500 g water.
Stock paste keeps in the refrigerator for several months.
The salt in this recipe is used as the preserving agent. When mixed with water as described above, the stock does not taste too salty.
If you wish to decrease the salt in the recipe, you must store the stock paste in the freezer.
Adapt the stock paste recipe using the natural ingredients of your choice.
Add more mushrooms for a vegetable stock paste with a stronger mushroom flavour.

title: Spaghetti carbonara
ingredients: 60 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces
steps: Place Parmesan and pecorino cheese in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place shallot in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add bacon cubes and extra virgin olive oil and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Transfer to a large serving bowl and keep warm.
Place water and ½ tsp salt in mixing bowl and bring to the boil 10 min/100°C/speed 1.

Add spaghetti through hole in mixing bowl lid and cook without measuring cup time indicated on packet/100°C//speed 1 or until al dente. Drain spaghetti through Varoma dish and transfer to serving bowl with bacon. Mix well and keep warm.

Before pasta has a chance to cool, place eggs, egg yolk, reserved grated cheese, ¼ tsp salt and black pepper in mixing bowl and mix 15 sec/speed 4. Add egg mixture to serving bowl with pasta and bacon. Combine thoroughly using spatula and serve immediately.
tips: If water bubbles on mixing bowl lid while pasta is cooking, add 1 tsp oil or butter to the cooking water to reduce frothing.
Pasta that is cooked al dente is tender but still firm to the bite.
The heat of the cooked pasta will partially cook and thicken the egg, so it is important the pasta is still hot when adding the egg mixture to the serving bowl.
To ensure the eggs are not overcooked and the sauce is creamy, in step 6 you can rinse the mixing bowl in cold water to cool it off before adding the eggs.

title: Chocolate custard
ingredients: 150 g dark chocolate, 70% cocoa solids, cut in pieces (see tip)
steps: Place chocolate in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10.
Add milk, sugar, cornflour and eggs and cook 12 min/90°C/speed 3.
Add butter and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer immediately to individual dessert bowls and allow to cool. Refrigerate for at least one hour before serving.
tips: Adjust amount of chocolate to your taste: 120 g for a milder flavour, 180 g for a rich chocolate dessert.
If using chocolate with a lower cocoa percentage, decrease sugar amount as desired.
For a pouring custard, omit cornflour.

title: Five-seed bread
ingredients: 2 tsp dried instant yeast (8 g)  o 20 g fresh yeast
30 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for greasing
150 g mixed seeds (sesame, linseed, sunflower, pumpkin, poppy), plus extra for sprinkling (see tip)
steps: Place water and yeast in mixing bowl and warm 2 min 30 sec/37°C/speed 2. Meanwhile, grease a loaf tin (approx. 30 cm x 12 cm x 10 cm) and set aside.
Add bread flour, salt, rolled oats, mixed seeds, honey and extra virgin olive oil in mixing bowl and knead Dough /2 min 30 sec. Dough will have a wet and sticky consistency (see tip).
Transfer dough to prepared loaf tin and sprinkle with extra mixed seeds. Let rise uncovered in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 45-60 minutes). Meanwhile, preheat oven to 200°C.
Bake for 40-45 minutes (200°C). Allow to cool in tin for 5 minutes. Transfer to a cooling rack and allow to cool before slicing.
tips: Use equal amounts (30 g each) of the different seeds or adjust proportions to your preference.
This dough is very sticky, but there is no need to add more flour as the wet dough produces a crunchy crust and moist crumb.

title: Sandwich bread
ingredients: 30 g butter, plus extra for greasing
1 tsp dried instant yeast (4 g)  o 10 g fresh yeast
steps: Grease a loaf tin (approx. 30 cm x 12 cm x 10 cm) and set aside.
Place water, dried yeast, brown sugar and butter in mixing bowl and mix 1 min/37°C/speed 2.

Add flour and salt and knead Dough /3 min. Transfer dough to a large bowl, cover with a damp tea towel and allow to rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour). Divide dough into 3 parts, form each into a ball and place them in prepared loaf tin. Cover with damp tea towel and allow to rise again in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour). Meanwhile, preheat oven to 180°C.
Bake for 30 minutes (180°C). Remove loaf from tin and allow to cool on a cooling rack before slicing.
tips: Enjoy fresh or toasted with butter and jam or another spread.
For a nice colour brush with milk before baking.

Wholemeal sandwich bread: Before starting the recipe, place 250 g wheat grains in mixing bowl and grind 1 min/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl, set aside and proceed with the recipe, using only 250 g bread flour plus the reserved ground wheat flour, and a total of 270 g water instead of 240 g.

title: Lentil moussaka
ingredients: 120 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces
1 pepper, green or red, cut in pieces (approx. 150 g)
40 g butter, plus extra for greasing
steps: Place red split lentils and 500 g water in a bowl and soak for 1 hour.
Place Parmesan cheese in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Cut aubergines in slices (1 cm thick) and place in Varoma dish. Make sure that some holes in the Varoma dish remain unobstructed so that steam passes through. Set Varoma aside.
Place olive oil, onions, garlic cloves and green or red pepper in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Add tomatoes and chop 2 sec/speed 5.
Add red wine, oregano, ginger, salt and black pepper in mixing bowl. Set Varoma in position and steam 20 min/Varoma//speed 1. Set Varoma aside.

Add drained red lentils and cook 8 min/100°C//speed 2. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 200°C and grease a baking dish. Arrange all aubergine slices in baking dish and cover them with lentil mixture. No need to clean mixing bowl.
Place butter, milk and flour in mixing bowl and cook 8 min/90°C/speed 4.

Add 60 g reserved grated Parmesan cheese to sauce and mix 5 sec/speed 4. Cover lentil layer with sauce and sprinkle with remaining grated Parmesan cheese. Bake moussaka for 30 minutes (200°C). Cut moussaka in squares and serve hot.
tips: Instead of soaked red lentils you can use pre-cooked brown lentils.

title: Creamy mushroom soup
ingredients: 400 g button mushrooms, cut in halves or quaters as needed
1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)  o 1 heaped tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade
steps: Place button mushrooms in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 4.
Add water, milk, vegetable stock cube, flour and salt and cook 10 min/100°C/speed 3.
Add cream, parsley and cream cheese and cook 2 min/90°C/speed 2.
Blend 1 min/speed 4-7, increasing speed gradually. Serve hot.
tips: Garnish with a few fried button mushrooms slices.

title: Cauliflower cheese
ingredients: 200 g Gruyère cheese, cut in pieces  o 200 g Cheddar cheese, cut in pieces
½ tsp salt, plus extra to taste
2 pinches ground white pepper, plus extra to taste
steps: Place Gruyère cheese in mixing bowl and grate 8 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place water in mixing bowl and cauliflower florets in Varoma dish. Set Varoma in position and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside and empty mixing bowl.
Place flour, butter, milk, salt and pepper in mixing bowl and cook 7 min/90°C/speed 3.
Add nutmeg and 70 g reserved grated Gruyère cheese and mix 5 sec/speed 5. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Preheat oven grill to 200°C.

Arrange cauliflower in a baking dish, cover with sauce and sprinkle with remaining grated Gruyère cheese. Place under the grill for approx. 10 minutes (200°C) or until golden brown. Serve immediately.
tips: For a heartier dish, add hard-boiled eggs, cut in halves. Arrange them in the baking dish with the cauliflower before covering with sauce. You can cook the eggs 15 min/Varoma/speed 1 in the simmering basket while steaming the cauliflower.

title: Asian Stir Fry with Noodles (Metric)
ingredients: 45 g sesame oil, divided, plus 1 tbsp to boil
600 g beef tenderloin, in strips (5 cm x 1 cm x 1 cm), divided, dried with paper towels
60 g green onions, in pieces (5 cm)
140 g red bell peppers, julienned (5 cm x 0.5 cm)
100 g carrots, julienned (5 cm x 0.5 cm)
steps: Place first bowl into position. Place sesame seeds and cumin seeds into mixing bowl and without measuring cup roast 3 min/120°C/speed 1. Insert measuring cup and grind 5 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a large bowl.
Place bowl with ground spices onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in 140 g water, soy sauce, sugar and corn starch, mix well and set aside.
Place 15 g sesame oil and 300 g beef tenderloin into mixing bowl and sauté High Temp. . Transfer to a bowl, set aside and keep warm.
Place 15 g sesame oil and 300 g beef tenderloin into mixing bowl and sauté High Temp. . Transfer to the bowl with reserved sautéed beef, set aside and keep warm.
Place 15 g sesame oil, garlic and ginger into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and chop 4 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add green onions, red peppers and carrots and sauté High Temp. .
Add reserved sauce and without measuring cup cook 5 min/120°C//speed . Add reserved beef and mix well with spatula. Set mixing bowl aside and keep warm.
Place second bowl into position. Place 1220 g water and 1 tbsp sesame oil into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and boil Kettle /95°C. Remove simmering basket and set aside
Add noodles and without measuring cup, cook for time indicated on package/100°C//speed . Drain cooked noodles through Varoma dish.
Transfer noodles to a serving platter, combine with reserved sautéed meat and vegetables and mix with spatula. Serve hot.
tips: For a vegetarian dish, omit the beef.

title: Fragrant Chicken Curry (Metric)
ingredients: 170 g English cucumbers, peeled and diced (2 cm)
910 g chicken thighs, skinless, bone in, skin on, air-chilled
910 g water  o 910 g vegetable broth
parsley leaf, fresh, to garnish  o cilantro, fresh, to garnish
steps: Place peanuts and mint leaves into mixing bowl and chop 8 sec/speed 4.
Add cucumber and salt and mix 3 sec/speed 1. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place turmeric, cayenne, salt, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, peppercorns, dried chilies, coriander, cumin and curry leaves into mixing bowl, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and toast 6 min/120°C/speed 1. Carefully remove simmering basket, insert measuring cup into mixing bowl lid and grind 1 min/speed 10. Scrape down lid and sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add garlic and ginger and chop 6 sec/speed 10. Scrape down lid and sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add onions and vegetable oil and chop 3 sec/speed 4. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 8 min/120°C/speed 1. Carefully remove simmering basket and set aside.
Add tomatoes, insert measuring cup and blend 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add chicken thighs and tomato paste, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 18 min/100°C//speed 0.5. Carefully remove simmering basket and set aside.
Add peanut butter, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 4 min/120°C//speed 0.5. Transfer to a bowl and keep warm. Clean mixing bowl.

Place water, turmeric and salt into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and weigh in rice. Remove simmering basket with spatula and rinse rice under cool water until water runs clear. Place simmering basket with rinsed rice into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and cook 20 min/100°C/speed 4. Transfer rice into a serving dish and toss with butter. Serve Yellow Rice with Chicken Curry and Cucumber Salad and garnish with parsley leaves.
tips: For a vegetarian version replace chicken with potatoes, cut into 5 cm cubes, increase vegetable stock to 225 g and reduce tomato paste to 30 g.

title: Tomato sauce
ingredients: ½ tsp salt, adjust to taste
steps: Place onions, garlic clove and extra virgin olive oil in mixing bowl. Chop 5 sec/speed 5, then sauté 7 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add tomatoes, sugar, salt and basil. Cook 20 min/100°C/speed 2. Serve hot with pasta or as a sauce for vegetables.
tips: Fresh tomato sauce: instead of crushed tomatoes, use 800 g fresh plum tomatoes, cut in pieces. After adding the ingredients in step 2, chop 15 sec/speed 5 and proceed with recipe, extending cooking time to 30 minutes and placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid to help prevent splashing.

title: Meatballs with tomato sauce
ingredients: 40 g bread, fresh or stale, cut in pieces
6 - 12 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
steps: Place a small bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh in bread and milk. Set bowl aside and leave to soak.
Place parsley and garlic clove in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add beef mince, eggs, salt and black pepper. Squeeze milk out of bread and discard milk. Add bread to mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl.
Grease the Varoma dish and tray. With oiled hands, shape small meatballs (Ø 4 cm) and place them in Varoma dish and tray. Set aside.
Place garlic clove, onions and extra virgin olive oil in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5, then sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add crushed tomatoes, salt and black pepper. Set Varoma in position and cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Serve meatballs hot with sauce.
tips: Use any white or light crusty bread such as baguette, ciabatta, country bread, whole wheat bread or bread rolls.
Serve meatballs with rice or steamed potatoes.
Part or all of the beef mince can be replaced with minced veal, pork or chicken.
Add 50 g grated Parmesan cheese in step 2.
If using fresh tomatoes, add them in step 6 and crush them 7 sec/speed 6 before continuing as directed by the recipe.

title: Chocolate chip cookies
ingredients: 140 g dark chocolate, cut in pieces
130 g butter, unsalted, cut in pieces
2 tsp vanilla sugar, homemade  o 1 tsp natural vanilla extract
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line two baking trays with baking paper and set aside.
Place dark chocolate in mixing bowl and chop 3-6 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place butter, sugar, brown sugar, egg and vanilla sugar in mixing bowl and mix 2 min/speed 3.
Add flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt and mix 40 sec/speed 4.

Add reserved chopped chocolate and stir 30 sec/speed 2. Using 2 teaspoons, form dough into walnut-size balls and place them 5 cm apart on prepared baking trays. Bake one baking tray after another for 10-12 minutes (180°C) until cookies are golden brown. Allow to cool on a cooling rack before serving or storing in an air-tight container.
tips: In step 5, add approx. 30 g chopped nuts or raisins in addition to chocolate.

title: Chicken garam masala
ingredients: 1 tbsp cumin seeds  o 1 tbsp caraway seeds
¾ tsp salt, adjust to taste
500 g chicken breast fillets, skinless, cut in cubes (3 cm)
steps: Place black peppercorns, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, nutmeg, cloves, cardamom, cinnamon and bay leaf in mixing bowl and grind 40 sec/speed 10. Transfer to an air-tight jar and set aside.
Place crushed tomatoes, sour cream, butter and sugar in mixing bowl. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid and cook 12 min/100°C/speed 2.
Add salt and 2 tbsp reserved garam masala spice mix. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid and cook 3 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Add chicken breasts to mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and cook 6 min/100°C//speed . Adjust seasoning to taste and serve hot.
tips: Serve with basmati or plain rice and sprinkle with parsley.
Serve with plain yoghurt if you wish to tone down the spiciness.
Reserve the rest of the garam masala spice mix for another curry recipe.
For a faster version replace the garam masala spice mix with a shop-bought version.

title: Chocolate ice cream
ingredients: 100 g dark chocolate, 70% cocoa solids, cut in pieces
steps: Place dark chocolate in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add cocoa powder, whole milk, cream, sugar, egg yolks and salt and cook 8 min/90°C/speed 2. Pour mixture up to 4 cm high into shallow freezable containers (e.g. aluminium, silicone) and cover with cling film. Allow mixture to cool completely before freezing for at least 10 hours.

Place frozen mixture in refrigerator for 15 minutes, then cut in pieces (4 cm x 4 cm) using a long sharp knife. Place half the pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix with aid of spatula 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer ice cream to a bowl.
Place remaining frozen cream pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix with aid of spatula 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer to bowl with ice cream and serve immediately.
tips: For a firmer consistency, place the ice cream in the freezer for 15 minutes before serving.
Garnish with chopped pistachio nuts, coconut flakes or chocolate drops.
Top with whipped cream and chocolate or fruit sauce.
For a spicy chocolate ice cream add some ground cayenne pepper in step 1.

title: Milk bread
ingredients: 50 g butter, cut in pieces, plus some extra for greasing
20 g fresh yeast, crumbled  o 2 tsp dried instant yeast (8 g)
steps: Lightly grease a large bowl and set aside. Place milk, butter, fresh yeast and sugar in mixing bowl and warm 3 min/37°C/speed 2.
Add bread flour and salt and knead Dough /3 min. Place dough in prepared bowl, cover with cling film or a damp tea towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour).

Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside. Divide dough into 3 pieces and roll each piece into a rope (approx. 45 cm). Join the 3 ropes at one end, plait, and join again at the other end. Place plait on prepared baking tray, cover with cling film or a damp tea towel and let rise again in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 30 minutes). Meanwhile, preheat oven to 180°C.
Brush with whisked egg and bake for 25-30 minutes (180°C) or until bread sounds hollow when tapped on the underside. Allow to cool on a cooling rack before slicing.
tips: Milk bread, or Zopf, is traditionally served in Switzerland on Sunday mornings for breakfast.
The dough will be slightly sticky. If the dough seems very wet after step 2, add a tablespoon of flour and knead a further 30 sec/.
Sprinkle with flaked almonds or pearl sugar after brushing with egg.
One minute before the end of the kneading in step 2, add 80 g raisins.
Form dough into small men. Use raisins for eyes and buttons.

title: Butter biscuits
ingredients: 100 g sugar, plus extra for dipping
100 g butter, unsalted, cut in pieces
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.
Place flour, sugar, butter, egg and baking powder in mixing bowl and mix 20 sec/speed 6.

Place some sugar on a plate. Pinch together 1 tbsp dough and roll into a small ball (approx. Ø 3 cm). Dip the top in sugar, place on prepared baking tray and flatten using a fork into a round biscuit shape. Repeat with remaining dough and bake for 20 minutes (180°C) or until light golden. Allow to cool on a cooling rack before serving or storing in an air-tight container.
tips: In step 2, add natural flavours such as vanilla sugar, lemon zest, orange zest, ground cinnamon or chopped candied ginger.

title: Indian vegetable curry
ingredients: 15 g fresh ginger, cut in thin slices
1 fresh red chilli, small, deseeded, cut in pieces
1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)  o 1 heaped tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade
600 g waxy potatoes, peeled, cut in pieces (2-3 cm)
150 g carrots, cut in slices (1 cm)
150 g courgettes, cut in slices (1 cm)
steps: Place coriander, cumin, cardamom and mustard seeds in mixing bowl and toast 6 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add onions, garlic cloves, ginger and red chilli and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add olive oil and sauté 6 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add turmeric, coconut milk, water, vegetable stock cube and salt and blend 1 min/speed 10.
Add potatoes and carrots and cook 10 min/100°C//speed . Meanwhile, insert Varoma tray in Varoma dish and place cauliflower, courgettes and frozen green peas on Varoma tray.
Set Varoma in position and cook 12 min/Varoma//speed 1.
Remove Varoma, add vegetables from Varoma tray to mixing bowl and cook 2 min/100°C//speed . Transfer curry to a bowl, garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.
tips: Use other vegetables such as broccoli, green beans, peppers or pumpkin.

title: Chocolate mousse
ingredients: 200 g dark chocolate, min. 50 % cocoa, cut in pieces
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add dark chocolate and cream and melt 4 min/50°C/speed 2.
Add egg yolks to mixing bowl and mix 15 sec/speed 4. Transfer mixture to a medium size bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl thoroughly.

Insert butterfly whisk. Place egg whites and salt in mixing bowl and whisk 3 min/speed 3.5 or until stiff. Remove butterfly whisk, then add whisked egg whites to reserved chocolate mixture and carefully fold in using spatula. Pour into 6 individual dessert bowls and refrigerate for at least 3 hours before serving.
tips: For a darker mousse, use chocolate with 70 % cocoa.
Add 2-3 tsp orange-flavoured liqueur or rum in step 3.
Fold in finely grated orange zest or chocolate chips in step 4, after folding in the egg whites.

title: Asian-style rice with eggs and vegetables
ingredients: 20 g light sesame oil  o 20 g peanut oil
150 g carrots, cut in large pieces (4 cm)
1 stock cube (for 0.5 l) (opcional)  o 1 heaped tsp stock paste, homemade (opcional)
350 g white short-grain rice (18-20 minutes cooking time)  o 350 g white long-grain rice (18-20 minutes cooking time)
400 g mixed vegetables (e.g. broccoli in small florets, frozen green peas, cauliflower in small florets, green beans cut in pieces, courgettes cut in pieces)
steps: Place light sesame oil and onions in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5.
Add carrots and chop roughly 2 sec/speed 4.5.
Add bacon cubes, soy sauce and sugar and sauté without measuring cup 7 min/120°C/speed . Transfer to a large serving bowl, cover and set aside.

Place stock cube in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and weigh rice into it. Add water over rice to mixing bowl. Set Varoma in position, weigh vegetables into it and close Varoma lid. Steam 13 min/Varoma/speed 2. Meanwhile, line Varoma tray with damp baking paper. Whisk eggs in a small bowl.
Carefully open Varoma, stir vegetables to ensure even cooking, insert prepared Varoma tray and place whisked eggs in it. Steam 7-8 min/Varoma/speed 2.

Remove Varoma, remove simmering basket using spatula and transfer rice and vegetables to serving bowl with reserved bacon mixture. Using the spatula, cut eggs in squares (2-3 cm) in the Varoma tray and transfer in to serving bowl. Using the spatula, combine all ingredients in serving bowl and serve hot.
tips: This dish can be varied endlessly depending on the vegetables you have on hand. Place the vegetables that require the longest cooking time first in the Varoma dish, and the others a few minutes later.

If one ingredient isn’t fully cooked, transfer the others to the serving bowl and continue to steam remaining ingredient for a few minutes/Varoma/speed 2 before combining with ingredients in serving bowl.
If you only have dark sesame oil (from toasted sesame seeds), use peanut oil or another mild cooking oil in step 1 and add 1 tsp dark sesame oil for flavour. Or omit sesame oil entirely.
Replace the soy sauce and sugar with either 60 g soy paste or 60 g hoisin sauce, or omit entirely.
Use any type of rice, making sure to adapt cooking time according to packet instructions. For instance for basmati rice, reduce steaming time in step 5 to 12 minutes.
You can mix in chopped herbs, spring onions or nuts before serving.

title: Spiced Moroccan lentil soup
ingredients: ¼ tsp ground black pepper, plus extra to taste
2 vegetable stock cubes (each for 0.5 l)  o 2 heaped tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade
2 - 3 sprigs fresh coriander, leaves only, to garnish
steps: Place onions and olive oil in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5, then sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add ginger, coriander, cumin, sweet paprika, black pepper, cinnamon, turmeric, cayenne pepper and nutmeg and cook 1 min/100°C/speed 1 to release the flavours.

Add water, vegetable stock cubes, red lentils and crushed tomatoes and cook 15-20 min/100°C//speed 1 or until lentils are cooked. Season with salt and extra black pepper to taste, garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot.
tips: Serve with fresh crusty bread.
Replace red lentils with green or brown lentils. Check packet for soaking instructions. It may be necessary to increase cooking time in step 3.

title: Chickpea soup with spinach
ingredients: 300 g fresh spinach, roughly chopped as needed
200 g onions, cut in pieces (3 cm)
250 g carrots, cut in pieces (3 cm)
100 g turnips, cut in pieces (3 cm) (opcional)
steps: Place Varoma dish on mixing bowl lid, weigh spinach into it and set aside.
Place dried chickpeas in mixing bowl and grind 30 sec/speed 9.
Add 400 g water and mix 15 sec/speed 4. Scrape bottom of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add remaining 400 g water, salt, onions, olive oil, carrots, garlic cloves, turnips and black pepper. Set Varoma in position and cook 30 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside.
Insert measuring cup and blend 1 min 30 sec/speed 4-8, increasing speed gradually. Add spinach, combine using spatula and serve immediately.
tips: If you prefer to cook spinach only briefly, add it to the Varoma in the last 5-10 minutes of cooking in step 4.
Replace fresh spinach with approx. 150 g frozen spinach. Let it defrost, then squeeze water out with your hands. Add it to the Varoma in the last 5-10 minutes of cooking in step 4.

title: Fresh pasta dough
ingredients: 200 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
steps: Place plain flour, eggs and extra virgin olive oil in mixing bowl and knead Dough /2 min. Dough will appear crumbly. Pat dough into a ball, wrap in cling film and allow to rest for 15 minutes.

Roll out dough on a floured surface into thin (2-3 mm) rectangular shapes, either with a rolling pin or with a pasta machine. Dust pasta lightly with flour to prevent it from sticking. Cut pasta in desired shapes according to the type of pasta you are making: Lasagne or ravioli: cut dough in sheets (approx. 20 cm x 10 cm). Tagliatelle: cut in strips (2 cm x max. 30 cm). Farfalle: cut in small rectangular shapes (2 cm x 5 cm) and pinch centre of each rectangle to form a butterfly shape.
Cook pasta in a large quantity of salted boiling water (approx. 1 tsp salt per litre of water) for 3-4 minutes, depending on shape and thickness of pasta. Serve hot, with sauce as desired.
tips: Serve pasta as a side or main dish with tomato sauce, pesto or your favourite sauce.
Roll out small amounts of dough at a time and cover remaining dough with a damp tea towel to prevent it from drying out.
For best results, after rolling and cutting allow pasta to dry 1-2 hours on a floured cloth-

Green pasta dough: use basic recipe with added 100 g flour and 70 g spinach leaves (fresh, clean and dry; or frozen, defrosted and water squeezed out). Place 300 g flour and spinach leaves in mixing bowl and mix 20 sec/speed 9. Add eggs and oil and knead 2 min/.
Red pasta dough without eggs: instead of 2 eggs, use 100 g tomato juice and proceed as directed by the recipe.
To increase quantity, add 1 extra egg per added 100 g flour. The maximum quantity at any one time is 500 g flour and 5 eggs. Increase kneading time to 3 minutes.

title: Marble cake
ingredients: 300 g butter, unsalted, cut in pieces, plus extra for greasing
370 g flour, plus extra for dusting
1 tsp vanilla sugar, homemade  o ½ tsp natural vanilla extract
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and flour a bundt cake tin (Ø 22-24 cm) and set aside.
Place butter in mixing bowl and mix 40 sec/speed 5.

Add 250 g sugar, vanilla sugar, salt, eggs, flour, baking powder and 40 g milk in mixing bowl then mix 50 sec/speed 5. Transfer half of cake mixture to prepared bundt cake tin, leaving remainder in mixing bowl.
Add cocoa powder, remaining 30 g sugar and remaining 30 g milk in mixing bowl and mix 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Mix a further 5 sec/speed 5.

Layer cocoa cake mixture in bundt cake tin. To create a marble pattern, swirl through both layers using a fork. Bake for 50-60 minutes (180°C). Allow cake to cool in tin for approx. 15 minutes before transferring to a serving plate and leaving to cool completely. Cut in slices and serve.
tips: If butter is very soft, omit step 2 and add the butter with the other ingredients in step 3.
Dust with icing sugar or cover with a chocolate glaze.
Pound cake: Omit cocoa marbling. Simply transfer all the cake mixture from step 3 to prepared bundt cake tin and bake for 50-60 minutes (180°C) as described in step 6.
Flavour the cocoa mixture with ½ tsp rum essence or with 20 g rum. If using rum, reduce milk to 10 g in step 4.

title: Mussels in spicy tomato sauce
ingredients: ½ tsp ground cayenne pepper, adjust to taste  o ½ tsp dried chilli flakes, adjust to taste
1000 g fresh mussels, shells scrubbed and de-bearded
200 g chopped tomatoes, canned or fresh
steps: Place onions and garlic clove in mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add olive oil and cayenne pepper and sauté 7 min/120°C/speed . Meanwhile, scrub and debeard mussels (if necessary) and place them in Varoma dish. Set aside.
Add chopped tomatoes, wine and salt in mixing bowl, set Varoma in position and cook 13 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma, set aside and keep warm.
Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid and reduce sauce 15 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Transfer steamed mussels to a serving bowl, cover with sauce and serve hot.
tips: Discard any mussels which are open before cooking and those that are still closed after cooking.
Adjust quantity of olive oil to personal taste.

Vegetables in spicy tomato sauce: As a vegetarian option make this dish with vegetables instead of mussels. Add 200 g water and some fresh herbs to the mixing bowl, then extend cooking time until vegetables are done.

title: Mango chutney
ingredients: 1 tbsp Sichuan peppercorns  o 2 tsp black peppercorns + 1 tsp finely grated lemon zest
10 g fresh ginger, cut in thin slices
700 g mangoes, flesh only, cut in pieces
steps: Place Sichuan peppercorns in mixing bowl and toast 6 min/Varoma//speed 1, then grind 25 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic cloves and ginger in mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add onions and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place water and raw cane sugar in mixing bowl and cook 5 min/100°C/speed 1.

Add reserved ground Sichuan pepper, reserved ginger-onion mixture, mangoes, vinegar, salt, turmeric and raisins. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid and cook 45 min/100°C/speed 1.

Remove simmering basket, insert measuring cup and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Pour into 2 sterilised jam jars with twist-off lids and close immediately. Turn jam jars upside down for 10 minutes before turning right side up. Allow to cool and serve or store in a cool, dry place.
tips: Serve with cheese or as a condiment for meat or fish or with an Indian curry meal.
After opening, store jar in the refrigerator.
Replace mangoes with apples, pears, plums, apricots or papayas.

title: Mushroom pie
ingredients: 750 g fresh button mushrooms, cut in slices
½ - 1 tsp mixed dried herbs (e.g. herbes de Provence)
½ tsp salt, plus extra to taste
¼ tsp ground black pepper, plus extra to taste
1 ½ tbsp flour (15 g), plus extra for dusting
190 g milk, plus extra for glazing
steps: Place garlic cloves and oil in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Cook 7 min/100°C/speed .
Add 400 g mushrooms, mixed herbs, salt and black pepper in mixing bowl and sauté 5 min/120°C//speed .

Add remaining 350 g mushrooms and cook for a further 5 min/120°C//speed . Transfer to Varoma dish placed in sink and allow to drain (discard cooking liquid or see tip). No need to clean mixing bowl.
Place flour, butter, milk, 2 pinches salt and 1 pinch black pepper in mixing bowl and cook 5 min/90°C/speed 4.

Add reserved drained mushrooms and mix 20 sec//speed . Remove mixing bowl and set aside to cool for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 200°C. Line base of a tart tin (Ø 26 cm) with baking paper and set aside.

Divide puff pastry in 2 equal pieces. Using a rolling pin, roll out one piece of pastry on a lightly floured surface. Line prepared tart tin with the pastry and set aside. Roll out the second piece of pastry and gently score its surface with the point of a sharp knife, making a criss-cross pattern without cutting through the dough. In the centre of the pastry, cut a cross and fold back its corners to create a small opening. Set aside.

Spread partially cooled mushroom and béchamel mixture in pastry-lined tart tin. Cover pie with second pastry disk, seal well around the edges, brush pie surface with milk and bake 30-35 minutes (200°C), or until golden brown. Serve hot or warm.
tips: Instead of discarding cooking liquid from mushrooms in step 4, drain over a bowl and reserve for use as stock in a soup.
Combine button mushrooms with other mushroom varieties (e.g. porcini, chanterelles, crimini, portobello, morels, shiitake).

title: Pumpkin soup
ingredients: 400 g pumpkin flesh, cut in pieces
½ tsp salt, plus extra to taste
steps: Place oil and fresh ginger in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5, then sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add pumpkin, potatoes, cashew nuts, salt, white pepper and water, cook 15 min/100°C/speed 1, then blend 1 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually. Adjust seasoning to taste and serve hot.
tips: Select a mature pumpkin for a more aromatic and sweeter flavour.
For a thinner soup consistency, add 150 g water and blend 20 sec/speed 7.
If using unpeeled pumpkin with seeds extend cooking time by 3-5 minutes in step 2 and blend for one minute longer.

title: Focaccia with onions
ingredients: 20 g olive oil, plus extra for greasing
30 g fresh yeast, crumbled  o 3 tsp dried instant yeast (12 g)
steps: Line a baking tray (approx. 40 cm x 35 cm) with baking paper and grease the baking paper with 2 tbsp olive oil. Set aside.
Place bread flour, fresh yeast, water, 20 g olive oil, sugar and salt in mixing bowl and knead Dough /3 min.

Using oiled spatula transfer dough to prepared baking tray. With oiled hands, form dough into a round shape and cover with a thin coating of olive oil. Cover dough with a large bowl or cling film and allow to rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour). Meanwhile, preheat oven to 220°C.
Without kneading the dough any further, spread it out with oiled finger tips into a rectangle the size of the baking tray and set tray aside.
Place extra virgin olive oil, water and salt in mixing bowl and emulsify 10 sec/speed 4.

Add onions in mixing bowl, chop 6 sec/speed 4 then cook 10 min/100°C//speed 1. Spread onions on top of dough. Bake for 20-25 minutes (220°C) or until golden brown. Allow to cool before cutting into squares and serving.
tips: Focaccia can be served with meals or as a sandwich bread.
The dough is quite wet but keeping its surface well oiled prevents it from sticking to fingers.
Use scissors to cut focaccia in squares.

Plain focaccia with salt: omit onions in step 6 and brush oil, water and salt emulsion from step 5 directly over the surface of the dough. Sprinkle with ½ tsp coarse salt and bake as directed by the recipe.

title: Cranberry Almond Cookies (Metric)
ingredients: 225 g butter, unsalted, diced, room temperature
1 orange, zest only, no white pith
steps: Place cranberries into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place sugar into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Add butter, orange zest and cornstarch and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 15 sec/speed 4.
Add flour and almond extract and mix 15 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add reserved chopped cranberries and almonds and knead Dough /1 min. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and knead a further Dough /1 min. Transfer to cling film, press dough together and shape into a log (dough will be slightly crumbly). Wrap with cling film and continue pressing and shaping the dough log until it’s 5 cm in diameter. Freeze for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350°F/180°C. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment and set aside.

Remove dough log from freezer and slice into rounds (approx. 0.5 cm thick). Place onto prepared baking sheets, spaced 2.5 cm apart and bake 14-15 minutes (350°F/180°C), until golden brown. Let cool on baking sheets 5-10 minutes. Allow to cool completely before serving or packaging.
tips: Recipe inspired by Armida Finser Thermomix® Independent Consultant Texas.
Make ahead: freeze dough for up to 3 months. Before baking, remove from the freezer and let stand at room temperature for about 30 minutes before slicing.
For even baking with two cookie sheets at once, space racks so oven is divided into thirds and switch cookie sheets top to bottom and back to front halfway through baking.
Replace almond extract with orange blossom water or vanilla extract.
Replace almonds with chopped pistachios.

title: Basil pesto
ingredients: 80 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces
steps: Place Parmesan cheese in mixing bowl and grate 15 sec/speed 10.
Add pine nuts, garlic clove, basil leaves, extra virgin olive oil and salt and chop 20 sec/speed 7. Serve as a sauce or transfer to a jar with a twist-off lid and store in refrigerator.
tips: Serve with spaghetti or other types of pasta. If you prefer a thinner sauce, add 1-2 tbsp cooking water from the pasta and mix before serving.
To keep pesto fresh in the refrigerator for up to a month, place in a clean jar, cover with a layer of olive oil and seal the jar air-tight.
For a greater depth of flavour, replace 30 g of the Parmesan cheese with 30 g pecorino cheese.

title: Hot chocolate
ingredients: 100 - 150 g chocolate, cut in pieces (see tip)
steps: Place milk and chocolate in mixing bowl and heat 6 min/80°C/speed 1. Pour into cups and serve immediately.
tips: Use dark or milk chocolate for this recipe. For chocolate with a high cocoa percentage (50-70 %), add 1-2 tsp sugar to taste.
Top with whipped cream or frothed milk.
Flavour with spices (e.g. vanilla, cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, star anise, chilli, ginger) or grated orange or lemon zest. Strain through simmering basket before serving if necessary.

title: Salmon in mushroom cream sauce with potatoes
ingredients: 1 ½ tsp salt, plus extra to taste
600 g potatoes, cut in pieces (2-3 cm)
10 g butter, plus extra for greasing
4 fresh salmon fillets, skinless (120-200 g each, approx. 2 cm thick)
1 lemon, preferably organic, grated zest and juice
1 pinch freshly ground pepper, plus extra to taste
300 g button mushrooms, cut in slices
200 g spreadable cheese (e.g. Laughing Cow®)  o 200 g cream cheese
steps: Place water and 1 tsp salt in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and weigh potatoes into it. Lightly grease Varoma tray.

Season salmon fillets with lemon juice, remaining ½ tsp salt and pepper and place on Varoma tray. Insert Varoma tray into Varoma dish, set Varoma in position and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma, remove simmering basket using spatula, set salmon fillets and potatoes aside and keep warm. Empty mixing bowl.
Place shallots in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add butter and sauté 2 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add 150 g button mushrooms, white wine, cream and spreadable cheese and cook 5 min/90°C/speed 2.
Add remaining 150 g button mushrooms, 1 heaped tsp grated lemon zest, nutmeg, salt and pepper to taste and cook 5 min/90°C//speed 1. Serve salmon with sauce and potatoes.
tips: When steaming in step 2 is finished, check whether potatoes are fully cooked. If not, remove Varoma with salmon and set aside to keep warm, then cook potatoes longer until tender.
Serve salmon with green pasta instead of potatoes.

title: Pizza Margherita
ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for greasing
1 tsp sugar  o 1 tsp non-diastatic malt powder
20 g fresh yeast, crumbled  o 2 tsp dried instant yeast (8 g)
400 g bread flour, plus extra for dusting
30 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for greasing
10 - 15 fresh basil leaves, torn in pieces
steps: Lightly grease a large bowl and set aside. Place water, sugar and yeast in mixing bowl and mix 20 sec/speed 2.

Add bread flour, extra virgin olive oil and salt and knead Dough /2 min. Place dough in prepared bowl and form into a ball. Cover bowl with cling film or a damp tea towel and allow dough to rise until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour).
Preheat oven to 230°C. Line a baking tray (approx. 40 cm x 35 cm) with baking paper or grease with extra virgin olive oil and set aside.
Place mozzarella in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Transfer to simmering basket and allow to drain for 10 minutes, if necessary.
Place dough on prepared baking tray and shape into a rectangle the size of the baking tray by pressing it with your finger tips and stretching it gently. Form a small ridge around the edges.

Spread chopped tomatoes and mozzarella on top of dough and sprinkle with salt, olive oil and 5-7 torn basil leaves. Bake pizza for 20 minutes (230°C). Scatter additional 5-8 torn basil leaves (to taste) over pizza and serve hot.
tips: Alternatively, roll pizza dough out on a floured surface using a rolling pin, and transfer dough to prepared baking tray.
4 individual round pizzas can be made from the dough. Italians bake them one at a time and share each pizza as it comes fresh out of the oven.
In step 2 lightly oil the cling film to prevent it from sticking to the rising dough.
If mozzarella is dry there is no need to drain it.
If chopped tomatoes have a lot of liquid, drain through simmering basket before using.
Add your favourite toppings (e.g. vegetables, salami, ham, cheese, fruit, herbs).

title: Biscoff Oatmeal Cookies (Metric)
ingredients: 100 g Biscoff spread  o 100 g speculoos spread
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F/180°C. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment and set aside.
Place butter and brown sugar into mixing bowl and mix 20 sec/speed 3.5.
Add egg, vanilla and milk and mix 5 sec/speed 3.
Add Biscoff, oats and pecans and mix 15 sec//speed 2.
Add spelt flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt and mix 10 sec//speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 10 sec//speed 3.

Scoop batter into balls (30 g) with a small ice cream scoop. Place onto prepared baking sheets, spaced 2.5 cm apart, pressing tops to flatten (approx. 5 cm diam.) and bake 8-10 minutes (350°F/180°C). Let cool 5 minutes on trays before transferring to a wire rack. Serve warm or at room temperature.
tips: Recipe inspired by Chef Vanessa Musi Thermomix® Independent Consultant Texas.
Speculoos or Biscoff spread/cookie butter can be found at most large supermarkets or ordered online.
Replace pecans with dried cherries, raisins, yellow raisins or dried apricots, chopped, or dark chocolate (70% cacao), chopped into chunks.
If spelt flour is unavailable, replace with organic all purpose white flour.

title: Salmon with Lemon Hollandaise, Asparagus and Rice (Metric)
ingredients: 30 g lemon juice, plus 1 tbsp to drizzle
1 tsp salt, divided, plus extra to season, to taste
1 pinch black pepper, ground, plus extra to season, to taste
30 g cilantro, fresh  o 30 g parsley leaves, fresh
1 lemon, thin peel only, no white pith
340 g asparagus, trimmed  o 340 g broccoli florets
450 g salmon fillet, fresh, skinless, wild caught sockeye salmon (3 cm thick)
steps: Place first bowl into position. Place 15 g water, lemon juice, butter, egg yolks, ½ tsp salt, and pepper into mixing bowl and cook Thicken /80°C. Set mixing bowl with Hollandaise aside and keep warm.
Place second bowl into position. Place cilantro and lemon peel into mixing bowl and chop 20 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in rice. Remove simmering basket, thoroughly rinse rice under cool water until water runs clear and set aside.
Place 995 g water into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket with rinsed rice. Add to rice, onion powder, garlic powder and ½ tsp salt, toss with spatula to combine and mix 10 sec/speed 7.

Set Varoma dish into position and weigh in asparagus. Insert Varoma tray, weigh in salmon, season to taste with salt and pepper, drizzle with lemon juice, secure Varoma lid and steam 17 min/Varoma/speed 3 or until salmon is cooked to your liking. Remove Varoma and set aside. Remove simmering basket with spatula, transfer steamed rice to a bowl and toss with reserved cilantro-lemon mixture. Serve salmon over rice, with asparagus, drizzle with hollandaise sauce and serve remaining sauce on the side.

title: Cheese crackers
ingredients: 200 g Edam cheese, cut in pieces  o 200 g Gruyère cheese, cut in pieces
120 g butter, unsalted, chilled, cut in pieces
steps: Place cheese in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 7.
Add flour, butter, egg and salt and mix 30 sec/speed 4.

Remove dough from mixing bowl, place on a long sheet of cling film and shape a thin log (approx. 40 cm long, Ø 4 cm). Wrap log in cling film and refrigerate until firm enough to cut in slices (approx. 2 hours).
Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.

Cut dough log in thin slices (3 mm thick), place slices on prepared baking tray, sprinkle with cumin and/or sesame seeds and bake for 10-15 minutes (180°C) or until golden brown. Allow to cool on a cooling rack before serving or storing in an air-tight container.
tips: Serve cheese crackers with beer or wine.
The cheese cracker dough can be prepared a day or two in advance, or frozen for several weeks, and sliced and baked shortly before serving.
Replace Edam cheese with any strong-flavoured hard or semi-hard cheese (e.g. Cheddar).
Omit salt in dough and sprinkle with coarse salt before baking.
Instead of 200 g cheese, grate a total of 250 g cheese and reserve 50 g for sprinkling on crackers before baking.

Cheese straws: Instead of shaping dough into a log for slicing, form into a flattened ball and wrap in cling film. Refrigerate for one hour, then roll out dough (3 mm thick) between 2 sheets of baking paper and cut strips (approx. 10 cm x 1.5 cm) with a fluted pastry wheel. Bake as directed by the recipe.

title: Apple cake
ingredients: 130 g butter, unsalted, softened, cut in pieces, plus extra for greasing
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease a round cake tin (Ø 26-28 cm) and set aside.

Peel apples, cut in quarters and remove core and seeds. Using a sharp knife, make parallel incisions on the outside of the apple, cutting down but taking care not to cut completely through. Set apple quarters aside.

Place butter, eggs, sugar, brandy, flour, baking powder and salt in mixing bowl and mix 20 sec/speed 6. Pour mixture into cake tin and spread evenly using spatula. Place reserved apple quarters on top, one next to the other, with incisions facing up.

Bake for 30-40 minutes (180°C) or until a skewer inserted in centre of cake comes out clean. Allow cake to cool in tin for approx. 10 minutes before transferring to a serving plate. Dust top of cake with icing sugar before serving.
tips: You can leave the apples unpeeled.
If a smaller Ø tin is used, increase baking time (e.g. 40-45 minutes for a Ø 24 cm tin). Fewer apples will be necessary for topping the smaller surface of the cake.

Apples can be replaced with pears (prepared as directed for the apples), plums (halved, stones removed), peaches (halved, stones removed) and prepared as directed for the apples), apricots (halved, stones removed), or any other fruit to your taste. The amount of fruit pieces depends on the size of the cake. You need enough to arrange evenly over the surface of the cake.
Brandy can be replaced with rum.

title: Quick Thai chicken curry
ingredients: 400 g waxy potatoes, peeled, cut in bite-size pieces
100 g carrots, cut in bite-size pieces
600 g chicken breast fillets, skinless, cut in cubes (3 cm)
2 - 3 sprigs fresh coriander, leaves only, to garnish
steps: Place garlic clove, onions, salt and oil in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5.
Add Thai curry paste and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add coconut milk, water, potatoes and carrots and cook 12 min/100°C//speed 1
Add chicken breasts and frozen green peas and cook 8 min/100°C//speed 1. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.
tips: Serve with rice.
In step 3, add flavourings such as 15 g fish sauce, 2 tsp sugar, and/or 2-3 kaffir lime leaves.
Just before serving, add 20 g lime juice, 5-6 fresh basil leaves (if possible Thai basil) and/or 1 fresh chilli, cut in thin slices.

Replace the potatoes, carrots and peas with any vegetables of your choice, cut in bite-size pieces as needed. Add the longer-cooking vegetables (e.g. aubergines, sweet potatoes, pumpkin) in step 3, and faster-cooking vegetables (e.g. broccoli, cauliflower, green beans, snow peas, cherry tomatoes, courgettes, sweetcorn) in step 4 or a few minutes before the end of the cooking time.
Replace chicken breasts with quick-cooking boneless meat of your choice, for instance turkey breasts or pork tenderloin.

title: Pork tenderloin with mustard sauce
ingredients: 450 g pork tenderloin, cut in slices (1 cm)
100 g button mushrooms, cut in slices
75 g dry vermouth  o 75 g Madeira wine
1 chicken stock cube (for 0.5 l)  o 1 heaped tsp chicken stock paste, homemade
1 pinch ground black pepper, adjust to taste
2 tbsp crème fraîche  o 2 tbsp cream
steps: Place pork tenderloin and mushrooms in simmering basket, alternating layers of meat and layers of mushrooms. Set aside.
Place vermouth, milk, onions, garlic clove, wholegrain mustard, hot mustard, chicken stock cube, salt and black pepper in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and cook 10 min/100°C/speed 1.

Stir contents of simmering basket using spatula to ensure even cooking. Cook a further 5 min/100°C/speed 1. Meat should be cooked evenly without being dry. If necessary stir again using spatula and cook a further 5 min/100°C/speed 1. Transfer pork and mushrooms to a serving dish and set aside in a warm place.
Add crème fraîche and cornflour to mixing bowl and cook 3 min/80°C/speed 4. Coat meat and mushrooms with sauce, sprinkle with parsley and serve immediately.
tips: Cooking time depends on thickness of meat slices.

title: Yoghurt cake
ingredients: 80 g sunflower oil, plus extra for greasing
1 tsp vanilla sugar, homemade (opcional)  o ½ tsp natural vanilla extract (opcional)
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease a bundt cake tin (Ø 22-24 cm) and set aside.
Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula. Transfer 1 tbsp icing sugar to a small bowl and set aside for dusting.

Add eggs, flour, baking powder, vanilla sugar, yoghurt, sunflower oil and salt and mix 30 sec/speed 5. Transfer to prepared cake tin and bake for 30 minutes (180°C). Allow to cool in cake tin for approx. 10 minutes before transferring to a serving plate and leaving to cool completely. Dust with icing sugar and serve.
tips: Use different yoghurt flavours (e.g. coffee, vanilla, berry).
For a lemon or orange flavour, add 1 organic lemon or orange zest to the sugar before grinding in step 2.

title: Steamed rice
ingredients: 20 g olive oil  o 20 g butter
50 - 350 g white long-grain rice (12-16 minutes cooking time)
steps: Place water, salt and olive oil in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket, weigh rice into it and cook 20 min/100°C/speed 4. Transfer rice to a serving dish and serve hot.
tips: Certain types of rice require rinsing (check packet instructions). Insert simmering basket in empty mixing bowl, weigh rice in it, remove simmering basket and rinse rice thoroughly under running water. Proceed as directed by the recipe.
For other types of rice, adjust the cooking time according to time indicated on rice packet.

title: Artisan Bread (Betty) Metric
ingredients: 2 ¼ tsp active dry yeast  o 15 g fresh yeast, crumbled
1665 g water, divided, plus extra to sprinkle
550 g bread flour, plus extra to dust
1 tsp Rustic Bread Spice Mix (see Tip) (opcional)
neutral oil, e.g. vegetable, canola, safflower, to grease
steps: Place yeast and 370 g water into mixing bowl and warm 3 min/37°C/speed 1.
Add flour, salt and Rustic Spice Mix and knead Dough /3 min. Meanwhile, lightly grease Varoma dish. Transfer dough to prepared Varoma dish, secure Varoma lid and set aside.
Place 995 g water and vinegar into mixing bowl and start Pre-clean . Discard water and rinse mixing bowl.
Place 300 g water and lemon juice into mixing bowl, set Varoma with dough into position and proof Fermentation /2 h/55°C.
Transfer dough to a floured work surface. Punch down dough to remove all air and form into a ball.

Lightly grease the inside of a stoneware casserole dish with lid Betty and carefully place dough into the dish. Let stand 50 minutes. Meanwhile, 15 minutes before end of rising time preheat oven to 400°F/200°C.

Use a sharp knife to make three diagonal cuts along the length of the bread and sprinkle a little water over the dough. Cover with lid and bake 30 minutes (400°F/200°C) then remove the lid and bake a further 15-20 minutes (400°F/200°C) or until golden brown.
Remove from oven and allow to cool in dish 15-20 minutes. Run a silicone spatula around the inside edge of Betty to release the bread, transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before slicing.
tips: Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odours on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.
Search Cookidoo® for Rustic Spice Mix for Bread recipe in our Artisan Bread collection. Rustic Spice Mix combines well with any robust bread. Add 1-2 tsp to flour for added flavour and colour.
Instead of the Betty stoneware casserole, you can also use another casserole dish with a lid or a Roman pot (20 x 30 cm/8 x 12 in.).

title: Chocolate cake
ingredients: 150 g butter, unsalted, cut in pieces, plus extra for greasing
250 g dark chocolate, cut in small pieces
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C. Grease a springform tin (Ø 22 cm) and set aside.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place egg whites and salt in mixing bowl and whisk 6 min/speed 3.5 or until stiff.
Add 20 g sugar and mix 20 sec/speed 3.5. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place remaining 180 g sugar, egg yolks and butter in mixing bowl and mix 6 min/70°C/speed 4.
Add dark chocolate, wait a few seconds for chocolate to soften, then mix 20 sec/speed 5.
Add flour and mix 10 sec/speed 5.
Insert butterfly whisk. Add reserved whisked egg whites and mix 15 sec/speed 2.5. Remove butterfly whisk and transfer cake batter to prepared springform tin.
Bake for 10-15 minutes (200°C, see tip). Allow cake to cool in tin for 5 minutes and serve warm or cold.
tips: If using chocolate with 70 % cocoa or more, reduce amount to 200 g.
The mixing method and short baking time produce a mousse-like centre. If you prefer a firm cake, bake for 20-25 minutes (180°C).
The cake can be served warm with vanilla ice cream.

Quick chocolate cake: place chocolate in mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 7. Add butter and melt 4 min/60°C/speed 2. Add flour, sugar, salt and eggs and mix 15 sec/speed 5. Transfer to prepared springform tin and bake for approx. 20 minutes (180°C).

title: Chicken Satay with Peanut Sauce (Hestan Cue™) Metric
ingredients: 680 g chicken breasts, skinless, boneless, cubed (4 cm)
1 ¼ tsp kosher salt, Diamond Crystal®
1 stalk lemon grass, fresh, cut in pieces (2.5 cm)
5 tbsp oil, e.g. grapeseed, vegetable, canola, as needed to fry
kosher salt, Diamond Crystal®, to season, to taste
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in chicken, sprinkle with salt and set aside.
Place lemon grass and garlic into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add soy sauce, sriracha, coriander and turmeric and mix 5 sec/speed 3. Transfer mixture to bowl with chicken and toss to coat. Cover with cling film, refrigerate and allow to marinate (approx. 2 hr.). Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl. With a vegetable peeler, thinly peel zest from 1 lime, avoiding the pith and set aside. Cut lime in half, squeeze the juice into a bowl and set aside.
Place reserved lime peels into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add peanut butter, 15 g reserved lime juice, sriracha, vinegar, soy sauce, sugar and water and mix 15 sec/speed 4. Set aside.
Continue the recipe in the HESTAN CUE™ induction burner app, search "USA & Canada" to assemble and brown the chicken skewers in the Hestan Cue™ frying pan.
Once skewers are browned, arrange on a serving platter. Drizzle with Peanut Sauce, sprinkle with salt and garnish with cilantro. Serve immediately with lime wedges.
tips: Search "Thermomix" in the Hestan Cue™ app to access all Thermomix® and Hestan Cue™ Smart cooking recipes.

title: Delizie al Limone (Lemon Crinkle Cookies) Metric
ingredients: 2 lemons, thin peel only, no white pith, plus 1 tbsp juice
60 g icing sugar, plus extra to dust
steps: Place sugar and lemon peels into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and mix 30 sec/speed 3.
Add egg, 1 tbsp lemon juice and vanilla and mix 1 min/speed 3.5.
Add flour and baking powder and mix 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Transfer dough to a bowl, cover with cling film and refrigerate 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375°F/200°C. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment and set aside.
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in icing sugar and set aside.
Scoop dough into 30 g balls, roll in reserved icing sugar and place onto prepared baking sheets, 5 cm apart.
Bake 15-18 minutes (375°F/200°C). While still warm, dust with icing sugar. Allow to cool completely before serving.
tips: Recipe inspired by Annalisa Del Grosso Thermomix® Independent Consultant New York.

title: Basic bread dough
ingredients: 20 - 25 g fresh yeast  o 2 - 3 tsp dried instant yeast (8 g)
30 g olive oil  o 30 g butter, plus extra for greasing
steps: Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside. Place water, sugar and fresh yeast into mixing bowl and mix 1 min/37°C/speed 2.
Add flour, olive oil and salt and knead Dough /2 min. Transfer dough to a bowl and cover with lightly oiled cling film. Use bread dough as needed (see tip).
tips: Transfer dough onto prepared baking tray and shape into a loaf or rolls. Dust with flour, place baking tray in cold oven and bake for 30-40 min (220°C) according to the bread shape and size. Allow to cool on a cooling rack before slicing.

title: Rice pudding
ingredients: 220 g white short-grain rice, for rice pudding
steps: Place milk, sugar and salt in mixing bowl and heat without measuring cup 8 min/100°C/speed 1 .
Add rice and cook without measuring cup 30 min/90°C//speed 1. Transfer to a serving bowl and allow to rest for 15 minutes. Serve warm or cold.
tips: Sprinkle with sugar, brown sugar or cinnamon sugar, or serve with maple syrup.
Serve with a red berry sauce.
Chocolate rice pudding: add 1-2 tbsp cocoa powder in step 2 and proceed as directed by the recipe.

Rich rice pudding: after cooking in step 2, add 2 eggs, lightly whisked, 1 tsp homemade vanilla sugar, 1 pinch ground cinnamon and 1 pinch ground nutmeg (optional) and mix 1 min//speed 3. Transfer to a serving bowl and allow to rest as directed by the recipe.

title: Chocolate hazelnut spread
ingredients: 170 g milk chocolate, cut in pieces
60 g peanut oil (opcional)  o 60 g sunflower oil (opcional)
steps: Preheat oven to 160°C. Roast hazelnuts on a baking tray for 10 minutes, allow to cool a little and set aside.
Place sugar and vanilla sugar in mixing bowl and grind 20 sec/speed 10.
Add reserved roasted hazelnuts and cocoa powder and grind 20 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add milk and heat 4 min/100°C/speed 4, then blend 2 min/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add milk chocolate and peanut oil and melt 3 min/50°C/speed 3.
Transfer to a sterilised jar and close air-tight. Allow to cool, then serve or refrigerate until needed.
tips: Replace vanilla sugar with ½ tsp natural vanilla extract, adding it in step 5.
Store the hazelnut spread in the refrigerator for a few weeks, or for a few days at room temperature.
Replace part of the milk chocolate with dark chocolate, as desired.
The peanut oil can be omitted for a more intensely flavoured spread, however the texture will not be as velvety smooth.

title: Lemon cake
ingredients: 70 g sunflower oil, plus extra for greasing
260 g flour, plus extra for dusting
2 - 3 lemons, preferably organic, zest and juice
70 g cornflour (starch)  o 70 g potato starch
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and flour a bundt cake tin (Ø 22-24 cm) and set aside.
Place sugar and zest of 2 lemons in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Add flour, cornflour, sunflower oil, 80 g lemon juice, eggs, milk and baking powder and mix 30 sec/speed 5. Transfer mixture to prepared bundt cake tin.
Bake for 35-45 minutes (180°C) or until golden. Allow to cool in cake tin for 10 minutes before transferring to a serving plate and leaving to cool completely. Dust with icing sugar and serve.
tips: Replace lemons with 2 medium oranges (approx. 150 g each), for a total of approx. 20 g zest and 110 g juice.
The cake can also be baked in a loaf tin (25 cm).

title: Shredded chicken in tomato sauce (tinga de pollo)
ingredients: 200 g panela cheese (Mexican fresh cheese), cut in pieces  o 200 g feta cheese, cut in pieces
2 stock cubes (each for 0.5 l)  o 2 heaped tsp stock paste, homemade
1000 g chicken breast fillets, skinless, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
30 g piloncillo, cut in pieces (see tip)  o 30 g brown sugar
20 - 30 g chipotle chillies, preserved (see tip)  o 1 fresh chilli, deseeded, chopped
steps: Place panela cheese in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside for serving.
Place onions, tomatoes, oil and stock cubes in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5, then sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add chicken breasts, piloncillo, chipotle chillies and bay leaves and cook 18 min/100°C//speed 1, then shred 5 sec//speed 4.
Serve immediately on tostadas, topped with reserved grated cheese and sour cream.
tips: Piloncillo is unrefined cane sugar, produced in cone shapes. It is also known as panela (not to be confused with panela cheese). Piloncillo can sometimes be found in health food stores.
Chipotle chillies have a smoky flavour. If you can’t find any, replace with fresh chillies, adjusting amount to taste.

title: Cheesecake (unbaked)
ingredients: 90 g jelly dessert powder, sweetened, lemon flavour (for 500 g liquid) (see tip)
1 - 2 tsp unflavoured gelatine powder (5 g) (see tip)
steps: Place biscuits in mixing bowl and crush 5 sec/speed 10.
Add butter and mix 5 sec/speed 5.

Spread mixture in base of a non-stick springform tin (Ø 24-26 cm). Use a spoon or your hands to press crumb mixture down firmly to make a compact layer. Place springform tin in the freezer. Clean mixing bowl.
Place water in mixing bowl and heat 5 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add lemon-flavoured jelly dessert powder, cream cheese, cream and sugar and mix 20 sec/speed 5.
Remove springform tin from the freezer and transfer contents of mixing bowl to springform tin. Chill in refrigerator until filling is set (approx. 4 hours). Clean mixing bowl.
Place jam, lemon juice, unflavoured gelatine powder and water in mixing bowl and heat 3 min/80°C/speed 2.
Allow mixture to cool for 10 minutes then pour it over the set cheesecake. Again chill cheesecake in refrigerator, for at least one hour. Serve cold.
tips: Jelly dessert powder contains gelatine powder, sugar and flavourings. To replace 90 g lemon-flavoured jelly dessert powder, use 10 g unflavoured gelatine powder, 80 g sugar and 1 grated lemon zest.

To replace gelatine powder (not jelly dessert powder) with gelatine sheets, use same weight of gelatine and soak sheets in cold water for five minutes. Drain, squeeze out water, discard soaking water and add gelatine to mixture.

title: Stuffed peppers with rice and tomato sauce
ingredients: 2 slices white bread, cut in pieces
2 vegetable stock cubes (each for 0.5 l)  o 2 heaped tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade
steps: Place onions and garlic clove in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5.
Add beef mince, white bread, mustard, salt, paprika, black pepper and egg and knead Dough /1 min 30 sec.
Cut the tops off the peppers and set aside. Remove all seeds and fill peppers with mince mixture, then replace cut-off top over each pepper. Place stuffed peppers in Varoma.

Place water and vegetable stock cubes in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket and weigh rice into it. Set Varoma in position and steam 30 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and remove simmering basket using spatula. Transfer rice and stuffed peppers to a serving dish and keep warm. Transfer cooking liquid to a bowl and set aside.
Place butter and flour in mixing bowl and sauté 3 min/100°C/speed 2.
Add 200 g reserved cooking liquid, crushed tomatoes, tomato purée, salt, black pepper, sugar and lemon juice and cook 5 min/100°C/speed 3.5. Serve stuffed peppers with rice and tomato sauce.
tips: Depending on the size of the peppers, you may have some leftover mince mixture. Form it into small balls and place them with the peppers in Varoma.
Instead of ground beef use ground lamb or a mixture of ground pork and beef.
The recipe can be halved to make two portions. But do not reduce the 1200 g water for steaming. Cooking time for the tomato sauce can be reduced by 1 minute.

title: Chilli con carne
ingredients: 250 g red peppers, cut in pieces
1 fresh green chilli (see tip)  o ½ tsp dried chillies, adjust to taste
300 g tomatoes, canned (whole)  o 300 g fresh tomatoes, cut in pieces
1 tsp chilli sauce, adjust to taste (see tip)
steps: Place olive oil, onions, garlic clove and cumin in mixing bowl. Chop 5 sec/speed 5, then sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add red peppers and fresh green chilli and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Add beef mince, tomatoes and salt. Stir using spatula to combine ingredients and break up meat. Cook 20 min/100°C//speed .
Add chilli sauce and kidney beans and cook 2 min/100°C//speed . Serve hot.
tips: Serve with rice.

Fresh chillies come in different strengths. Removing the seeds will tone down the spiciness. If you are not familiar with cooking with fresh chillies, start with a small amount and then adjust the heat level of the dish by adding more chilli sauce.
Serve with sour cream or yoghurt to tone down the spiciness.
Vary the spices and adjust their amount according to your preference. Sprinkle with fresh herbs such as coriander.
Kidney beans may be replaced with other cooked beans, increased or omitted, according to your preference.

title: Pâté Chinois (Canadian Shepherd's Pie)
ingredients: 500 g lean ground beef, crumbled into small portions, divided
1 tsp salt, divided, plus extra to season, to taste
¼ tsp freshly ground black pepper, divided, plus extra to season, to taste
25 g fresh parsley or ½ bunch, patted dry, cut in thirds
398 ml canned sweet corn kernels, drained (approx. 1 can)  o 398 ml canned creamed sweet corn, undrained (approx. 1 can)
700 g yellow potatoes, sliced or diced (2.5 cm/(½ in.)  o 700 g Yukon gold potatoes, sliced or diced (2.5 cm/(½ in.)
60 g butter, diced, divided, to taste
steps: Place 15 g olive oil, 75 g onion and 1 garlic clove into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and without measuring cup, sauté 3 min/Varoma/speed 2.
Add 250 g ground beef, evenly distribute meat in bottom of mixing bowl with spatula, add ½ tsp salt and ⅛ tsp pepper and brown High Temp. . Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Again, place 15 g olive oil, 75 g onion and 1 garlic clove into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and without measuring cup, sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add 250 g ground beef, evenly distribute meat in bottom of mixing bowl with spatula, add ½ tsp salt and ⅛ tsp pepper and brown High Temp. . Transfer to bowl with reserved browned meat and set aside.
Place parsley into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and chop 5 sec/speed 7.

Add reserved browned beef, paprika and Worcestershire sauce, season with salt and pepper if needed and stir 20 sec//speed 2. Then, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 2 min/120°C//speed . Transfer mixture into bottom of a baking dish (20 cm x 24 cm) or (8 in. x 10 in.), top with corn and spread evenly over the meat. Set aside.
Place water and vinegar into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and start Pre-clean /Browning. Rinse and dry mixing bowl before proceeding with recipe.
Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F.

Place potatoes and milk into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl and cook 20 min/95°C//speed 1. Check for doneness and if necessary, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook a further 5 min/95°C//speed 1 until fork tender.
Add 30 g butter, salt and savory, insert measuring cup and mash 15 sec/speed 4. Spread mashed potatoes over meat and corn, then dab with 30 g diced butter and bake 20-25 minutes (200°C/400° F).
If desired, place Shepherd's Pie on top rack in oven and broil 1-2 minutes, watching carefully until potatoes are golden brown. Serve hot.
tips: Canadian Shepherd's pie is a ground meat pie with vegetables added to the filling: peas, corn, carrots or a combination. The filling is covered with mashed potatoes and often topped with cheese. Pâté Chinois is the name of this traditional French dish made with layered ground beef sometimes mixed with onions in the bottom layer, canned corn (whole kernel, creamed, or a mixture) in the middle layer and mashed potatoes on top with special seasonings (savory or salted herbs) in the potatoes and made in French Canadian homes throughout Canada as a favourite weeknight meal, often served with ketchup.
Type of potato used will affect the cooking time: 20 minutes may be sufficient, but some varieties may need 30 minutes. Do not over whip to avoid a gummy or gluey texture.
Shepherd's Pie can be baked in a pie plate (23 cm) or (9 in.).

Canadian Shepherd’s Pie can be a great way to repurpose Sunday dinner leftovers. Ground meat can be replaced with 500 g leftover roast beef, minced with gravy added, topped with leftover peas and carrots and covered with mashed potatoes. Bake as directed.
Replace 1 tsp salt with 1 tbsp salted herbs in the potato topping. Search Cookidoo® for Salted Herbs recipe in our O Canada collection.

title: Green smoothie
ingredients: 1 lemon, peeled, white pith and pips removed
1 cm fresh ginger, cut in slices (2 mm)
1 orange (approx. 100 g), peeled, white pith and pips removed
50 - 100 g water  o 50 - 100 g coconut water
steps: Place cucumbers, spinach leaves, parsley, mint, lemon, ginger, salt, orange, apple, ice cubes and water in mixing bowl and blend 1 min/speed 9. Serve immediately.
tips: Adjust ingredient quantities according to your taste.
Replace the fruit and vegetables in this recipe with any other varieties to create your own variation (e.g. pear, celery, grapes, kale, citrus fruit).

title: Roasted Vegetables, Farro and Lemon Feta Dressing (Ben) Metric
ingredients: 255 g Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
450 g zucchini, sliced in half moons (1 cm)
90 g extra virgin olive oil, divided
2 ¼ tsp salt, divided, to taste
3 - 5 sprigs dill, fresh, plus extra to garnish
¼ tsp black pepper, ground, to taste
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F/220°C.
Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in Brussels sprouts, zucchini, carrots, 45 g olive oil and 2 tsp salt, toss well with spatula to coat all vegetables.
Transfer seasoned vegetables into a stoneware baking dish Ben and spread out evenly. Lay rosemary sprigs over top of vegetables and roast 30 minutes (425°F/220°C). Meanwhile make the farro.
