Insert simmering basket and weigh in farro. Remove simmering basket with spatula rinse farro under cold running water.

Insert simmering basket with rinsed farro. Add water and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 2. Remove simmering basket with spatula, transfer steamed farro to a large bowl and discard steaming water. Clean mixing bowl.

Turn vegetables over and roast a further 15 minutes (425°F/220°C). Meanwhile with a vegetable peeler, thinly peel zest from 1 lemon, avoiding the white pith and set aside. Cut the lemon in half, squeeze the juice into a small bowl and set aside. Continue with recipe.

Place feta, dill, 45 g reserved lemon juice, reserved lemon zest, 45 g olive oil, ¼ tsp salt and pepper into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix 30 sec/speed 5. Transfer to bowl with reserved farro and toss to combine.
Arrange roasted vegetables over farro, garnish with dill and serve.
tips: Use any mixture of in-season vegetables.
Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.
Add 4 cloves of crushed garlic when mixing the vegetables with olive oil.
Add 225 g thickly sliced onion when mixing the vegetables with olive oil.

title: Baguette
ingredients: 10 g fresh yeast, crumbled  o 1 tsp dried instant yeast (4 g)
500 g bread flour, plus extra for dusting
steps: Place water and yeast in mixing bowl and warm 2 min/37°C/speed 2. Meanwhile, lightly grease a large bowl and set aside.
Add flour and salt and knead Dough /2 min. Transfer dough to prepared bowl. Cover bowl with cling film or a damp tea towel and allow to rise until doubled in size (approx. 1½ hours).

On a lightly floured surface, use a large knife to separate dough into three equal pieces. Gently flatten and roll each piece loosely into a log shape and set aside on a lightly floured surface. Dust rolls lightly with flour, cover with cling film or a damp tea towel and allow to rest for 20 minutes.

Again, gently flatten each piece of dough into a rectangle, taking care to preserve the air bubbles trapped within. Roll dough again into a log shape. Pinch seam of roll with your fingers to seal. Elongate roll into a baguette shape, rolling back and forth exerting gentle pressure from the middle of the baguette to its ends. Place baguettes seam-side down on baking paper, pulling up paper between baguettes to create a low wall. This will help baguettes to hold their shape and will prevent them from sticking to each other as they rise. Cover baguettes loosely with cling film or a damp tea towel and allow to rise for a further 45 minutes.
20 minutes before end of rising time, place 2 baking trays in lower part of oven, one tray on the lowest rung, the other on a rung above. Preheat oven to 250°C.

Pour approx. 100 g very hot water in a cup and set aside. Slash baguettes using a very sharp knife, making three overlapping slashes along the length of each bread. Slide baguettes, together with baking paper, onto the top preheated baking tray. Quickly but also carefully splash the hot water on the lower baking tray to create steam and immediately close oven door to trap the steam. Bake for 20 minutes (250°C), or until dark golden brown. If baguettes seem quite brown before end of baking time, reduce oven temperature to 230°C. Allow baguettes to cool for 20 minutes before slicing.
tips: To test if baguettes are ready to bake, gently press dough with your fingertip. The indentation left by your finger should slowly disappear. If the dough springs up quickly then it has not risen sufficiently. If the indentation remains, the dough has over-proved. The baguettes won’t rise as much in the oven but they will still taste good.

Creating the burst of steam at the beginning of baking gives the baguettes their crisp, golden crust. Be very careful not to splash yourself or any glass elements in your oven. You may omit the steam if desired.
Baguettes are always best eaten freshly baked.

Baguettes develop more flavour if you chill the dough overnight in the refrigerator. After the dough has risen in step 2, gently fold dough over itself to deflate it, cover the bowl with cling film and store it in the refrigerator. The next day proceed with step 3 as directed by the recipe. The baguettes may need 10-20 minutes longer to rise in step 4 before baking.

title: Lemon curd
ingredients: 3 - 5 lemons, preferably organic, zest and juice
120 g butter, unsalted, cut in pieces
steps: Place sugar and zest of 1 lemon in mixing bowl and grind 20 sec/speed 10.
Add butter, eggs and 150 g lemon juice and cook without measuring cup 20 min/90°C/speed 2.
Insert measuring cup and mix 25 sec/speed 6. Transfer to 2 sterilised jam jars with twist-off lids and close immediately. Allow to cool before serving or storing in the refrigerator.
tips: Lemon curd keeps in the refrigerator for up to one month.
Serve as a spread on toasts or scones, as a filling for cakes and tarts, or as a dessert, mixed with an equal amount of softly whipped cream and served with biscuits.

title: Cheesecake (baked)
ingredients: 120 g butter, unsalted, cut in pieces, plus extra for greasing
250 g plain biscuits  o 250 g digestive biscuits
1 ½ tsp vanilla sugar, homemade  o 1 tsp natural vanilla extract
steps: Grease the bottom and sides of a springform tin (Ø 20 cm) generously with butter.
Place butter in mixing bowl and melt 2 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add biscuits and sugar and crush 10 sec/speed 7.
Spread crumb mixture in base of prepared springform tin. Use a spoon or your hands to press crumb mixture down firmly to make a compact layer. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 220°C and clean mixing bowl.
Place cream cheese, cream, sugar and vanilla sugar in mixing bowl and mix 20 sec/speed 4.
Add eggs and egg yolk and mix 20 sec/speed 4. Pour cheesecake filling over crumb base.

Bake on a baking tray on the lowest shelf of oven for 10 minutes (220°C). Reduce temperature to 150°C and bake for a further 45-50 minutes or until mixture is almost set. Allow to cool for one hour in turned-off oven with door ajar. Allow to cool to room temperature, then cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours before cutting in slices and serving.
tips: Cooling the cake slowly in the oven helps prevent surface cracks. If a crack does form, you can disguise it with one of the following: a dusting of icing sugar, whipped cream, caramel sauce, chocolate sauce or fruit coulis.
Lime or lemon cheesecake: in step 6, add the grated zest and juice of 2 limes or small lemons. Garnish cake with lime or lemon zest or wedges.

Raspberry swirl cheesecake: after step 7, clean the mixing bowl. Place 150 g raspberries in mixing bowl and blend 30 sec/speed 10. Pass purée through a fine sieve into a bowl. Stir 2 tbsp sugar into purée and drop purée on unbaked cheesecake using a teaspoon. Swirl sauce into filling with a wooden skewer or a toothpick. Bake as directed by the recipe.

title: Pitta bread
ingredients: 1 tsp dried instant yeast (4 g)  o 10 g fresh yeast
steps: Place dried yeast, water and sugar in mixing bowl and warm 30 sec/37°C/speed 2.

Add olive oil, bread flour and salt and knead Dough /3 min. Transfer dough to a bowl, cover with cling film and allow to rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 h). Divide dough into 7-8 pieces, form each into a ball and allow to rest for 15 minutes. With a rolling pin roll out each ball into a flat circle (approx. Ø 15 cm) and allow to rest for a further 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, preheat oven and baking tray to 250°C.

Place 2-4 dough circles on preheated baking tray and bake for 4-5 minutes (250°C) or until puffed up or pale golden. Repeat with remaining dough. Transfer hot pitta breads to a plate and cover immediately with a dry tea towel to keep them soft. Allow to cool before serving.
tips: Cut pitta bread in half to fill with sandwich fillings (e.g. lettuce leaves, tomatoes, cheese, cold meat, mayonnaise).
Placing dough on preheated baking tray helps it puff up. If a few of the pitta breads don’t puff up, they can still be served as soft flat breads.

title: Risotto with Parmesan cheese
ingredients: 40 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces (3 cm)
320 g risotto rice (e.g. Carnaroli, Arborio), 14-15 minutes cooking time (see tip)
1 stock cube (for 0.5 l), meat or vegetable  o 1 heaped tsp stock paste, homemade, meat or vegetable
steps: Place Parmesan cheese in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape cheese out of mixing bowl using spatula, transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place shallot in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add 20 g butter and extra virgin olive oil and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add risotto rice and sauté without measuring cup 3 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add dry white wine and cook without measuring cup 1 min/100°C//speed 1.

Add water, stock cube and salt and scrape bottom of mixing bowl thoroughly using spatula to loosen rice. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid and cook 12-13 min/100°C//speed 1. Allow risotto to rest in mixing bowl for 1 minute, then transfer to a serving bowl. Using spatula, combine with remaining 20 g butter and reserved Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.
tips: Risotto is best served immediately.
Adjust cooking time according to time indicated on rice packet.
Liquid absorption may vary according to the type of rice. If risotto seems dry before it is cooked through, add more liquid.

Rule of thumb for creating your own risotto recipe: for every 100 g risotto rice you will need 275 g liquids (water and wine) combined with stock paste. The maximum quantity of rice that can be cooked at any one time for this basic recipe is 500 g. Bear in mind adding other ingredients (e.g. mushrooms, sausage) will increase volume to the dish, so adapt rice quantity accordingly.
Saffron risotto: add 2 pinches of saffron in step 6.

Mushroom risotto: in step 3, add 250 g fresh mushrooms (cut in pieces if too large) or 50 g dried mushrooms (soaked in water for 30 minutes, water squeezed out). Proceed as directed by recipe. Saffron can also be added in this variation.
Sausage and apple risotto: in step 3, add 150 g sausage meat (cut open a fresh sausage and crumble in the minced meat). In step 4, add 100 g green apple, cut in cubes.

title: Tagliatelle with porcini mushrooms
ingredients: 100 g fresh porcini mushrooms, cut in slices  o 30 g dried porcini mushrooms, soaked in warm water for 20 minutes, drained
100 g fresh mushrooms, cut in slices
1 - 2 pinches freshly ground black pepper, to taste
steps: Place parsley in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Transfer 1 tbsp chopped parsley to a bowl and set aside. Leave remainder in mixing bowl.
Add garlic clove and 30 g extra virgin olive oil and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1. Remove garlic clove if desired.
Add porcini mushrooms, fresh mushrooms and ¼ tsp salt to mixing bowl and cook 12 min/100°C//speed . Transfer to a serving bowl, keep warm and set aside.
Place water in mixing bowl and bring to the boil 10 min/100°C/speed 1.

Add tagliatelle and remaining 1 tsp salt and cook without measuring cup time indicated on packet/100°C//speed 1 or until al dente. Drain pasta through Varoma dish, then transfer to serving bowl with reserved porcini mushrooms. Add remaining 1½ tbsp extra virgin olive oil (20 g), black pepper and reserved chopped parsley and combine using spatula. Serve hot.
tips: The quantity of salt can be increased to taste depending on the quality of the mushrooms.
Serve with grated Parmesan cheese.
Porcini mushrooms are also known as ceps.

This recipe calls for two types of mushrooms but you can adapt it to your preference. Porcini mushrooms provide a unique flavour. Use exclusively porcini mushrooms or replace them entirely with your favourite mushrooms, for a different but also delicious result.
You can also make this dish with homemade pasta. Cook pasta in a saucepan while sautéing porcini mushrooms in Thermomix®.

title: Quick cheese soufflés
ingredients: 50 g butter, cut in pieces, plus extra for greasing
60 g flour, plus extra for dusting
150 g Gruyère cheese, cut in pieces
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and flour 6 ceramic ramekins (approx. Ø 8 cm, height 4.5 cm) and set aside.
Place Gruyère cheese in mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place eggs, flour, milk, butter, nutmeg, salt and black pepper in mixing bowl and heat 3 min/90°C/speed 3.
Add cream and reserved grated Gruyère cheese and mix 10 sec/speed 6. Transfer to prepared ramekins and bake for 20-25 minutes (180°C) or until golden brown. Serve immediately.
tips: Serve with a green or mixed salad.
Instead of making individual soufflés, bake in a large soufflé dish (Ø 20 cm) for 35-40 minutes.
Replace Gruyère with the cheese of your choice (e.g. Parmesan, feta, Gouda, blue Stilton).
Add fresh herbs or spices (e.g. rosemary, oregano, caraway seeds).

title: Apple strudel
ingredients: 370 g flour, plus extra for dusting
130 g butter, unsalted, cut in pieces
1 tbsp vanilla sugar, homemade  o 1 ½ tsp natural vanilla extract
steps: Place flour, egg, 40 g sunflower oil, water, white wine vinegar and salt in mixing bowl and knead Dough /2 min. Place dough on a lightly floured surface and form dough into a ball. Brush with remaining sunflower oil, cover with cling film and allow to rest at room temperature for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare filling.
Place hazelnuts in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place 40 g butter in mixing bowl and melt 2 min/70°C/speed 2.
Add breadcrumbs and ½ tsp cinnamon and toast 6 min/Varoma/speed 2.
Add reserved chopped hazelnuts and mix 5 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place sugar, remaining ½ tsp cinnamon, vanilla sugar, lemon juice and rum in mixing bowl and mix 15 sec//speed 4.

Cut apples in quarters, remove cores, then cut quarters in slices. Add apples and raisins to mixing bowl and mix with aid of spatula 5-10 sec//speed 3, adjusting time according to desired size of apple pieces. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place remaining 90 g butter in mixing bowl, melt 3 min/70°C/speed 1 and set aside for brushing.
Preheat oven to 190°C and line a large baking tray (approx. 40 cm x 35 cm) with baking paper.

Place a large tea towel (approx. 80 cm x 45 cm) on a table and dust it with flour. Place dough on tea towel, dust with flour and using a rolling pin, roll it out on the tea towel into a thin, rectangular shape. Cover with second tea towel and allow to rest for 5 minutes.

Remove the top tea towel and place it on the table, its long edge overlapping slightly with the long edge of the other tea towel, to create a large surface on which to stretch the dough. Brush dough with some melted butter, then lift over the backs of hands and gently stretch it with your knuckles toward the table edges. Move around the edge of the dough and keep stretching the dough slowly and carefully toward and finally over the table edges, until the dough is very large, thin and transparent. Use scissors to cut off thick edges of dough. If holes appear while stretching, pinch them together lightly; small holes will not be visible after rolling the strudel.

Brush entire dough surface with some more melted butter, sprinkle reserved breadcrumb and hazelnut mixture in a wide band along the shortest edge of the pastry, leaving a few centimetres of dough uncovered along the edge and top the crumb mixture with the apple filling, forming a narrower band than the breadcrumb mixture. Lift up cloth at filling edge, using it to flip the dough. Roll strudel by pulling the first tea towel upwards and continuing with the next tea towel until the whole strudel is rolled. Pinch ends of roll shut, cutting off unnecessary excess dough and tucking dough ends underneath roll. With the help of the remaining tea towel, carefully transfer strudel on prepared baking tray, forming strudel into a horseshoe shape if necessary to make it fit.
Brush top with remaining melted butter. Bake for 25-30 minutes (190°C) or until crisp and golden. Allow to cool a little, dust with icing sugar and serve warm, cut in thick slices.
tips: Serve with vanilla sauce, vanilla ice cream or whipped cream.
The breadcrumb and hazelnut mixture traps juices from the apples and keeps the strudel crust crisp. Instead of using both, you can use all breadcrumbs or all hazelnuts.
Before placing apples on breadcrumb mixture, check whether they have released a lot of juice. For a drier filling, discard part of the juice.
Dough can be prepared a day or two in advance and stored in the refrigerator.
Instead of two tea towels, you can use a large tablecloth to roll the strudel.
For a faster version, use ready-made strudel dough.

You can form two apple strudels instead of one large one: when placing filling on top of dough, leave empty a channel of a few centimetres in the middle of the row of apples. Roll the strudel as described in the recipe, then cut through the channel to form two strudels, pinching the ends of each strudel shut.

title: Baked spinach and eggs
ingredients: 50 g hard cheese, for grating (e.g. Gruyère, Cheddar, Parmesan)
steps: Drain spinach in Varoma, squeezing water out using hands. Meanwhile, place hard cheese in mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 7. Transfer grated cheese to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic clove and olive oil in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7, then sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 2. Meanwhile, pat spinach dry with paper towels.
Add spinach and salt to mixing bowl and sauté 5 min/120°C//speed  .
Preheat oven to 200°C.
Add flour in mixing bowl and cook 1 min 30 sec/120°C//speed 2.
Add milk, butter, nutmeg and black pepper and cook 7 min/100°C/speed 2.

Transfer half of spinach to 6 ceramic ramekins (approx. Ø 8 cm, height 4.5 cm), break one egg on top of each and cover with remaining half of spinach. Sprinkle with reserved grated cheese, bake for 10 minutes (200°C) to cook the eggs and brown the cheese topping. Serve immediately.
tips: For a browner top, place ramekins under a hot grill for a few minutes (but bear in mind this will extend the cooking time for the eggs).
This dish can also be prepared in one large baking dish.
The creamed spinach can be prepared to the end of step 6 ahead of time. Allow spinach to cool then refrigerate. When ready to serve, proceed with step 7, adding a minute or two to the baking time.

title: Béchamel sauce
steps: Place butter in mixing bowl and melt 3 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add flour and cook 3 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add milk, salt, pepper and nutmeg and cook 6 min/90°C/speed 4. Serve béchamel sauce immediately or use as needed.
tips: Quick version: place all ingredients in mixing bowl and cook 7 min/90°C/speed 4. The main version has a little more flavour, but this faster version is an acceptable substitute.
Béchamel sauce can be used in many dishes such as gratins, lasagne or vol-au-vent (puff pastry shells with savoury filling).

Béchamel sauce is the base for several other sauces. For example:Mornay sauce: add 50 g grated cheese at the end of step 3 (you may also add 2 egg yolks and 20 g cream), then mix 15 sec/speed 4.Aurore sauce: add 1 tsp tomato paste to the béchamel at the end of step 3 and mix 15 sec/speed 4.

title: Tofu stew
ingredients: 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)  o 1 heaped tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade
200 g fresh mushrooms, cut in slices
400 g firm tofu, cut in cubes
steps: Place onions, garlic cloves, olive oil and tomatoes in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5, then sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 2.
Add vegetable stock cube, salt, black pepper, wine, courgettes, carrots and mushrooms and sauté 12 min/Varoma//speed .
Add tofu, basil and oregano and cook 4 min/100°C//speed  . Serve hot.
tips: Serve with rice or whole wheat pasta.

title: Stir-fried vegetables
ingredients: 300 g pak choi or other green vegetables, cut in strips (see tip)
steps: Place garlic cloves and extra virgin olive oil in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Sauté 2 min/120°C/speed .
Add pak choi, salt and black pepper and stir-fry 5 min/120°C//speed . Serve immediately.
tips: Cut thick white parts of pak choi in smaller pieces (5 cm) and green leafy parts in larger pieces (10-15 cm)
Different kinds of vegetables will require different cooking times. If vegetables seem undercooked, or if you like your vegetables softer, stir-fry a further 2-3 min /120°C//speed .
Replace pak choi with spinach (including stalks), water spinach or Chinese broccoli.
In step 2 add carrot strips to give colour to the dish.

title: Caramel sauce
ingredients: 250 g white sugar  o 250 g brown sugar
30 g butter, unsalted, cold and as much as possible in one piece (approx. 60 mm x 40 mm x 10 mm)
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stage modes, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar in the mixing bowl.
Place sugar, 70 g cream, 30 g water, lemon juice and butter in mixing bowl. Place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start Sugar Stages .
Add remaining 130-180 g cream and without measuring cup mix 2 min/speed . Then without measuring cup cook 3 min/Varoma/speed 2. Pour into an air-tight jar and set aside.
Place 1000 g water and vinegar in mixing bowl and start Pre-clean . Use the caramel sauce as needed.
tips: Caramel sauce is made by mixing caramelised sugar with cream. Depending on the intended application, additional ingredients such as butter, fruit purees, liquors or vanilla are often added. Caramel sauce is used in a variety of desserts, though most notably as a topping for ice cream. Butterscotch sauce is made with dark brown sugar, butter and often a splash of whiskey.
To succeed with this recipe the 30 g butter need to be added as much as possible in one piece. Cut one chunk of approx. 60 mm x 40 mm x 10 mm and add some more if necessary.
Adding lemon juice prevents the sugar from burning or crystallising, without affecting the flavour.
For a salted caramel sauce add 1 tsp salt.

title: Beef goulash with bread dumplings
ingredients: 300 g bread rolls, slightly stale, cut in slices (1 cm)  o 300 g white bread, slightly stale, cut in slices (1 cm)
½ tsp salt, adjust to taste
30 g oil  o 30 g clarified butter
750 g beef (for stewing), cut in pieces (2-3 cm), patted dry with paper towels
350 g chopped tomatoes, canned or fresh
1 tsp salt, plus extra to taste
½ tsp ground caraway  o ½ tsp caraway seeds
200 g peppers, red and green, cut in thin strips
steps: Place bread rolls in mixing bowl and chop with aid of spatula 12 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place parsley and onions in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add butter and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add milk and warm 1 min 30 sec/60°C/speed 1.
Add reserved chopped bread rolls, eggs, salt, black pepper and nutmeg and mix with aid of spatula 20 sec//speed 3. Transfer to a bowl, combine using spatula and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place garlic cloves, onions and oil in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add beef and sauté 5 min/120°C//speed .

Add sugar, tomato purée, chopped tomatoes, red wine, sweet paprika, salt, black pepper, caraway, lemon zest, marjoram, bay leaves, juniper berries and cloves and cook 40 min/100°C//speed 1. Meanwhile, lightly grease Varoma dish and tray. With wet hands, form 12 dumplings from the reserved dumpling mixture and place them in greased Varoma dish and Varoma tray.
Add 100 g water, set Varoma with dumplings in position and steam 20 min/Varoma//speed 1. Set Varoma aside.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh flour and 50 g water in it. Mix flour and water.
Add flour-water mixture, 150 g water and peppers to mixing bowl, set Varoma back in position and cook 8 min/90°C//speed 1. Season goulash to taste and serve hot with dumplings.
tips: Bread dumplings are best when made with day-old bread rolls, which makes this a good recipe for using up leftover rolls, baguette or sandwich bread.
If the bread mixture is too soft to shape, add some breadcrumbs.
Goulash can also be served with pasta, boiled potatoes or bread.
Bacon bread dumplings: Add 120 g bacon cubes in step 3.
Venison goulash: Replace beef with venison fillet and replace pepper strips with mushrooms (e.g. chanterelles, button mushrooms), cut in slices.

title: Chicken stock paste
ingredients: 300 g chicken meat, skinless, boneless and sinew free (from approx. 500 g chicken legs), cut in pieces
200 g mixed white vegetables (e.g. celeriac, onions, garlic, leek), cut in pieces as needed
4 sprigs mixed fresh herbs (e.g. rosemary, thyme, parsley), leaves only
steps: Place chicken meat in mixing bowl and mince 5 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place mixed white vegetables and mixed fresh herbs in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add coarse salt, white wine, bay leaf, whole clove, coriander seeds and reserved minced chicken. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid and cook 25 min/Varoma/speed 2. Mixture will thicken and become fairly dry.
Remove simmering basket, insert measuring cup and blend 1 min/speed 4-7, increasing speed gradually. Transfer to an air-tight jar and allow to cool before using or storing in refrigerator.
tips: - 1 heaped tsp stock paste is roughly equivalent to 1 shop-bought chicken stock cube for 0.5 l.- To make chicken stock, use 1 heaped tsp per 500 g water.- Stock paste keeps in the refrigerator for several months.- The salt in this recipe is used as the preserving agent. When mixed with water as described above, the stock does not taste too salty.- If you wish to decrease the salt in the recipe, you must store the stock paste in the freezer.
Adapt the stock paste recipe using the natural ingredients of your choice.

title: Menu with ginger-pea soup, lemon salmon, broccoli and potatoes
ingredients: 1 lemon, preferably organic, zest and juice
4 fresh salmon fillets, skinless (150-180 g each)  o 4 white fish fillet, skinless (150-180 g each)
5 - 10 g fresh ginger, peeled and sliced (opcional)
100 g leek, white part only, cut in pieces  o 100 g onions, cut in halves
100 g celery stalks, cut in pieces
350 g frozen green peas  o 350 g carrots, cut in pieces (see tip)
250 g potatoes, cut in pieces (1 cm)
400 g broccoli florets  o 400 g mixed vegetables (e.g. carrots, courgettes, mushrooms), cut in slices (0.5 cm)
50 - 100 g single cream, approx. 18% fat, to taste
steps: Place 30 g olive oil, soy sauce, brown sugar, lemon zest from half the lemon and 25 g lemon juice in mixing bowl. Emulsify 20 sec/speed 5. Place salmon fillets in a deep dish and pour marinade from mixing bowl over the salmon. Refrigerate for 10 minutes and continue with recipe.
Place ginger, garlic clove, shallots, leek and remaining 50 g olive oil in mixing bowl. Chop 4 sec/speed 4 and scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Sauté 7 min/120°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, line Varoma tray with baking paper.
Add celery stalks and green peas to mixing bowl and chop 8 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add water and 1 tsp salt to mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and add potatoes to it. Set Varoma dish in position, add broccoli florets to it and season them with ½ tsp salt. Insert prepared Varoma tray, arrange salmon fillets on the tray, season with ½ tsp salt and black pepper and drizzle with marinade. Close Varoma and cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set covered Varoma aside on a plate to keep warm. Remove simmering basket using spatula, set aside on a plate and cover with a tea towel to keep warm.

Add cream to mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and blend 2 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually. Serve soup for starter (see tip), then salmon fillets, potatoes and broccoli for the main course.
tips: A quick, healthy meal with bright flavours and colours, starting with a vibrant green pea soup with zingy ginger, followed by lemon-marinated salmon with steamed potatoes and broccoli: this recipe can turn a weeknight dinner into a special treat.
If making a carrot soup instead of a pea soup, make sure carrots are cut in small pieces.
If the celery stalks have leaves, place a few leaves on top of salmon fillets before steaming to add extra flavour.
For a milder taste omit drizzling salmon with marinade in step 3.
After serving the soup, set mixing bowl and covered Varoma back in position so the main course keeps warm while the soup is enjoyed.

title: Tomato ketchup
ingredients: 1000 g ripe tomatoes, cut in quarters  o 1000 g canned whole tomatoes
180 g red peppers, cut in pieces
¼ - ½ tsp ground cayenne pepper
steps: Place tomatoes, red peppers, onions, garlic cloves and 50 g vinegar in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7.
Add bay leaf, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid and cook 40 min/100°C/speed 2.

Remove bay leaf and add remaining 50 g vinegar, nutmeg, black pepper, cayenne pepper, paprika, salt and honey. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid and cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Blend 1 min/speed 3-7, increasing speed gradually. Transfer to sterilised bottles or jars and close air-tight. Allow to cool, then serve or store in refrigerator.
tips: Provided the bottles have been thoroughly washed and rinsed with boiling water, this sauce can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3 months.
If sauce seems too liquid after cooking in step 3, reduce a further 10 min/Varoma/speed 1 or longer, until desired consistency is achieved.
The flavour improves with time. If possible, keep it refrigerated for two weeks before serving.

title: Menu with vegetable velouté, chicken with mustard sauce and steamed vegetables
ingredients: 700 g mixed vegetables (e.g. courgettes, carrots, asparagus, peppers, broccoli), cut in slices (0.5 cm)
400 g potatoes, cut in slices (0.5 cm)
500 g chicken breast fillets, skinless, cut in strips (5 cm x 2 cm)  o 500 g turkey breast fillets, skinless, cut in strips (5 cm x 2 cm)
50 g cream cheese  o 50 g cream, min. 30% fat
steps: Place onions, garlic clove and olive oil in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add 350 g mixed vegetables to mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add water and 2 tsp salt, insert simmering basket and weigh potatoes into it. Set Varoma dish in position and add remaining 350 g mixed vegetables to it. Insert Varoma tray and arrange chicken on it. Drizzle chicken with soy sauce and sprinkle with pepper, sweet paprika and remaining ½ tsp salt. Mix well and close Varoma. Steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Remove Varoma and set aside on a plate to keep warm. Remove simmering basket using spatula and set aside. Add butter and blend soup 1 min/speed 5-10, increasing speed gradually.

To make the sauce, transfer almost all the soup to a serving bowl, keeping enough soup in the mixing bowl to cover the lowest blade of the mixing knife (approx. 100 g). Add cream cheese, mustard, salt, pepper, parsley and egg yolk and mix 20 sec/speed 7, then heat 2 min/60°C/speed 2.

Serve the creamy vegetable soup hot or allow to cool, cover and refrigerate for later use. Transfer chicken to a serving dish, arrange vegetables and potatoes around the chicken and serve hot with sauce .
tips: In step 1, replace olive oil with 20 g butter.
Replace chicken fillets with fish fillets (1.5 cm thick). For the sauce, replace mustard with freshly squeezed juice from half a lemon and add a pinch of cumin (optional).
Vary or add vegetables according to the season and your preferences.

title: Fruit ice cream
ingredients: 500 g frozen fruit, cut in pieces as needed, frozen in a single layer (see tip)
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 15 sec/speed 10.
Add frozen fruit and crush 15 sec/speed 8.
Add cream and blend with aid of spatula 40 sec/speed 5. Serve immediately.
tips: For a firmer consistency, place the ice cream in the freezer for 15 minutes before serving.
Whenever you have leftover fruit, freeze it for making ice cream later.

Freeze fruit in individual pieces or small clusters. Cut fruit in pieces as needed, spread out on a tray in a single layer, freeze, then use frozen fruit in recipe or transfer to a freezer bag for later use.
Use any frozen fruit (e.g. strawberries, raspberries, cherries, peaches).
For a lighter version, replace cream with plain yoghurt or curd cheese (quark), or a combination of the two.

title: Smoothie
ingredients: 350 - 450 g mixed fresh fruits, cut in pieces as needed
200 - 300 g fruit juice (e.g. apple, orange, grape, pineapple, cranberry)  o 200 - 300 g water
steps: Place mixed fresh fruit, fruit juice, ice cubes, lemon juice and sugar in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5, then blend 1 min/speed 10. Serve immediately.
tips: For best results use ripe fruit. If fruit is lacking in flavour, add the optional sugar.
Lemon juice helps keep colours bright and enhances the taste of the fruit.

Fresh fruit can be replaced with frozen fruit. To freeze fruit, cut in pieces as needed, spread out on a tray in a single layer, freeze, then use frozen fruit in recipe or transfer to a freezer bag for later use.
If using mostly frozen fruit, partially defrost fruit first and omit ice cubes.
If using very juicy fruit such as melon or watermelon, increase fruit to 500 g and reduce juice to 150 g.
If using a large proportion of less juicy fruit such as bananas, reduce fruit to 350 g and increase juice to 300 g.
Suggested combinations:- Melon, apple, orange juice- Peach, apple, banana, grape juice- Pear, banana, apple juice- Mango, raspberries, apple juice- Pineapple, plums, orange juice

title: Lemon Glazed Blueberry Muffins
steps: Lightly spray 9 silicone egg cups with non-stick spray oil. Divide cups between Varoma dish and tray and set aside. Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in blueberries and 15 g flour and toss together to coat. Set aside.
With a vegetable peeler, thinly peel zest from 1 lemon, avoiding the white pith and set the peel aside. Cut the lemon in half, squeeze the juice into a small bowl and set aside until needed.
Place sugar and reserved lemon peel into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil, yogurt, eggs, 30 g reserved lemon juice and vanilla and mix 10 sec/speed 4.
Add 185 g flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt and mix 5 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add reserved blueberries and mix through with spatula to combine. Divide batter between silicone cups, insert Varoma tray with filled cups and set Varoma aside. Rinse mixing bowl.

Place water into mixing bowl. Set Varoma with filled cups into position, secure Varoma lid and steam 35 min/Varoma/speed 2. Remove muffin cups from Varoma and allow to cool 15 minutes. Invert to unmould and set aside to cool completely. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Place icing sugar and lemon juice into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and mix 30 sec/speed 3. Drizzle Lemon Glaze over cooled muffins and serve.

title: Chicken with Creamed Spinach Crepes (Metric)
ingredients: 75 g butter, unsalted, in pieces, divided, plus extra to grease
1 ½ tsp salt, divided, to taste
140 g baby spinach, fresh, stems removed
595 g chicken breasts, skinless, boneless, organic, cubed (3 cm)
½ tsp black pepper, ground, to taste
70 - 140 g sour cream, any type, to taste
steps: Place first bowl into position. Place 45 g butter into mixing bowl and melt 2 min/70°C/speed 2.
Add milk, eggs, sugar, ½ tsp salt and flour and mix 30 sec/speed 8. Remove mixing bowl and let batter rest 30 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the filling.
Place second bowl into position. Place Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place mozzarella cheese into mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to bowl with reserved grated Parmesan cheese and set aside.
Place spinach into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a separate bowl and set aside.

Place 30 g butter, chicken, garlic powder, 1 tsp salt and pepper, to taste into mixing bowl, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 18 min/100°C//speed . Add reserved chopped spinach, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 3 min/100°C//speed .
Add sour cream and half the reserved cheese mixture, insert measuring cup and mix 5 sec//speed 4. Reserve in mixing bowl until ready to use.

Lightly grease a non-stick frying pan (22 cm) with butter and heat over medium heat. Pour in a small ladle of batter, twirling the pan as you pour to cover base of pan completely (crepe will be approx. 21.5 cm and very thin). Cook for 2-3 minutes or until edges of crepe are light and golden. Turn crepe over and cook a further 1 minute. Transfer to a plate and cover with a kitchen towel to keep warm. Repeat with remaining batter.
Preheat oven to 350°F/180°C. Grease a baking dish (20 cm x 20 cm x 5 cm) and set aside.

Fill each crepe with reserved spinach and chicken mixture and fold into envelopes, place the envelopes in prepared baking dish. Repeat the process with remaining filling and crepes. Sprinkle with remaining grated cheese and bake 25 minutes (350°F/180°C) or until cheese turns golden brown. Remove from oven and serve hot with a small salad of your choice.
tips: Make up to three days ahead: prepare crepes as per recipe, fill and sprinkled with cheese, cover and refrigerate. When ready to eat, bake 25 minutes at 350°F/180°C.

title: Broccoli and potatoes with blue cheese sauce
ingredients: 500 g potatoes, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
100 g blue cheese, cut in pieces
steps: Place broccoli florets in Varoma dish and set aside. Place water and salt in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket and weigh potatoes into it. Cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Set Varoma in position and cook a further 10-15 min/Varoma/speed 1 or until broccoli is cooked as desired.
Remove Varoma and remove simmering basket using spatula. Set covered Varoma aside on a plate to keep warm. Transfer cooking liquid to a bowl.
Place 400 g reserved cooking liquid, blue cheese, flour, butter and cream in mixing bowl and cook 10 min/90°C/speed 3.
Add white pepper and nutmeg and mix 5 sec/speed 6.
Transfer broccoli and potatoes to a serving dish, drizzle with cheese sauce and serve immediately.
tips: Replace broccoli with cauliflower.
Add fresh dill to the sauce.

title: Potato cakes
steps: Place potatoes, onions, lemon juice, salt, black pepper, cornflour, oat flakes and egg in mixing bowl and chop with aid of spatula 12 sec/speed 5.

Pour frying oil into a hot non-stick frying pan, covering the bottom of the pan with a thin layer, and heat. Place 2 heaped tbsp of mixture per potato cake in the hot frying oil and using the spoon, flatten each heap to form a pancake shape (Ø 10 cm). Fry potato cakes on both sides until golden brown and crisp. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot.
tips: A traditional German dish, served with sweet or savoury side dishes depending on the region.
Serve with apple sauce or for a savoury alternative, with sour cream or herbed cottage cheese.
Use fresh potatoes. If you clean the potatoes well, there is no need to peel them.

Depending on the kind of potatoes used, and how long the batter is left to rest before frying, you may need to add more cornflour or oat flakes, or to remove excess moisture from the batter using a spoon.

Vegetable potato cakes: replace ⅓ of the potatoes with vegetables (e.g. carrots, kohlrabi, cauliflower, courgettes). Double the amount of starch and oat flakes. Season with ground mixed pepper and serve with a sour cream herb dip.
As the batter can be prepared in seconds, it is easy to repeat this recipe quickly to increase portions for a party.

title: Chicken Coq au Vin (Betty) Metric
ingredients: 60 g extra virgin olive oil, divided
30 g butter, unsalted, plus 1 heaping tbsp, room temperature
8 chicken thighs, skin on, bone in  o 1 chicken
225 g bacon, unsmoked, in pieces (5 cm)
225 g carrots, peeled, in rounds (2 cm)
225 g cremini mushrooms, trimmed, halved or quartered, if large
1 tsp black pepper, freshly ground, to taste
mashed potato, to serve  o pasta, any type, cooked, to serve
steps: Preheat oven to 190°C/375°F.
Place 30 g olive oil and onions into mixing bowl and brown High Temp. .

Heat 30 g olive oil and 30 g butter in a frying pan over medium/medium-high heat until bubbling. Working in batches of 2-3 pieces at a time, brown the chicken until golden, turning to brown evenly. Do not over-crowd the pan. Place browned chicken pieces into a stoneware casserole dish Betty.

Drain and discard grease from frying pan. In the same frying pan, cook bacon over medium heat 8-10 minutes and place into casserole dish Betty, distributing around the chicken. Distribute reserved browned onions, carrots, mushrooms, salt, pepper, wine, garlic, thyme and bay leaves around the chicken.

Bake 45-60 minutes (190°C/375°F). Remove and discard bay leaves and thyme, set chicken aside and keep warm. Carefully, pour liquid from Betty into mixing bowl (approx. 710-850 g) and without measuring cup boil 30 min/100°C/speed 2, until reduced by half.
Add 1 heaping tbsp butter and flour, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook Thicken /100°C. Pour sauce over chicken, sprinkle with parsley and serve with mashed potatoes or noodles.
tips: Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.

Coq au vin is a classic French stew in which chicken is braised slowly in red wine to yield a supremely rich sauce filled with tender meat. For a lighter version, reduce red wine to 340 g and 115 g chicken stock (or 115 g water).

title: Caramel toffees
ingredients: 80 g butter, cold, cut in cubes (2-3 cm)
1 - 2 tsp sea salt flakes (opcional)  o 1 - 2 tsp mixed seeds (opcional)
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stage modes, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar in the mixing bowl.
Line a square baking tray (17 cm x 17 cm) with baking paper and set aside.

Place sugar, 30 g water, cream, butter, lemon juice and vanilla extract in mixing bowl. Place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start Sugar Stages . Transfer caramel immediately to prepared baking tray, and, using spatula, immediately scrape off any mixture left on rim of mixing bowl so mixing bowl lid closes securely for Pre-clean mode. Allow to cool 5 minutes and garnish to taste with sea salt flakes, seeds or nuts.
Place 1000 g water and vinegar in mixing bowl and start Pre-clean .

Allow the caramel to cool a further 35 minutes and cut while still warm with a sharp knife into rectangles (approx. 1 cm x 3 cm). Allow toffees to cool completely and individually wrap with baking paper squares (5 cm). Store in an air-tight container at room temperature (see tip).
tips: To succeed with this recipe the butter needs to be added cold and cut in 2-3 cm cubes, not smaller.
Adding lemon juice prevents the sugar from burning or crystallising, without affecting the flavour.
Store the caramel toffees for 1-2 weeks, individually wrapped, in an air-tight container and in a cool place to prevent moisture absorption.

title: Lemony Apple Cider Vinaigrette
steps: Place a pitcher onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in olive oil and set aside. Use a zester or vegetable peeler to remove thin peel from ½ the lemon, avoiding the white pith and set aside. Cut lemon in half, squeeze the juice into a small bowl and set aside.
Place garlic and reserved lemon peel into mixing bowl and chop 15 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add cider vinegar, honey, Dijon mustard salt and 15 g lemon juice and start, mix Blend /1 min while slowly pouring reserved oil in a thin stream onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle in a thin stream onto rotating blades.Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Transfer dressing to a sterilized jar with airtight lid (see Tip), seal and store in refrigerator. Use as desired and consume within one week.
tips: To prepare jar: place 500 g water into mixing bowl. Place jar and lid upside down in the centre of the Varoma and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Leave to drain - do not dry or touch the inside surfaces. Alternatively, thoroughly wash jar and lid in hot, soapy water. Rinse by pouring over with boiling water. Prepare for filling, if needed, by placing on a clean tea towel in a roasting pan and heating in the oven at 100°C/212˚F until required.

title: Chocolate Covered Pound Cake (Metric)
ingredients: 225 g dark chocolate chips  o 225 g dark chocolate
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F. Lightly grease a loaf pan (approx. 23 cm x 13 cm) and line with baking paper, letting edges hang over sides of pan (excess paper will serve as handles to lift out the cake).
Place first bowl into position. Place oil, sugar and eggs into mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cocoa, flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda and milk and mix 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 5 sec/speed 5.

Transfer mixture into prepared pan, place pan onto a baking tray and bake 60-70 minutes (176°C/350°F) or until a toothpick inserted in the center of cake comes out clean and cake is just pulling away from sides of the pan. Allow to cool in pan 10 minutes. Meanwhile, place a wire rack onto a piece of baking paper. Transfer cooled cake to prepared rack and let cool completely before glazing.

Place second bowl into position. Insert butterfly whisk. Place whipping cream, milk and chocolate into mixing bowl and mix 6 min/50°C/speed 4. Remove butterfly whisk. Pour chocolate glaze over pound cake and spread with spatula. Cool, slice and serve at room temperature.

title: Boiled eggs
steps: Place water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket and place eggs in it. Steam time according to taste/Varoma/speed 1. Cooking time depends on how you like your eggs: 10 minutes very runny (egg yolk liquid, egg white viscous) 11 minutes runny (egg yolk liquid, egg white firm) 12 minutes soft (egg yolk soft) 13 minutes firm boiled 14 minutes hard boiled
Immediately remove simmering basket using spatula and place simmering basket with eggs under cold running water to stop cooking. Use boiled eggs as needed.
tips: Using eggs at room temperature, smaller eggs or hot water will shorten cooking time.

title: Berry foam
ingredients: 500 g mixed frozen red berries or other frozen fruit of choice, e.g. blueberries, mango, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
10 - 30 g lemon juice  o 10 - 30 g lime juice
100 g mixed fresh red berries, to garnish (opcional)
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind Turbo/2 sec/2-3 times.
Add mixed frozen red berries and crush 10 sec/speed 8.
Add lemon juice, egg white and blend with aid of spatula 40 sec/speed 5.
Insert butterfly whisk, and whisk 1 min/speed 3. Remove butterfly whisk and serve cold in dessert bowls, garnished with mixed fresh red berries.
tips: For a firmer texture, whisk a further 1-2 min/speed 3 in step 4.

title: Sponge cake
ingredients: 1 tsp vanilla sugar, homemade  o ½ tsp natural vanilla extract
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease a springform tin (Ø 22 cm) and set aside.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place eggs, sugar and vanilla sugar in mixing bowl and whisk 6 min/37°C/speed 4. Whisk for a further 6 min/speed 4.
Add flour, baking powder and salt around butterfly whisk and mix 4 sec/speed 3.
Remove butterfly whisk and carefully complete stirring using spatula.

Transfer mixture to prepared springform tin and bake immediately for 20-25 minutes (180°C). Allow cake to cool for approx. 10 minutes before removing from springform tin. Allow cake to cool completely on a cooling rack before slicing in half horizontally for filling.
tips: This cake can be used as a base for a variety of different cakes with fillings such as fruit, flavoured cream or whipped cream (e.g. San Marcos cake, truffle cake, fraisier). Or serve it on its own or with a dusting of icing sugar.
If springform tin is larger, or if you wish to cut the cake in three layers, increase recipe using 1.5 x the ingredients and increase baking time by a few minutes.
The baking powder helps the sponge cake rise but it can be omitted for a traditional génoise recipe.
Cake texture is at its best when consumed within one day. To prevent sponge cake from drying out, store it in a container in the refrigerator.
Chocolate sponge cake: use only 80 g flour and add 40 g cocoa powder.

Rolled cake: bake the sponge cake in a thin rectangular layer for use in jam rolls, Swiss rolls, etc. Transfer cake batter to a baking tray lined with baking paper or a silicone mat. Spread batter into a rectangle (40 cm x 30 cm) and bake immediately for 8 minutes (180°C). Roll cake while it is still hot with the help of a clean tea towel. Allow to cool, carefully unroll, remove towel, spread filling and roll again.

title: Chocolate Rolls (Anna) Metric
ingredients: 1 egg yolk, from a large egg
100 g milk chocolate chips or baking chocolate
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in raisins and rum and set aside.
Place water, whipping cream, sugar, butter and yeast into mixing bowl and warm 5 min/37°C/speed .
Add salt, egg yolk, flour and cocoa and knead Dough /5 min. Transfer to a bowl and cover with cling film. Leave to proof in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 30 min.).
Grease a stoneware baking dish Anna with butter and set aside.
Place butter into mixing bowl and melt 3 min/37°C/speed 1. Add brown sugar, granulated sugar and cocoa and mix 5 sec/speed 3.5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Transfer risen dough to a floured work surface and roll out into a rectangle (approx. 30 cm x 40 cm). Leaving a 5 cm border along the top short side, spread dough with reserved filling and sprinkle with chocolate chips and reserved soaked raisins (reserve the rum). Starting from the short side covered with filling, roll the dough into a tight log (approx. 5-6 cm diam.).

Cut the roll into 12 equal slices and space 5 cm apart inside baking dish Anna. Cover with a damp kitchen towel and leave in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 30 min.). Meanwhile, preheat oven to 350°F/180°C.
Bake 15-20 minutes (350°F/180°C). Remove from oven and allow to cool.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place butter, sugar, cocoa, cream cheese and reserved rum into mixing bowl and mix 1 min 30 sec/speed 3.5. Remove butterfly whisk. Spread rolls with glaze and serve.
tips: Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.
Replace chocolate chips with an additional 100 g rum soaked dark raisins.

title: Bistro Mayonnaise
ingredients: 250 g grapeseed oil, room temperature  o 250 g neutral oil, e.g. safflower, canola, room temperature
15 g white wine vinegar  o 15 g white vinegar
steps: Place a small pitcher onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in oil and set aside.

Place egg yolk, vinegar, water, Dijon mustard, salt and pepper into mixing bowl and mix 1 min 30 sec/speed 4 while very slowly pouring reserved oil onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle in a thin stream onto rotating blades. Transfer to an air-tight container, store in refrigerator and consume within 2-4 days.
tips: Ingredients must be at room temperature. Pour in oil slowly at first, and finish in the first minute to leave the last 30 seconds to emulsify.
For a delicious aioli, start the recipe by placing 1-2 garlic cloves into the empty mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Leave chopped garlic in mixing bowl and proceed as directed by the recipe.
Recipe makes approximately 265-300 g.

title: Steamed cabbage and pork dumplings
ingredients: 1 tbsp oil, plus extra for greasing
150 g water, plus extra as needed
300 g flour, plus extra for dusting
400 g white cabbage leaves, cut in pieces
10 g rice wine  o 10 g sake
steps: Oil Varoma dish, Varoma tray and a bowl and set aside.

Place water, flour, oil and salt in mixing bowl and knead Dough /2 min. If dough seems dry, add 10 g water (2 tsp) and knead a further Dough /1 min. Transfer dough to prepared bowl and form into a ball. Cover bowl and allow to rest for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the filling.
Place white cabbage leaves and 1 tsp salt in mixing bowl and chop with aid of spatula 20 sec/speed 4. Transfer to simmering basket and set aside to drain.
Place pork mince, 30 g water, soy sauce, rice wine, sugar, remaining ½ tsp salt, pepper and light sesame oil in mixing bowl and mix 2 min/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Squeeze excess moisture out of cabbage by pressing it against sides of simmering basket, add cabbage to mixing bowl and mix 6 sec//speed 6. Transfer filling to a big plate and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Turn rested dough out onto a floured surface. Divide dough into 4 equal pieces and shape each piece into a rope (Ø 2 cm). Use spatula to cut each rope into 8-10 small pieces and form them into balls.

With a rolling pin, roll each ball of dough into a thin round shape (Ø 9 cm). Place 1 tbsp filling in the centre of each and fold the wrapper in half over the filling to make a semi-circle shape. Pinch the seam in the centre and hold it with one hand while using the other hand to pleat the top edge of the wrapper from the middle outwards on both sides. Arrange dumplings in prepared Varoma dish and tray.
Place 500 g water in mixing bowl, set Varoma in position and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and serve dumplings hot.
tips: Thermomix® lends itself perfectly to making dim sum such as these; kneading the dough, chopping and mixing the filling, and steaming the dumplings can all be done with your Thermomix®. If you've never shaped dumplings before, take your time and practise with friends or children to help you. By the second time you make these, you will be much faster, and you may find that you enjoy the process as much as the fresh homemade flavour of the end result.
These dumplings are usually served with a dip of black vinegar or soy sauce, or a mixture of both (e.g. 3 tbsp soy sauce + 1 tbsp black or white vinegar). Chopped garlic and chilli can also be added.
If you're in a hurry, use ready-made dumpling wrappers from an Asian supermarket.
You can prepare dumplings ahead of time and freeze them. Steam as described in recipe without defrosting, adding 5 minutes to steaming time.

title: Versatile smooth soup
ingredients: 170 - 200 g mixed vegetables, for sautéing (e.g. onions, shallots, leek), cut in pieces (2 cm)
700 - 800 g mixed vegetables, for soup (e.g. courgettes, carrots, pumpkin, sweet potatoes, celeriac, parsnips, green peas), cut in pieces as needed
1 tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
steps: Place olive oil and mixed vegetables for sautéing in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and sauté High Temp. .
Add mixed vegetables for soup and chop 5 sec/speed 4.
Add water, vegetable stock paste and salt and cook 25 min/100°C/speed 2. Start Blend /1 min 30 sec. Serve hot.
tips: Garnish with chopped aromatic herbs, croutons, toasted seeds, a drizzle of cream or extra virgin olive oil.

title: Matcha Wreath Cookies (Metric)
ingredients: 60 g icing sugar, plus extra to dust
steps: Preheat oven to 325°F/160°C. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment and set aside.
Place cranberries into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8 Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place pistachios into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a separate bowl and set aside. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Place butter and icing sugar into mixing bowl and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Add whipping cream and mix 5 sec/speed 4.

Add salt, matcha powder and cake flour, insert measuring cup and mix 10 sec/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 5 sec/speed 3. Transfer to a piping bag with large star nozzle, pipe into wreaths on prepared baking sheets and bake 18-20 minutes (325°F/160°C) until lightly golden. Allow to cool completely. Clean and dry mixing bowl.

Place white chocolate into mixing bowl and heat 3 min/50°C/speed 1. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Dip part of cookie into melted chocolate and decorate with reserved nuts and cranberries. Dust with icing sugar and serve.
tips: Recipe inspired by Chengxiang Hong Thermomix® Independent Consultant British Columbia, Canada.
For even baking with two cookie sheets at once, space racks so oven is divided into thirds and switch cookie sheets top to bottom and back to front halfway through baking.
Pipe batter into Christmas tree shapes.

title: Japanese Souffle Pancakes (Metric)
ingredients: 85 g cake and pastry flour, sifted
1 tbsp mayonnaise, full fat  o 1 tbsp Japanese mayonnaise, kewpie mayonnaise
steps: Separate 4 large eggs, place egg yolks and egg whites into separate bowls. Set egg yolks aside and refrigerate egg whites until ready to use.

Place first bowl into position. Insert butterfly whisk. Place chilled egg whites and cream of tartar into mixing bowl and without measuring cup, whip 1 min 30 sec/speed 4. Add sugar and whip 2 min 30 sec/speed 4 until glossy and soft peaks form. Remove butterfly whisk. Set mixing bowl aside.

Place second bowl into position. Insert butterfly whisk. Place flour, egg yolks, milk, baking powder, vanilla and mayonnaise into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and whip 40 sec/speed 4 just until batter is smooth and pale yellow. Remove butterfly whisk.

With spatula, scoop out one-third of the whipped egg whites and gently fold into the batter until incorporated. Make sure to start folds from the bottom so all batter is mixed. Once incorporated, add in another third of the reserved whipped egg whites. Gently fold in to incorporate and then fold in the final third whipped egg whites until batter is very light and airy and there are no visible white streaks.

Place two ring molds (8-10 cm) into a large frying pan, grease the interior of the molds and the bottom of pan where the pancakes will be cooked with nonstick cooking spray. Heat the pan with the molds over low heat. Fill molds ¾ full with batter, allowing room for batter to rise. Add ½ tbsp of water to each side of the pan (preferably not touching the pancakes). Cover pan with lid and allow to cook 3-4 minutes or until centers are completely set. Use a spatula or turner to flip the pancakes (while still in their molds). Cover and cook for another 2-3 minutes until pancakes are completely cooked and golden brown on both sides.
Gently push pancakes out of molds to remove, transfer to a plate and keep warm. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve warm with syrup, butter and fresh berries.
tips: Serve with icing sugar, whipped cream, fruit, or other toppings of your choice.

title: Baci di dama (Hazelnut Kiss Cookies) Metric
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F/180°C. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment and set aside.
Place flour, hazelnuts, almonds and salt into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place butter, sugar and vanilla into mixing bowl and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add reserved flour mixture and mix 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix 20 sec/speed 3.5.
Use a small scoop to form dough into 24 balls (approx. 15 g ea.). Use your hands to shape and form a smooth surface and place onto prepared baking sheets.
Bake 12-15 minutes (350°F/180°C). Let cool completely. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl.
Place chocolate into mixing bowl and chop 4-5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and melt 2 min/50°C/speed 2.
Spread a thin layer of melted chocolate on the flat side of half the cookies, then cover with remaining cookies and sandwich together. Allow chocolate to set before serving.
tips: Recipe inspired by Anna Finazzi Thermomix® Independent Consultant North Carolina.
Replace almonds with almond flour and hazelnut with hazelnut flour and omit the step to grind the nuts to flour.

title: Caramelised red onion chutney
ingredients: 500 g red onions, cut in wedges
½ - 1 fresh red chilli, cut in strips
steps: Place olive oil and red onions in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and caramelise High Temp. .

Add red chilli, brown sugar, salt and red wine vinegar and cook 25 min/Varoma//speed 0.5. Pour into a warm jam jar with twist-off lid and seal immediately (see tip). Allow to cool. Refrigerate for 1 day before serving. Keep refrigerated for up to 1 month.
tips: Clean jam jar and lid thoroughly in hot soapy water, then dry in a low oven (100°C) or run it through the dishwasher. Pour chutney into jar while jar is still warm.
If some caramelised onion sticks to the bottom of the mixing bowl, in the next step vinegar will dissolve it almost completely.

title: Canadian Strawberry Shortcake
ingredients: 1500 g fresh strawberries, cleaned and sliced, plus extra to garnish
170 g unsalted butter, cold, cut into pieces
10 g vanilla paste  o 10 g natural vanilla extract, pure
steps: Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in strawberries and sugar, stir with spatula to combine and set aside for an hour to macerate. Continue with recipe.
Set oven rack to middle position and preheat to 190°C/375˚F. Line a baking sheet with parchment and set aside.
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in heavy cream and eggs, whisk with a fork to combine and set aside.
Place flour, baking powder, sugar, butter and salt into mixing bowl and mix Turbo/2.0 sec/2 times until mixture resembles coarse crumbs with some pea-size bits.
Add reserved whisked egg mixture around edges of mixing bowl, gently stir with spatula to combine and knead Dough /15 sec until moisture is absorbed and dough is crumbly.

Transfer to a clean work surface and gently bring together into a ball by hand or with a D-shaped dough spatula. Form into 8 biscuits (see Tip) and place onto prepared baking sheet. Bake 20 minutes (190°C/375°F) or until baked to your liking. Transfer to a wire rack to cool. Meanwhile, clean and dry mixing bowl and make the Whipped Cream.

Insert butterfly whisk. Place whipping cream, sugar and vanilla into mixing bowl and without measuring cup, whip without setting a time/speed 3.5 until soft peaks form, listening for change in sound and stop when desired stiffness is achieved. Remove butterfly whisk. Refrigerate whipped cream until ready to serve or split warm biscuits and fill with reserved strawberries. Top with whipped cream, garnish with a sprig of mint and strawberry slices. Serve immediately with remaining whipped cream and strawberries on the side.
tips: The word “Shortcake” is derived from an old English cooking definition which refers to something made crisp with the addition of fat. A shortcake is a crisp, crumbly biscuit made with butter. The traditional Canadian Strawberry Shortcake is always made with a butter-rich slightly sweetened biscuit often with heavy cream replacing the typical buttermilk to increase the crumbly crisp richness of the biscuit.

To form biscuits, lightly flour the inside of a 125 ml or ½ cup measuring cup and gently pack dough into it, then invert and tap out onto parchment covered baking sheet. If necessary, run a knife around circumference of cup to loosen dough.
Bake shortcake biscuits an additional 4 minutes if a crunchy golden top is preferred.

The required time to whip cream depends upon the temperature, fat content and quantity of the cream. The higher the fat content, the easier it is to whip the cream to a stiff texture. Take care to not over whip or it will turn to butter. Listen for a change in the mixing sound. We recommend checking for soft peaks after 30 seconds and whipping to desired consistency.
To reheat biscuits, slice each room temperature biscuit in half gently with a serrated knife, then reheat for 5-10 minutes 205°C/400˚F just before assembling.

title: Chicken Breasts Au Gratin in Chipotle Salsa (Ben) Metric
ingredients: 30 g chipotle chillies, canned, to taste
1 tsp black pepper, freshly ground, to taste
255 g white button mushrooms, fresh, quartered
5 - 6 chicken breasts, skinless, boneless, in large cubes (5 cm)
8 slices ham, cooked, smoked, cut into bite size pieces
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F/180°C.
Place Manchego cheese into mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place chipotle, cream cheese, whipping cream, salt, pepper, onions and water into mixing bowl and blend 1 min/speed 10. Add corn and mushrooms and mix well with spatula to combine. Pour into stoneware baking dish Ben and spread out evenly with spatula.

Season chicken with salt and pepper to taste, place chicken pieces and ham into baking dish Ben, sprinkle with reserved grated cheese and bake 25-30 minutes (350°F/180°C). Increase oven temperature to 420°F/220°C and bake 6-10 minutes (420°F/220°C) until top is golden brown. Remove from oven and serve.
tips: Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.

title: Liver Detox (Metric)
ingredients: ½ apple, green, peeled, cored and quartered  o 2 radishes, red, quartered
5 cm ginger, fresh, peeled and cut into pieces
2 stalks celery, cut into pieces, plus leaves
340 g alkaline water or 340 g spring water
steps: Place apple, pineapple, ginger, celery, parsley and water into mixing bowl and start Blend /1 min.
Strain through a fine-mesh sieve into a pitcher and serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.
tips: Strain pulp from juice to taste. Pulp is where the fibre is, and fibre helps to decrease sugars in the blood. For the most health benefits, add some pulp back into the juice and thin to desired consistency with water.
Pulp can be used to liven up smoothies, turn into ice cubes to flavour water or add to baked goods, reducing the need for oils or butter.

title: Citrus Kick (Metric)
ingredients: 5 cm ginger, fresh, cut into pieces
450 - 570 g alkaline water or 450-570 g spring water
1 - 2 tbsp honey, to taste  o 1 - 2 tbsp agave syrup, to taste
steps: Place ginger and carrots into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add water, orange, lemon and honey and blend Turbo/2 sec/1-2 times. Strain juice through a fine-mesh sieve into a pitcher and serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.
tips: Strain pulp from juice to taste. Pulp is where the fibre is, and fibre helps to decrease sugars in the blood. For the most health benefits, add some pulp back into the juice and thin to desired consistency with water.
Pulp can be used to liven up smoothies, turn into ice cubes to flavour water or add to baked goods, reducing the need for oils or butter.
Mix with a scoop of protein powder.

title: Tomato rice
ingredients: 200 g fresh tomatoes, cut in halves  o 200 g canned tomatoes
steps: Place onions, garlic cloves, tomatoes and olive oil in mixing bowl, chop 5 sec/speed 5, then sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add rice, salt and water, mix well using spatula and cook 17 min/100°C//speed 1. Serve immediately.
tips: Serve as a side dish for fish, meat or poultry.
This dish has a fairly liquid consistency.
In step 2 add 50 g sun-dried tomatoes, cut in small cubes.

title: Chicken corn chowder, Broccoli terrines
ingredients: ¼ tsp ground black pepper, adjust to taste
140 g onions, cut in halves,  o 140 g shallots, cut in halves
350 - 400 g chicken breasts, skinless, boneless, cut in pieces (3 cm)
2 tsp chicken stock paste, homemade,  o 2 chicken stock cubes (each for 0.5 l)
1 fresh green chilli (e.g. jalapeño), deseeded, chopped (opcional)
200 - 300 g cream,  o 200 - 300 g sour cream
2 tbsp fresh coriander, leaves only, chopped
steps: Place water in mixing bowl. Set Varoma dish in position, add broccoli florets to it, close Varoma and steam 10 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile, grease 8 ceramic ramekins (Ø max. 7 cm x 4.5 cm high) with butter. Set Varoma aside and empty mixing bowl.

Place steamed broccoli, eggs, cream, salt, black pepper and nutmeg in mixing bowl and mix 1 min/speed 5. Divide mixture evenly between prepared ramekins and arrange them in Varoma dish and tray. Set Varoma aside and clean mixing bowl.
Place garlic cloves and onions in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add butter and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add sweetcorn kernels and sauté 5 min/120°C/speed , then chop 6 sec/speed 7.
Add chicken breast pieces and cook 3 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add water and chicken stock paste, set Varoma with broccoli terrines in position and cook 27 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set covered Varoma aside on a plate to keep terrines warm.
Add green chilli, cream, salt, cumin and sweet paprika to mixing bowl, mix 10 sec/speed 4, then cook 5 min/90°C/speed 1.5.
Serve chicken corn chowder sprinkled with chopped coriander leaves as a starter, followed by broccoli terrines as a main dish (see tip).
tips: Thermomix® helps you prepare a meal for 8 people in less than 40 minutes spent in the kitchen. Serve the creamy chicken corn chowder as a starter, followed by the broccoli terrines as a light main dish.
To keep the broccoli terrines warm while you enjoy the chowder, set the covered Varoma with the broccoli terrines on the empty but still warm mixing bowl.
Tip terrines out onto a plate for an attractive presentation.
Broccoli terrines can also be served as a starter or as a side dish, for instance with smoked salmon or roasted meat.
Instead of ceramic ramekins, use glass jars or metal moulds. If using metal moulds, reduce cooking time by 2 minutes in step 7.

title: French Fries (Paul) Metric
ingredients: 45 g extra virgin olive oil  o 45 g vegetable oil
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F/220°C. Meanwhile, scrub potatoes, then cut into fries (see Tip).
Place water into mixing bowl, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and boil Kettle /100°C. Carefully remove simmering basket and set aside.

Set Varoma dish into position, place cut fries into Varoma dish leaving some holes clear for steam to circulate, secure Varoma lid and steam 10 min/Varoma/speed 2. Pat steamed fries with paper towel to remove excess condensation.

Transfer steamed fries to a large bowl, sprinkle with olive oil and salt and toss to coat. Working In batches, place seasoned fries in a single layer onto a stoneware pizza stone Paul and bake 23-25 minutes (425°F/220°C) or until crisp and golden. Repeat with remaining steamed fries. Serve hot with Quick Aioli (for recipe see Tip).
tips: Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

To cut potatoes into fries: place a potato on its side and using a large knife, cut a thin slice off the edge to serve as a flat base. Turn the potato cut side down and cut thin slices to your preferred French fry width. Stack a few of the slices and cut them in the other direction to create French fries.
For crispier fries: soak the cut potatoes in cold water for 30 minutes (in a colander placed in a larger bowl) to remove some starch, before steaming.

Quick Aioli: Place 2-3 garlic cloves into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Add 200 g mayonnaise, 2 tsp Dijon mustard, 2 tsp lemon juice, ¼ tsp salt, to taste and mix 30 sec/speed 3.5. Transfer to serving bowl and serve immediately or cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless . For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.
Season fries with cracked pepper, paprika, chili powder, garlic, dried herbs or Old Bay® Seasoning.

title: Quick fruit sorbet
ingredients: 1 lemon, peeled, white pith and pips removed
300 g mixed fresh fruit, cut in pieces as needed
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 15 sec/speed 10.
Add lemon and mixed fresh fruit and chop 10 sec/speed 5.
Add ice cubes and blend with aid of spatula 1 min 30 sec/speed 9. Serve immediately.
tips: For a creamier consistency, add one egg white in step 2.
Instead of peeling the lemon you can squeeze out the juice and add it in step 2.

title: Baba Ganoush
ingredients: 3 tbsp parsley leaf, fresh, plus 1 tbsp roughly chopped
1 ½ tsp extra virgin olive oil, for drizzling, plus extra for brushing
steps: Brush eggplants with oil and grill on a barbecue, turning regularly with tongs, until soft and completely charred (see Tip). Leave to cool then slit eggplants lengthways and scoop out flesh, discarding skins. Transfer eggplant flesh to simmering basket and press out excess liquid with spatula then set aside.
Place garlic into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add lemon juice, tahini, 2 tbsp parsley, chilli powder (if using) and salt then mix 10 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add reserved eggplant flesh and mix 4 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a serving bowl, sprinkle with remaining 1 tbsp chopped parsley and drizzle with 1½ tsp olive oil. Serve with toasted whole wheat pita chips or crudités.
tips: This Middle Eastern dip is deliciously smoky, the creamy aubergine flesh is so flavourful that only a handful of simple ingredients are required to finish off this moreish dip.

Best roasting results are achieved on a barbecue. However, if a barbecue is not available,  eggplants can be cooked in the oven under a medium grill for approx. 30 minutes, turning halfway, until completely charred and soft. The flavour will not be as smoky.

title: Quinoa salad with crunchy vegetables
steps: Place spring onion in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place carrots and courgettes in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Transfer to Varoma dish and set aside.
Place water and 1 tsp salt in Mixing bowl and bring to a boil 5 min/Varoma/speed 2.
Add quinoa, set Varoma in position and steam 13 min/Varoma//speed 2.

Set Varoma aside, strain quinoa through simmering basket and allow to drain. Transfer vegetables from Varoma and quinoa to a bowl and allow to cool for at least 10 minutes. Add chopped spring onion, diced tomatoes, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, nigella seeds, ½ tsp salt and pepper. Combine and season to taste. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
tips: Quinoa is one of the pseudo-cereals, i.e. it is not a real grain and therefore gluten-free, but is used much like grain.
Quinoa has a slightly nutty flavour and can be prepared sweet or savory.
As a side dish, quinoa can be served instead of rice, polenta or pasta.
Vary the salad by adding parsley, chives, basil, mint or raisins to taste

title: Shredded Brussels Sprout Salad with Bacon and Cranberries
ingredients: 80 g extra virgin olive oil, divided
1 lemon, thin peelings of skin and 25 g juice
20 g sherry vinegar  o red wine vinegar
500 g Brussels sprouts, trimmed, halved if large
steps: Place bacon and 10 g oil into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and sauté 5 min/120°C//speed 0.5. Transfer bacon into simmering basket and position over a bowl to catch bacon drippings (see Tip). Place reserved bacon into a large bowl and place bowl onto mixing bowl lid. Weigh in cranberries and pumpkin seed and set aside.
Place garlic and lemon peel into mixing bowl then chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and chop a further 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add lemon juice, vinegar, honey, remaining 70 g oil, mustard, salt and pepper and mix 20 sec/speed 6. Scrape down lid and sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 250 g Brussels sprouts and shred 2 sec/speed 5. Transfer to bowl with bacon then set aside.
Place remaining 250 g Brussels sprouts in mixing bowl and shred 2 sec/speed 5. Transfer to bowl with shredded sprouts. Mix well then serve immediately or refrigerate until needed.
tips: Typically boiled or steamed, sprouts are considered an essential addition to the Christmas table. Here we serve them raw, shredded and mixed with lardons and cranberries in a delicious salad that is perfect served with cold cuts on Boxing Day.
Reserve bacon drippings in refrigerator up to a week for another use.

title: Classic Mashed Potatoes
ingredients: 1000 g floury potatoes, e.g. Russet, peeled and cubed (2 cm/¾ in.), (see Tip)
black pepper, freshly ground, to taste
fresh parsley leaves, chopped, to garnish
steps: Place potatoes, milk and salt into mixing bowl, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 35 min/95°C/speed 1 until fork tender. Carefully remove simmering basket and set aside. If necessary, cook a further 4-5 min/95°C/speed 1.

Add butter, nutmeg and pepper, insert measuring cup and mix 12 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 4 sec/speed 7. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley leaves and serve hot.
