tips: The best mashed potatoes are achieved using floury potatoes.
Cooking and mashing time can be adjusted according to variety of potatoes used and desired texture.
Check that potatoes are very tender before mashing. If they still seem firm, cook for an additional 5 minutes.
For chunky mashed potatoes: mash only 15-20 sec/speed 3.
For a more liquid purée: add 100 g milk when adding butter and nutmeg.
For Italian-style mashed potatoes: prepare the mashed potatoes using only ½ tsp salt, and add 30 g grated Parmesan cheese when adding butter and nutmeg.

title: Fueled Up Protein Shake (Metric)
ingredients: 1 portion whey protein powder, vanilla flavoured (1 serving - see Tip)
steps: Place spinach, soy milk, banana, protein powder, peanut butter and cocoa powder into mixing bowl and start Blend /30 sec.
Divide between two glasses, top with hemp seeds and serve.
tips: One portion protein powder is equal to one serving. All protein powders will come with a Nutrition Facts label that shows the serving size, as well as how many scoops are in each serving.
Replace soy milk with oat, hemp or almond milk.

title: Cashew Milk (Metric)
steps: Place cashews and 200 g water into mixing bowl, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 10 min/100°C/speed 1. Remove simmering basket and set aside.

Add remaining 795 g water and vanilla, insert measuring cup and start Blend /1 min. Line simmering basket with a nut milk bag and place into a large bowl. Pour mixture into prepared simmering basket. Strain mixture through nut milk bag (squeezing to extract all liquid). Transfer to glass bottles, cover and refrigerate until ready to serve (see Tip). Store milk in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Serve cold.
tips: Shake well before drinking, as it tends to separate.
For additional sweetness, add 2 dried pitted dates with water and vanilla and blend as per recipe.

title: Frozen fruit sorbet
ingredients: 500 g fruit, cut in pieces as needed, frozen in a single layer (see tip)
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Add frozen fruit, lemon juice and egg white and blend with aid of spatula 1 min 30 sec/speed 5. Serve immediately.
tips: Fruit should be frozen in individual pieces or small clusters. Cut fruit in pieces as needed, spread out on a tray, freeze, then use frozen fruit in recipe or transfer to a freezer bag for later use.
For a firmer consistency, place the sorbet in the freezer for 15 minutes before serving.
If using frozen berries, allow to rest at room temperature 10-15 minutes before step 2.
For a lighter texture and flavour when using the egg white, blend 30 sec/speed 10  after step 2.
For a creamier sorbet: insert butterfly whisk after step 2 and whip 1 min/speed 3.
Replace lemon juice with 2 tsp homemade vanilla sugar.
Quick milkshake: place 1-2 tbsp sorbet and 200 g milk in mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 6.

title: Chinese pork with vegetables
ingredients: 600 g pork tenderloin, cut in strips (0.5 cm x 1 cm x 5 cm)
150 g red onions, cut in wedges
150 g red pepper, cut in strips (0.5 cm x 5 cm)
150 g carrots, cut in strips (0.5 cm x 5 cm)
150 g baby pak choi, roughly chopped
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh into it pork tenderloin and 30 g soy sauce and mix well using spatula. Cover and allow to marinate in refrigerator for 15-20 minutes.
Place a large bowl on mixing bowl lid, weigh rice noodles into it and set aside. Drain pork tenderloin strips through simmering basket.
Place 15 g oil and 300 g drained pork in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and brown High Temp. . Transfer to a large bowl and set aside.

Again place 15 g oil and remaining 300 g remaining drained pork in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and brown High Temp. . Transfer to bowl with browned pork, keep warm and set aside.
Place remaining 20 g oil and garlic in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add grated ginger, red onions, red pepper and carrots, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and sauté High Temp. .

Add 80 g water, Chinese five-spice powder, remaining 20 g soy sauce, oyster sauce, brown sugar, snow peas and baby pak choi, mix well using spatula and cook 5 min/120°C//speed . Transfer to bowl with browned pork and mix gently using spatula.

Place 1200 g water and 1 tsp salt in mixing bowl and boil Kettle /100°C. Pour over rice noodles in large bowl and allow to soak for the time indicated on packet. Drain through Varoma dish, transfer to large serving bowl. Serve reserved meat and vegetables over rice noodles garnished with red chilli, roasted cashew nuts and spring onion.

title: Vanilla ice cream
steps: Split vanilla pods lengthwise and scrape out seeds. Place vanilla seeds and pods in mixing bowl. Add whole milk, cream, sugar, egg yolks and salt and cook 8 min/90°C/speed 2. Remove vanilla pods.
Pour mixture up to 4 cm high into shallow freezable containers (e.g. aluminium, silicone) and cover with cling film. Allow mixture to cool completely before freezing for at least 10 hours.

Place frozen mixture in refrigerator for 15 minutes, then cut in pieces (4 cm x 4 cm) using a long sharp knife. Place half the pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix with aid of spatula 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer ice cream to a bowl.
Place remaining frozen cream pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix with aid of spatula 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer to bowl with ice cream and serve immediately.
tips: For a firmer consistency, place the ice cream in the freezer for 15 minutes before serving.
Garnish with chopped pistachio nuts, coconut flakes or chocolate drops.
Top with whipped cream and chocolate or fruit sauce.

title: Red Pepper Dip (Muhammara)
ingredients: 100 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for drizzling
1 tsp freshly squeezed lemon juice, to taste
1 tsp Aleppo pepper flakes  o 1 tsp Espelette pepper, ground
parsley, fresh or mint leaves, for garnishing (optional)
steps: Roast red bell peppers (see Tip) and set aside to cool.
Place a pitcher onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in olive oil and set aside.
Place bread into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 9.

Add reserved roasted red bell peppers, garlic, walnuts, pomegranate molasses, lemon juice, cumin, paprika, cayenne pepper, Aleppo pepper flakes and salt and mix 15 sec/speed 6, for a chunky texture (for a smoother texture, see Tip). Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Adjust seasoning to taste.

Insert measuring cup and blend 1 min/speed 4, while slowly pouring reserved oil onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades. Transfer dip into a serving bowl, drizzle with a little oil and garnish with fresh parsley or mint leaves (optional) to serve.
tips: To roast red bell peppers, preheat oven to 200°C/400°F. Place red bell peppers onto a baking sheet and roast, turning occasionally, until all sides are charred and flesh is soft. Transfer to a heat-resistant snaplock bag, seal and leave to rest for 10 minutes, then peel and discard skins.
If you prefer a smoother texture after initial blending, blend an additional 20 sec/speed 9.
This sauce can be served as a dip with pita bread, spread onto flatbreads, mixed into stews or served with pasta or potatoes.

title: Gluten Free Chocolate Orange Cookies (Metric)
ingredients: 1 orange, zest only, no white pith (opcional)
85 g butter, unsalted, diced, room temperature
steps: Place almond flour, brown sugar, salt and orange zest into mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 6.
Add butter, eggs and orange blossom water and mix 20 sec/speed 4.5.
Transfer dough to a bowl, cover with cling film and refrigerate 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350°F/180°C. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment and set aside.

Use a small ice cream scoop (30 g) to form dough into balls. Place on prepared baking sheets and bake 15-18 minutes (350°F/180°C). Transfer to a wire rack and let cookies cool completely before glazing.
Place chocolate and butter into mixing bowl and melt 3 min/50°C/speed 1. Dip cooled cookies into melted chocolate and top with candied orange peel. Let chocolate set before serving or storing.
tips: Recipe inspired by Lauriane Laforge Thermomix® Independent Consultant New Brunswick, Canada.
For even baking with two cookie sheets at once, space racks so oven is divided into thirds and switch cookie sheets top to bottom and back to front halfway through baking.
Replace orange peel with orange zest to garnish.

title: Fish and potatoes with tomato sauce
ingredients: 800 g potatoes, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
30 g olive oil, plus extra for greasing
6 hake steaks (120-200 g each)  o 6 white fish fillets (any type of white fish, 120-200 g each)
steps: Place potatoes in Varoma dish and set aside. Lightly grease Varoma tray, place hake steaks on it and season with salt to taste. Set aside.
Place onions, garlic clove, carrots, olive oil, white wine, tomatoes, black pepper, 1 tsp salt and water in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Set Varoma without Varoma tray in position and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Insert Varoma tray in Varoma dish, close lid and steam a further 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Season potatoes with salt to taste. Serve hake and potatoes with the tomato sauce.
tips: - For a smooth sauce, mix sauce 15 sec/speed 5 before serving.

title: Mint Chocolate Chip Cookies (Metric)
ingredients: 225 g dark chocolate chips  o 225 g semisweet chocolate chips
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F/180°C. Line a baking sheet with a silicon mat or parchment and set aside.
Place monk fruit sweetener into mixing bowl and grind 20 sec/speed 4.
Add butter, egg, peppermint extract and food colouring and mix 1 min 30 sec/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 30 sec/speed 3.
Add flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt and knead Dough /20 sec.

Add chocolate chips and mix Dough /20 sec. Scoop batter into balls (30 g) with a small ice cream scoop. Place onto prepared baking sheets, spaced 2.5 cm apart, pressing tops to flatten and bake 8-10 minutes (350°F/180°C). Transfer to a wire rack and let cool. Serve warm or at room temperature.
tips: Recipe inspired by Paula Zubieta Thermomix® Independent Consultant Florida.
For a keto friendly version: replace all-purpose flour with 200 g almond flour and replace dark chocolate chips with 225 g sugar free dark chocolate chips and continue as per recipe.

title: Gooey Hot Chocolate Cookie (Metric)
ingredients: 455 g semisweet chocolate, cut into squares (1 cm), divided
steps: Place 170 g chocolate into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and melt 2 min/50°C/speed 1. Allow to cool for 2 minutes.
Add brown sugar, eggs and vanilla and mix 10 sec/speed 3.

Add cocoa, flour, baking powder and salt and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl, cover with cling film and refrigerate for 2 hours.
Preheat oven to 325°F/160°C. Line 2 baking sheets with foil and set aside.

Use a small ice cream scoop (30 g) to form dough into balls and place onto prepared baking sheets, spaced 2 cm apart. Press each ball with the back of a spoon to flatten slightly and bake 10 minutes (325°F/160°C). Remove cookies from oven and place a piece of chocolate into the centre of each hot cookie, top with half a marshmallow and bake a further 5 minutes (325°F/160°C).
Broil 15-45 seconds watching carefully until marshmallows are golden brown (see Tip). Serve warm or at room temperature.
tips: Recipe inspired by Ragan Rodgers Thermomix® Independent Consultant Alberta, Canada.
Cookies will appear underdone after the first baking.
In order to ensure cookies are gooey, bake and serve the same day. For ultimate fudginess, eat the cookies within 15-20 minutes while the centre is still molten.
For even baking with two cookie sheets at once, space racks so oven is divided into thirds and switch cookie sheets top to bottom and back to front halfway through baking.
Use a culinary torch to toast marshmallows after baking.
Cookie dough can be frozen in balls and baked for 13 minutes at 325°F/160°F and then topped with chocolate pieces and marshmallows and cooked a further 5 minutes (325°F/160°F).
For a spicy cookie add ½-1 tsp ground cayenne pepper with the flour.
Replace semi-sweet chocolate with bittersweet chocolate.

For a Peppermint Cookie grind 30-60 g candy canes Turbo/0.5 sec/1-2 times or until desired consistency is achieved. Sprinkle with half the candy cane powder after placing the marshmallows and then the other half after final baking.

title: Steamed Thai-style fish cakes
ingredients: 2 - 4 fresh kaffir lime leaves (see tip), stalks removed
2 spring onions (approx. 40 g), cut in pieces  o 2 shallots (approx. 40 g), cut in pieces
600 g white fish fillets (e.g. cod, snapper, perch), cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
60 g coconut cream  o 30 g coconut cream powder, diluted in 30 g of water
1 red fresh chilli, thinly sliced, to garnish
steps: Lightly grease Varoma dish and tray and set aside. Place kaffir lime leaves in mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add green beans and spring onions and chop 6-8 sec/speed 5.
Place white fish fillets, Thai red curry paste, coconut cream, egg white and salt in mixing bowl and chop Turbo/1 sec/3 times, or until mix is well combined but not puréed.

Dive mixture into 18 equal-size balls (approx. 1 heaped tbsp each) and gently flatten each ball to form fish cakes. Place several fish cakes in prepared Varoma dish and tray, being careful not to let the fish cakes touch.
Place water in mixing bowl and set Varoma in position. Steam 16 min/Varoma/speed 2. Transfer to a plate and keep warm.
Place remaining fish cakes in Varoma dish and tray, set Varoma in position and steam 10 min/Varoma/speed 2. Serve fish cakes warm, garnished with chilli.
tips: Serve fish cakes with sweet chilli dipping sauce.
Sprinkle fish cakes with fresh coriander leaves, chopped chives or the green part of spring onions,  thinly sliced.
These fish cakes can also be pan-fried in a lightly oiled frying pan over medium heat.

Rice can be steamed in the simmering basket at the same time as the fish cakes. Add 3 extra kaffir lime leaves to steaming water for extra flavour. Or steam Asian vegetables alongside the fish cakes in the Varoma.
Fresh kaffir lime leaves can be replaced with frozen kaffir lime leaves. Dried kaffir lime leaves, though less aromatic, may also be used. Or see variation for alternative flavourings.
Replace kaffir lime leaves with grated lime zest (1-2 tsp), fresh coriander leaves (5-6 sprigs, leaves only) or sliced fresh ginger (approx. 1-2 cm).

title: Granola Bars (Ben) Metric
steps: Preheat oven to 325°F/160°C. Line a stoneware baking dish Ben with parchment and set aside.
Place almonds, oats, cashews and coconut into mixing bowl and chop 6 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a large bowl and set aside.

Place dates and water into mixing bowl and blend 35 sec/speed 6. Transfer to bowl with chopped almonds and oats. Place the large bowl onto mixing bowl lid, add blueberries, cherries, cranberries, pumpkin seeds, goji berries, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, cloves and vanilla. Remove bowl from lid and mix well with spatula until completely incorporated.
Spread mixture into prepared baking dish Ben and press down firmly into an even compact layer. Bake 1 hour (325°F/160°C).
Remove from oven and cut into 16 bars while still warm. Allow to cool completely in baking dish.
Serve or store bars in an air-tight container for up to 7 days.
tips: Substitute any nuts or dried fruit to taste.
Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.

title: Cod with citrus butter
ingredients: 1 orange, preferably organic, zest and juice
1 lemon, preferably organic, zest and juice
400 g courgettes, cut in slices (5 mm)
80 g butter, plus extra for greasing
4 fresh cod fillets, skinless (120-200 g each)
½ tsp salt, adjust to taste
½ tsp ground black pepper, adjust to taste
1 tsp anise seeds  o 1 tsp dried fennel seeds
3 sprigs fresh parsley, leaves only, chopped
steps: Place orange and lemon zests in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a small bowl and set aside.

Place water in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket and weigh potatoes into it. Set Varoma dish in position and weigh courgettes into it. Lightly grease Varoma tray. Season both sides of fresh cod fillets with salt and black pepper, place on Varoma tray and sprinkle with ¼ of the reserved chopped zest. Insert Varoma tray into Varoma dish, close Varoma lid and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Remove Varoma and remove simmering basket using spatula. Transfer courgettes, fish and potatoes to a large dish, set aside and keep warm. Empty mixing bowl.
Place butter, anise seeds and remaining citrus zests in mixing bowl and heat 4 min/60°C/speed 1.
Add orange and lemon juice to mixing bowl and mix 30 sec/speed 3. Place cod, courgettes and potatoes on plates. Pour over warm citrus butter, sprinkle with parsley and serve immediately.
tips: Replace potatoes with rice: increase water to 1200 g and place 200 g rice (preferably long grain rice with 20 minutes cooking time) in simmering basket. Steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 1 and proceed as directed by the recipe.

title: Warm Spinach and Artichoke Dip
ingredients: 1 can artichoke hearts, fresh (approx 398 ml), drained
115 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces
285 g spinach leaves, frozen, defrosted and drained (see Tip)
½ tsp pepper sauce, type Tabasco
steps: Drain artichoke hearts and set aside.
Place Parmesan and mozzarella cheese into mixing bowl and chop 8 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place garlic, shallot and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and sauté 2 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add reserved drained artichoke hearts and spinach, insert measuring cup and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Add cream cheese, sour cream, red pepper flakes, salt, Worcestershire and Tabasco and mix 10 sec/speed 4.
Add reserved chopped cheese and cook 8 min/80°C//speed 1. Transfer to a heat-resistant serving bowl. Serve hot.
tips: Serve with artisan breads, crackers, tortilla chips, crostini or veggies.
Squeeze drained spinach to extract remaining water.
This dish can be frozen. Reheat in an oven at 180°C/350°F until warmed through.
To brown dip: bake 15-30 minutes (200°C/400°F) or until golden brown.
Broil setting can be used to brown top, watch carefully to avoid burning.

title: Devilled Eggs
ingredients: 250 g grapeseed oil, room temperature  o 250 g neutral oil, e.g. safflower, canola, room temperature
15 g white wine vinegar  o 15 g white vinegar
6 eggs, large, cold from the fridge
water, to fill to 1 litre mark
3 - 5 drops Tabasco  o 1 pinch ground cayenne pepper
freshly ground black pepper, to taste
steps: Place a small pitcher onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in oil and set aside.

Place egg yolk, vinegar, water, Dijon mustard, salt and pepper into mixing bowl and mix 1 min 30 sec/speed 4 while slowly pouring reserved oil onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle in a thin stream onto rotating blades. Reserve 75 g for recipe and transfer remainder to an air-tight container and store in refrigerator (see Tip). Clean mixing bowl.
Place eggs and water (to 1 litre mark) into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and start Egg Boiler /Hard. Meanwhile, fill a large bowl with cold water.

Once egg mode stops, add one tray ice cubes to bowl with cold water. Insert simmering basket, hold simmering basket in place over the eggs with spatula and carefully drain water into the sink to avoid damaging eggs. Remove simmering basket and carefully transfer eggs into prepared bowl of ice water to stop the cooking process. After 3-4 minutes, add another tray of ice cubes and allow eggs to cool completely (approx. 10 min.). Meanwhile, dry mixing bowl.
Carefully peel cooled eggs (see Tip) and cut in half lengthwise. Using a small spoon, gently remove cooked egg yolks and set aside. Place egg whites on a serving platter.
Place reserved cooked egg yolks, 75 g reserved mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, shallot, Tabasco and pepper into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and mix 20 sec/speed 3.

Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Check and adjust seasoning, adding more salt if necessary and mix a further 10 sec/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and transfer to a small bowl. Then, to recover remaining filling around mixing knife, start Turbo/1.0 sec/1 time. Use spatula to scrape sides of mixing bowl and add to bowl with reserved filling.
Evenly distribute yolk mixture into reserved cooked egg whites with a piping bag or spoon, sprinkle with paprika and chopped chives. Refrigerate until ready to serve (see Tip).
tips: This is a recipe beloved the world over with minor alterations from medieval times with the word devilled first documented in 1786. In the 19th century, it came to be used most often with spicy or zesty food, including eggs prepared with mustard, pepper or other ingredients stuffed into the yolk cavity.
Immediately cooling the eggs after cooking ensures they will be cooked to perfection. Adding a tray of ice cubes to the water will ensure the perfect temperature to quickly cool the eggs.
Mayonnaise ingredients and mixing bowl must be at room temperature.
Homemade Mayonnaise makes approximately 265-300 g. After preparing devilled eggs, refrigerate leftover mayonnaise (190- 225 g) for an alternate use. Consume within 2-4 days.

Use the spoon method to peel eggs: crack both ends gently, then on the wider end, peel off the shell and gently insert the tip of a small teaspoon under the egg membrane and nuzzle it along the curve of the egg, gently removing bits of the shell as you go.
Refrigerate Devilled Eggs in an airtight container and consume within 2 days.
Replace fresh chives with the green stalks from 1 green onion, chopped, to garnish.

title: Beet-Tox (Metric)
ingredients: 240 g red beets, raw, peeled, quartered
240 g alkaline water or 240 g spring water
240 g orange juice, freshly squeezed (approx. 1 med.)
steps: Place beets, pineapple, water, orange juice and lemon juice into mixing bowl and start Blend /1 min 30 sec.
Strain juice through a fine-mesh sieve into a glass bottle (750 ml) and serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.
tips: Shake well before drinking, as it tends to separate.

Strain pulp from juice to taste. Pulp is where the fibre is, and fibre helps to decrease sugars in the blood. For the most health benefits, add some pulp back into the juice and thin to desired consistency with water.
Pulp can be used to liven up smoothies, turn into ice cubes to flavour water or add to baked goods, reducing the need for oils or butter.

title: Crème caramel (flan)
steps: Place in mixing bowl sugar, whole milk and eggs. Mix 2 min 30 sec/40°C/speed 3. Meanwhile, place 1-2 tsp liquid caramel in each Thermomix® ramekin and set aside. Fill Thermomix® ramekins with the mixture. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place water in mixing bowl, heat 5 min/100°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, cover Thermomix® ramekins with their lids, aluminium foil or heat-resistant cling film and place them in Varoma.
Set Varoma in position and steam 11 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside.

Allow to cool uncovered for one hour before placing in refrigerator. Chill for a minimum of four hours, or overnight for easiest unmolding. Tip each crème caramel upside down on a plate (see tip) and carefully remove ramekin. Serve immediately.
tips: Crème caramel, or flan, is a traditional dessert served in France and Spain.
The crème caramel will set better if refrigerated for 12 hours. The firmer it is, the easier it will be to unmold it.

To make your own liquid caramel, melt 100 g sugar with 1 tbsp water and 1 tsp lemon juice in a medium-size, very clean saucepan over medium heat. Do not stir, but occasionally swirl the saucepan, until sugar becomes a dark amber. At this point, carefully pour in approx. 50 g hot water (it will bubble up and spatter). Stir over medium heat until all caramel is dissolved and syrup thickens slightly. Allow to cool before using. This caramel can be preserved for weeks in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

To unmold, run a small sharp knife around the crème caramel, place a plate upside down on the ramekin, flip ramekin and plate at the same time, hold them together tightly and give a sharp shake or two to loosen the crème caramel so that it falls on the plate.

title: French Macarons with Blueberry Jam (Metric)
ingredients: 115 g egg whites, slightly less than 4 eggs (see Tip)
food colouring in gel, to taste (see Tip)
1 lemon, thin peel only, no white pith
steps: For best result, follow the steps and ensure ingredients are in exact amounts.
Place first bowl into position. Place ground almonds and icing sugar into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Strain with a fine mesh sieve into a large bowl and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Prepare a piping bag with small smooth tip. Line four baking trays with baking paper and set aside (see Tip).
Preheat oven to 275°F/135°C.
Place second bowl into position. Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in sugar and set aside.

Insert butterfly whisk. Place egg whites with 2 hour rest uncovered at room temperature (see Tip) into mixing bowl and without measuring cup, whip 1 min/speed 3.5, Add reserved granulated sugar and whip 4 min/speed 3.5 until sift peaks form. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer mixture to large bowl with reserved sugar and almond mixture.

Add food coluoring and with spatula, slowly fold into mixture until just combined, avoid over-mixing (see Tip). Transfer to prepared piping bag and pipe circles (2 cm diam.) onto baking paper. Tap the baking tray twice on a flat surface to release any air bubbles. Let macarons dry until dry to the touch and brushing a finger over top does not leave an indentation (approx. 30 min. or more).

Bake 15 minutes (275°F/135°C) or until foot develops (see Tip), if necessary turn the tray and bake 10 minutes more. Remove and cool, carefully peel off one piece, if the macaron pulls off completely continue with recipe; if the base of the macaron is soft and sticks to the baking paper, bake a further 10 minutes. Remove from oven and cool.
Place first bowl into position. Place sugar and lemon peels into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add blueberries and pectin, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 8 min/110°C/speed 3. Remove simmering basket and set aside.
Add lemon juice, insert measuring cup and mix 20 sec/speed 2. Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate until cold.
Spread a spoonful of blueberry filling onto a cooled macaron and top with another macaron. Repeat with remaining macarons. Store in the freezer and serve frozen (see Tip).
tips: Ripening of macarons: freezing macarons once assembled provides a light moisture, making them smooth and shiny. Place them in an airtight container and freeze—the texture will be amazing!

For best result: separate egg whites from yolks, place egg whites into a bowl and let sit for 2 hours to dehydrate and remove some of the moisture in the recipe. Refrigerate egg yolks during this time.

Continue to fold egg whites into almond/flour mixture until batter falls into ribbons and you can make a figure 8 while holding up the spatula. Batter is mixed enough when you can make a figure eight without the batter breaking.
Using processed almond powder and icing sugar from the supermarket will give better baking results while keeping the macaron shape.
Place a dot of batter in each corner of a rimmed baking tray under baking paper and press to adhere to the baking tray.
Do not use a silicone mat, baking paper allows for dryer macarons.

Macaron feet are the little ruffles around the edge of the shell and should be small and unbroken. They are the sign of a well baked macaron. If your macarons do not have feet, it could be your batter is too wet. Make sure you're using aged egg whites.
If oven's lowest temperature is too hot prop the door ajar to maintain a lower temperature.
If your oven is traditional and heats from the bottom, use a double baking tray to avoid burning the macarons.
To get the perfect shape, circles can be drawn onto the underside of the baking paper and mixture piped using the template.
The dye in gel or powder form brings less humidity to the preparation giving a better result than using liquid food coloring.
For chocolate macarons, replace 2 tsp almond powder and 2 tsp icing sugar with 30 g cocoa powder.
To replace apple pectin with apple peels, grind the peels from 2 apples when grinding lemon peels and sugar.

title: Strawberry ice cream bars
ingredients: 150 g strawberries, rinsed, hulled and cut in halves
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 15 sec/speed 10.

Add strawberries, lemon juice, quark and cream and blend 25 sec/speed 8. Transfer to ice lolly moulds and insert ice lolly sticks. Freeze for at least 12 hours, ideally overnight. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place chocolate in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8.
Add coconut oil and melt 4 min/50°C/speed 2.
Transfer to a glass or cup that fits the tip of the ice cream bars. Unmold the ice cream bars (see tip) and dip in chocolate. Serve immediately or store in freezer until serving.
tips: To unmould the ice cream bars, briefly dip the moulds in warm (not hot) water until the ice cream bars loosen. Place the ice cream bars back into the freezer for a few minutes before dipping in melted chocolate.
Use the leftover melted chocolate to decorate cakes or biscuits.
Use any kind of fresh berries (e.g. raspberries, blueberries) or a mix of fresh red berries.

title: Couscous with chicken, lamb and spicy sausages
ingredients: 400 g lamb shoulder meat, preferably bone in (see tip), cut in pieces (4 cm x 4 cm)
400 g carrots, cut in pieces (approx. 1.5 cm)
250 g turnips, cut in 6 or 8 pieces (depending on size)
300 g chicken breast fillets, cut in fine strips (approx. 2 cm long)
6 beef or mutton spicy sausages (e.g. merguez) (opcional)
400 g courgettes, unpeeled, cut in slices (approx. 1.5 cm)
1 - 2 tsp harissa paste  o 1 - 2 tsp chilli paste
steps: Place coriander and parsley in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a small bowl and set aside.
Place onions in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add lamb meat, 2 tsp salt, pepper and 20 g olive oil and sauté 10 min/120°C//speed .

Add carrots, turnips, cinnamon, ginger, 550 g water and reserved chopped herbs. Set Varoma dish in position and add chicken breast fillets to it, making sure that some holes remain unobstructed. Arrange spicy sausages and courgettes on top of chicken. Close Varoma and steam 15 min/Varoma//speed . Meanwhile, place couscous, remaining 1 tsp salt and 20 g olive oil in a bowl. Rub the couscous in a circular motion between your hands to moisten the grains evenly and remove any lumps that may form, cover with 350 g water and stir using spatula to moisten the couscous evenly. Cover the bowl and set aside.

Gently fluff the couscous with a fork to separate the grains and transfer it to Varoma tray. Carefully remove Varoma lid, insert prepared Varoma tray, close Varoma and steam a further 10 min/Varoma//speed . Remove Varoma.

Add raisins and chickpeas to mixing bowl, set Varoma back in position and heat 5 min/Varoma//speed . Remove Varoma and transfer contents of mixing bowl to a large serving dish. Add chicken, sausages and courgettes and combine gently using spatula. Spoon out 100 g broth from the serving dish into a sauceboat, add harissa and mix with a fork. Transfer couscous to another serving dish. Serve couscous, vegetables, meat and sausages hot, with harissa sauce on the side.
tips: Couscous is a traditional dish from northwest Africa. Merguez are fresh, spicy sausages made from mutton and/or beef, and are typical of the region. Replace them with any other spicy fresh sausage, or omit them altogether. For a more traditional flavour, replace the cinnamon and ginger with 2 tbsp ras-el-hanout, a North African spice blend that can contain up to 40 ingredients.
The bone in the lamb shoulder meat adds flavour. However if you are cutting the meat yourself, the dish will also be excellent with boneless meat.
If you have some couscous left over, use it to prepare a traditional Moroccan dessert. Place couscous onto a plate, sprinkle with 50 g sugar and 1 tsp ground cinnamon. Serve warm or cold.
This dish easily serves 6. If you serve a starter first, it can serve up to 8 people.

title: Clam Chowder
ingredients: 85 g celery, cut into pieces (approx. 2 stalks)
2 slices bacon, smoked, cut into pieces (0.5 cm/¼ in.)
450 g russet potatoes, peeled, diced (1 cm/½ in.)
⅛ tsp black pepper, ground, plus extra to sprinkle
soup crackers, e.g. oyster crackers, to serve
steps: Place onion, celery, garlic, flour and butter into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add bacon and without measuring cup cook 10 min/120°C//speed 1. Meanwhile open 3 cans chopped clams. Drain juice into a small bowl and set aside. Reserve clams separately.
In a separate small bowl, stir together 1 tablespoon water and 1 tablespoon corn starch to make a slurry and set aside.
Add potatoes, 340 g reserved clam juice, 225 g water, salt, pepper and bay leaf and without measuring cup, cook 15 min/100°C//speed 1. Add reserved slurry and cook a further 5 min/100°C//speed 1.
Add cream and reserved drained clams, insert measuring cup and cook 4 min/85°C//speed 1. Remove bay leaf, season with ground black pepper and serve hot with soup crackers.

title: Prawns Tikka Masala (Hestan Cue™) Metric
ingredients: 2 ½ cm ginger, fresh, peeled, in pieces
15 g oil, e.g. grapeseed, vegetable or canola
1 serrano pepper, deseeded and finely chopped
½ tsp kosher salt, Diamond Crystal®, to taste
2 tbsp oil e.g. grapeseed, vegetable or canola
steps: Place ginger and garlic into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 10.

Add onions, oil, curry powder and serrano pepper and and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 8 min/120°C/speed 1. Carefully remove simmering basket and set aside.
Add cilantro, coconut milk and tomatoes and place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 15 min/100°C/speed 1. Carefully remove simmering basket and set aside.
Insert measuring cup and purée 20 sec/speed 7. Add lemon juice, stir through with spatula and set aside.
Continue the recipe in the HESTAN CUE™ app, search "USA & Canada" to season and cook the shrimp in the Hestan Cue™ frying pan.
When prawns are cooked toss in reserved sauce to taste, garnish with cilantro and sliced radishes. Serve hot with remaining sauce on the side.
tips: Search "Thermomix" in the Hestan Cue™ app to access all Thermomix® and Hestan Cue™ Smart cooking recipes.

title: Kimchi Pancakes (Hestan Cue™) Metric
ingredients: ½ tsp kosher salt, Diamond Crystal®
4 green onions, thinly sliced, plus extra to garnish
2 tbsp vegetable oil, e.g. grapeseed, vegetable, canola, as needed, to fry
1 tsp sesame seeds, toasted, to garnish
steps: Place kimchi, 60 g kimchi juice, flour, water, salt and sesame oil into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 4.5. Add green onions and mix with spatula to combine.
Continue the recipe in the HESTAN CUE™ induction burner app, search "USA & Canada" to cook the pancakes in the Hestan Cue™ frying pan.
Garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions and serve hot.
tips: Serve with poached eggs. Search Cookidoo® for Poached Eggs recipe.
Search "Thermomix" in the Hestan Cue™ app to access all Thermomix® and Hestan Cue™ Smart cooking recipes.

title: Rise and Shine Juice (Metric)
ingredients: 5 cm ginger, fresh, peeled, in pieces
225 g alkaline water or 225 g spring water
steps: Place pineapple and ginger into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add coconut water and alkaline water and start Blend /1 min 30 sec. Strain juice through a fine-mesh sieve into a pitcher and serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.
tips: Shake well before drinking, as it tends to separate.

Strain pulp from juice to taste. Pulp is where the fibre is, and fibre helps to decrease sugars in the blood. For the most health benefits, add some pulp back into the juice and thin to desired consistency with water.
Pulp can be used to liven up smoothies, turn into ice cubes to flavour water or add to baked goods, reducing the need for oils or butter.

title: Caprese Egg White Omelette (Metric)
ingredients: 115 g tomatoes, cored, deseeded and quartered
8 basil leaves, fresh, plus extra to garnish
steps: Cut baking paper to fit Varoma tray (see Tip). Scrunch baking paper into a ball under running water, squeeze out excess water, lay onto Varoma tray, lightly grease baking paper and set aside.
Place first bowl into position. Place Gruyère cheese into mixing bowl and grate 6 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside
Place tomatoes and basil into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a separate bowl and set aside.
Place water into mixing bowl and set aside.

Place second bowl into position. Insert butterfly whisk. Place egg whites into mixing bowl and without measuring cup, whip 1 min 30 sec/40°C/speed 4 or until glossy and soft peaks form. Remove butterfly whisk. Remove mixing bowl. Place reserved first bowl with water into position. Using spatula, gently spread reserved whipped egg whites onto prepared Varoma tray, evenly sprinkle with reserved chopped cheese and tomato mixture and season with salt and pepper. Set Varoma into position, insert Varoma tray with whipped egg whites, secure Varoma lid and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 3. Remove omelette from baking paper by sliding spatula under one end of the omelette and rolling it in one direction until it is completely rolled up. Garnish with basil, drizzle with balsamic glaze, divide into 2 servings and serve hot.
tips: To cut baking paper to fit Varoma tray: tear off a piece of baking paper wide enough to cover Varoma tray. Place Varoma tray on top of baking paper and cut around the tray to form an oval shape.
Any condensation can be removed with a paper towel before serving.
When whipping egg whites make sure the mixing bowl is dry and clean from grease.
To make your own balsamic vinegar glaze, search Cookidoo® for Caramelized Balsamic Reduction recipe.

title: Plain yoghurt in Varoma
ingredients: 1 level tsp ascorbic acid (powdered Vitamin C)  o 30 g lemon juice, freshly squeezed (approx. ½ lemon)
steps: Place plain yoghurt, milk and sugar in mixing bowl and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Start Warm Up /37°C/speed 2.
Pour the yoghurt mixture into glass yoghurt jars (approx. 120 g each) and arrange in the centre of Varoma dish. Close the jars with their lids or cover them with a loose sheet of cling film.

Place water and ascorbic acid or lemon juice in mixing bowl. Set Varoma in position and start Fermentation /10 h/70°C. Set Varoma aside and place glass yoghurt jars in refrigerator. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving or store yoghurts covered in the refrigerator up to 8 days.
tips: If not using sugar, mix 10 sec/speed 4.
Use either cold or room temperature milk.
To protect the mixing knife against oxidation, the juice of half a squeezed lemon or a level teaspoon of vitamin C/ascorbic acid must be added to the water.

title: Choux pastry
ingredients: 80 g butter, unsalted, cut in pieces
steps: Place water, butter, salt and sugar in mixing bowl and bring to the boil 5 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add flour and mix without measuring cup 20 sec/speed 4. Remove mixing bowl and set aside to cool for 10 minutes.
Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.
Set mixing bowl back in position and mix speed 5, adding eggs one at a time through hole in mixing bowl lid onto rotating blades.
After adding the last egg, mix a further 30 sec/speed 5.

Transfer pastry mixture to a piping bag and pipe balls (choux) or sticks (éclairs) on prepared baking tray, leaving 5 cm space between each. Bake for 20-25 minutes (200°C) or until golden brown. Turn off oven and open oven door slightly, leaving it ajar for 10 minutes to allow choux pastries to dry. Remove tray from oven and allow choux pastries to cool completely before serving or filling as desired.
tips: In France, different variations of choux pastry have specific names, such as choux à la crème, éclairs, gougères, profiteroles, chouquettes.
Use a wet finger to smooth down any bumps on the top of choux pastries before baking.
If you don't have a piping bag, cut the corner off a sturdy freezer bag and use to pipe choux pastries on baking tray.
You can double the recipe: double all ingredients and proceed as directed by the recipe.
Choux pastries can be filled with whipped cream or pastry cream and served with fresh fruit, dusted with sugar.
Fill choux pastries with cream cheese and fresh herbs for a savoury option.

title: Sweet shortcrust pastry
ingredients: 200 g butter, unsalted, chilled, cut in pieces
1 ½ tsp vanilla sugar, homemade  o 1 tsp natural vanilla extract
steps: Place sugar in mixing bowl and grind 15 sec/speed 10.

Add butter, flour, egg, salt and vanilla sugar in mixing bowl and mix with aid of spatula 25-30 sec/speed 5. Remove pastry dough from mixing bowl, form into a flattened ball and wrap with cling film. Refrigerate for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease a tart tin or line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.

Roll out dough between 2 sheets of baking paper or cling film to a thickness of 5 mm. Line prepared tart tin with dough or cut out shapes and place them on prepared baking tray. For a tart case, prick pastry using a fork to avoid air bubbles. Bake tart case for 15–20 minutes (180°C), biscuits for 10–12 minutes (180°C), or until golden. Allow to cool completely on a cooling rack before decorating, filling, or storing in an air-tight container.
tips: Be careful not to knead the dough unnecessarily with your hands, as this will make the biscuits or tart case tough.
If the dough becomes warm and difficult to work with, place rolled out dough, still covered with sheets of baking paper or cling film, in refrigerator until dough is firm enough to handle.

Instead of rolling out the dough with a rolling pin, shape it into a log. For biscuits, roll the log so the cross section is round. For a tart case, make a flatter log. Wrap log in cling film and refrigerate until firm enough to cut in slices. For biscuits, cut round log in round slices (5 mm thick) and bake as directed by the recipe. For a tart case, line the tart tin with long dough slices (5 mm thick), overlapping them slightly, and press dough with fingers to fill in any cracks. Bake as directed by the recipe.
Decorated biscuits: decorate biscuit shapes with coloured icing, chocolate coating and sweets.
Jam-filled biscuits: spread cool biscuit with jam and place another on top. Dust with icing sugar.

title: Shortcrust pastry
ingredients: 75 g butter, unsalted, chilled, cut in pieces
steps: Place flour, butter, salt and water in mixing bowl and mix 20 sec/speed 4. Remove pastry from mixing bowl and form into a flattened ball. Wrap in cling film and refrigerate until needed or use pastry as described in other recipes.
tips: Use shortcrust pastry for sweet or savoury tarts.
Unbaked shortcrust pastry freezes well. Freeze dough partially rolled out for faster defrosting in the refrigerator.

To blind bake a tart case, use a rolling pin to roll out pastry on a lightly floured surface. Line a greased quiche or tart tin with the pastry and prick using a fork to avoid air bubbles. Line pastry with baking paper and fill with baking beans before baking in a preheated oven (180°C) for 15 minutes. Remove baking paper and baking beans and bake for a further 5 minutes or until golden brown.

title: Pork tenderloin with sauerkraut and potato purée
ingredients: 750 g potatoes, cut in pieces (3 cm)
steps: Place 100 g onions in mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.
Add bacon cubes and sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, season pork tenderloin with ½ tsp salt, pepper and sweet paprika, wrap it in bacon slices and set aside.

Add sauerkraut, bay leaf and juniper berries to mixing bowl and cook 3 min/120°C/speed 1. Drain contents of mixing bowl through Varoma dish over a bowl. Set Varoma dish aside and reserve the collected cooking liquid.

Place water and 1¼ tsp salt in mixing bowl, insert simmering basket and add potatoes to it. Season potatoes by sprinkling with reserved cooking liquid. Set Varoma dish containing sauerkraut in position, place wrapped tenderloin on sauerkraut, close Varoma and steam 35 min/Varoma/speed 1. In the last 10 minutes heat frying oil in a frying pan, slice 250 g onions and fry them golden brown. Remove Varoma and remove simmering basket using spatula, set both aside and empty mixing bowl.

Place milk, butter, remaining ¼ tsp salt, nutmeg and cooked potatoes in mixing bowl and purée with aid of spatula 25 sec/speed 3.5. Slice the tenderloin and arrange on a dish with sauerkraut and potato purée. Top the meat and purée with fried onions and serve hot.
tips: Can comfort food be festive as well? We think so! This German classic, while usually made with a cured and slightly smoked pork loin (“Kassler”), is just as good with pork tenderloin, served ever-so-slightly pink in the centre.

Sauerkraut can be more or less sour and you can adjust it to your preference: rinse it briefly through the simmering basket with cold water if you prefer it less sour or season with vinegar or white balsamic vinegar to increase its acidity.
Replace the pork tenderloin with smoked pork loin, thick slices of bacon (1.5 cm) or smoked pork sausages.
For a quicker and lighter recipe, omit fried onions and bacon slices.

title: Crispy Eggplant with Tomato Basil Sauce (Hestan Cue™) Metric
ingredients: ½ tsp red pepper flakes, dried
kosher salt, Diamond Crystal®, as needed to sprinkle
225 g oil, e.g. grapeseed, vegetable or canola, as needed, to fry
steps: Place garlic into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add olive oil, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and sauté 6 min/100°C/speed 1. Carefully remove simmering basket and set aside.

Add pepper flakes, tomatoes and salt, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 20 min/100°C/speed 1. Carefully remove simmering basket and set aside. Set aside and keep warm.
Cut eggplant into slices (approx. 0.5 cm) and place in a single layer onto paper towels. Sprinkle with salt and set aside.
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in oil and set aside.
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in flour and set aside.
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in panko, garlic powder, onion powder and paprika, stir to combine and set aside. Crack eggs into a separate bowl and whisk with a wire whisk.
Continue the recipe in the HESTAN CUE™ induction burner app, search "USA & Canada" to fry the eggplant in the Hestan Cue™ frying pan.
Serve with reserved Tomato Basil Sauce and sprinkle with sliced basil.
tips: Search "Thermomix" in the Hestan Cue™ app to access all Thermomix® and Hestan Cue™ Smart cooking recipes.

title: Cherry Nut Shortbread (Metric)
steps: Place pistachios into mixing bowl and chop 2-4 sec/speed 6, or until desired consistency is achieved. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place cherries into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 5.
Add butter, sugar and vanilla and mix 1 min/speed 3.5.
Add flour and salt and mix 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix 25 sec/speed 4. Transfer dough to cling film and shape into a log (approx. 30 cm). Freeze 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 325°F/160°C. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment and set aside.
Cut frozen dough into slices (6 mm) and place onto prepared baking sheets.
Bake 15-18 minutes (325°F/160°C). Let cool completely before icing.

Place white chocolate into mixing bowl and heat 3 min/50°C/speed 1. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Dip part of each cookie into melted chocolate and sprinkle with reserved chopped pistachios. Let chocolate set before serving.
tips: Recipe inspired by Cec Sparrow Thermomix® Independent Consultant Alberta, Canada.

For a nuttier version, replace 70 g pistachios with 155-170 g pistachios and chop 5 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Add 85-100 g reserved chopped pistachios when adding the flour and salt and continue as per recipe, garnishing with remaining 70 g chopped pistachios.

title: Spitzbuben (Metric)
ingredients: 225 g butter, unsalted, cut into pieces
340 g all purpose white flour, plus extra to dust
1 tsp vanilla sugar  o ¼ tsp vanilla extract, natural
1 lemon, zest only, no white pith
steps: Place butter and sugar into mixing bowl and mix 30 sec/speed 5.
Add flour, vanilla sugar, salt, baking powder, egg yolk and lemon zest and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 10 sec/speed 4.
Transfer dough to a lightly floured work surface and shape into a ball. Press to flatten, wrap in cling film and refrigerate to chill (30 min.).
Preheat oven to 325°F/160°C. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment or silicone baking mats and set aside.
Roll out chilled dough. Use a round fluted cookie cutter (6 cm) to cut out 25 cookies for the bottoms. Transfer to a prepared baking sheet.
Cut out 25 cookies for the tops, either same size or slightly smaller. Use an apple corer to cut out a smaller circle in the centre of each cookie top. Transfer to a prepared baking sheet.
Bake one sheet after the other 8-10 minutes (325°F/160°C) until edges start to darken (Do not overbake). Transfer to a wire rack and allow to cool.
Lay uncut bottoms upside down on a work surface and spread with lemon curd or jam. Top with cookie rings, so that filling is visible in the centre.
Dust with icing sugar and serve or refrigerate (see Tip).
tips: Recipe inspired by Heike Gibson Thermomix® Independent Consultant Massachusetts.
Refrigerate cookies when using lemon curd.
Search Cookidoo® to make your own jam.
Search Cookidoo® to make your own vanilla sugar.
Search Cookidoo® for TM5 and TM6™ lemon curd recipes.
For even baking with two cookie sheets at once, space racks so oven is divided into thirds and switch cookie sheets top to bottom and back to front halfway through baking
Any flavor jam can be used to fill cookies.

title: Meal Replacement Shake (Metric)
ingredients: 1 portion protein powder (1 serving - see Tip)
steps: Place almonds, almond milk, grated coconut, monk fruit sweetener and protein powder into mixing bowl and start Blend /1 min.
Serve immediately.
tips: One portion protein powder is equal to one serving. All protein powders will come with a Nutrition Facts label that shows the serving size, as well as how many scoops are in each serving.

title: Sugar and Spice Cookies (Metric)
ingredients: 60 g crystallized ginger, plus 60 g chopped, to sprinkle
steps: Place sugar and 60 g crystallized ginger into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Add shortening and mix 20 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 20 sec/speed 4.
Add egg and molasses and mix 10 sec/speed 4.

Add flour, baking soda, cinnamon, ground ginger, cloves, black pepper, salt and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl, cover with cling film and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight.
Preheat oven to 350°F/180°C. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment and set aside.

Scoop batter into balls (30 g) with a small sized ice cream scoop. Place onto prepared baking sheets, spaced 7 cm apart. Slightly flatten dough balls, sprinkle with 60 g chopped crystallized ginger and bake 10 minutes (350°F/180°C). Rotate pans from top to bottom and front to back and bake a further 2-3 minutes (350°F/180°C) until cookies are set but still very soft. Allow to cool 10 minutes on trays before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
Transfer cooled cookies to an air-tight container, place parchment between cookie layers and store at room temperature for up to one week or freeze for up to one month.
tips: Recipe inspired by Pamela Sue Wnuck Thermomix® Independent Consultant California.
These are everything nice cookies—spicy, chewy, and soft with a crisp edge. The smaller cookies are wonderful with fresh fruit and desserts, or as the cookie part of a vanilla ice cream sandwich.
For even baking with two cookie sheets at once, space racks so oven is divided into thirds and switch cookie sheets top to bottom and back to front halfway through baking.
To make 52 smaller cookies, form the dough into 15 g balls; flatten and bake 8 minutes at 350°F/180°C. Remove from oven and sprinkle with sugar as directed.

title: Caesar Dressing
ingredients: 200 g oil, (neutral oil such as canola, sunflower)
60 g Parmesan cheese, cubed, plus extra shaved for garnish
2 garlic cloves, or 2 confit garlic cloves (optional) (see Variation)
steps: Place a pitcher onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in oil and set aside.
Place Parmesan cheese and peppercorns into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place egg yolks, garlic cloves, anchovies, lemon juice, Dijon mustard and salt into mixing bowl and chop 5-8 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix 2 min 30 sec/speed 4 while very slowly pouring reserved oil onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle in a thin stream onto rotating blades. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add reserved Parmesan cheese mixture and mix 15 sec/speed 5. Transfer into a sterilized airtight jar (see Tip), seal and store in refrigerator. To be served with romaine hearts, shaved Parmesan, croutons and cracked black pepper. Consume within the time given.
tips: To prepare jar, place 500 g water into mixing bowl. Place jar and lid upside down in the centre of the Varoma and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Leave to drain - do not dry or touch the inside surfaces. Alternatively, thoroughly wash jar and lid in hot, soapy water. Rinse by pouring over boiling water. Prepare for filling, if needed, by placing on a clean tea towel in a roasting pan and heating in the oven at 100°C/212˚F until required. Use within one week.
Search Cookidoo® for Confit Garlic recipe in our TM Basics -Condiments collection.

title: Duck breasts with orange ginger sauce, mashed potatoes and green beans
ingredients: 20 g fresh ginger, peeled, thinly sliced (2 mm)
60 g Seville orange marmalade  o 60 g orange marmalade plus 1 tbsp lemon juice
20 g balsamic vinegar  o 20 g sherry vinegar
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper, adjust to taste
2 duck breasts, skinless, boneless (approx. 150-200 g each) (see tip)
350 g floury potatoes, peeled, cut in small pieces (1 cm)
120 - 150 g fresh green beans, cut in pieces (2 cm) if necessary
steps: Place shallots, garlic clove, ginger, Seville orange marmalade, thyme, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, port wine, 50 g water, ½ tsp salt and ¼ tsp black pepper in mixing bowl and blend 1 min/speed 10. Meanwhile, line Varoma tray with baking paper with enough to go 2 cm up the sides.
Place duck breasts on lined Varoma tray and pour marinade over them. Insert Varoma tray into Varoma dish, cover and set aside to marinate. Clean mixing bowl.
Place 500 g water in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket, add potatoes to it and steam 10 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 50°C and warm a serving dish for the mashed potatoes.

Set Varoma in position and steam 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma. Keeping baking paper lining intact, gently scrape marinade off duck breasts onto baking paper lining. Transfer duck breasts to a plate and set Varoma with marinade and duck juices aside for the sauce. Sprinkle duck breasts with sweet paprika, cover and keep warm in oven.

Check that potatoes are completely cooked and tender (see tip). Remove simmering basket using spatula and discard steaming water. Insert butterfly whisk. Place cooked potatoes, butter, milk, remaining ½ tsp salt and ¼ tsp black pepper in mixing bowl and mash 10-15 sec/speed 3.5 until smooth. Transfer to warm serving dish and keep warm in oven. Clean mixing bowl.

Pour reserved marinade and duck juices from Varoma tray into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket, add green beans to it and cook 14 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove simmering basket using spatula and transfer sauce to a serving jug. Slice duck breasts on the diagonal and serve hot with mashed potatoes, orange ginger sauce and beans.
tips: The sauce accompanying the duck in this special dinner for two is exceptional - Seville orange marmalade gives it a slightly bitter edge which balances the sweetness and gingery heat. Feel free to use a normal orange jam or marmalade with the extra lemon juice if you can't find a Seville variety. Marinating and steaming the duck makes it beautifully tender, and if you'd like to serve 4 and share the enjoyment, see our doubling tip.

Potatoes must be cooked through and tender before mashing to create a creamy mash that is lump-free and not gluey. In step 4, cook potatoes 5-10 minutes longer if needed - cooking time depends on potato variety.
If you buy duck breasts with skin, they should be approx. 225-300 g each. Peel off skin and fat with the help of a small sharp knife before marinating duck.

Duck breasts can be marinated for up to 24 hours before steaming. In step 2, place duck and marinade in a sealed bag or covered container and refrigerate. When ready to cook, transfer duck and marinade to lined Varoma tray and continue with recipe.

Replace green beans with vegetables of your choice in step 6, for instance thinly sliced carrots, halved Brussels sprouts, shredded savoy cabbage, sliced red peppers or pak choi. Place the vegetables that require the longest steaming time in the simmering basket first.

To serve 4, use 4 duck breasts, increase ingredients for marinade by 1½ times, and double the ingredients for mashed potatoes and beans. Water for steaming and the recipe instructions remain unchanged.

title: Honey Sesame Chicken (Hestan Cue™) Metric
ingredients: 1 ½ tsp kosher salt, Diamond Crystal®
450 g chicken breasts, skinless, boneless, cubed (2.5 cm)
2 green onions, white parts in pieces, green parts, thinly sliced, to garnish
¼ tsp red pepper flakes, dried
340 g oil, e.g. grapeseed, vegetable or canola, as needed to fry
kosher salt, Diamond Crystal®, to season, to taste
1 tbsp sesame seeds, to taste, to garnish
steps: Place cornstarch, flour, water and salt into mixing bowl and mix 20 sec/speed 5 until smooth. Transfer to a large bowl, add cubed chicken and fold into batter with spatula to coat well. Clean mixing bowl.

Slice 2 green onions on the bias, separate green parts from white parts and set aside. Place garlic and green onions (white parts only) into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cornstarch and water into mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 5.
Add soy sauce, chicken stock, honey, rice vinegar, oyster sauce, sesame oil, lemon juice and pepper flakes and without measuring cup cook 10 min/120°C/speed 1.
Continue the recipe in the HESTAN CUE™ app, search "USA & Canada" to cook the chicken in the Hestan Cue™ frying pan.
Toss cooked chicken with sauce. Garnish with sliced green onions (green parts only) and sesame seeds and serve.
tips: Search "Thermomix" in the Hestan Cue™ app to access all Thermomix® and Hestan Cue™ Smart cooking recipes.

title: Antonio Bachour: Chocolate Raspberry Tarts (Metric)
ingredients: 340 g all purpose white flour, plus extra to dust
270 g Valrhona chocolate discs, Jivara milk chocolate 40% (see Tip)  o 270 g milk chocolate 40%, high quality chips or chunks
steps: Place all purpose flour, icing sugar, almond flour, cocoa powder and salt into mixing bowl and mix 20 sec/speed 10.

Add butter and eggs and mix 20 sec/speed 5. Transfer pastry to a clean surface and shape into a disk. Divide pastry in half, wrap in cling film and refrigerate 1 hour. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl. Line a baking sheet with parchment and set aside.

On a lightly floured surface, roll out one half of the chilled pastry dough to 3 mm thickness. Line 12 perforated tart rings (8 cm) by pressing ring molds into rolled out pastry to create the bottom. Transfer to prepared baking sheet. Roll out remaining chilled pastry and cut into thin strips slightly larger than the height of the rings (approx. 2-3 cm wide). Line the inside walls of the tart rings with pastry strips, trimming as needed. Gently press the bottom dough and wall strips together with your finger to seal. With a small paring knife, trim off any dough that is above the tart rings. Use a fork to prick holes in the pastry and refrigerate (approx. 30 min.). Meanwhile, preheat oven to 325°F/160°C.

Line chilled pastry shells with parchment and baking weights (e.g. dried beans) and blind-bake 13 minutes (325°F/160°C). Remove parchment and weights and bake a further 2-5 minutes (325°F/160°C) until pastry is dry to the touch. Set aside to cool. Meanwhile, make the ganache.
Place chocolate into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add whipping cream and glucose and heat 1 min/50°C/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and heat a further 1 min/50°C/speed 3.
Carefully fill the cooled tart shells with Milk Chocolate Ganache. Refrigerate until set (approx. 1 hr.).
Decorate with fresh raspberries and serve.
tips: Use a ring mold (13 cm) to cut circles from rolled pastry and place into perforated tart ring molds (8 cm). Gently press the pastry up the sides to line the molds. Roll a rolling pin over the top of the rings to remove excess pastry from above the tart rings. Run a small sharp knife around the top edge between the pastry and the ring edge, providing easy removal from tart ring once baked.

For best results we recommend using Valrhona or other couverture chocolate. The recipes will work with other chocolates but the results may be different. Valrhona is a high-quality couverture chocolate. Couverture is the name given to a certain class of high-quality chocolate. Couverture chocolate, unlike regular chocolate, is ground to a finer texture during the production process and contains a greater percentage of cocoa butter relative to the other ingredients. These two differences produce a superior flavour and texture that makes couverture the preferred chocolate for tempering and enrobing truffles, bonbons, and other fine candies.
Valrhona chocolate can be found at specialty markets or purchased online.
Glucose is a simple syrup used in baking that can be found at well stocked supermarkets, specialty and craft stores.

To make your own glucose syrup place 45 g water and 45 g sugar into mixing bowl and heat 5 min/100°C/speed 1 until sugar is dissolved. Transfer into a jar and place in refrigerator to cool completely (approx. 15 min.) before using. Leftover syrup can be stored in the refrigerator in a sealed glass jar.

title: Peanut brittle
ingredients: 150 g unsalted peanuts, roasted  o 3 - 4 tbsp mixed seeds
30 g butter, unsalted, cold and as much as possible in one piece (approx. 60 mm x 40 mm x 10 mm)
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stage modes, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar in the mixing bowl.
Line a square baking tray (17 cm x 17 cm) with baking paper, cover with peanuts and set aside on a heat-resistant surface.

Place brown sugar, 70 g water, butter and lemon juice in mixing bowl. Place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start Sugar Stages . Transfer immediately to prepared baking tray and, using spatula, immediately scrape off any mixture left on rim of mixing bowl so mixing bowl lid closes securely for Pre-clean mode.
Place 1000 g water and vinegar and start Pre-clean .
Allow to cool completely to room temperature and break into pieces. Store in an air-tight container at room temperature (see tip). Use as needed.
tips: To succeed with this recipe, the 30 g butter need to be added as much as possible in one piece. Cut one chunk of approx. 60 mm x 40 mm x 10 mm and add some more if necessary.
Adding lemon juice prevents the sugar from burning or crystallising, without affecting the flavour.
Store the brittle for up to a week in an air-tight container in a cool, dry place to prevent it from absorbing moisture.
Garnish the brittle with different nuts (e.g. peanuts, toasted walnuts, seeds, coconut flakes).

title: Quick puff pastry
ingredients: 200 g butter, unsalted, cut in small pieces (1-2 cm), frozen
200 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
steps: Place butter, plain flour, chilled water and salt in mixing bowl and mix 20 sec/speed 6. Remove pastry dough from mixing bowl. Dough will appear crumbly. Pat it into a rough square, wrap in cling film and refrigerate for 20 minutes.

Unwrap dough and place on a lightly floured work surface. Using a rolling pin, roll out dough into a long rectangle 3 times as long as it is wide (approx. 60 cm x 20 cm). Fold dough in thirds and give folded dough a quarter turn so that the fold is on the left. Repeat rolling and folding process twice, then return to refrigerator for 20 minutes or place in freezer for 5 minutes before using.
Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.

Roll out dough into a rectangle (5 mm thick) and cut in required shape or shapes right before baking. Bake for 20 minutes (200°C) for one large piece of pastry, 12-15 minutes (200°C) for smaller pastries, or as directed by other recipes. Allow to cool on a cooling rack before serving or storing in an air-tight container.
tips: This pastry serves as a base for cakes, pastries, cream puffs and fruit tarts.

The success of this recipe depends on keeping the pastry dough chilled so the layers of butter do not melt. A cold work surface (marble or stone) and a cool room temperature are helpful. If at any time during the process the dough feels warm, place in the freezer for 5 minutes before rolling out again. To prevent the dough from sticking to the work surface, whenever necessary use a light dusting of flour, or roll out dough between two sheets of baking paper.
Puff pastry dough freezes very well before baking. Defrost in the refrigerator before using. Partially rolling out the dough before freezing allows for faster defrosting.
Once baked, pastry keeps well for up to 15 days stored in an air-tight container in a cool dry place.
Replace water with very cold white wine.

title: Strawberry jam
ingredients: 500 g strawberries, cut in halves or quarters as needed
steps: Place strawberries, lemon juice, sugar and oil in mixing bowl. Place Varoma dish without its lid instead of measuring cup on mixing bowl lid and cook 35-40 min/Varoma/speed 1 (see tip).

Test setting point of jam (see tip), pour into warm sterilised jam jars with twist-off lids and seal immediately. Turn jam jars upside down for 10 minutes before turning right side up and allowing to cool. Serve or store in a cool dry place.
tips: Only use ripe fruit in this recipe.

Setting point test: place a saucer in the freezer (5-10 minutes). Place 1 tsp jam on the chilled saucer. When jam on saucer is cool, push it with your finger. If the jam wrinkles, it is ready. If not, boil jam for a further 2 minutes, then test again.
Adjust cooking time according to the consistency you prefer: longer cooking time results in thicker jam.
Depending on the fruit, the jam may bubble up slightly onto the Varoma. If this happens, reduce temperature to 100°C or even to 90°C and extend cooking time as needed.
To ensure preservation, clean jam jars thoroughly in hot soapy water, then dry in a low oven or run them through the dishwasher. Pour jam into jars while jars are still warm.
Raspberry jam: replace strawberries with 500 g raspberries. Reduce cooking time to 8-10 minutes according to the consistency you prefer.
Mixed berries jam: use a total of 250 g strawberries and 250 g raspberries. Reduce cooking time to 25-30 minutes.

title: Leftover Vegetable Hummus
ingredients: 240 g cooked white chickpeas (1 x 400 g can)
250 - 300 g leftover roasted vegetables (e.g. carrot, celery, fennel, onion, celeriac), cut in pieces (see Tip)
30 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for drizzling
½ - 1 tsp ground cumin, to taste
parsley, fresh, finely chopped, for garnishing
steps: Drain chickpeas over a bowl, reserve liquid, transfer chickpeas to a separate bowl and set both aside. Place vegetables, reserved chickpeas, 50 g reserved chickpea liquid, tahini, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, cumin and salt into mixing bowl and start Blend /45 sec. Transfer to a bowl, drizzle with extra oil, garnish with parsley, then serve with bread, pita bread or crudités.
tips: Use leftover cooked vegetables, from soup preparation for example.
Search Cookidoo® for tahini inspiration and make it fresh with Thermomix®.
Chickpea brine (aquafaba) can be used to make vegan meringues. You can find a recipe on Cookidoo®.
Substitute aquafaba with the same quantity of water.

title: Green Day Juice (Metric)
ingredients: 395 - 510 g alkaline water or 395-510 g spring water  o 395 - 510 g grapefruit flesh
1 apple, green, cored, deseeded and quartered
60 g kale  o 60 g spinach leaves, fresh
30 g cucumber, peeled and deseeded, cut into pieces (5 cm)
2 stalks celery, cut into pieces (5 cm)
steps: Place water, apple, kale, cucumber and celery into mixing bowl and start Blend /1 min 30 sec.
Strain juice through a fine-mesh sieve into a pitcher and serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.
tips: Strain pulp from juice to taste. Pulp is where the fibre is, and fibre helps to decrease sugars in the blood. For the most health benefits, add some pulp back into the juice and thin to desired consistency with water.
Pulp can be used to liven up smoothies, turn into ice cubes to flavour water or add to baked goods, reducing the need for oils or butter.
Serve over ice.

title: Amaretto Sour (Metric)
ingredients: 2 tsp agave syrup  o 2 tsp maple syrup
2 egg whites, from large eggs, pasteurized (see Tip)
steps: Place first bowl into position. Place amaretto, bourbon, lemon juice, agave and bitters into mixing bowl and mix 2 min/speed 7. Set first mixing bowl aside.
Place second bowl into position. Insert butterfly whisk. Place egg whites into mixing bowl and without measuring cup, whip 2 min/speed 3.5, until glossy and stiff peaks form.
Add reserved amaretto mixture over egg whites, insert measuring cup and mix 15 sec/speed 3. Remove butterfly whisk.
Add ice and stir 6 sec/speed 3. Strain into a glass, garnish with a cherry and lemon slice and serve.
tips: To pasteurize eggs: wash eggs. Place 1220 g water into mixing bowl and boil 15 min/60°C/speed 3. Insert simmering basket and place in eggs. When temperature reaches 60°C, pasteurize 3 min 30 sec/60°C/speed 0.5. Immediately remove eggs and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking process.
Raw eggs are not recommended for infants, the elderly, pregnant women, or people with weakened immune systems.
Serve over ice.
For a vegan variation: replace egg whites with 2 tablespoons aquafaba (liquid from a can of chickpeas).

title: Versatile chunky soup
ingredients: 100 - 150 g mixed vegetables, for sautéing (e.g. onions, shallots, leek), cut in pieces (2 cm)
350 - 400 g mixed vegetables, for soup (e.g. courgettes, carrots, pumpkin, sweet potatoes, celeriac, parsnips), cut in pieces (2 cm)
50 g mixed frozen vegetables (opcional)  o 50 g frozen green peas (opcional)
1 tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
½ - 1 tsp salt  o ½ - 1 tbsp soy sauce
steps: Place olive oil, mixed vegetables for sautéing and mixed vegetables for soup in mixing bowl, place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and sauté High Temp. .
Add mixed frozen vegetables, water, vegetable stock paste and salt and cook 15 min/100°C/speed 2.
Add pasta and cook time indicated on package/100°C//speed 1. Serve garnished as desired.
tips: Add 30-50 g bacon, cut in cubes, along with vegetables in step 1.

title: Newfoundland White Bread and Toutons (Frybread)
ingredients: 55 g butter, divided, (45 g melted, 10 g diced, to grease)
635 g all-purpose flour, divided, plus extra to dust
butter, melted, to brush, plus extra to serve
steps: Place 15 g sugar, water and yeast into mixing bowl and stir 5 min/37°C/speed . Allow to rest in bowl for 5 minutes, then stir 5 sec/speed 2.
Add 45 g melted butter, milk, 375 g flour, 30 g sugar and salt and mix 1 min/speed 4 until combined and smooth.

Add 260 g flour and knead Dough /4 min or until dough completely releases from sides of mixing bowl. Meanwhile, grease a large bowl with remaining 10 g butter. Remove dough from mixing bowl, form into a ball and place in prepared bowl. Cover with a damp tea towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 90 min.). Meanwhile, dust a clean tea towel with flour and set aside.

Once dough has risen, carefully slice off two doughnut sized portions (80-100 g ea.) retaining as much air as possible and shape into rustic circles (8-10 cm/3-4 in. ea.). Transfer to prepared cloth and let rest 10 minutes. Meanwhile, heat vegetable oil (approx. 5 cm/2 in.) in a heavy skillet on stove top over medium high heat. Once dough has rested, drop a small piece into the hot oil and if oil sizzles, fry dough circles (Toutons) until golden (approx. 1 min. per side).
Reshape remaining dough and let rest for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, grease a large loaf (30 cm x 12 cm) or (12 in. x 5 in.) and set aside.

Divide rested dough into 3 equal portions forming each into a ball. Arrange all 3 dough balls into prepared loaf pan, cover with a clean damp tea towel and set aside to proof until approximately 10 cm/ 2 in. above rim of pan (approx. 2 hr.). During last 15 minutes, set oven rack to middle position and preheat to 190°C/350°F.
Bake 30-40 minutes (190°C/350°F) or until golden brown and bread sounds hollow when tapped on the underside.

Allow to cool in pan for 5 minutes then transfer to a wire rack and brush top with melted butter. Allow bread to cool completely before slicing and serving. Serve Toutons hot with butter and molasses or topped with powdered sugar.
tips: This bread was traditionally made for large families in oversized loaf pans that today can only be found in vintage shops and in Newfoundland kitchens. We can enjoy these two Newfoundland traditions without the need of specialty pans using this smaller version of the traditional recipe. It is said the three portions of the loaf represent the holy trinity and when pulled apart, the 4 slices on either side of each tear are called “the kissing slices” and are most desired!
Two 80-100 g Toutons can be made from this dough with enough remaining for 1 loaf of bread or use the entire dough to make one or the other.

title: Banana Cream Pie with Wafer Crust (Metric)
ingredients: 140 g cream cheese, cubed, room temperature
140 g heavy whipping cream, 30-40% fat, very cold
2 bananas, ripe but firm and thinly sliced
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F/190°C.
Place first bowl into position. Place butter into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl id and melt 2 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add sugar and wafers, insert measuring cup and crush 10 sec/speed 7. Spread the crumb mixture into a pie dish (23 cm) and press into base and sides of pan.
Bake 7 minutes (375°F/190°C). Set aside and cool completely. Clean and dry mixing bowl.

Place first bowl into position. Place sugar, corn starch, milk, egg yolks, butter and vanilla into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook Thicken /100°C. Pour the pastry cream over reserved cooled crust, smooth surface with spatula, cover with cling film, refrigerate and allow to cool completely.
Place second bowl into position. Place sugar into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and grind 15 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Insert butterfly whisk. Add cream cheese, whipping cream and vanilla and without measuring cup and without setting a time, whip speed 3.5 until desired consistency is achieved, watching carefully to avoid over whipping. Remove butterfly whisk. Set whipped cream aside.

Remove cling film from pastry cream, arrange banana slices in concentric circles over top of pastry cream -- starting in the center and fanning out towards the edges while slightly overlapping banana slices. Spread whipped cream over bananas creating decorative swirls and soft peaks. Refrigerate for 1 hour to chill and serve cold.
tips: Sprinkle with cocoa powder just before serving.
Replace bananas with sliced mango, peaches, berries or any favourite fruit.

title: Chilli Cheese Dogs
ingredients: 115 g red onions, cut into pieces, plus extra sliced to garnish
¼ tsp chilli powder, to taste
8 all beef hot dogs, pierced with a fork
steps: Place cheddar cheese into mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onions, garlic and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and without measuring cup cook 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add tomato sauce, ketchup, mustard, salt, chilli powder and broth and without measuring cup cook 15 min/100°C/speed 2.
Place Varoma dish into position and weigh in ground beef. Insert Varoma tray, place in hot dogs, secure Varoma lid and steam 8-10 min/Varoma/speed 2.
Remove Varoma. Remove Varoma tray, set hot dogs aside and keep warm. Transfer steamed beef to mixing bowl and without measuring cup, cook 5 min/85°C//speed 1.5.
Place steamed hot dogs in buns and top with chilli. Garnish with sliced onion and reserved grated cheese and serve immediately.
tips: Refrigerate any unused chilli and consume within 5 days.
Replace ground beef with ground turkey and/or replace beef hot dogs with turkey hot dogs.

Steaming buns make them warm and soft. In Canada, there are hot dog buns made especially for steaming. Steam your steamable hot dog buns in the Varoma after cooking the chilli. Rinse mixing bowl and clean Varoma. Place 300 g water into mixing bowl, place Varoma dish into position and place in 8 made for steaming hot dog buns, evenly distribute between Varoma dish and tray, secure Varoma lid and steam 8-10 min/Varoma/speed 1.5.

title: Maple Pecan Pie
ingredients: 70 g unsalted butter, chilled, cut into pieces, plus extra to grease
140 g pecan nut halves, raw, divided
2 tbsp all-purpose flour, plus extra to dust
