steps: Grease a loose-based rectangular tart tin (34 x 10 cm/14 x 4 in.) and set aside.
Place flour, baking powder, salt, butter, powdered sugar, egg yolks and milk into mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 6. Wrap dough in cling film and refrigerate 20 minutes.

Roll out dough on a lightly floured silicone bread mat or work surface to 3-6 mm (⅛-¼ in.) thick. Starting at the edge of the dough, use the rolling pin to roll away from you until the dough is wrapped over the pin. Transfer pastry to prepared tart tin and gently press to mould to shape of tin. Trim off any dough above edges by running a rolling pin over the top of the tin. Prick dough with a fork and place in freezer while preparing the filling.
Set oven rack to lowest position and preheat to 190°C/375°F. Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in 70 g pecan halves and set aside until ready to decorate.
Place remaining 70 g pecans into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a separate bowl and set aside.

Place maple sugar, flour, cornstarch, egg and whipping cream into mixing bowl, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and start Thicken /100°C. Carefully remove simmering basket and set aside.

Cover bottom of pastry shell with reserved chopped pecans and slowly pour warm filling over the nuts (filling will be thin). Decorate with reserved pecan halves and bake on bottom rack for 20-30 minutes (190°C/375°F) or until filling is set. Allow to cool completely before serving.
tips: If maple sugar contains hard crystallized pieces: place 225 g maple sugar in a clean, dry mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/ speed 9. Use as per recipe.
If using our Traditional Canadian Pie Dough recipe from our O Canada collection, use 270 g pie dough for a rectangular tart tin (34 cm x 10 cm).

title: Bison Burger with Cheddar and Pickled Onions
ingredients: 600 g bison, freshly ground (see Tip)  o 600 g ground bison, store bought
75 g beer, golden Canadian beer or ale (see Tip)
½ tsp dried red chili flakes
freshly ground black pepper, to taste
135 g strong cheddar cheese, cut into 3 cubes
150 g red onions, peeled and trimmed
steps: Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in ground bison and set aside.
Place garlic and onion into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 5.

Add egg, beer, Worcestershire sauce, onion powder, garlic powder, chili flakes, salt and pepper and mix 5 sec/speed 3. Pour contents of mixing bowl around edges of bowl with reserved ground meat and gently mix with hands to incorporate all ingredients without over mixing. Divide and shape into three equal-sized patties. Wrap each patty around a cheddar cube and transfer to a plate, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 30 minutes (see Tip). Meanwhile, continue with recipe.
Preheat barbecue grill to 230°C/450°F or high heat.
Halve onions lengthwise and slice into ½ inch wedges. Insert a toothpick to hold layers together while grilling, then set aside in a shallow bowl.

Place vinegar, sugar and salt into mixing bowl and cook for 5 min/80°C/speed 2 until sugar is dissolved. Pour into bowl with reserved onions, ensuring onions are fully submerged. Set aside for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Meanwhile, lightly grease a piece of foil large enough to partially cover grill and vent by poking holes with a toothpick.

Drain onions through a fine sieve and pat dry with paper towel. Place evenly over foil on grill-top and cook for 2-3 min per side or until soft. Once cooked, remove and discard toothpicks, set aside and keep warm.

Grill burgers 2-3 min per side, or until internal temperature registers 60˚C/140°F (medium rare) or 71˚C/160°F (well done). Place bison burgers on toasted buns, top with Grilled Pickled Onions and serve (see Tip).
tips: Bison Burgers can be found in Canadian prairie restaurants and most recently in some fast-food chains. Bison was fundamental to Canadian Indigenous life. Prairie bison were extirpated from Canada by 1888 and the wood bison were almost extinct by the 1850s due to heavy hunting. Preservation efforts began in the mid 19th century and currently we have 20,000 bison preserved in their native environment via Parks Canada with many more raised commercially, thus the bison burger has become an iconic Canadian prairie recipe.
Search Cookidoo® for the Ground Bison Meat recipe in our O Canada collection.
Refrigerating the patties for 30 minutes firms the meat for easier handling on the grill.
Bison meat has very little fat and is best cooked rare.
We recommend using Sleeman Honey Brown lager, but any good medium dark Canadian beer will work.
Serve with baby arugula and tomato, homemade mayonnaise or with an Alberta specialty, Brassica Whole Grain Mustard.
Replace cheddar cheese with blue cheese.

title: Chinese Blistered Green Beans (Hestan Cue™) Metric
ingredients: 2 green onions, white parts sliced, green parts cut on the bias
2 ½ cm fresh ginger root, peeled, cut into pieces
2 tbsp oil, e.g. grapeseed, vegetable, canola, to fry, divided
kosher salt, Diamond Crystal®, to season, to taste
steps: Slice 2 green onions on the bias, separate green parts from white parts and set aside.
Place garlic, green onions (white parts only) and ginger into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add sesame oil, sambal oelek, hoisin, black bean garlic sauce, rice vinegar and water and without measuring cup cook 8 min/100°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, continue the recipe in the HESTAN CUE™ induction burner app, search "USA & Canada" to cook the green beans in the Hestan Cue™ frying pan.
Pour sauce over green beans and toss. Season with salt, to taste. Finish with a squeeze of fresh lime juice, garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions (green parts only) and serve.
tips: Search "Thermomix" in the Hestan Cue™ app to access all Thermomix® and Hestan Cue™ Smart cooking recipes.

title: Chocolate Gingerbread Cookies (Metric)
ingredients: 115 g butter, unsalted, diced, room temperature
steps: Place brown sugar into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Add butter and mix 25 sec/speed 3.5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add egg, maple syrup, molasses, ginger, cinnamon, cloves and pepper and mix 25 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add flour, cocoa powder, salt, baking powder and baking soda, stir through with spatula to combine and mix 15 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 15 sec/speed 5.
Divide dough in half, flatten into disks and wrap in cling film. Refrigerate 1 hour. Clean mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 350°F/180°C. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment and set aside.

On a lightly floured surface, roll out one piece of chilled dough to a 0.5 cm thickness. Use cookie cutters to cut out shapes and arrange on prepared baking sheet (approx. 2.5 cm apart). Repeat with remaining dough and scraps.
Bake 13-15 minutes (350°F/180°C), until cooked through. Transfer to wire racks and let cool completely before decorating.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place icing sugar, egg white and water into mixing bowl and mix 1 min/speed 3.
Transfer icing to a piping bag with a small tip and decorate cooled cookies to taste. Allow to dry before storing or gift giving.
tips: Recipe inspired by Carole Bilodeau Thermomix® Independent Consultant Quebec, Canada.
For even baking with two cookie sheets at once, space racks so oven is divided into thirds and switch cookie sheets top to bottom and back to front halfway through baking.
Use Preclean Mode to loosen and remove dough from blades and bowl.

title: Roasted Pork Loin (Betty) Metric
ingredients: black pepper, ground, to season, to taste
2 apples, cored and sliced into rings
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F/180°C. Place pork loin, fat side down on a large cutting board and butterfly (see Tip). With the flat side of a meat tenderizer or a rolling pin, pound to flatten slightly.
Place bacon down the full length of the centre of the pork roast. Roll up pork loin and tightly secure at 5 cm intervals with kitchen string. Season with salt and pepper and set aside.

Place white wine, onion rings and apple rings into a stoneware casserole dish Betty and top with reserved pork. Scatter bay leaves and rosemary over pork, cover with Betty's lid and bake 55-60 minutes (350°F/180°C) or until meat thermometer registers an internal temperature of 145°F/62°C (see Tip). Transfer cooked pork, onion and apple rings to a serving dish and keep warm. Strain liquid from Betty over a bowl through a fine mesh sieve and reserve.
Place Parmesan into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 8.

Add reserved strained liquid from pork, white pepper and mustard and place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 10 min/95°C/speed 2. Carefully remove simmering basket, insert measuring cup and blend 30 sec/speed 10.
Discard bay leaves and rosemary. Slice pork and serve with reserved onions, apples and sauce.
tips: The USDA Guidelines and National Pork Board recommend cooking pork chops, roasts and tenderloin to an internal temperature between 145°F/62°C (medium rare) and 160°F/70°C (medium), followed by a 3 minute rest.
Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

To butterfly a pork loin, hold the knife blade parallel to the cutting board and make a lengthwise cut into the side of the meat at the center, stopping about one inch from the opposite side and open the pork loin like a book. If necessary, pound the meat to even out the thickness.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.

title: Beef Wellington (Ben) Metric
ingredients: 795 g beef tenderloin (2 pieces, 397.5 g ea.)
¼ tsp black pepper, ground, to taste
200 g beef tenderloin, filet mignon, in pieces (4 cm)
3 sprigs thyme, fresh, leaves only, plus extra to garnish
755 g red wine, e.g. merlot or cabernet (1 bottle)
500 g beef broth  o 500 g water
steps: Wrap fillets in cling film to maintain shape and refrigerate overnight.

Remove fillets from refrigerator, unwrap and set aside. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and add olive oil. Once oil begins to smoke slightly, sear fillets until the entire surface of the meat is lightly browned (approx. 3 min. per side). Remove from heat and set aside on paper towels.
With a pastry brush, coat fillets with Dijon mustard and set aside.
Place garlic and shallot into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add brown mushrooms and button mushrooms and chop 15 sec/speed 4.5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Add salt, pepper and thyme and chop 20 sec/speed 4.5. Place simmering basket onto mixing and cook 15 min/100°C/speed 1.
Transfer mixture to a large piece of cheesecloth, squeeze out all the water and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Place a piece of cling film (approx. 45 cm long) onto a clean work surface. Shingle 4 prosciutto slices to form a rectangle that can encompass the entire fillet, spread prosciutto with half the pâté and distribute half the mushroom mixture in a layer approximately 1 cm thick.

Place 1 reserved fillet at one end and roll up with aid of cling film to form as tight a roll as possible, twist the ends to seal completely and hold in a log shape. Refrigerate 15 minutes. Repeat with remaining fillet.
Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Roll out each puff pastry piece into a rectangle, large enough to cover an entire fillet with a ½ cm thickness.

Remove beef from refrigerator and cut off cling film. Set a fillet in the centre of each pastry and fold over the longer sides, wrap each fillet with an even thickness of pastry and remove all excess. Refrigerate 30 minutes.

Brush the pastry with beaten egg yolks, sprinkle with fleur-de-sel and place the rolls into stoneware baking dish Ben. Bake 15 minutes (220°C/425°F). Reduce temperature to 205°C/400°F and bake 20-25 minutes (205°C/400°F) or until an inserted thermometer registers 57°C/135°F for medium rare (see Tip). Meanwhile prepare the sauce.
Place olive oil and butter into mixing bowl and without measuring cup, heat 2 min/120°C/speed 1. Add 200 g beef pieces and without measuring cup sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1.

Add peppercorns, bay leaf, thyme, red wine vinegar, red wine, beef broth, salt and cornstarch, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 30 min/120°C/speed 2. Using a fine mesh sieve, strain the sauce into a saucepan and keep warm.
Garnish with thyme and serve sliced Beef Wellington with sauce.
tips: Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.
The USDA Guidelines recommend cooking roasts and tenderloin to an internal temperature between 63°C (medium rare) and 70°C (medium), followed by a 3 minute rest.

title: Maple-Dijon Vinaigrette
steps: Place shallots and garlic into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 50 g olive oil and without measuring cup, cook 10 min/120°C//speed .

Add remaining 50 g olive oil, white balsamic vinegar, sherry vinegar, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, maple syrup, salt and pepper, insert measuring cup and mix 3 min/55°C/speed 4. Serve warm or transfer to a sterilized jar with airtight lid (see Tip), seal and allow to cool before refrigerating. Consume within one week.
tips: To prepare jar: place 500 g water into mixing bowl. Place jar and lid upside down in the centre of the Varoma and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Leave to drain - do not dry or touch the inside surfaces. Alternatively, thoroughly wash jar and lid in hot, soapy water. Rinse by pouring over with boiling water. Prepare for filling, if needed, by placing on a clean tea towel in a roasting pan and heating in the oven at 100°C/212˚F until required.

title: Cashew Coconut Milk (Metric)
ingredients: 30 g desiccated coconut  o 30 g coconut, flaked, unsweetened
155 g ice cubes, or to taste
steps: Place cashews, dates, coconut and vanilla into mixing bowl and start Blend /30 sec.
Add ice cubes and start Blend /30 sec.
Add water and start Blend /4 min. Transfer to a large carafe, cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Store milk in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Serve cold.

title: Trout with hollandaise sauce
ingredients: 350 g potatoes, cut in pieces (3-4 cm)
350 g vegetables (e.g. asparagus, cauliflower, in florets, carrots), cut in pieces
¼ tsp ground black pepper, adjust to taste
2 whole fresh trout, gutted, descaled (approx. 220 g each)
100 g butter, unsalted, cut in pieces
¼ tsp ground black pepper, adjust to taste
steps: Place water in mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket, place potatoes in it and season with ½ tsp salt.

Place vegetables in Varoma dish, season with ½ tsp salt, set Varoma in position and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile, place trout on Varoma tray, sprinkle with lemon juice (approx. 2 tsp) and season with black pepper and ½ tsp salt.
Insert Varoma tray in Varoma dish, close Varoma and steam a further 15 min/Varoma/speed 1.

Check if fish, potatoes and vegetables are cooked. If not steam a further 3 min/Varoma/speed 1. Transfer potatoes, trout and vegetables to a serving dish and keep warm. Transfer cooking liquid to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place 50 g reserved cooking liquid, butter, egg yolks, white wine, lemon juice, salt and black pepper in mixing bowl and cook 6 min/70°C/speed 4. Remove butterfly whisk.
Serve trout immediately with sauce, lemon quarters, potatoes and vegetables.
tips: Adjust steaming time of vegetables in step 2 according to preference.
Replace trout with other types of fish, adjusting cooking time as necessary.

title: Stuffed vegetables
ingredients: 10 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for greasing and drizzling
steps: Cut courgettes and aubergines in half lengthwise. Cut white onions in half across the middle. Arrange all vegetables in Varoma dish and tray with cut side facing down.
Place water in mixing bowl, set Varoma in position and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set Varoma aside and empty mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease a baking dish and set aside.
Using a tablespoon, scoop out pulp of cooked vegetables, leaving the outside intact for stuffing later. Set pulp aside for use in stuffing mixture.
Place extra virgin olive oil, breadcrumbs, basil leaves, egg, milk, salt, black pepper and reserved pulp of cooked vegetables in mixing bowl and mix 3 sec/speed 5.
Place vegetable shells cut side up in prepared baking dish. Fill vegetables shells with stuffing mixture and drizzle with extra virgin olive oil. Bake for 20-30 minutes (180°C). Serve hot.
tips: If you don't like onions or if they are too small for stuffing, replace with 1 more aubergine or courgette or use onion for the filling only.
Add 30 g grated Parmesan cheese in step 5.

title: Almond Milk (Metric)
ingredients: ½ tsp natural vanilla extract, pure (opcional)
steps: Place a large ceramic or glass bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in almonds and water. Set aside to soak for 1 hour.
Place dates, vanilla, reserved soaked almonds and soaking water into mixing bowl and blend 2 min/speed 9, until thick and creamy.
Pour mixture into a nut milk bag or muslin cloth and firmly squeeze to extract milk. Transfer into a glass bottle (approx. 995 g). Refrigerate and use Almond Milk as needed.
tips: Refrigerate and consume within 5 days.
Shake well before drinking, as it tends to separate.
Use leftover almond pulp in cakes, breads, smoothies or as a base for protein balls.
Yield depends on the amount of water used to soak and the length of soaking time.

title: Cultured Butter
steps: Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in buttermilk and heavy cream. Stir with spatula until combined. Cover with cling film. Leave cream mixture on the counter for 12 hours up to overnight.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place cream mixture into mixing bowl and whip 3-4 min/speed 4, or until solids and liquids have separated. Remove butterfly whisk.
Using simmering basket, strain liquid from solids over a bowl. Reserve buttermilk for later use.
Place iced cold water and butter solids into mixing bowl and mix 10-15 sec/speed 4, until liquids and solids are separated again.

Using simmering basket, strain liquids from solids a second time, and press with spatula so that only butter remains. Squeeze as much liquid out of the butter as possible and form into desired shape (see Tip). Refrigerate and serve butter chilled or freeze for later use.
tips: Reserve buttermilk from strained churned butter to make more cultured butter.
Use reserved buttermilk in pancakes, cakes or in smoothies.
Butter will keep sealed in the fridge for up to 2 weeks.
Replace buttermilk with Greek yogurt, and whip the cream mixture 10-12 min/speed 4 or until the liquid and solids separate, then continue with recipe.
For salted butter: add 1¼ tsp salt after squeezing out the liquid a second time and mix 10 sec/speed 3 to incorporate. Salt assists in giving butter a longer shelf life.

title: Roast Potatoes (Betty) Metric
ingredients: 1360 g Yukon gold potatoes (approx. 70-100 g ea.)
85 g extra virgin olive oil  o 85 g vegetable oil
1 lemon, thin peel only, no white pith
steps: Preheat oven to 450°F/230°C.
Place water into mixing bowl, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and boil Kettle /100°C. Meanwhile, scrub potatoes.

Once water is boiling, carefully remove simmering basket and set aside. Set Varoma dish into position, place prepared potatoes into Varoma dish leaving some holes open for steam to circulate, secure Varoma lid and steam 18 min/Varoma/speed 2.
Remove Varoma, carefully remove Varoma lid. Transfer potatoes into a stoneware casserole dish Betty, sprinkle with olive oil and salt and toss to coat.
Place rosemary sprigs over potatoes and without lid, roast 45 minutes (450°F/230°C). Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl and prepare Gremolata.
Place Parmesan cheese, garlic, parsley and lemon peel into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and start Blend /10 sec. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Once potatoes are roasted, discard rosemary and broil 3 minutes or until potatoes are golden brown. Carefully transfer potatoes and the hot oil to a serving bowl. Sprinkle with Parmesan Gremolata and toss to coat. Serve hot.
tips: Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.
For a classic appearance, potatoes can also be peeled.

title: Soy Milk (Metric)
steps: Place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in soybeans. Remove simmering basket with soybeans and submerge in a bowl of warm water. Leave to soak for at least one hour to overnight.

Discard soaking water. Rinse soaked soybeans under cold running water. Place rinsed soybeans and cold water into mixing bowl, place simmering basket and cook 30 min/100°C//speed 2. Carefully remove simmering basket and set aside.
Add sugar and start Blend /3 min. Serve immediately or store in an air-tight container and refrigerate.
tips: Consume within 3 days.

For an oat flavoured soy milk: after blending, add 45 g oats, place simmering basket and cook for an additional 7 min/100°C/speed 2 and blend 3 min/speed 7. Serve warm or store in an air-tight container and refrigerate.

title: Maple and Spice Glazed Ham
ingredients: 1 pork shoulder, boneless smoked (picnic ham) (approx. 1.5 kg-1.6 kg)
1 tsp cloves, plus an extra charge for decoration
80 g dark brown sugar  o 80 g maple sugar granules
steps: Remove any wrapping from ham. Place ham in a large saucepan, add cloves, bay leaf, allspice, salt, peppercorns, and enough water to cover the meat. Bring to a boil then simmer gently for about 1 hour, turning after 30 minutes. Insert a fork into the ham to check for doneness; it should go in easily. Towards the end of this time, prepare the glaze.

Place brown sugar, Dijon mustard, rosemary, cloves and cinnamon into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and grind again 10 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add maple syrup and mix 3 sec/speed 5, then heat 5 min/90°C/speed 1.
Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F and line a large baking dish with foil and set aside.
Remove ham from pan and let it cool slightly. Using a sharp knife, carefully remove the top layer of skin, leaving as much fat as possible underneath. Transfer ham to prepared dish.

Using a sharp knife, score top of ham in a diagonal pattern. Repeat scoring, diagonally, in the opposite direction to create a crossing pattern. Brush the entire surface with half of the Spicy Maple Glaze, then insert a clove into each diamond. Bake 10 minutes (220°C/425°F). Carefully remove ham from oven and baste with remaining Spicy Maple Glaze. Bake again 5-10 minutes (220°C/425°F) until meat is sticky and caramelized.
Let cool slightly then slice and serve hot, or cool completely, chill and serve cold.
tips: Our version of this traditional recipe involves boiling the ham in a savoury broth bursting with festive flavours, then brushing it with a spicy, sweet Maple Syrup Glaze. Baked until golden and caramelized, this ham is delicious served hot or cold.

title: Berry Clafoutis (Anna) Metric
ingredients: 100 g sugar, plus 2 tbsp to sprinkle
450 g red berries, mixed, fresh, plus extra to garnish (see Tip)
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F/180°C. Place 15 g butter into a stoneware baking dish Anna. Place baking dish into oven and heat for 15 minutes (350°F/180°C).
Place milk, eggs, 100 g sugar, vanilla, lemon zest, flour and salt into mixing bowl and blend 1 min/speed 10. Remove mixing bowl and set aside.

With oven mitts, carefully remove Anna from oven and brush the melted butter to coat the baking dish. Evenly distribute berries into baking dish then slowly and evenly pour batter over berries. Sprinkle top with 30 g sugar and bake 60-80 minutes (350°F/180°C), until puffed, and top is golden brown (it will deflate when cool).
Top with fresh berries, sprinkle with icing sugar and serve warm or at room temperature.
tips: Use your favorite fresh berry combination (e.g. strawberries, hulled and halved, blackberries, raspberries, blueberries, cherries, pitted and halved etc.).
Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.
If replacing fresh berries with frozen berries, thaw completely before using.

title: Lemon sorbet
ingredients: 200 g lemon juice (5-7 lemons), freshly squeezed
steps: Place 400 g water and sugar in mixing bowl and cook 5 min/100°C/speed 3.
Add remaining 250 g water and lemon juice and mix 3 sec/speed 3.

Add egg white and mix 3 sec/speed 4. Pour mixture up to 4 cm high into freezable containers (e.g. plastic, silicone) and cover with cling film. Allow mixture to cool mixture completely before freezing for at least 8 hours.

Cut frozen mixture in pieces (approx. 4 cm x 4 cm) using a long sharp knife. Place pieces in mixing bowl and crush 30 sec/speed 9, then mix with aid of spatula 30 sec/speed 4. Serve immediately in dessert bowls.

title: Vegetable Stock Paste (Vegan)
ingredients: 200 g celery stalks, trimmed, cut into pieces
100 g yellow onions, cut into pieces  o 100 g Spanish onions, cut into pieces
1 - 2 sprigs fresh sage, leaves only (about 4-5 large leaves)
4 - 5 sprigs fresh parsley, leaves and stems, cut into pieces
30 g dry white wine  o 30 g water
steps: Place celery, carrots, onions, tomatoes, zucchini, mushrooms, garlic cloves, bay leaf, thyme, sage, rosemary and parsley into mixing bowl and chop 15 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add salt, wine and olive oil. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 25-30 min/Varoma/speed 2. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and start Blend /1 min or until a smooth paste consistency is achieved. Mixture will become thick and fairly dry. Transfer into air-tight glass jars and allow to cool before using or storing in refrigerator (see Tip).
tips: 1 tablespoon of stock paste is roughly equivalent to 1 shop-bought stock cube.
To make vegetable stock, use 1 tablespoon per 500 g water.
You can store stock paste in a sealable container in the refrigerator for several months.
The salt in this recipe is used as a preservative. When mixed with water as described above, the stock will not taste too salty.
If you wish to decrease the salt in this recipe, we recommend to store the stock paste in the freezer (freeze using ice cube trays to portion the paste).
Small quantities of sea vegetables, such as dulse, wakame or kombu can be added to the stock for extra flavour and nutrients.
Adapt this recipe using any leftover vegetables in your refrigerator. Weigh into the mixing bowl to ensure quantities are consistent with the recipe.

title: Sugar Pie
ingredients: 2 tbsp all-purpose flour, plus extra to dust
270 g pie pastry disc, homemade (see Tip)  o 1 pie dough, store bought
steps: Set oven rack to lowest position and preheat to 190°C/375°F.

Place brown sugar, flour, cornstarch, egg and whipping cream into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and start Thicken /100°C. Meanwhile, lightly flour a dough mat and roll out 1 homemade pastry disc to a thickness of 5 mm (¼ in.). Line a deep pie pan 20 cm (8-in.) and gently press to mould pastry to pan and flute edges.
Pour warm filling into pastry shell (filling will be thin) and bake on bottom rack 20 minutes (190°C/375°F). Allow to cool completely before serving.
tips: In the days of New France, this pie was a "Tarte au sirop d’érable" made with maple syrup. Sugar pie or Tarte au sucre is now made with golden brown sugar and is much more common than Maple Pie in Quebec. The colonists of New France made their desserts with the only sugar they had on hand at that time: syrup or maple sugar. But over the generations, commercial sugar gradually replaced maple products and golden-brown sugar replaced syrup and the Tarte au sucre became a traditional regional Quebecois recipe that is still beloved by all!
Search Cookidoo® for Traditional Canadian Pie Dough recipe in our O Canada collection. For an 8 inch pie shell, 270 g pie dough is required.
If brown sugar contains hard crystallized pieces: place 225 g brown sugar in a clean, dry mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/ speed 9. Use as per recipe.

title: Low Carb Cheese Dinner Rolls
ingredients: 200 g mozzarella (low moisture), cubed (5 cm/2 in.)
60 g cream cheese, diced (2.5 cm/1 in.)
1 tsp whole milk  o 1 tsp water
steps: Place almonds and coconut into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place mozzarella cheese into mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 7.
Add cream cheese and mix 5 sec/speed 7 and heat 3 min/65°C/speed 1.

Add reserved almond-coconut flour mixture, baking powder, 2 eggs and salt and mix 20 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides and bottom of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer to cling film, shape into a disc and refrigerate 30 minutes, up to overnight.
Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside.
Divide chilled dough into 8 pieces and roll each into a ball. Place onto prepared baking sheet, spaced 5 cm/2 in. apart.
In a small bowl, combine 1 egg with 1 tsp milk. Brush rolls with egg wash and bake 20-24 minutes (180°C/350°F). Serve warm.
tips: To reheat: place rolls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and heat 10 minutes at 180°C/350°F.
Add dried herbs (rosemary, dill, thyme) or seeds (chia, sesame, hemp) to the dough itself, or sprinkle on after the egg wash.
Replace cream cheese with sour cream.

title: Baked Beans with Maple Syrup
ingredients: 400 g white beans, dried Navy type (see Tip)
150 g brown onions cut into pieces
150 g smoked bacon slices, cut into pieces (approx. 1 cm/¼ in.)
steps: Place a ceramic or glass bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in beans. Cover with boiling water (approx. 6 cm above the beans) and let soak overnight.
Drain beans through Varoma dish, rinse well and set aside.
Place oil, onion and bacon into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 7 min/120°C/speed .
Insert measuring cup and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add maple syrup, molasses, ketchup, vegetable stock, mustard powder, water and drained beans, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 20 min/100°C//speed . Then, start Slow Cook /6 h 30 min/98°C or until beans are tender.
Serve hot, as needed (see Tip).
tips: Dried white beans can be found in grocery, health food or bulk stores.
Using a dark maple syrup will provide a stronger maple flavour and preferred results.
Search Cookidoo® for vegetable stock recipe.
Leftovers can be kept in the freezer for up to 3 months.
Make ahead to allow for flavours to develop and sauce to thicken.
Serve as a side dish with eggs, maple ham and bacon for a hearty breakfast (or dinner).
Replace white beans with dried cannellini beans and proceed as per recipe.

title: Steamed Crème Brûlée (Metric) (TM6)
ingredients: 45 g sugar, plus extra to sprinkle
steps: Place sugar into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add egg yolks, whipping cream, vanilla and salt and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Divide filling into 6 Thermomix® ramekins (120 ml) (see Tip). Cover with 6 Thermomix® ramekin lids, place into Varoma dish and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place water into mixing bowl, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing cup lid and start Kettle /100°C. Carefully remove simmering basket and set aside.

Place Varoma dish with covered ramekins into position, secure Varoma lid and steam 18 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma, set covered ramekins aside to cool 10 minutes. Remove ramekin lids, refrigerate ramekins until filling is set (approx. 4 hr.), up to overnight.
Sprinkle sugar over tops of the Crème Brûlée and caramelize with a culinary torch (see Tip). Allow to rest for 5 minutes before serving.
tips: If Thermomix® ramekins are unavailable, use any 120 ml ramekins with lids for similar results. Ensure they are heatproof, fit in the Varoma dish and allow the Varoma lid to secure.

You can also use 120 ml glass mason jars (canning or jam jars) with metal lids but do not use the metal rings. Place the lids loosely on the jars without sealing. For glass jars, increase the steaming time by 3 minutes. Ensure they are heatproof, fit in the Varoma dish and allow the Varoma lid to secure.
If lids are unavailable, place a small round piece of parchment over the custard and cover with cling wrap. Increase steaming time by 5 minutes.

If a culinary torch is unavailable, ensure ramekins are broiler safe and place under an oven broiler for 1 minute to caramelize, watching carefully to avoid burning. If using glass mason jars, do not place under a broiler, a culinary torch must be used to caramelize.
For presentation purpose, wipe the rim of the glass mason jars before sprinkling with sugar to torch.

Replace vanilla extract with half a vanilla bean. Split half a vanilla bean lengthwise, scrape out seeds and place pod and seeds into mixing bowl at the same time you're adding the sugar and grind 10 sec/speed 10.

Chocolate Crème Brûlée: add 2 tbsp cocoa powder at the same time as the egg yolks and whipping cream and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 5 sec/speed 4. Continue as per recipe.

title: North Carolina BBQ Chicken with Skillet Cornbread
ingredients: 6 chicken thighs, skin on, bone in  o 6 chicken breast fillets, skin on
425 g canned sweet corn kernels, drained
300 g cream of sweet corn condensed soup, canned
steps: Place mustard, vinegar, brown sugar, honey, butter, garlic powder, chilli powder, Worcestershire, salt and pepper into mixing bowl and cook 4 min/70°C/speed 2, then blend 20 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and let cool.
Place chicken in a large bowl. Pour approximately a third of the BBQ sauce over chicken, turn to fully coat. Cover with cling film and refrigerate 2 hours or overnight.
Remove marinated chicken from refrigerator 20 minutes before grilling and let stand at room temperature. Preheat grill to 230°C/450°F or medium/high.
Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F. Grease a large cast iron frying pan (25 cm/10 in.).
Place butter into mixing bowl and melt 3 min/70°C/speed 1.
Add corn, creamed corn soup, sour cream and eggs and mix 30 sec//speed 3.

Add flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder and salt and mix 20 sec//speed 4. Transfer mixture to prepared frying pan and bake for 60-65 minutes (180°C/350°F), until top is golden brown and a toothpick inserted in centre comes out clean. Meanwhile grill chicken.

Insert MEATER® into centre of thickest part of the chicken thigh (parallel to the surface of the grill). Ensure the safety notch is fully inside the meat. Open the MEATER® app and connect to MEATER®. When connected, tap "set up cook", choose poultry, select chicken, and decide your preferred target cooking temperature. Tap "start cook" and place chicken on the grill. Ensure MEATER® is away from direct heat of the flames.

Sear on direct heat for 1 minute (ea. side) then move to indirect heat. Close grill and cook, flipping once and basting with a third of the BBQ sauce, until the MEATER® app alerts you to remove chicken from grill. Allow to rest until MEATER® app alerts you when ready, then carefully remove MEATER®.
Serve drizzled with remaining North Carolina BBQ Sauce and Skillet Cornbread.
tips: Make your own condensed cream of corn soup before starting the recipe with TM6™ Thicken Mode. Place 45 g unsalted butter, 45 g all-purpose flour, ¼ tsp salt (optional), 226 g whole milk and 30 g corn kernels into mixing bowl and start Thicken /100°C. Yields the equivalent of one 298 g can. Use as per recipe.
Carolina BBQ Sauce can be made in advance and refrigerated until ready to use.

title: Confetti Rice
ingredients: 30 g green onions (2-3 onions), cut into pieces (5 cm/2 in.)
250 g mixed bell peppers, red, yellow, orange, cut into pieces (5 cm/2 in.)
steps: Place green onions into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and chop a further 3 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place peppers into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5.
Add olive oil, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and sauté 5 min/Varoma/speed 2. Transfer to a bowl and set aside (do not wash mixing bowl).
Insert simmering basket and weigh in rice. Remove simmering basket, thoroughly rinse rice under cool running water until water runs clear.

Place water, rinsed rice and salt into mixing bowl and stir with spatula to combine. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook Rice Cooker . Meanwhile, strain peppers through a fine mesh sieve, set peppers aside and discard liquid (see Tip).

Once cooked, transfer rice to a serving dish. Add ⅓ of the reserved onions and ⅓ of the reserved peppers and stir with spatula to combine with rice. Repeat with remaining vegetables, adding butter between each addition. Stir until completely incorporated. Serve immediately.
tips: Replace mixed peppers with 250 g of your favourite colourful vegetables, cut into pieces (5 cm/2 in.) to turn plain rice into a more appealing dish.
Serve with extra butter, soya sauce or your favourite rice accompaniment.
For additional nutritional value, add strained vegetable liquid back into the cooked rice, toss with the onions and peppers to incorporate.
Leftovers freeze well in freezer bags for up to three months.
For an Asian flair, add 1-2 garlic cloves and 15 g ginger, peeled and cut into pieces when chopping peppers.
Fold 120 g frozen peas or 120 g frozen corn into the steamed rice for added flavour, increased textural contrast and balanced nutrition.
Replace 800 g water with 800 g stock or broth for a more complex flavour and make a Confetti Pilaf.
This recipe makes 8 servings. You can easily reduce the recipe to serve 4 by halving all the ingredients and cooking as per recipe.

title: Oat Milk (Metric)
ingredients: 710 g water, plus extra to soak
steps: Place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in oats. Remove simmering basket, rinse oats well under running water and transfer into a bowl. Cover oats with water, set aside and allow to soak approximately 20-60 minutes (see Tip).
Drain and rinse reserved soaked oats through simmering basket to remove any starchy residue.
Place water, drained oats and dates into mixing bowl and start Blend /1 min 30 sec.

Line simmering basket with a nut milk bag and place into a large bowl. Pour mixture into prepared simmering basket. Strain mixture through nut milk bag (squeezing to extract all liquid). Transfer to a large carafe, cover and refrigerate until ready to serve (see Tip).
tips: Oats can be soaked for several hours (even overnight), if desired. Soaking softens the oats and makes them easier to digest.
For a thicker milk, reduce water to 450 g.
Milk can be stored in the refrigerator for 4-5 days.
Shake well before drinking, as it tends to separate.
Add 1 tsp vanilla extract before blending.

title: Antonio Bachour: Red Velvet Raspberry Trifle (Metric)
ingredients: 60 g vegetable shortening, plus extra to grease
115 g butter, unsalted, diced, room temperature
115 g cream cheese, diced, room temperature
steps: Place raspberries into mixing bowl and blend 10 sec/speed 8.
Add sugar and agar-agar and cook 6 min/85°C/speed 2.5. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl. Refrigerate until set (approx. 2-4 hr.).
Preheat oven to 350°F/175°C. Lightly grease a rectangular baking pan (approx. 30 cm x 20 cm) and line with parchment.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place sugar, shortening and egg into mixing bowl and mix 5 min/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl and butterfly with spatula.
Add buttermilk, vanilla, vinegar and food coloring and mix 30 sec/speed 3.
Add flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt and mix 20 sec/speed 3. Remove butterfly whisk. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 10 sec/speed 3.

Spread batter evenly onto prepared baking sheet. Bake 18-25 minutes (350°F/175°C) or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean. Transfer to a cooling rack and let cool completely. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl and butterfly whisk.

Insert butterfly whisk. Place butter, cream cheese and icing sugar into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and mix 1 min/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 2 min/speed 3 until smooth and creamy. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer Cream Cheese Frosting into a piping bag and refrigerate until needed. Clean mixing bowl.
Place reserved set Raspberry Gel into mixing bowl and purée 1 min/speed 4.

Cut cooled Red Velvet Cake into cubes. Divide cake cubes between trifle glasses. Pipe Cream Cheese Frosting on top of cake cubes and add a spoon of Raspberry Gel over the frosting. Garnish with berries and serve.

title: Gerbeaud Cakes (Metric)
ingredients: 225 g whole walnuts, shelled  o 225 g hazelnuts, blanched
1 lemon, zest only, no white pith
225 g butter, unsalted, diced, room temperature
steps: Place walnuts, sugar and lemon zest into mixing bowl and chop 8 sec/speed 8. Add raisins and stir with spatula to combine. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place milk and yeast into mixing bowl and heat 3 min/37°C/speed 1.
Add 225 g butter, sour cream, sugar and egg yolk and mix 40 sec/speed 3.

Add flour, baking powder and salt and mix 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and knead Dough /30 sec. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and knead a further Dough /1 min.
Transfer dough to a clean work surface and divide into 3 equal pieces. Transfer to cling film, cover and shape each piece into a square. Refrigerate to chill (30 min.). Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl.

Preheat oven to 350°F/180.°C Line a square baking pan (23 cm x 23 cm) with parchment, leaving flaps to extend 2.5 cm over rim of pan. Working with 1 portion of dough at a time, roll out to fit baking pan.
Spread half the jam evenly over the dough. Spread half the reserved walnut mixture over top of jam.

Repeat with remaining ingredients, ending with a layer of dough on top. Gently press down, use a fork to prick the top of the dough to prevent from bubbling. Bake 25 minutes (350°F/180°C). Set aside and allow to cool completely before topping with chocolate. Meanwhile, make the chocolate topping.
Place chocolate into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and chop 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add 60 g butter and melt 3 min/50°C/speed 1. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and melt a further 1 min 30 sec/50°C/speed 1. Evenly spread over cooled cake and let set. Cut to serve.
tips: Recipe inspired by Dorottya Schwender Loubani Thermomix® Independent Consultant Florida.
To cut diamond shaped cakes, slice into 4 rows and cut each row into 6 triangles.

title: Chicken Fricassee (Metric)
ingredients: 140 g bacon, cured, smoked, sliced, in pieces (2.5 cm)
450 g chicken thighs, skinless, boneless, cut into pieces (5 cm)
140 - 285 g white wine, to total 450 g liquid when combined with strained broth  o 140 - 285 g chicken stock, to total 450 g liquid when combined with strained broth
15 g fresh parsley leaves, plus extra to garnish
½ tsp white pepper, ground, to taste
pasta, any type, cooked, to serve
steps: Place first bowl into position. Place onions, garlic and 15 g butter into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5.
Add bacon and fresh mushrooms and without measuring cup cook 20 min/120°C//speed 1.

Add chicken, season to taste with salt and black pepper, insert measuring cup and cook 15 min/90°C//speed . Insert simmering basket, hold simmering basket lid in place with spatula and strain broth from mixing bowl into a bowl and set aside. Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in reserved strained broth. Add enough wine or chicken stock to total 450 g liquid and set aside. Set mixing bowl with chicken aside and keep warm.
Place second bowl into position. Place dried mushrooms into mixing bowl and chop 20 sec/speed 10.
Add parsley and chop 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add 45 g butter, flour, white pepper, paprika and reserved broth, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook Thicken /100°C. Add sauce to first bowl with chicken and mushroom mixture and gently stir with spatula to combine. Transfer to a serving dish and toss with cooked pasta, garnish with parsley and serve.

title: Nectarine, Stilton and Walnut Salad with a Raspberry Vinaigrette
steps: Place a serving bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in salad leaves and cranberries. Remove bowl, add nectarines and set aside.
Place walnuts into mixing bowl and chop 1 sec/speed 6. Transfer to bowl with salad and set aside.
Place garlic into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil, vinegar, raspberry balsamic glaze, salt and pepper and blend 20 sec/speed 5. Transfer to bowl with salad and mix together gently.
Crumble Stilton over salad before serving.

title: Sticky Toffee Puddings (Metric) (TM6)
ingredients: 60 g butter, unsalted, cut into pieces
15 g clementine juice  o 1 tsp vanilla extract, natural
45 g butter, unsalted, cut into pieces
steps: Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in dates and baking soda and set aside.

Place water into mixing bowl, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and heat Kettle /100°C. Remove simmering basket and set aside. Pour hot water slowly over reserved dates; the mixture will bubble up. Set aside and allow dates to soak for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, grease 6 Thermomix® ramekins (120 ml) (see Tip), place into Varoma dish and set aside.

Place butter, brown sugar, honey, milk and clementine juice into mixing bowl, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 7 min/100°C/speed 2. Remove simmering basket and set aside. Transfer sauce to a heat-resistant bowl and cool for 10 minutes then refrigerate to thicken. Meanwhile, continue with recipe.

Place reserved dates and soaking water, butter, brown sugar, flour, baking powder and egg into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and mix 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 10 sec/speed 5. Divide evenly between prepared ramekins. Rinse mixing bowl.

Place water into mixing bowl, place Varoma dish with filled ramekins into position, secure Varoma lid and steam 30 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and set aside. Invert puddings from moulds and serve warm with reserved Sticky Toffee Sauce.
tips: If Thermomix® ramekins are unavailable, you can use any small 120 ml porcelain ramekins with similar results. You can also use small 120 ml glass mason jars (canning jars) without lids for similar results. Ensure they are heatproof, fit in the Varoma dish and allow the Varoma lid to secure
If using glass mason jars, do not place under a broiler; use a culinary torch to caramelize.

The sauce makes approximately 225 ml. To make a larger batch, double all sauce ingredients and cook with same timings. Extra sauce keeps well in a sterilized jar in the refrigerator for up to 3 months; if it separates when cold, stir before using.
Raisins can be used instead of dates.

Steam as one large pudding in a deep 20 cm/8 in. round springform pan. Line the pan base with greased parchment, proceed as per recipe and place prepared pan into Varoma dish, ensuring some holes remain unobstructed so steam can circulate (place a steaming rack or chopsticks on bottom of Varoma dish to raise pan). Steam 40-45 min/Varoma/speed 1 or until a toothpick inserted into the centre comes out clean.

title: Layered Mexican dip
ingredients: 250 g tomatoes, ripe (approx. 2-3 tomatoes), deseeded and cut into quarters
1 jalapeño pepper, trimmed and cut into halves (optional)
cilantro, fresh, leaves only, for garnishing
steps: Place tomatoes, jalapeño pepper, red onions, lime juice and salt into mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 5. Transfer into simmering basket and place over a bowl to drain. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place cashews and pine nuts into mixing bowl and grind 5 sec/speed 10.
Add lemon juice, water and salt and mix 1 min/speed 8. Transfer into a bowl, cover and refrigerate until ready to use. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place avocados, lime juice, salt and pepper into mixing bowl and mix 4 sec/speed 4. Transfer into a bowl and refrigerate until ready to use.

Place a small bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in vegan cheese and set aside. Place a large serving bowl onto mixing bowl lid, then weigh refried beans into it. Use spatula to create a smooth, even surface. Gently spread the Guacamole on top of the beans, followed by a layer of the Sour "cream". Top with iceberg lettuce, then reserved Pico de Gallo and reserved vegan cheese. Garnish with cilantro and serve with corn chips (see Tip).
tips: To make your own Vegan cheese and Refried beans, please refer to the recipes on Cookidoo®

You can store the Sour "cream" in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. You can store the dip in the refrigerator for up to 2 days (although we recommend adding the lettuce and chips just before serving).

title: Chilli-Lime Chicken with Cauliflower Rice
ingredients: ½ bunch cilantro, fresh, leaves only, plus extra to garnish
onion, to brush grill  o vegetable oil, to brush grill
steps: Place cilantro, garlic, jalapeño, and salt into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add lime juice, olive oil, agave and cumin and blend 30 sec/speed 8. Transfer half the sauce to a bowl and set aside. Transfer remaining half of the sauce to a large zip lock bag, add the chicken breasts and allow to marinate 20 minutes. Meanwhile preheat grill to 230°C/450°F or medium/high. Brush surface of grill with an onion or oiled kitchen towel.

Insert MEATER® into centre of the thickest part of one marinated chicken breast. Ensure the safety notch is fully inside the meat (parallel to surface of the grill). Open the MEATER® app and connect to MEATER®. When connected, tap "set up cook", choose poultry, select breast, and decide your preferred target cooking temperature. Tap "start cook" and place chicken breasts on preheated grill. Ensure MEATER® is away from direct heat of the flames.

Sear on direct heat for 1 minute (ea. side) then move to indirect heat. Close grill and cook, flipping once, until the MEATER® app alerts you to remove chicken from grill. Allow to rest until MEATER® app alerts you when ready, then carefully remove MEATER® and keep warm. Meanwhile make Cauliflower Rice.
Place cauliflower and reserved marinade into mixing bowl and chop 6 sec//speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and chop a further 3 sec//speed 6. Transfer to Varoma.

Place water into mixing bowl, set Varoma into position, secure Varoma lid and steam 18 min/Varoma/speed 2. Divide grilled Chilli-Lime Chicken and Cauliflower Rice between four plates. Garnish with crumbled cotija cheese, chopped cilantro and lime wedges and serve.
tips: Baste chicken breasts with marinade while grilling.
Replace cotija cheese with feta or romano.

title: Salted Herbs
ingredients: 100 g fresh parsley, leaves and tender stems (see Tip)
10 g fresh savory, in sections (3 cm/1 in.)
10 g fresh thyme, leaves and tender stems, in sections (3 cm/1 in.)
30 g fresh mixed herbs and greens, e.g. oregano, chervil, celery leaves, carrot fronds (see Tip)
150 g carrots, cut into pieces  o 150 g parsnips, cut into pieces
100 g celery stalk with leaves, cut into pieces
100 g green onions, cut into pieces (1-2 cm or ½ in.-¾ in.)  o 100 g leeks, cut into pieces (1-2 cm or ½ in.-¾ in.)
steps: Place parsley, savory, thyme, mixed herbs and greens into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a small bowl, thoroughly scraping sides of mixing bowl with spatula and set aside.

Place carrots, celery and green onion into mixing bowl and grind 5-6 sec/speed 5 until desired texture is achieved. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and if necessary grind a further 2-3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add salt and reserved chopped herbs and mix 15 sec//speed 3. Divide between 2 sterilized air-tight glass jars with glass lids (250 ml) and press with spatula to remove air. Wipe jar rims thoroughly before sealing.
Store in the refrigerator and consume within 3 months.
tips: The "traditional Acadian salted herbs" varies from the Quebecois version as it contains only brined bulbs and green stems from the onion family. The origin of salted herbs in Quebec dates back to the deportation of the Acadians in the second half of the 18th century; many Acadians settled in Quebec where salted herbs quickly became part of the culinary tradition. This ancestral method of preservation keeps the delicious aromas of fresh herbs harvested during the summer throughout the winter months and still used in modern Quebecois kitchens today.

To prepare jars, place 500 g water into mixing bowl. Place jars and lids upside down in center of the Varoma, secure Varoma lid and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Leave to drain - do not dry or touch the inside surfaces. Alternatively, clean jars and lids thoroughly in hot soapy water. Rinse by pouring boiling water over them, then put the clean jars and lids in a baking dish and heat 15 minutes in the oven (100°C / 212°F). Let cool until ready to fill.
Mixing bowl must be clean and completely dry before chopping herbs.

This recipe has a traditional salted herb flavour, however any assorted herbs and greens can be used to achieve different flavour profiles, e.g. rosemary, beet leaves, chard, radish leaves, garlic flower, etc, cut into pieces (3 cm).
Fresh herbs are required for this recipe as dried herbs will not release their flavours and aromas in the salt.
Three bunches of parsley are approximately 100 g, bottom stems trimmed.
The ratio of salt to herbs required is 1:3 which enables preservation and must not be altered.
We recommend using coarse salt, ideally from Guérande, but Kosher salt or pickling salt can be used.
Salted herbs have a fine minced texture. Store in the refrigerator as they cannot be frozen.

Use in small quantities to season and salt dishes. Salted herbs are a traditional addition to soups and add a flavourful zest to eggs, salad dressings, mashed potatoes, rice, fish and meat casseroles, etc. and are a great way to preserve garden herbs year-round.

title: Antonio Bachour: Pancakes with Mascarpone Cream and Berries (Metric)
ingredients: 3 egg whites, from large eggs, chilled
60 g butter, unsalted, melted and cooled
steps: Insert butterfly whisk. Place mascarpone, whipping cream and icing sugar into mixing bowl and whip 30 sec/speed 3.5. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer to a bowl, cover with cling film and refrigerate until needed. Thoroughly clean and dry mixing bowl and butterfly whisk.
Place a small bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in sugar and set aside.

Insert butterfly whisk. Place chilled egg whites and sugar into mixing bowl and without measuring cup, whip 1 min 30 sec/speed 4, whipping until glossy and soft peaks form. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer whipped egg whites to a large bowl and set aside.

Insert butterfly whisk. Place flour, buttermilk, whole milk, butter, egg yolks, baking powder and salt into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and whisk 30 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 10 sec/speed 4 just until batter is smooth and pale yellow. Remove butterfly whisk.

With spatula, scoop out one-third of the reserved whipped egg whites and gently fold into the batter until incorporated. Make sure to start folds from the bottom so all batter is mixed. Once incorporated, add in another third of the reserved whipped egg whites. Gently fold in to incorporate and then fold in the final third whipped egg whites until batter is very light and airy and there are no visible white streaks.

Place three perforated tart rings (8 cm.) into a large frying pan, grease the interior of the molds and the bottom of pan where the pancakes will be cooked with nonstick spray oil and heat over low heat. Ladle a small amount of batter into each mold (approx. ⅓ cup ea.), cover with lid and cook 4-5 minutes. Using tongs flip each ring mold (with pancake inside). Cover and cook another 3-4 minutes or just until set. Gently push pancakes out of molds to remove, transfer to a plate and keep warm. Repeat with remaining batter.
Place three pancakes on a plate and top with Mascarpone Cream and berries. Serve with maple syrup.

title: Super Green Juice (Metric)
ingredients: 115 g kale (e.g., dinosaur) in pieces, center rib removed
200 g apple, type Gala, cored, quartered
60 g ginger, fresh, peeled, in pieces
395 g alkaline water or 395 g spring water
steps: Place kale, apple, lemon and ginger into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add water, insert measuring cup and start Blend /1 min 30 sec. Strain juice through a fine-mesh sieve into a large carafe and serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.
tips: Shake well before drinking, as it tends to separate.

Strain pulp from juice to taste. Pulp is where the fibre is, and fibre helps to decrease sugars in the blood. For the most health benefits, add some pulp back into the juice and thin to desired consistency with water.
Pulp can be used to liven up smoothies, turn into ice cubes to flavour water or add to baked goods, reducing the need for oils or butter.

title: Boules d'amour (Coconut Snowballs) Metric
ingredients: 2 large eggs, yolks and whites separated
steps: Line a baking sheet with parchment and set aside.
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in coconut and set aside.
Place butter and brown sugar into mixing bowl and whip 20 sec/speed 3.5.
Add egg yolks and vanilla and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add flour and salt and mix 20 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 10 sec/speed 4.
Scoop cookie dough into balls (approx. 30 g). Place on prepared baking sheet and refrigerate 20 minutes. Meanwhile preheat oven to 350°F/180°C.
Lightly whisk egg whites with a fork. Dip each cookie ball into the whisked egg whites, roll them in reserved coconut and transfer to prepared baking sheet.
Bake 15-18 minutes (350°F/180°C), until golden. Cool before serving.
tips: Recipe inspired by Louise Desmarais Thermomix® Independent Consultant Québec, Canada.

title: Fruit Galettes (Paul) Metric
ingredients: 225 g all-purpose flour, plus extra to dust
1 lemon, thin peel only, no white pith
steps: Place flour and lemon peel into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10.
Add cornmeal, butter, salt and sugar and grind Turbo/2.0 sec/1 time just until crumbly and flaked with butter.

Add vodka and mix Turbo/2.0 sec/1 time, then mix a further Turbo/1.0 sec/1 time. Transfer dough to a floured surface and quickly shape into a ball. Cover in cling film and refrigerate 20 minutes. Meanwhile make the filling.

Place strawberries and sugar into mixing bowl, place Varoma dish (dish only, no lid) instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 8 min/95°C//speed . Transfer to a bowl and set aside to cool completely.
Line a baking sheet with parchment, sprinkle with cornmeal and set aside.

Divide chilled pastry into 6 equal pieces (approx. 100 g ea.). Working with 1 chilled piece at a time, place the dough onto a floured work surface, roll into a circle (15 cm), moving pastry to avoid sticking. Transfer to a separate piece of parchment and set aside. Repeat with remaining dough, stacking with parchment between layers. Refrigerate 20 minutes to chill.

Using a slotted spoon, divide reserved strawberries into centre of each pastry disk, reserving any excess juice in the bowl. Gently and tightly fold edges over filling leaving the very centre exposed, pleating the dough as you fold. Transfer to prepared baking sheet with cornmeal and refrigerate 15-20 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 400°F/200°C.

Use a wide flat spatula to gently lift chilled galettes onto stoneware pizza stone Paul. Bake 20-25 minutes (400°F/200°C) until pastry edges are golden brown. Gently transfer to a wire rack to cool. If necessary repeat baking with any remaining galettes.
Serve warm with vanilla ice cream and drizzle with reserved strawberry juice.
tips: Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.

title: Mustard-dill sauce
ingredients: 25 g Dijon mustard or other medium-hot mustard
steps: Place a jug on mixing bowl lid, weigh rapeseed oil into jug and set aside.
Place dill in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place sugar, white wine vinegar, lemon juice, Dijon mustard, sweet mustard, egg yolk, salt and black pepper in mixing bowl and mix 5 sec/speed 4.
Mix on speed 3 while very slowly pouring oil onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades to create an emulsion.
Add reserved chopped dill, mix 8 sec//speed 3 and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Serve cold.
tips: Serve this sauce with salmon (e.g. gravlax) or boiled eggs.
Instead of rapeseed oil use another neutral oil (e.g. safflower oil, sunflower oil).

title: Olive Spread
steps: Place olives and nuts into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cream cheese, mayonnaise, olive oil and black pepper and mix 20 sec/speed 3. Transfer to a serving bowl and serve as a spread or dip.

title: Saskatoon Berry Jam
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in water and set aside.
Place another bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in sugar and set aside.
Cut lemon in half, use a zester to remove the thin peel from lemon half (approx. 1 tsp), avoiding the white pith and set aside. Squeeze the juice into a bowl and set aside.
Place berries into mixing bowl, place Varoma dish (dish only, no lid) onto mixing bowl lid and cook 10 min/Varoma//speed 1 or until boiling.
Add reserved sugar and reserved water. Place Varoma dish (dish only, no lid) onto mixing bowl lid and cook 10 min/Varoma//speed 1.
Add 2 tbsp reserved lemon juice and reserved lemon zest. Place Varoma dish (dish only, no lid) onto mixing bowl lid and cook a further 10 min/Varoma//speed 1.

Use a wide mouthed canning funnel to pour into 3 hot sterilized canning jars (250 ml), leaving a 6 mm or ½ inch head space. Wipe jar rims thoroughly before sealing and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 months.
tips: Saskatoon is a Cree word for the sweet, fleshy berries that were a primary food source for Aboriginal people and early settlers on the Canadian prairies. Saskatoon berries resemble blueberries in size as well as colour but they are discernably different in flavour from one another. The Saskatoon berry has a much more intense flavour and when baked or in a jam may present an almond note. These delicious berries grow from western Ontario to British Columbia and the Yukon and are beloved by Canadians where family foraging stories are abundant during Saskatoon berry season. These have become available commercially only the past 20 years due to their diminishing availability in the wild. Saskatoon berry pies and Saskatoon berry jam have been farmhouse favourites for generations. A jar of Saskatoon berry jam is a sought after tourist purchase!

If using frozen Saskatoon berries, check thickness after 30 minute point and if necessary, place Varoma dish (dish only, no lid) onto mixing bowl lid and cook a further 5 min/Varoma//speed 1. When ready, ingredients will be thick, but still loose. As the jam cools, it will thicken considerably yet this will remain a loose jar.

To prepare jars, place 500 g water in mixing bowl. Place jars, seals and lids upside down in center of the Varoma, secure Varoma lid and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Leave to drain - do not dry or touch the inside surfaces. Alternatively, clean jars and lids thoroughly in hot soapy water. Rinse by pouring boiling water over them. Prepare for filling by placing clean jars and lids in a baking pan and heat in oven (100°C/212°F) until required.
If Saskatoon berries are unavailable replace with blueberries. Blueberries will yield 750 ml of jam due to the difference in density of the berries.
Prior to serving, add fresh lemon zest to the jam pot (fully incorporate) to enhance the berry flavour and brighten the taste experience.
Yield: there will be a scant 700 mL so two 250 mL containers and then one to use right away that will not be quite full.

title: Antonio Bachour: Crème Brûlée with Tropical Fruits (Metric)
ingredients: 170 g sugar, plus extra to sprinkle
tropical fruit (e.g. mangos, kiwi, papaya), sliced, to serve
steps: Preheat oven to 300°F/150°C. Split a vanilla bean lengthwise, scrape out seeds and place pod and seeds into mixing bowl.
Add sugar, whipping cream and egg yolks and cook 6 min/80°C/speed 3.
Strain mixture through a fine-mesh sieve. Discard solids.

Divide strained mixture between 12 ramekins (approx. 120 ml). Place in a water bath (see Tip) and bake 55-60 minutes (300°F/150°C), until centres are just set but still slightly wobbly. Remove from oven and water bath and let cool 15 minutes.
Wrap tightly with cling film and refrigerate 2 hours, up to overnight.
Sprinkle sugar over tops of the Crème Brûlée and caramelize with a culinary torch (see Tip). Allow to rest for 5 minutes. Decorate with cubed tropical fruits and serve.
tips: To prepare a water bath for baking, place filled ramekins in a large pan and add enough boiling-hot water to reach halfway up the sides of the filled ramekins.
If a culinary torch is unavailable, ensure ramekins are broiler safe and place under an oven broiler for 1 minute to caramelize, watching carefully to avoid burning.

title: Traditional Canadian Pie Pastry
ingredients: 165 - 175 g ice cold water, for a total of 237 g whisked liquid
850 g all-purpose flour, divided, plus extra to dust
454 g lard, divided, partially frozen and cubed (see Tip)
steps: Place a small bowl (approx. 250 ml) onto mixing bowl lid, tare scale to zero and weigh in 15 g vinegar, add whisked egg and weigh in enough ice cold water to total 237 g liquid (see Tip). Whisk together with a fork until combined and set aside.
Place 425 g flour, 227 g lard cubes and 1 tsp salt into mixing bowl and mix Turbo/2.0 sec/2 times.

Add 80 g reserved whisked liquid and knead Dough /15 sec. Transfer to a lightly floured work surface and gently form into a ball, add extra liquid only if necessary to obtain a crumbly but workable dough (see Tip). Using a D-shaped dough spatula, divide into 3 equal portions or discs. Wrap each disc in plastic wrap and let rest 15-30 minutes. Meanwhile, continue with second batch.
Place remaining 425 g flour, 227 g lard cubes and 1 tsp salt into mixing bowl and mix Turbo/2.0 sec/2 times.

Add 80 g reserved whisked liquid and knead Dough /15 sec. Transfer to a lightly floured work surface and gently form into a ball, add extra liquid only if necessary to obtain a crumbly but workable dough (see Tip). Using a D-shaped dough spatula, divide into 3 equal portions or discs. Wrap each disc in plastic wrap and let rest 15-30 minutes before rolling out dough and lining pie pans, or transfer individually wrapped discs to freezer bags, freeze until needed and use as described in other recipes (see Tip).
tips: This traditional Canadian pie pastry has been revered for almost 80 years in North America due to its incredible flakey quality and delicious flavour made famous by the Tenderflake® company who provided the recipe on the side of their lard boxes in 1943. Bakers throughout Canada in the early days made pastry from "leaf lard" rendered from around the kidneys and loin of the pig because it provided a rich appealing umami taste and was easily available. When provided by Tenderflake® with the recipe on the side of the box, it became the Canadian pastry baking standard and claim to fame as even to this day Americans cross the border with Tenderflake® lard on their grocery lists.
After portioning and cubing the lard, place on a parchment covered baking sheet and freeze for 30 minutes.

The amount of whisked liquid used is determined by temperature and humidity. In summer, less whisked liquid will be required per batch, whereas in winter, more whisked liquid will be required for the dough to cling together. We recommend starting with 80 g whisked liquid per batch and adding more (maximum of 120 g per batch), and only as needed to obtain a crumbly but workable dough.
Rolling pastry dough on a dough mat or parchment paper makes for easy clean up. Use a cover or sleeve on your rolling pin to avoid sticking.

Unbaked pie pastry freezes well and can be frozen for up to 6 months. Place individually wrapped pastry discs in freezer bags and freeze. Thaw in fridge the night prior to using and roll each portion on a lightly floured surface: if dough is sticky, chill until firm enough to handle. Transfer rolled pastry dough to pie plate; trim and flute shells or crusts and bake according to your pie recipe.

Traditional Canadian pie pastry is used for sweet or savory pies made from very cold lard and is famous for its crisp and flakey texture. This much sought-after quality is obtained with ice-cold lard and minimal handling as overworking will make it tough.
Replace 227 g lard with 227 g butter for a tasty alternative.

title: Five seed bread
ingredients: 30 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for greasing
2 tsp dried instant yeast or 20 g fresh yeast, crumbled
30 g sesame seeds plus extra for sprinkling
30 g flax seeds plus extra for sprinkling
30 g sunflower seeds plus extra for sprinkling
30 g pumpkin seeds plus extra for sprinkling
30 g poppy seeds plus extra for sprinkling
steps: Grease a deep-sided loaf tin and set aside. Place water and yeast into mixing bowl and heat 2 min 30 sec/37°C/speed 2.

Add bread flour, salt, rolled oats, sesame seeds, flax seeds, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, poppy seeds, honey and extra virgin olive oil into mixing bowl and knead Dough /2 min 30 sec. Dough will have a wet and sticky consistency.

Preheat oven to 200°C/400°C. Transfer dough into prepared loaf tin and sprinkle with extra sesame seeds, flax seeds, sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds and poppy seeds. Leave to prove in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 45-60 minutes).

Bake for 30-40 minutes (200°C/400°F). Allow to cool in tin for 5 minutes then transfer onto a wire rack. Serve warm or allow to cool completely before transferring into a sealable container until ready to use.
tips: Serve bread with freshly made butter and citrus marmalade for a delicious breakfast, or use to make your favourite sandwiches.

title: Mexican Black Bean Dip with Healthy Tortilla Chips
ingredients: 80 g tomatoes, deseeded, diced (1 cm/½ in.)
230 g canned black beans, rinsed, drained (drained weight)
180 g chipotle chilli salsa (or regular salsa)
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F. Place cilantro into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7, then transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in tomatoes, onions, vinegar and 10 g reserved chopped cilantro. Stir with spatula to combine and set aside.
Cut each tortilla into 8 equal triangles and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Spray triangles with oil and sprinkle with 1 tsp garlic powder and smoked paprika. Bake 10-15 minutes(180°C/350°F) or until crisp, then leave to cool on baking sheet while making dip.
Place black beans, chipotle chilli salsa, lime juice, cayenne pepper, cumin, ¼ tsp garlic powder, remaining chopped cilantro, salt and pepper into mixing bowl and mix 3 sec/speed 5.
Transfer dip to a serving bowl, top with tomato-onion mixture and sour cream (if using). Serve immediately with cooled tortilla chips.

title: Tuna dip
ingredients: flat-leaf parsley, leaves only, to taste
1 spring onion, trimmed, cut into pieces
1 pinch black pepper, ground, to taste
250 g cream cheese, cut into pieces
180 g tuna, canned in brine or water, drained
steps: Place parsley, walnuts, spring onion, salt and ground black pepper into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add mayonnaise and cream cheese and mix 12 sec/speed 4.5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add tuna and mix 15 sec/speed 5. Serve immediately.
tips: Serve with crackers and vegetable crudités of choice.
Search Cookidoo® for our Bistro Mayonnaise and make it fresh with Thermomix®.
If dip is not served immediately, transfer into a sealable container and refrigerate until ready to use.

title: Hazelnut Milk (Metric)
steps: Place hazelnuts and 300 g water into mixing bowl, place simmering basket and cook 10 min/100°C/speed 1. Remove mixing bowl. Remove simmering basket and set aside, open mixing bowl lid and allow to cool (approx. 10 min.).
Set mixing bowl back into position, add 700 g water and vanilla, insert measuring cup and start Blend /1 min.

Line simmering basket with a nut milk bag and place into a large bowl. Pour mixture into prepared simmering basket. Strain mixture through nut milk bag (squeezing to extract all liquid). Transfer to a glass bottle, cover and refrigerate until ready to serve (see Tip). Store milk in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Serve cold.
tips: Shake well before drinking, as it tends to separate.

Blanch hazelnuts to easily remove skins. Place 680 g water into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and heat 100°C. Add 1 tbsp baking soda and 60-155 g hazelnuts and mix 3 min/speed 2. Drain through simmering basket and place into a bowl of ice cold water. Rub the hazelnuts to remove loose skins and continue with recipe. If using in another recipe, transfer to a paper towel and let dry completely.

title: Hemp Milk (Metric)
steps: Place hemp seeds, dates (optional) and water into mixing bowl and start Blend /1 min.

Line simmering basket with a nut milk bag and place into a large bowl. Pour mixture into prepared simmering basket. Strain mixture through nut milk bag (squeezing to extract all liquid). Transfer to a large carafe, cover and refrigerate until ready to serve (see Tip).
tips: Small and crunchy, hemp seeds are derived from the hemp plant. They contain all the amino acids (proteins) essential for the body and also are high in omega-3 and omega-6. Whole hemp seeds contain high amounts of fiber (both soluble and insoluble) which benefits digestive health. These seeds have been known to reduce joint pain, improving gut health and reducing sugar cravings. You can find them at some major supermarkets, health food stores and online.
Store Hemp Milk in the refrigerator for up to 2-3 days.
Shake well before drinking, as it tends to separate.
Add 1 tsp vanilla extract before blending.

title: Antonio Bachour: Lemon Basil Tarts (Metric)
ingredients: 1 egg yolk, from a large egg
1 ½ sheets gelatin, silver grade (approx. 3.5 g)
1 lemon, zest only, no white pith
140 g lemon juice, from 2 large lemons
8 - 10 fresh basil leaves, plus extra to decorate
450 g berries, mixed, fresh, to decorate
steps: Place all purpose flour, icing sugar, almond flour and salt into mixing bowl and mix 25 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix 5 sec/speed 8.

Add butter, egg, egg yolk and ice water and mix 1 min/speed 4. Transfer pastry to a clean surface and shape into a disk. Divide pastry in half, wrap in cling film and refrigerate 1 hour. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl. Line a baking sheet with parchment and set aside.

On a lightly floured surface, roll out one half of the chilled pastry dough to 3 mm thickness. Line 12 perforated tart rings (8 cm) by pressing ring molds into rolled out pastry to create the bottom. Transfer to prepared baking sheet. Roll out remaining chilled pastry and cut into thin strips slightly larger than the height of the rings (approx. 2-3 cm wide). Line the inside walls of tart rings with pastry strips, trimming as needed. Gently press the bottom dough and wall strips together with your finger to seal. With a small paring knife, trim off any dough that is above the tart rings. Use a fork to prick holes in the pastry and refrigerate (approx. 30 min.). Meanwhile, preheat oven to 325°F/160°C.

Line chilled pastry shells with parchment and baking weights (e.g. dried beans) and blind-bake 13 minutes (325°F/160°C). Remove parchment and weights and bake a further 2-5 minutes (325°F/160°C) until lightly golden. Set aside to cool. Meanwhile make cake batter.

Place flour, eggs, olive oil, sugar, milk and baking powder into mixing bowl and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Fill baked tart shells ⅓ of the way and bake 12-15 minutes (325°F/160°F). Set aside to cool. Meanwhile clean mixing bowl and make lemon basil cream.
