Place gelatin sheets in a small bowl, cover in ice water and let soak until softened (5-10 min.). Remove soaked gelatin and gently squeeze out water. Discard water, return gelatin to the small bowl and set aside.
Place eggs, sugar, butter, lemon zest, lemon juice, and basil leaves into mixing bowl and cook 5 min/85°C//speed 4.

Add the drained gelatin, stir through with spatula until fully dissolved. Quickly strain the cream (optional) through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl. Cover with cling film, touching the surface and refrigerate.
Transfer Lemon Basil Cream into a pastry bag with tip and pipe onto top of tarts. Refrigerate 1 hour.
Decorate with fresh berries and fresh basil leaves before serving.
tips: Use a ring mold (13 cm) to cut circles from rolled pastry and place into perforated tart ring molds (8 cm). Gently press the pastry up the sides to line the molds. Roll a rolling pin over the top of the rings to remove excess pastry from above the tart rings. Run a small sharp knife around the top edge between the pastry and the ring edge, providing easy removal from tart ring once baked.

title: Healthy Gut Zinger (Metric)
ingredients: 100 g celery, cut into pieces (approx. 3 stalks)
170 g apple, type Gala, cored, quartered (approx. 1)
30 g ginger, fresh, peeled, in pieces
225 g alkaline water or 225 g spring water
steps: Place grapefruit, lemon, celery, radishes, apple and ginger into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add water and start Blend /1 min 30 sec. Strain juice through a fine-mesh sieve into a pitcher and serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.
tips: Shake well before drinking, as it tends to separate.

Strain pulp from juice to taste. Pulp is where the fibre is, and fibre helps to decrease sugars in the blood. For the most health benefits, add some pulp back into the juice and thin to desired consistency with water.
Pulp can be used to liven up smoothies, turn into ice cubes to flavour water or add to baked goods, reducing the need for oils or butter.

title: Candy Cane Cookies (Metric)
ingredients: 315 g all purpose white flour, plus extra to dust
2 - 3 drops food colouring, red, to desired colour
steps: Line 2 baking sheets with parchment and set aside.
Place butter and icing sugar into mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add egg, vanilla extract, almond extract, flour and salt and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and knead Dough /1 min.

Transfer half the dough to a floured work surface, wrap in cling film and refrigerate. Add 2-3 drops red food colouring to remaining dough in mixing bowl and knead Dough /1 min until colour is evenly blended. Repeat if necessary until desired colour is achieved. Wrap tinted dough in cling film and refrigerate 30 minutes.

Divide each chilled dough colour into 30 small balls of equal size (approx. 15 g ea.). On a lightly floured work surface, roll balls into ropes approximately 7 cm long (see Tip) and transfer to a prepared baking sheets.

Lay 1 red and 1 white dough rope side by side and twist the 2 ropes together. Using the palms of your hands, roll them into ropes (approx. 15 cm) so that the two colours adhere together. Create a curve at one end for the top of the candy cane and repeat with remaining dough ropes. Refrigerate until well chilled (approx. 20 min.). Meanwhile, preheat oven to 350°F/180°C.
Bake 8-10 minutes (350°F/180°C), or until edges are lightly browned. Allow to cool 10 minutes on baking sheets before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely before serving.
tips: Recipe inspired by Kristianne Hannemann Thermomix® Independent Consultant California.
If the red dough is too soft to roll into ropes: on a floured work surface, knead in 1 tbsp all purpose white flour and proceed to roll into ropes.
If at any time the dough becomes too soft, wrap in cling film and refrigerate 10-20 minutes to chill for easier handling.
Store cookies between layers of parchment paper in an airtight container for approximately 2 weeks.

title: Canestrelli (Italian Egg Yolk Cookies) Metric
ingredients: 100 g butter, unsalted, diced, room temperature
steps: Split ½ vanilla pod lengthwise and scrape out seeds. Place sugar, vanilla seeds and pod into mixing bowl and grind 20 sec/speed 10.
Add butter and mix 30 sec/speed 3.5
Add flour, potato starch, baking powder and salt and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add cooked egg yolks (see Tip) and knead Dough /2 min. Transfer dough to cling film, shape into a square and refrigerate 30 minutes. Meanwhile preheat oven to 350°F/180°C and line 2 baking sheets with parchment.

Roll dough to 6 mm thickness. Cut out shapes with a flower shaped cookie cutter. Then use the large end of a round piping tip to remove a piece from the centre of the flowers. Place on prepared baking sheets. Reroll scraps and repeat with remaining dough.
Bake 12-15 minutes (350°F/180°C), until cooked through but still blonde. Let cool completely.
Dust tops of cookies with icing sugar before serving.
tips: Recipe inspired by Enrica Ulivieri Thermomix® Independent Consultant California.
Use the TM6™ Egg Boiler mode to hard boil the eggs. Allow yolks to cool before using.

title: Biscuits aux fruits confits (Candied Fruit Cookies) Metric
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F/180°C. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment and set aside.
Place pecans into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place sugar, butter, milk, egg and vanilla into mixing bowl and mix 20 sec/speed 3.
Add flour, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda and salt and mix 20 sec/speed 3.
Add candied fruits, raisins and reserved chopped pecans and mix 10 sec//speed 2.

Shape dough into balls (approx. 30 g), place on prepared baking sheets, 5 cm apart and flatten slightly. Bake 12-15 minutes (350°F/180°C), or until golden brown. Let cookies cool completely before glazing.

Place chocolate into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and melt 3 min/50°C/speed 2. Transfer to a bowl, then dip one end of each cookie into melted chocolate. Transfer to a cooling rack and decorate with sprinkles. Let chocolate set before serving.
tips: Recipe inspired by Luce Parent Thermomix® Independent Consultant Montréal, Québec.

title: Salted caramel ice cream
ingredients: 250 g white sugar  o 250 g brown sugar
30 g butter, unsalted, cold and as much as possible in one piece (approx. 60 mm x 40 mm x 10 mm)
steps: To guarantee the success of recipes using Sugar Stage modes, the ingredients used must match exactly the quantity and description given. The recipe should also be cooked immediately after placing the sugar in the mixing bowl.
Place sugar, 70 g cream, 30 g water, lemon juice and butter in mixing bowl. Place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and start Sugar Stages .
Add remaining 130 g cream and salt, then mix without measuring cup 2 min/speed . Without measuring cup, cook 3 min/Varoma/speed 2. Pour into an air-tight jar and set aside.
Place 1000 g water and vinegar and start Pre-clean . Empty and dry mixing bowl.

Split vanilla pod lengthwise and scrape out seeds. Place vanilla seeds, whole milk, cream, sugar, egg yolks and 100 g salted caramel sauce in mixing bowl and cook 12 min/90°C/speed 2.5. Store remaining salted caramel sauce in refrigerator.
Pour mixture up to 4 cm high into shallow freezable containers (e.g. aluminium, silicone) and cover with cling film. Allow mixture to cool completely before freezing for at least 10 hours.

Place frozen mixture in refrigerator for 15 minutes, then cut in pieces (4 cm x 4 cm) using a long sharp knife. Place half the pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a loaf tin (1.5 l).
Drizzle 2 tbsp salted caramel sauce over ice cream and set aside.
Place remaining frozen cream pieces in mixing bowl and crush 20 sec/speed 6, then mix 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer to loaf tin with ice cream.

Drizzle 2 more tbsp salted caramel sauce over ice cream and use a knife to swirl the sauce into the ice cream. Cover the surface of the ice cream with cling film and place in the freezer for 2 hours before serving. Serve with remaining salted caramel sauce.
tips: To succeed with this recipe, the 30 g butter needs to be added as much as possible in one piece. Cut one chunk of approx. 60 mm x 40 mm x 10 mm and add some more if necessary.
Adding lemon juice prevents the sugar from burning or crystallising, without affecting the flavour.

title: Tex-Mex tortillas with shredded pork and black beans
ingredients: 600 g pork meat piece, sinew free, boneless, cut in cubes (6 cm x 4 cm)
200 g ripe tomatoes, cut in pieces
20 - 30 g jalapeño chilli, canned  o 1 - 2 fresh chillies, deseeded, cut in slices
120 g red pepper, cut in pieces (2 cm)
120 g green pepper, cut in pieces (2 cm)
250 g whole black beans, canned, drained
½ tsp chicken stock paste, homemade  o ½ chicken stock cube (for 0.5 l)
steps: Place 20 g olive oil, 300 g pork, ¼ tsp salt and 1 pinch ground pepper in mixing bowl. Place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and brown High Temp. .Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place remaining 20 g olive oil, remaining 300 g pork, ¼ tsp salt and 1 pinch ground pepper in mixing bowl. Place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and brown High Temp. . Transfer to the bowl with reserved browned pork and set aside.
Place 20 g of the meat juices, onions, tomatoes, jalapeno chilli, red and green pepper in mixing bowl. Place splash guard on top of mixing bowl lid and sauté High Temp. .
Add reserved browned pork, 50 g drained black beans, tomato purée, water and chicken stock paste and cook 20 min/110°C//speed 1.
Cook further 10 min/105°C//speed 1, then shred 4 sec//speed 4.

Add 200 g remaining drained black beans, mix gently using spatula and cook 2 min/100°C//speed . Meanwhile, peel avocados and cut them in slices. Serve shredded pork and black beans with corn tortillas garnished with sour cream, avocado, coriander leaves and lime wedges on the side for squeezing over.

title: Chopped vegetable salad
ingredients: 500 g mixed vegetables and fruit (e.g. 50 g celeriac, 100 g beetroot, 250 g carrots, 100 g apple), cut in pieces as needed
20 g vinegar  o 20 g lemon juice
1 tsp salt  o 1 tsp herb salt
½ tsp sugar (opcional)  o ½ tsp honey (opcional)
steps: Place mixed vegetables and fruit, oil, vinegar, salt, black pepper and sugar in mixing bowl. Chop with aid of spatula 5 sec/speed 5 and serve.
tips: Chopping time depends on the consistency of the vegetables and fruit you have chosen (soft vegetables need a shorter chopping time). If you prefer a chunkier salad, chop at speed 4.5.
Prepare your own herb salt with Thermomix®.
Serve on endive leaves or a bed of lettuce or combine with lettuce leaves.
Choose your preferred oil (e.g. extra virgin olive oil, nut oils, grapeseed oil) and vinegar (e.g. balsamic vinegar, cider vinegar, fruit-flavoured vinegars).

Create your own salads by using vegetables and/or fruit that you have at home or that are in season (e.g. cabbage, turnips, carrots, cauliflower, broccoli, peppers, courgettes, apples, pears, peaches).
Mixing different vegetables or adding fruit is not required. You can make this salad with a single vegetable. For example use this recipe to make carrot salad.
For added flavour and texture, add fresh herbs, 50 g nuts (e.g. hazelnuts, walnuts, almonds, cashews) or 20 g seeds (e.g. sunflower, pumpkin).

title: Naan Bread with Hummus (Hestan Cue™) Metric
ingredients: 60 g butter, unsalted, room temperature, in pieces
625 g all purpose white flour, plus extra to dust
45 g extra virgin olive oil, divided
¼ tsp kosher salt, Diamond Crystal®
10 tbsp extra virgin olive oil, as needed to fry
steps: Grease a large bowl and set aside. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment and set aside.
Place butter, water and yeast into mixing bowl and heat 3 min/37°C/speed 1.
Add milk, egg, flour and salt and mix 15 sec/speed 5. Knead Dough /3 min.

Transfer dough to a lightly floured surface and knead by hand until round and smooth (approx. 4-5 min.). Place in prepared bowl, cover with cling film and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 60 min.).
Place sesame seeds and garlic into mixing bowl and grind 20 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add chickpeas, water, lemon juice, 30 g olive oil and salt and blend 20 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl, drizzle with 15 g olive oil, sprinkle with paprika and refrigerate until ready to serve.
Continue the recipe in the HESTAN CUE™ app, search "USA & Canada" to form the breads and cook the Naan Bread in the Hestan Cue™ frying pan.
Serve warm Naan Bread with reserved Hummus.
tips: Search "Thermomix" in the Hestan Cue™ app to access all Thermomix® and Hestan Cue™ Smart cooking recipes.

title: Hollandaise sauce
ingredients: 250 g butter, unsalted, cut in pieces
steps: Place butter in mixing bowl and melt 4 min/70°C/speed 2. Transfer to a jug and set aside.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place water, lemon juice, egg yolks, salt and pepper in mixing bowl and heat 2 min/70°C/speed 4.

Mix 4-5 min/70°C/speed 4 while very slowly pouring melted butter onto mixing bowl lid, letting it drizzle around measuring cup in a thin stream onto rotating blades to create an emulsion. Remove butterfly whisk and serve immediately.
tips: If the sauce seems too thin, emulsify for slightly longer in step 3.
If the sauce becomes too thick, add 2 tbsp water and mix 30 sec/70°C/speed 2 before serving.
Serve with steamed asparagus, small potatoes, vegetables or fish. Steam the dish first, then prepare the hollandaise sauce and serve warm.
Hollandaise sauce is best served freshly made. Leftovers can be gently warmed in Thermomix® at 70°C before serving.
Maltese sauce: replace lemon juice with orange juice.

title: Immune Boost (Metric)
ingredients: 85 g red beets, raw, peeled, cut into pieces
85 g cucumber, peeled and deseeded, cut into pieces
340 g alkaline water or 340 g spring water
steps: Place spirulina, beets, cucumber, spinach, lemon juice and water into mixing bowl and start Blend /2 min.
Strain juice through a fine-mesh sieve into a large carafe and serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.
tips: Strain pulp from juice to taste. Pulp is where the fibre is, and fibre helps to decrease sugars in the blood. For the most health benefits, add some pulp back into the juice and thin to desired consistency with water.
Pulp can be used to liven up smoothies, turn into ice cubes to flavour water or add to baked goods, reducing the need for oils or butter.

title: Brioche Creamed Corn (Metric)
ingredients: 85 g Asiago cheese, aged, in pieces
85 g brioche bread crust removed, cubed (5 cm)
extra virgin olive oil, to drizzle
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F/205°C. Line a baking sheet with a silicone mat and set aside.

Place Asiago cheese into mixing bowl and grate 4 sec/speed 8. Create a 20 cm circle of prepared cheese directly on the silicone mat and bake 15-17 minutes (400°F/205°C) or until golden and crisp. Set cheese crisp aside to cool.
Place bread into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place nutmeg into mixing bowl and grind 1 min/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place ginger into mixing bowl and chop 8 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onions and 30 g butter into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 30 min/100°C/speed 1. Transfer cooked onions to a bowl and set aside.
Place 60 g butter into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and heat 4 min/85°C/speed 1.
Add reserved ginger, reserved cooked onions, corn, whipping cream and salt and without measuring cup cook 20 min/85°C//speed 1. Meanwhile break cooled Asiago crisp into 6 pieces and set aside.

Add reserved brioche crumbs to mixing bowl, gently combine with spatula and adjust seasoning to taste. Transfer Brioche Creamed Corn to serving plates, garnish with cheese crisps, drizzle with olive oil and 1 pinch nutmeg. Serve warm.
tips: Search Cookidoo® for recipes to make your own brioche.
Replace nutmeg with ½ tsp ground mace.

title: White Pesto Pasta (Metric)
ingredients: 1 lemon, thin peel only, no white pith
115 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces
115 g ricotta cheese  o 115 g goat's cheese
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F. Place halved walnuts on a baking sheet and dry roast for 8 minutes. Set aside to cool.
Place first bowl into position. Place lemon peels, Parmesan cheese and oregano into mixing bowl and grate 20 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place ricotta, reserved dry roasted walnuts and ¾ of the reserved chopped lemon and cheese mixture into mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 5. Set first mixing bowl aside.
Place second bowl into position. Place water into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and boil Kettle /100°C.

Add penne and salt, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook for time indicated on package/100°C//speed . Reserve approx. 45 g cooking water in a small bowl and set aside. Drain penne and transfer to a large bowl.

Place first bowl with ricotta mixture into position. Insert butterfly whisk, add olive oil and reserved cooking water into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and whisk 15 sec/speed 3.5. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer sauce to bowl with cooked penne, season with salt and pepper to taste and toss well. Garnish with remaining lemon and cheese mixture and serve.

title: Baked Fish with Shrimp, Vegetables and Basmati Rice (Ben) Metric
ingredients: 6 - 8 cod fillets (2.54 cm/1-in. thick, approx. 995 g)
1 - 2 pinches black pepper, freshly ground, to taste
395 g shrimp, raw, peeled, deveined  o 395 g mussels, fresh, cleaned
2 mixed bell peppers, green and red, deseeded, julienned
1 tsp black pepper, freshly ground, to taste
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F. Season each fish fillet with salt and pepper to taste and set aside.
Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in spinach and shrimp. Transfer reserved seasoned fish, spinach and shrimp to a stoneware baking dish Ben.

Place whipping cream, goat cheese, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper and vegetable stock paste into mixing bowl and start Blend /30 sec. Pour over fish and spinach in baking dish Ben. Add peppers and bake 30 minutes (180°C/350°F). Meanwhile, continue with the recipe.
Place water and a few drops dish soap into mixing bowl and start Pre-clean /Quick. Empty and rinse mixing bowl.

Place rice, salt, pepper, olive oil, water and chicken stock paste into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook Rice Cooker . Transfer to a bowl and serve with baked fish and shrimp.
tips: Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.

title: Cocoa Nib Chocolate Milk (Metric)
steps: Place cocoa nibs into mixing bowl and grind, Blend /45 sec. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and heat 4 min 30 sec/60°C/speed 1.

Add honey, vanilla and soy milk and mix 10 sec/speed 7. Line simmering basket with a nut milk bag and place into a large bowl. Pour mixture into prepared simmering basket. Strain mixture through a nut milk bag (squeezing to extract all liquid). Transfer to a large carafe, cover and refrigerate until ready to serve (see Tip). Store milk in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Serve cold.
tips: Shake well before drinking, as it tends to separate.

title: Flourless Chocolate and Nut Torte (gluten free)
ingredients: 200 g dark chocolate, small pieces or callets
200 g unsalted butter, diced, plus extra for greasing
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F.

Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in almonds and hazelnuts. Tip out onto a baking sheet and toast for 8 minutes (180°C/350°F), turning occasionally. Meanwhile, grease sides and line base of a cake pan (23-24 cm/9 in.)| with parchment paper. Set nuts aside and allow to cool.
Place chocolate into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 6. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place 120 g cooled, toasted nuts into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 6. Transfer to another bowl.
Place remaining cooled, toasted nuts into mixing bowl and grind 8 sec/speed 10. Transfer to bowl with chopped nuts and set aside.
Place butter and 75 g reserved chopped chocolate into mixing bowl and melt 4 min/50°C/speed 1. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add sugar, eggs and vanilla extract and mix 20 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add reserved chopped and ground nuts and mix 20 sec/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add remaining 125 g chopped chocolate and stir in with spatula. Transfer to prepared pan and bake for 40-50 minutes (180°C/350°F) until just firm to the touch.
Allow to cool in pan before removing. Serve, dusted with icing sugar.
tips: The absence of flour may make this suitable for those on a gluten free diet, but we defy anyone to turn down a slice of this torte! It’s rich, smooth and nutty making this a wonderfully decadent dessert.
Serve with cream or crème fraîche and fresh berries if desired.

title: Low Carb Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: 1 orange, plus extra, sliced, to garnish
140 - 155 g monk fruit sweetener, white, 1:1 sugar substitute, to taste
steps: With a vegetable peeler, thinly peel zest from 1 orange, avoiding the white pith and place peels into mixing bowl.
Add monk fruit sweetener and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cranberries, water and cinnamon stick, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 20 min/100°C//speed 1.
Remove cinnamon stick and transfer Low Carb Cranberry Sauce to a serving bowl. Let cool to room temperature, cover and refrigerate. Garnish with an orange slice and serve chilled.
tips: Ceylon cinnamon should not be used due to its soft texture.
Replace fresh cranberries with frozen cranberries, thawed.

title: Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: 1 orange, thin peelings of skin and 50-60 g juice
300 g fresh cranberries  o frozen cranberries
160 - 170 g water, to make up 220 g total liquid
steps: Place orange peel and 20 g sugar in mixing bowl then grind 15 sec/speed 9. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cranberries, orange juice and water to make up 220 g total liquid. Place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and heat 10 min/100°C//speed .

Add port and remaining 100 g sugar. Place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and heat 8 min/100°C//speed . Transfer to warm glass jars with airtight lids (see Tip), leaving approx. 5 mm gap at the top. Make sure rims of jars are clean then close immediately, label and leave to cool (see Tip) and refrigerate until needed.
tips: A spoonful of Cranberry Sauce is the perfect finishing touch for roast turkey and all the trimmings. Our version, made with orange zest and port for even more festive flavour, can be made ahead of time and frozen until needed to make things easier on Christmas Day.

To prepare jars, thoroughly wash jars and lids in hot, soapy water. Rinse by pouring over boiling water. Prepare for filling, if needed, by placing on a clean tea towel in a roasting tin and heating in the oven at 100˚C/212°F until required.
The sauce will thicken as it cools.
Make the sauce up to 1 week ahead and store in the refrigerator. Stir well before serving.
Make and freeze for up to 2 months. Defrost overnight at room temperature. Stir well before serving.

title: Low Carb Cauliflower Stuffing
ingredients: 85 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces
225 g dried white bread cubes, Keto bread
340 g cauliflower, cut into small florets
170 g chicken sausage, cooked, halved, diced
170 g rainbow chard, leaves and tender stems cut into strips (5 cm/2 in.)
115 g unsalted butter, cut into pieces
225 g onions, cut into pieces (2.5 cm/1 in.)
115 g carrots, cut into pieces (2.5 cm/1 in.)
115 g celery, cut into pieces (2.5 cm/1 in.)
steps: Place Parmesan cheese, basil, sage and rosemary into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a small bowl and set aside.
Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in dried bread cubes and set aside.
Place Varoma dish into position, weigh in cauliflower, sausage and mushrooms and set aside.
Place chard into mixing bowl and shred 2 sec/speed 5. Transfer to Varoma dish with reserved cauliflower mixture.

Place butter, onions, carrots, celery, garlic, parsley, thyme, and salt into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 5 min/100°C//speed 1. Pour over reserved vegetables in Varoma and set aside.
Place chicken stock into mixing bowl. Place Varoma with reserved vegetables into position, secure Varoma lid and steam 20 min/Varoma//speed 1. Meanwhile preheat oven to 200°C/400°F.

Transfer steamed vegetables to large bowl with bread cubes. Sprinkle half the reserved grated cheese and slowly drizzle 115-170 g reserved hot chicken stock to moisten the dried bread cubes and toss to combine.
Transfer stuffing to an ovenproof baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining reserved grated cheese and bake 20-25 minutes (200°C/400°F), until browned. Serve hot.
tips: Any remaining stock after steaming the vegetables can be cooled, stored in an airtight container and refrigerated for another use.
Search Cookidoo® for the Chicken Stock recipe in our O Canada and TM Basics - Stocks and Pastes collections.

title: Smoked Salmon Lemon Pasta Second Bowl
ingredients: 1 - 2 fresh chillies, to taste, and deseeded, if preferred
2 pinches salt, plus extra to season, to taste
2 pinches ground black pepper, plus extra to season, to taste
4 pieces lemon peel, thin peel only, no white pith (5 x 1½ cm/2 x ½ in. ea.)
85 g extra virgin olive oil, divided
60 g lemon juice, to taste (1-2 lemons)
450 g dried pasta, e.g. spaghetti, linguine, fusilli
155 g salmon, smoked hot, flaked (see Tip)
ground black pepper, to season, to taste
3 - 4 sprigs flat-leaf parsley, leaves only, roughly chopped
steps: Place first bowl into position. Place garlic, chilli, salt, pepper and lemon peel into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and chop 10 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. If necessary, chop a further 10 sec/speed 7 or until a fine consistency is achieved.
Add 60 g olive oil, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and sauté 3 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Add lemon juice and capers and without measuring cup, heat 1 min/90°C//speed 1. Set mixing bowl with lemon garlic sauce aside and keep warm.
Place second mixing bowl into position. Place water and 30 g oil into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and heat 8 min/100°C/speed 1. Carefully remove simmering basket.

Add pasta, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook for time indicated on package/100°C//speed 1 or until al dente. Drain pasta through simmering basket and transfer to a large serving bowl.

Place serving bowl with cooked pasta onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in smoked salmon. Remove serving bowl from mixing bowl lid, add reserved lemon sauce to pasta, season with salt and pepper and gently toss to combine. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.
tips: If hot smoked salmon is unavailable, use any cooked fish and toss to combine with reserved pasta at the end.
If a second bowl is unavailable, transfer sauce to a small bowl, set aside and keep warm. Then, thoroughly clean and dry mixing bowl and continue with recipe.
Replace salmon with hot smoked trout, if desired. You can find hot smoked fish fillets in the seafood section or the refrigerated food section of most major supermarkets.

title: Mushroom Stock Paste
ingredients: 30 g porcini mushrooms, dried  o 30 g dried wild mushrooms
280 g yellow onions (approx. 2 onions), cut into pieces
260 g carrots (approx. 2 carrots), cut into pieces
250 g fresh mushrooms, cut into slices
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh dried porcini mushrooms and water into it. Set aside to soak for 20 minutes.
Place oil, onions, carrots and fresh mushrooms into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5, then place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 5 min/100°C/speed 2.
Add vinegar, dried shiitake mushrooms, salt and reserved porcini mushrooms with soaking liquid (see Tips) and cook 60 min/95°C/speed 2.
Add thyme and cook 5 min/95°C/speed 2, then blend 10 sec/speed 4.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and blend 10 sec/speed 6. Use as needed or transfer into a sealable container and store in refrigerator or freezer (see Tip).
tips: You can store this stock paste in the refrigerator for up to 4 days or in the freezer for up to 6 months (freeze using ice cube trays to portion the paste).
This recipe does not contain as much salt (acting as a preservative) as the Vegetable Stock Paste recipe in The Basic Cookbook, so it has a shorter shelf life.
Make sure you discard the last tablespoon of the porcini mushroom soaking liquid as this may contain any sediment from soaking.

title: Confit garlic
ingredients: 140 g garlic cloves, peeled (approx. 3 large heads)
steps: Place olive oil, garlic, black peppercorns and bay leaf into mixing bowl, evenly distribute in mixing bowl with spatula and start High Temp. . Remove mixing bowl, open mixing bowl lid and allow mixture to cool in mixing bowl until temperature reaches 100°C (set mixing bowl into position to check temperature).
Once cooled use as needed or store Confit Garlic with oil in the refrigerator in a sterilized jar with airtight lid for 2-3 weeks.
tips: Confit Garlic can be frozen in ice cube trays for up to 3 months.

To ensure preservation: clean jar and lid thoroughly in hot soapy water. Rinse by pouring boiling water over them. Prepare for filling by placing clean jar and lid in a baking pan and heat in oven (100°C/212°F) until required.
Use garlic peels in recipes. Search Cookidoo® for Onion skin Broth in our Earth Day No Waste, sustainability collection.
Adding herbs will give Confit garlic a wonderful aroma.

title: Steamed Chocolate Lava Cakes (Metric) (TM6, TM5)
ingredients: 1 egg yolk, from a large egg
icing sugar, to serve  o whipped cream, to serve
steps: Place chocolate chips into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and heat 2 min/50°C/speed 2.
Add heavy cream and heat 2 min/70°C/speed 2. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix 10 sec/speed 3. Transfer to a bowl and refrigerate until set (approx. 1 hr.).
Scoop reserved ganache into 6 balls (approx. 1 tbsp/15 g) and refrigerate to keep firm, or until needed (see Tip).
Grease 6 Thermomix® ramekins (120 ml) and set aside (see Tip).
Place sugar, oil, yoghurt, egg, egg yolk, and vanilla into mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 4.

Add flour, cocoa powder, espresso powder, baking soda and salt and mix 5 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 5 sec/speed 4. Divide batter evenly between prepared ramekins. Gently push 1 chilled ganache ball into each ramekin, just until fully covered by cake batter, place into Varoma dish and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Place water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma dish with filled ramekins into position, secure Varoma lid and steam 30 min/Varoma/speed 1. Garnish with raspberries, sprinkle with icing sugar and serve warm.
tips: If Thermomix® ramekins are unavailable, you can use any small 120 ml porcelain ramekins with similar results. You can also use small 120 ml glass mason jars (canning jars) without lids for similar results. Ensure they are heatproof, fit in the Varoma dish and allow the Varoma lid to secure
If using glass mason jars, do not place under a broiler; use a culinary torch to caramelize.

Ganache can be made up to a week ahead. Freeze ganache balls and store in a freezer safe zip lock bag. Thaw overnight in refrigerator before using. The cakes can also be made up to a week ahead. Mix the batter, pour into ramekins, tightly wrap with cling film and freeze. Let sit at room temperature for about an hour (or until thawed) before adding a ball of chilled ganache and steaming as per recipe.

title: Inverted Sugar Syrup
steps: Place sugar and water into mixing bowl and heat 14 min/100°C/speed 2.
Add citric acid and without measuring cup cook 5 min/115°C/speed 1.
Carefully pour mixture into heat-proof jar and let cool completely in the refrigerator (approx. 4 hrs.), (see Tip). Use as desired to retain moisture in baked goods and improve ice cream texture.
tips: Inverted sugar gives more a uniform sweetness and softer, smoother product texture (related to less sugar crystallization). Inverted sugar can be used in combination with other sweeteners to sweeten a variety of common foods, such as: ice cream, sorbet, gelato, jellies, fudge, ganache, taffy, soft-baked cookies, cakes, frozen cocktails and other iced beverages.
To cool quicker, divide the hot mixture in 2 or 3 heat proof containers.
Store inverted sugar in the refrigerator in an airtight container and consume within 6 months.

title: Avocado Tikka (Matthew Kenney) Metric
ingredients: 425 g potatoes, peeled and cubed (5 cm)
450 g extra virgin olive oil, to fry (2 tbsp per batch)
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in cashews, cover with water and soak for at least 4 hours to overnight. Then, drain and rinse soaked nuts through a fine-mesh sieve and discard soaking water.
Place curry leaves, oil and salt into mixing bowl and heat 6 min/85°C/speed 1. Strain through a coffee filter into a bowl and set aside. Discard solids.

Place reserved drained cashews, 140 g filtered water, cider vinegar, agave, 60 g reserved Curry Leaf Oil and salt and start Blend /40 sec. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and start again Blend /40 sec until very smooth. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.
Place olive oil and curry powder into mixing bowl, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 7 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add cider vinegar and salt, insert measuring cup and mix 1 min/speed 3. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.

Place water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma dish into position and weigh in potatoes. Top with dill and curry leaves, secure Varoma lid and steam 25 min/Varoma/speed 3. Remove Varoma. Empty mixing bowl. Discard dill and curry leaves.
Place steamed potatoes into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and mix 6 sec/speed 7.

Add flour and with aid of spatula, mix 30 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a work surface (dough will be crumbly) and form into 16 balls (approx. 60 g ea.). Use a rolling pin to roll balls into circles (20 cm ea.).
Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a large frying pan over med-high heat. Once pan is hot, add 1 potato bread and fry until golden (2-3 min. per side), drain on paper towels and repeat with remaining breads.

Spoon approximately 60 g Curry Leaf Yogurt into the centre of each plate and spread into a large circle. Top with 2 fried Potato Breads and sliced avocado, drizzle with reserved Tikka Sauce, garnish with microgreens and edible flowers and serve.
tips: Not all flowers are edible, some are poisonous. Flowers should be purchased from a reliable source.
Those that suffer from pollen allergies should not consume edible flowers.

title: Heirloom Tomato and Zucchini Lasagna (Matthew Kenney) Metric
ingredients: 170 g pistachio nuts, peeled and unsalted
200 g sun-dried tomatoes  o 200 g sun-dried tomatoes, in oil, drained
140 g red bell pepper, cut into pieces
basil, fresh, e.g. petite Italian basil
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in macadamia nuts, cover with water and soak for at least 4 hours to overnight. Drain and rinse nuts through a fine-mesh sieve and discard soaking water.
Using a vegetable peeler, thinly peel zest from lemon, avoiding the white pith and set aside. Cut lemon in half, squeeze the juice from both halves into a small bowl and set aside.
Place reserved lemon peels into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add reserved drained macadamia nuts and start Blend /15 sec. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and start again Blend /15 sec. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add ice cubes, nutritional yeast, reserved lemon juice, salt and olive oil and mix 6 min/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 2 min/speed 5 or until smooth. Transfer ricotta to an air-tight container and refrigerate until ready to use. Clean mixing bowl.
Cut lemon in half. Using a vegetable peeler, thinly peel zest from ½ lemon, avoiding the white pith and set aside. Squeeze the juice from both halves into a small bowl and set aside.
Place reserved lemon peels, salt and pistachios into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add basil, spinach and reserved lemon juice and blend 3 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and blend a further 3 sec/speed 8.
Add olive oil and blend 1 min/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place sun-dried tomatoes into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add Roma tomatoes, basil, shallot, bell pepper, olive oil, lemon juice, agave and salt and blend 30 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place parsley, basil, spinach and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and cook 10 min/80°C/speed 1. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl and set aside.

Trim the top and bottom from the zucchini. Using a mandoline shave zucchini lengthwise into very thin slices (approx. 2 mm thick), then cut the slices into 7 cm long pieces. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle with Herb Oil. These will serve as your lasagna "noodles".

For each serving, cut two thick slices from the part of your tomatoes that most closely match the size of your lasagna layers. Cut wedges from the remaining tomato for garnish. Season with salt and pepper. Arrange 3 pieces of seasoned zucchini in the centre of a plate. Top zucchini with dollops of Sun-Dried Tomato Pesto, Macadamia Ricotta and Pistachio Pesto. Place a tomato slice over the ricotta and pestos.

Layer the next set of 3 zucchini pieces over the tomato and repeat as directed with pestos and ricotta. Top with the second slice of tomato. Layer the remaining set of zucchini over the tomato. Garnish with a little of each pesto, tomato wedges, salt, pepper, and a sprig of basil. Drizzle Herb Oil directly onto the plate around the lasagna, repeat with remaining ingredients and serve.
tips: If using roasted and salted macadamia nuts omit the salt.
Refrigerate Macadamia Ricotta in an air-tight container and consume within one week.

Nutritional yeast is not to be confused with brewer's yeast or baking yeast. It is a natural flavour booster that lends a cheesy, nutty or savoury flavour to many dishes. Available in the natural food section of your supermarket or in health food stores.
The colour of Ricotta may vary depending on the nutritional yeast and type of macadamia nuts used.

title: Chocolate Budino (Matthew Kenney) Metric
ingredients: 200 g vegan whipping cream, e.g. Silk®
200 g dark chocolate, 70% cocoa solids, broken into pieces
130 g vegan whipping cream, e.g. Silk®, divided
steps: Place glucose, vegan whipping cream and soy milk into mixing bowl, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and heat 8 min/100°C/speed 2. Meanwhile, grease 10 Thermomix® custard moulds or individual moulds (70 g ea.) with non-stick spray oil and set aside.

Add cocoa powder, sugar, agar and salt, insert measuring cup and blend 10 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Place Varoma dish (without lid) instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 5 min/100°C/speed 1.

Add chocolate, allow to sit 1 minute for chocolate to soften, then insert measuring cup and mix 30 sec/speed 5. As quickly as possible, pour into prepared moulds and refrigerate 4 hours to overnight until set. Meanwhile, make the caramel.

To ensure the success of recipes with Sugar Stages the ingredients must match exactly in quantity and description given. The recipe should be cooked immediately after placing the sugar with other ingredients in the mixing bowl.
Place sugar, 70 g vegan whipping cream, 30 g water, lemon juice and cold vegan butter into mixing bowl, place splash guard onto mixing bowl lid and caramelize Sugar Stages .

Add remaining 60 g whipping cream and ½ tsp salt and without measuring cup mix 2 min/speed  and without measuring cup cook 3 min/Varoma/speed 2. Pour into an air-tight jar and set aside. Immediately scrape off any mixture left on rim of mixing bowl so mixing bowl lid closes securely for Pre-clean mode.
Place 995 g water and 1 drop dish soap into mixing bowl. Insert measuring cup into mixing bowl lid and start Pre-clean /Fat or caramel.
When ready to serve, invert Chocolate Budinos onto plates and drizzle with Caramel Sauce. Garnish with edible flowers and serve.
tips: To ensure success with this recipe the vegan butter must be added as much as possible in one piece. Scoop or cut one chunk (approx. 2.5 cm x 2.5 cm x 2.5 cm) and add a bit more if necessary, to achieve 30 g.
Lemon juice prevents crystallization and possible sugar burning and it does not change the taste of the caramel.
To store, keep refrigerated in an airtight container. To warm, place in the microwave for 30 seconds to heat through.
Heat up leftover caramel to spoon or drizzle over ice cream to create the perfect ice cream sundae.
Not all flowers are edible, some are poisonous. Flowers should be purchased from a reliable source.
Those that suffer from pollen allergies should not consume edible flowers.
Serve with vegan whipped cream.

title: Individual Pineapple Cheesecakes
ingredients: 2 lemons, preferably organic, zest and 25 g juice
15 - 25 g fresh ginger, peeled, thinly sliced, to taste
750 g fresh pineapple, cut into pieces
250 g berry sugar  o 250 g jam sugar 2:1
300 g cream cheese, chilled, in pieces
steps: With a zester or vegetable peeler, thinly grate zest from 2 lemons, avoiding the white pith. Divide zest into two equal portions and set aside. Cut 1 lemon in half, squeeze the juice from both halves into a small bowl and set aside.
Place ginger and half the reserved lemon zest into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add pineapple and mix 4 sec/speed 5.

Add 25 g reserved lemon juice and berry sugar, place Varoma dish (dish only, no lid) instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 45 min/100°C/speed 2. Transfer to a bowl, set aside and allow to cool. Clean mixing bowl.

Place butter, almond flour, remaining reserved lemon zest, poppy seeds, pecans and maple syrup into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and chop 10 sec/speed 7. Divide between 6 glass canning or yoghurt jars (120 ml ea.) and gently press to form a compact layer in each jar.

Place cream cheese, whipping cream, vanilla sugar, salt and eggs into mixing bowl and mix 1 min/speed 4. Divide over the crumble dough in each jar. Cover with parchment or loosely with lids and place into Varoma dish. Clean mixing bowl.

Place water into mixing bowl. Set Varoma with cheesecakes into position, secure Varoma lid and steam 20-22 min/Varoma/speed 1 until filling is set. Remove Varoma. Set cheesecakes aside and allow to cool.
Once cool, top each cheesecake with cooled Pineapple Jam and serve.
tips: Recipe inspired by Karine Lapointe, Thermomix® Independent Consultant, Québec.
Remove country filters and search Cookidoo® for Vanilla Sugar recipes.
Replace vanilla sugar with 15 g maple syrup, plus 1 tsp vanilla extract.
Remove country filters and search Cookidoo® for Praline Pecans recipe in the US Charleston Savor the South collection.
To preserve Pineapple Jam, while jam is still hot, pour into a warm sterilized jam jar with twist-off lid, leaving approximately 1 cm head space and seal immediately. Store in the refrigerator.

To ensure preservation, clean jam jars and lids thoroughly in hot soapy water. Rinse by pouring over with boiling water. Prepare for filling by placing clean jars and lids in a baking pan and heat in oven at 100°C/212°F until required.
For a lighter dessert, omit the crumble.
Replace 15 g caramelized pecans with 15 g raw pecans and add an additional 1 tbsp maple syrup.

title: Brown Rice Milk (Metric)
ingredients: 1 - 2 tsp sugar or sweetener of your choice (opcional)
steps: Place rice, salt and sugar into mixing bowl and grind Blend /1 min. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add water and vanilla and place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 7 min/100°C/speed 3. Carefully remove simmering basket, insert measuring cup and start Blend /1 min. Serve chilled.
tips: Store in refrigerator and consume within three days.
If Rice Milk is too thick, add water to desired consistency and mix thoroughly.

title: Antonio Bachour: White Chocolate Raspberry Almond Cake (Metric)
ingredients: 170 g butter, unsalted, diced, room temperature
170 g white chocolate Valrhona Ivoire 35% (see Tip)  o 170 g white chocolate Valrhona Ivoire 35% (see Tip)
1 tbsp gelatin powder, unflavoured  o 4 ½ sheets gelatin, silver grade
155 g white chocolate Valrhona Ivoire 35% (see Tip)  o 155 g white chocolate Valrhona Ivoire 35% (see Tip)
1 - 3 tsp red food colouring gel, to desired tint
steps: Place raspberries and lemon juice into mixing bowl and chop 30 sec/speed 6.

Add sugar and pectin and mix 20 sec/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 8 min/100°C/speed 1. Divide mixture into a pavoflex Lovely mini mold (15 Lovely forms) and freeze until solid (approx. 2 hr.). Clean mixing bowl and continue with recipe.
Preheat oven to 350°F/175°C. Grease a rectangular baking pan (approx. 37 cm x 26 cm), line with parchment and set aside.
Place almond paste, butter and sugar into mixing bowl and mix 2 min/speed 4.

Add almond flour, sour cream, eggs, baking powder and salt and mix 30 sec/speed 5. Transfer batter into prepared pan. Bake 18-20 minutes (350°F/175°C), until golden brown. Let cake cool completely before cutting into 15 rectangular pieces (approx. 7.5 cm x 3.8 cm, to fit mold forms). Cover with cling film and refrigerate. Clean mixing bowl.
Once confit is frozen solid, remove silicone mold from freezer and carefully pop molded Raspberry Confit from forms. Transfer to a freezable tray and return to freezer.
Soak gelatin sheets in a bowl of ice water until softened (approx. 5 min.). Once softened, remove soaked gelatin and gently squeeze out water. Discard water, return gelatin to the bowl and set aside.
Place white chocolate into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Split a vanilla bean lengthwise and scrape out seeds. Add vanilla bean seeds and pod, milk, 45 g whipping cream, and reserved gelatin and heat 4 min/50°C/speed 2.
Add rose water and mix 30 sec/speed 1. Transfer to a large bowl, remove and discard vanilla bean pod and set mixture aside to cool (to approx. 28°C). Meanwhile thoroughly clean and dry mixing bowl.

Insert butterfly whisk. Add 410 g whipping cream and whip 3 min/speed 2.5 until stiff peaks form. Remove butterfly whisk. Add ⅓ of the whipped cream into reserved chocolate mixture and fold in with spatula. Add the remaining whipped cream and fold in with spatula. Transfer to a piping bag and set aside. Clean mixing bowl.

Pipe the first layer of mousse into each form of the Lovely mini mold. With the back of a spoon, spread the mousse up the sides of the forms. Place frozen raspberry confit on top of first layer of mousse, then pipe on a second layer of mousse. Arrange cake pieces over the mousse, gently pressing them into the mold. Use mousse to fill in any gaps so the molds are completely filled, use an offset spatula to wipe away any excess and freeze the cakes 8 hours, to overnight.
Place 6 tbsp water into a small bowl. Sprinkle gelatin powder over water, stir to combine and set aside for 10 minutes.
Place 225 g fresh water, sugar, gelatin-water and glucose into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and heat 6 min/120°C/speed 1.

Add whipping cream and white chocolate and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Add red gel food coloring to taste and mix 1 min/speed 3. Remove mixing bowl, open mixing bowl lid and allow mixture to cool in mixing bowl until temperature reaches 37°C (set mixing bowl into position to check temperature). Meanwhile, line a baking sheet with parchment and top with small ramekins or pinch bowls turned upside-down.

Once glaze is cool, carefully remove frozen mousse cakes from mold and place on top of prepared ramekins. Pour glaze over cakes to cover top and sides. Let glaze drip (approx. 10 min.) before cleaning edges with an offset spatula.
Transfer cakes to a serving platter and refrigerate 30 minutes, to 24 hours before serving.
tips: For best results we recommend using Valrhona or other couverture chocolate. The recipes will work with other chocolates but the results may be different. Valrhona is a high-quality couverture chocolate. Couverture is the name given to a certain class of high-quality chocolate. Couverture chocolate, unlike regular chocolate, is ground to a finer texture during the production process and contains a greater percentage of cocoa butter relative to the other ingredients. These two differences produce a superior flavour and texture that makes couverture the preferred chocolate for tempering and enrobing truffles, bonbons, and other fine candies.
Valrhona chocolate can be found at specialty markets or purchased online.

If using gelatin sheets, place 225 g cold water and 4.5 sheets of gelatin, silver grade into a bowl (cut sheets to fit bowl) and set aside to soak (5 min.). Remove soaked gelatin and gently squeeze out water. Discard water, return gelatin to the small bowl and set aside. Add soaked gelatin to mixing bowl when adding the red food coloring.
Glucose is a simple syrup used in baking that can be found at well stocked supermarkets, specialty and craft stores.

To make your own glucose syrup place 45 g water and 45 g sugar into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and heat 5 min/100°C/speed 1 until sugar is dissolved. Transfer into a jar and place in refrigerator to cool completely (approx. 15 min.) before using. Leftover syrup can be stored in the refrigerator in a sealed glass jar.

For a vibrant coloured glaze, allow the glaze to rest in the refrigerator 24 hours. Once rested, microwave for 1 minute, then place into mixing bowl and without setting a time blend /speed 1 until temperature reaches 35°C.

title: Antonio Bachour: Chocolate and Raspberry Heart Cookies (Metric)
ingredients: 285 g Valrhona chocolate Raspberry Inspiration (see Tip)  o 285 g ruby chocolate, callets or pieces, i.e. Callebaut couverture
340 g all purpose white flour, plus extra to dust
1 egg yolk, from a large egg
steps: Place chocolate into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add whipping cream, fresh raspberries and glucose and heat 1 min/50°C/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and heat a further 1 min/50°C/speed 3.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and start Blend /30 sec. Transfer to a bowl, cover and refrigerate 8 hours to overnight. Clean mixing bowl.
Place all purpose flour, icing sugar, almond flour, cocoa powder and salt into mixing bowl and grind 20 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add butter, egg, egg yolk and ice water and mix 30 sec - 1 min/speed 4, until dough is fully combined. Transfer pastry to a clean work surface, shape into a disk, wrap with cling film and refrigerate 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 325°F/160°C. Line a baking sheet with parchment and set aside.

With a rolling pin, roll out chilled pastry on a lightly floured surface to 3 mm thickness. Cut chocolate pastry dough with a heart-shaped cookie cutter and transfer to prepared baking sheet. Bake 15-18 minutes (325°F/160°C), until cooked through. Let cool 5 minutes before transferring to cooling rack. Cool completely.

Transfer chilled raspberry chocolate ganache into a large piping bag and pipe onto one side of half the cookies, then cover with remaining cookies and sandwich together. Roll edges of cookies in coloured sprinkles until well coated and serve.
tips: For best results we recommend using Valrhona or other couverture chocolate. The recipes will work with other chocolates but the results may be different. Valrhona is a high-quality couverture chocolate. Couverture is the name given to a certain class of high-quality chocolate. Couverture chocolate, unlike regular chocolate, is ground to a finer texture during the production process and contains a greater percentage of cocoa butter relative to the other ingredients. These two differences produce a superior flavour and texture that makes couverture the preferred chocolate for tempering and enrobing truffles, bonbons, and other fine candies.
Valrhona chocolate can be found at specialty markets or purchased online.
Glucose is a simple syrup used in baking that can be found at well stocked supermarkets, specialty and craft stores.

To make your own glucose syrup place 45 g water and 45 g sugar into mixing bowl and heat 5 min/100°C/speed 1 until sugar is dissolved. Transfer into a jar and place in refrigerator to cool completely (approx. 15 min.) before using. Leftover syrup can be stored in the refrigerator in a sealed glass jar.

If Valrhona Raspberry Inspiration Chocolate is unavailable, place 85 g freeze dried raspberries into a clean and dry mixing bowl and grind 1 min/speed 10. Sift the ground raspberry powder through a fine mesh sieve and set aside. Replace Valrhona Raspberry Inspiration Chocolate with 285 g white Valrhona chocolate and chop as per recipe. Add reserved ground raspberry powder with whipping cream, fresh raspberries and glucose and continue as per recipe.

title: Guava Paste Cookies (Metric)
ingredients: 140 g butter, unsalted, cut into pieces
285 g all purpose white flour, plus extra to dust
300 g guava paste, cut into pieces (2 cm x 2 cm x 0.5 cm)
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F/180°C. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment and set aside.
Place butter, sugar, salt and flour into mixing bowl and mix 30 sec/speed 6.
Add water, insert measuring cup and knead Dough /1 min 20 sec.

Transfer dough to a lightly floured surface and roll out to a 4 mm thickness. Use a round cookie cutter (7.5 cm) to cut circles from dough and transfer to prepared baking sheets. Toss guava pieces in coloured sugar and place 1 slice in the centre of each circle. Brush edges of each circle with a little water, then fold 2 opposite sides of dough together overlapping the edges and pinch lightly to close. Sprinkle each cookie with coloured sugar, place a Christmas tree confetti sprinkle in the centre of each cookie closure and place onto prepared baking sheets.
Bake 18 minutes (350°F/180°C) or until lightly brown. Transfer to a wire rack and let cool to room temperature before serving.
tips: Recipe Inspired by Gabriela Boscolo Thermomix® Independent Consultant Pennsylvania.
Guava paste can be purchased in the Latin section of the grocery store.
For even baking with two cookie sheets at once, space racks so oven is divided into thirds and switch cookie sheets top to bottom and back to front halfway through baking.

title: Twice Baked Cheese Soufflés (Metric)
ingredients: 30 g unsalted butter, plus extra to grease
115 g goat's cheese, peppered, divided (85 g, in pieces, 30 g crumbled)
steps: Set oven rack to middle position and preheat oven to 350°F/180°C. Butter 4 ramekins (110-170 ml) or 4 egg coddlers (110-170 ml) and set aside.
Place first bowl into position. Place Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl and grind 5 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place cream, onions, bay leaf, nutmeg, peppercorns and salt into mixing bowl and cook 4 min/90°C/speed 2. Meanwhile, separate eggs placing whites and yolks gently into two separate cups and set aside. Strain mixture over a bowl through a fine mesh sieve. Discard solids and return the strained milk to mixing bowl.
Add butter, flour, reserved egg yolks, chives and white pepper, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook Thicken /100°C.
Add 85 g peppered goat cheese, insert measuring cup and mix 5 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a large bowl and set aside.

Place second bowl into position. Insert butterfly whisk. Place reserved egg whites into mixing bowl and without measuring cup whip 1 min 30 sec/40°C/speed 3.5 or until glossy and soft peaks form. Remove butterfly whisk. Fold egg whites into reserved cheese-egg mixture. Divide mixture between prepared ramekins.

Place ramekins into a roasting pan and pour approximately 1 cm of boiling water around ramekins. Bake 20-25 minutes (350°F/180°C) or until soufflés are set and feel springy in the center (do not overcook). Immediately remove from roasting pan and refrigerate ramekins.

When ready to serve, pre-heat oven to 400°F/205°C. Sprinkle soufflés with 30 g crumbled goat cheese and bake 20-25 minutes (400°F/205°C) or until well-risen and golden brown. Sprinkle with reserved grated Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.
tips: After initial baking ramekins can be frozen instead of placing in refrigerator. When ready to serve, remove individual frozen soufflés from the freezer and place on a baking sheet. Sprinkle with 1 oz crumbled peppered goat cheese and bake 40 minutes at 350°F/180°C.
Replace goat cheese with equal amounts cheddar cheese.

title: Tequila Sour (Metric)
ingredients: 4 tsp agave syrup  o 4 tsp maple syrup
2 egg whites, from large eggs, pasteurized (see Tip)
steps: Place first bowl into position. Place tequila, lemon juice, lime juice, agave and bitters into mixing bowl and mix 6 sec/speed 8. Set first mixing bowl aside.
Place second bowl into position. Insert butterfly whisk. Place egg whites into mixing bowl and without measuring cup, whip 2 min/speed 3.5, until glossy and stiff peaks form.
Add reserved tequila mixture over egg whites, insert measuring cup and mix 15 sec/speed 3. Remove butterfly whisk.
Add ice and stir 6 sec/speed 3. Strain into a glass, garnish with a cherry and lemon slice and serve.
tips: To pasteurize eggs: wash eggs. Place 1220 g water into mixing bowl and boil 15 min/60°C/speed 3. Insert simmering basket and place in eggs. When temperature reaches 60°C, pasteurize 3 min 30 sec/60°C/speed 0.5. Immediately remove eggs and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking process.
Raw eggs are not recommended for infants, the elderly, pregnant women, or people with weakened immune systems.
Serve over ice.
For a vegan variation: replace egg whites with 2 tablespoons aquafaba (liquid from a can of chickpeas).

title: Pao de Alho (Crispy Flatbread) Paul (Metric)
ingredients: 6 green onions, cut into pieces (5 cm)
315 g bread flour, plus extra to dust
extra virgin olive oil, to brush
4 tsp sesame seeds, black (opcional)  o 4 tsp nigella seeds (opcional)
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F/220°C.
Place garlic and green onions into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add flour, salt, cold water and boiling water and mix 15 sec/speed 4. Transfer dough to a well-floured work surface and knead into a disk. Divide dough into 8 equal pieces. Roll out each piece as thin as possible, dusting work surface and rolling pin with flour between each use.

Brush breads with olive oil, sprinkle with black sesame seeds and stack on top of each other. Place 2-4 flatbreads onto stoneware pizza stone Paul (see Tip). Bake 9-12 minutes (425°F/220°C), depending on thickness of breads and oven temperature (see Tip). Repeat with remaining flatbreads.
Stack the breads as cooked and serve warm.
tips: For crisp, cracker-like flatbreads, bake 8 minutes at 425°F/220°C, carefully flip and bake an additional 4 minutes. Size and thickness of breads will determine the amount you can bake at one time, as well as the time it will take to bake.
Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.

title: Hawaiian Pizza with Stuffed Cheese Crust (Ben) Metric
ingredients: 2 tsp extra virgin olive oil, plus extra to grease
30 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra to grease
10 basil leaves, fresh, plus extra to garnish
200 g cream cheese, cut into small cubes
100 g cold meats, assorted (e.g. chorizo, pepperoni, salami, etc.)
steps: Grease a large bowl with oil and set aside. Place water, sugar and yeast into mixing bowl and warm 3 min/37°C/speed 1.
Add flour, oregano, basil, olive oil and salt and knead Dough /2 min. Transfer dough to prepared bowl, cover with cling film or a tea towel and let rise until doubled in size (approx. 30 min.).
Place Manchego cheese into mixing bowl and grate 5 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place garlic, salt, onions, tomatoes, olive oil and basil into mixing bowl and chop 15 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 10 min/120°C/speed 3. Transfer to a bowl and set aside to cool.
Preheat oven to 450°F/230°C. Grease a stoneware baking dish Ben with olive oil and set aside.

Transfer risen dough to baking dish Ben and spread out evenly to cover bottom of pan. Stretch dough to hang over edges of pan and line inside edge of dough with cream cheese cubes. Roll extended dough over cheese and gently pinch all along the edges to firmly seal. Sprinkle stuffed dough edges with sesame seeds to taste.

Evenly spread reserved tomato sauce over bottom of crust and sprinkle with reserved grated cheese. Top with pineapple and cold meats. Bake 20 minutes (450°F/230°C). Remove from oven, garnish with fresh basil and serve immediately.
tips: Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.
Dough can be stretched with a rolling pin on a lightly floured work surface and transferred to pan before stuffing the crust.
Top pizza with any of your favourite ingredients (e.g. vegetables, mushrooms, ham, cheese, artichokes and/or herbs).

title: Tamale Pie (Anna) Metric
ingredients: 185 g lard, room temperature  o 185 g vegetable shortening, room temperature
510 g maize meal, nixtamalised (masa harina), instant for tamales
100 g poblano chillies, peeled, cut into strips (see Tip)
steps: Insert butterfly whisk. Place lard into mixing bowl and whisk 3 min/speed 3.5.

Remove butterfly whisk. Add masa harina, chicken broth, salt and baking powder and mix 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix 8 sec/speed 6. Remove half the dough and set aside.
With remaining dough in mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and knead Dough /3 min. Transfer to a large bowl and set aside.
Place reserved unmixed dough into mixing bowl and knead Dough /3 min. Transfer to bowl with reserved kneaded dough, cover with cling film and let rest 20 minutes.
Without cleaning mixing bowl, place tomatillos, garlic, 100 g onion segments, serrano peppers, water, salt and sugar into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.
Set Varoma dish into position, weigh in zucchini, 100 g diced onions, poblano strips and corn, secure Varoma lid and cook 15 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and set aside.
Insert measuring cup and increasing speed gradually, purée 1 min/speed 5-10, Set aside.
Preheat oven to 350°F/180°C. Lightly grease a stoneware baking dish Anna with vegetable oil and set aside.

Place half of the dough inside the baking dish, spread out in an even layer over bottom of baking dish Anna. Top dough with reserved steamed vegetables, pour half of the green sauce over vegetables and set aside the rest to serve. Place remaining dough over top of pie, firmly press down to create an even layer and smooth top with spatula. Cover with foil.
Bake 50 minutes (350°F/180°C), remove foil and bake a further 10-15 minutes (350°F/180°C) until top crust is fully cooked. Serve hot with remaining green sauce on the side.
tips: Grease the stoneware dishes for the first time (see instructions for use). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer during use and ensures that the food does not adhere to the shape and can be easily detached from the stoneware.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.

To peel poblano peppers: Preheat broiler on high heat. Line a baking sheet with foil. Place poblano peppers onto prepared baking sheet. While watching carefully, broil until charred on all sides, turning once (approx. 10 min.). Transfer charred peppers to a bowl and cover with cling wrap until cool enough to handle (approx. 10 min.). Wearing gloves when handling peppers, peel away charred skin from poblano peppers, remove stems and discard seeds.

title: Japanese Cheesecake (Anna) Metric
ingredients: 340 g cream cheese, room temperature, in pieces
115 g unsalted butter, room temperature, in pieces
steps: Preheat oven to 325°F/160°C. Cut a circle from parchment to fit into the bottom of a stoneware baking dish Anna. Grease bottom and sides of Anna with 15 g butter and line with prepared parchment to prevent sticking.
Separate egg whites from egg yolks, reserving yolks in one bowl and whites in another. Make sure you have a large roasting pan that will hold the baking dish and boiling water to make a bain-marie.
Place cream cheese, 115 g butter and milk into mixing bowl and blend 10 sec/speed 5.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and heat 6 min/50°C/speed 2. Blend 10 sec/speed 6.

Add reserved egg yolks, lemon juice, salt, flour and corn starch and mix 20 sec/speed 6. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix 10 sec/speed 5 or until smooth. Transfer to a large bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place sugar into mixing bowl and grind 15 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Insert butterfly whisk. Place reserved egg whites and cream of tartar into mixing bowl and without measuring cup whip 1 min/speed 4 until just fluffy. Add 113 g reserved ground sugar and whip without measuring cup 1 min/speed 4
Add remaining 112 g reserved ground sugar and whip 1 min 30 sec/speed 4 until medium peaks form.

Gently fold 1 large tablespoon of whipped egg whites into reserved cream cheese mixture and mix well. With spatula or a large spoon, very gently fold the remaining whipped egg whites into the cream cheese mixture, using a figure eight motion, to mix until well incorporated (see Tip).

Pour mixture into prepared baking dish, gently tap to release any air pockets and place into reserved roasting pan. Place roaster with baking dish on middle rack in oven and fill the roaster with boiling water up to approximately 2.5 cm of Anna's height.
Bake 1 hour (325°F/160°C). Decrease oven temperature to 300°F/150°C and bake for 25 minutes (300°F/150°C).
Turn off oven, crack oven door open and allow to cool approximately 30 minutes with door ajar. Cake should shrink from pan sides (approx. 1-2 cm).
Allow to cool 2 hours outside of the oven before running a butter knife around edge of pan. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours up to overnight. Garnish with fresh berries and serve.
tips: Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.
Don’t waste a drop of whipped egg whites: remove the butterfly whisk and stir any clinging whipped egg whites into the cream cheese.

Over-mixing can cause the cake to shrink too much. Only beat the egg whites until medium peaks form. Very gently fold egg whites into the cream cheese mixture, using a flipping motion. Do not stir or blend vigorously, do so gently and thoroughly otherwise you end up with a rubbery bottom and cakey top.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.

title: Rustic bread
ingredients: 30 g fresh yeast  o 3 tsp dried instant yeast (12 g)
150 g bread flour, plus extra for dusting
steps: Place 200 g wheat grains in mixing bowl and grind 1 min/speed 10. Transfer to a large bowl.
Again place 200 g wheat grains in mixing bowl and grind 1 min/speed 10. Transfer to the large bowl.
Again place remaining 200 g wheat grains in mixing bowl, grind 1 min/speed 10, transfer to the large bowl and set aside.
Place water, yeast and buttermilk in mixing bowl and warm 2 min/37°C/speed 2.

Add reserved ground wheat grains, bread flour, salt, balsamic vinegar and malt powder. Knead Dough /3 min then allow to rise in mixing bowl with lid on until dough rises to top of bowl (approx. 30 minutes).
Knead a further Dough /1 min.
Preheat oven to 220°C. Line a baking tray with baking paper and set aside.

Turn dough out on a floured surface. Using floured hands, shape dough into a loaf, place on prepared baking tray and allow to rise again while oven is heating (approx. 15 minutes). Using a sharp knife, slash top of loaf in a criss-cross pattern.
Bake for 15 minutes (220°C), reduce temperature to 190°C and bake for a further 20-25 minutes or until loaf sounds hollow when tapped on the underside. Allow to cool on a cooling rack before slicing.
tips: If some of the dough sticks to the blades when transferring it to the floured surface in step 8, set mixing bowl back in position and mix 2 sec/speed 10. The remaining dough should now be easy to remove using the spatula.
You can let the loaf rise in a rising basket and then tip it on the baking tray just before baking. This will help the loaf retain its shape while rising.
Replace buttermilk with yoghurt or with milk to which 1 tsp of vinegar has been added, or with sour cream.
Replace wheat grains with spelt grains, or 100 g of the wheat grains with 100 g rye grains.
Bake the bread in a loaf tin. After baking, remove loaf from tin and allow to cool on a cooling rack.

title: Digestive Bliss (Metric)
ingredients: 115 g papaya, peeled and deseeded, cut into pieces
340 g alkaline water or 340 g spring water
steps: Place apple, pineapple, papaya and water into mixing bowl and start Blend /1 min 30 sec.
Strain juice through a fine-mesh sieve into a carafe and serve immediately or refrigerate until ready to serve.
tips: Strain pulp from juice to taste. Pulp is where the fibre is, and fibre helps to decrease sugars in the blood. For the most health benefits, add some pulp back into the juice and thin to desired consistency with water.
Pulp can be used to liven up smoothies, turn into ice cubes to flavour water or add to baked goods, reducing the need for oils or butter.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry with Eggs and Rice (Hestan Cue™) Metric
ingredients: kosher salt, Diamond Crystal®, to taste
45 g oil, e.g. grapeseed, vegetable or canola
½ tsp kosher salt, Diamond Crystal®
¼ tsp red pepper flakes, dried
steps: Cut parchment to fit Varoma tray (see Tip). Scrunch parchment into a ball under running water, squeeze out excess water and lay onto Varoma tray. Insert Varoma tray into Varoma dish and set aside.
Place eggs, salt and pepper into mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 6. Carefully pour onto the prepared parchment in the Varoma tray. Clean mixing bowl.
Place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in rice. Remove simmering basket, rinse rice under cold running water until water runs clear and set aside to drain.
Place water and salt into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket with rinsed rice, set Varoma with eggs into position, secure Varoma lid and steam 19 min/Varoma/speed 2.

Remove Varoma, remove simmering basket with spatula and transfer cooked rice to a serving bowl. Remove Varoma tray, use spatula to cut eggs into strips, transfer to serving bowl with rice and keep warm.
Continue the recipe in the HESTAN CUE™ induction burner app, search "USA & Canada" to prepare and stir fry the vegetables in the Hestan Cue™ frying pan.
Season sautéed vegetables with salt, pepper flakes and lemon juice. Place the Sautéed Vegetables on top of the Eggs and Rice. Drizzle with soy sauce and sesame oil and toss to combine. Serve warm.
tips: To cut parchment to fit Varoma tray: tear off a piece of parchment paper wide enough to cover Varoma tray. Place Varoma tray on top of parchment and cut around the tray to form an oval shape.
Search "Thermomix" in the Hestan Cue™ app to access all Thermomix® and Hestan Cue™ Smart cooking recipes.

title: Squash soup, Fish with rice and vegetables, Apple-pear crumble
ingredients: 400 g water, plus extra to soak rice
2 white fish fillets, skinless, 150-180 g each (e.g. hake, sole, perch)
1 tsp salt, plus extra to taste
2 - 3 pinches ground pepper, plus extra to taste
120 g apple (1 apple), cut in pieces (1.5 cm), core removed
120 g ripe pear (1 pear), cut in pieces (1.5 cm), core removed
130 g carrots, cut in sticks (1 cm x 5 cm)
4 green asparagus, cut in halves lengthwise if thicker than 1 cm,  o 150 g broccoli florets
150 g onions, cut in pieces (4 cm)
250 - 300 g butternut squash, peeled, cut in pieces (3 cm)
80 g ripe tomatoes, cut in pieces
steps: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh long-grain rice into it. Add water to cover rice and set aside to soak.

Sprinkle fish fillets with 1-2 pinches salt and pepper; if fish fillets are thin, roll them up and secure with a toothpick to avoid overcooking. Place fish fillets on a piece of baking paper (30 cm x 40 cm), add cherry tomatoes and sprinkle again with 1-2 pinches salt. On another piece of baking paper (30 cm x 40 cm), place apple and pear pieces and drizzle with honey and lemon juice. Close both parcels, folding up baking paper and twisting ends, then place them in Varoma dish. Insert Varoma tray and arrange carrots on it with green asparagus on top. Set Varoma aside.
Place flour, brown sugar and butter in mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 5. Transfer crumble mixture to a bowl and set aside.
Place onions, garlic clove, butternut squash and extra virgin olive oil in mixing bowl, chop 2 sec/speed 5, then sauté 8 min/120°C/speed 1.

Add tomatoes. Drain rice through simmering basket and insert simmering basket in mixing bowl. Add 1 tsp salt, 1 pinch ground pepper and water. Set Varoma in position and cook 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 180°C.
Set covered Varoma aside on a plate to keep warm and remove simmering basket using spatula. Blend soup 1 min/speed 4-9, increasing speed gradually.

Divide steamed apple and pear pieces and their cooking juices between 2 ovenproof ceramic dishes (approx. Ø 12 cm), sprinkle with reserved crumble mixture and bake until golden (180°C), 15-20 minutes.
Serve soup sprinkled with chopped chives as a starter (see tip), then fish with rice and vegetables as a main dish (remove toothpicks from fish rolls) and finally fruit crumble for dessert.
tips: A nutritious and complete menu for two, you can serve this meal on weekdays, weekends, or even for a special occasion. The colourful soup and vegetables and the mouth-watering crumble are excellent companions for the healthy and delicious fish parcel.

To keep the main course warm while soup is served, insert simmering basket with rice back into empty but still warm mixing bowl and set covered Varoma containing fish parcel and vegetables in position on mixing bowl lid.
Instead of asparagus, use flat runner beans, cut in pieces (2 cm).
Use chicken stock or vegetable stock instead of water in step 5 (in this case salt maybe reduced in the same step to ¼ tsp).

title: Charcoal Bread
ingredients: extra virgin olive oil, to grease
470 g all-purpose flour, plus extra to dust
80 g black tahini  o 80 g black sesame paste, unsweetened (see Tip)
steps: Grease a large bowl and set aside. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside.
Place water and active dry yeast into mixing bowl and heat 3 min/37°C/speed 1.

Add flour, activated charcoal, salt and black tahini and knead Dough /4 min. Transfer dough to a floured work surface, then shape into a ball. Place into prepared bowl, cover with cling film or a tea towel and allow to rest for 1 to 1 ½ hour or until doubled in size.

Transfer risen dough to a floured work surface. Punch down dough to remove all air and shape into a ball. Place dough onto parchment paper. Cover with cling film or tea towel and let stand for a further 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, 15 minutes before end of rising time, place a small container filled with water in the bottom of the oven and preheat oven to 240°C/460°F.

Brush the surface of the dough with water, sprinkle with poppy seeds and black sesame seeds and use a very sharp knife to score cuts on the surface. Place in the oven and bake for 20 minutes (240°C/460°F). Remove from oven and cool on a wire rack before serving.
tips: Powdered activated charcoal is available in supermarkets and health food stores.
Black sesame paste is available in health food stores.
This bread will keep for several days in an airtight bag.

title: Black tahini banana bread
ingredients: 150 g unsalted butter, softened, plus extra to grease
