350 g sweet bananas, ripe (approx. 4 bananas), cut into pieces
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F. Grease a deep-sided loaf (20 x 10 cm/8 x 4 in.) pan and set aside.
Place bananas into mixing bowl and mash 5 sec/speed 6.
Add butter and sugar, then mix 20 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add eggs and mix 10 sec/speed 4.
Add plain flour, cornstarch, cocoa powder, salt, bicarbonate of soda, tahini and vanilla, then mix 20 sec/speed 4.

Pour into prepared loaf pan and sprinkle with sesame seeds (optional). Bake for 55-60 minutes (180°C/350°F) or until a wooden skewer inserted into the centre of the loaf comes out clean. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Remove from oven and allow to cool in pan for 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

Place all ricotta cream ingredients into mixing bowl and blend 1 min/speed 4 or until smooth and creamy. Pour in a small bowl and place in the refrigerator to thicken. Serve sliced banana bread with ricotta cream (optional).
tips: You can replace Black cocoa powder with Dutch cocoa powder, if desired.
To make your own Black tahini, see Cookidoo® for the recipe.
Banana breads flavour improves on standing and is even better a day or 2 after baking. Store in an airtight container for up to 3 days.

title: Low Carb Stuffed Acorn Squash
ingredients: 15 g fresh parsley leaves, plus extra to garnish or 15 g celery leaves, plus extra to garnish
avocado oil, to rub  o unsalted butter, melted, to rub
115 g cauliflower florets, small stems removed
60 g yellow onion, cut into pieces
30 g celery, cut into pieces (2.5 cm/1 in.)
15 g walnut halves, shelled  o 15 g pecan nut halves, raw
140 g cremini mushrooms, fresh, destemmed and quartered
steps: Place Parmesan cheese and parsley into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a small bowl and set aside.

Wash and dry acorn squash. Cut in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds. Rub inside and outside of squash with oil, season with salt and pepper. Place into Varoma dish, skin side down and set aside.
Place cauliflower, onion, celery, walnuts, oil, salt and pepper into mixing bowl and chop 1 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add mushrooms and without measuring cup cook 8 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add cranberries, tamari and apple cider vinegar and without measuring cup cook 2 min/90°C//speed 1.
Divide filling between prepared squash halves and sprinkle with reserved Parmesan-parsley mixture.
Place water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma dish with stuffed squash into position, secure Varoma lid and steam 40-45 min/Varoma/speed 2, until squash is tender (see Tip).
Transfer Stuffed Acorn Squash to a serving dish, garnish with parsley and serve hot.
tips: Steaming stuffed acorn squash in your Thermomix® will free up oven space for other holiday roasting or baking.

To broil: preheat broiler to high. Line a baking sheet with foil. Lightly spray steamed, stuffed squash with cooking spray and place on prepared baking sheet. Place under broiler to brown, watching carefully to prevent the nuts and dried cranberries from burning (approx. 3-5 min).
Use the Pre-clean function on your Thermomix® TM5 for easy clean up. For TM6® users, place 1 l water and 1 drop dish soap into mixing bowl and start Pre-clean /Browned Bottom.

To reheat: bring steamed, stuffed squash to room temperature and bake 20-30 minutes. Or steam by placing 570 g water into mixing bowl, place squash into Varoma dish, secure Varoma lid and steam 20-25 min/Varoma/speed 2.
Replace cauliflower with strips of plain tempeh (approx. 2.5 cm/1 in.).
Serve stuffed acorn squash as a meal or cut into wedges after steaming to serve as a side dish.

title: Low Carb Pecan Tarts
ingredients: 60 g unsalted butter, chilled, cut into pieces (2.5 cm/1 in.)
15 g monk fruit sweetener, white, 1:1 sugar substitute, brown sugar substitute
85 g unsalted butter, cut into pieces (2.5 cm/1 in.)
85 g monk fruit sweetener, white, 1:1 sugar substitute, brown sugar substitute
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F. Lightly grease muffin pan with non-stick cooking spray and set aside.
Place pecans into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place butter, almond flour, monk fruit sweetener, salt, xanthan and egg into mixing bowl and mix 15 sec/speed 4. Transfer dough to a clean work surface and form into a flattened ball. Wrap in cling film and refrigerate to chill 15 minutes to overnight.
Place butter and monk fruit sweetener into mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add egg, heavy cream, molasses, vanilla and salt and mix 10 sec/speed 4.
Add reserved chopped pecans and mix 4 sec//speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Roll dough out between 2 pieces of parchment paper to 5 mm/¼ in. thickness. Cut 12 circles using a round cookie cutter (9 cm/3½ in.). Place dough circles into prepared muffin pan and gently press into shape, lining the bottom and up the sides (approx. ¾ of the way up) of each muffin hole.

Divide pecan filling between tart shells and bake 20-23 minutes (180°C/350°F), rotating pan halfway through baking. Allow to cool completely before carefully removing from muffin pan. Serve immediately with whipped cream (see Tip) or refrigerate in an airtight container until ready to serve.
tips: If the tops begin to brown too quickly, loosely cover with foil once browned to your liking.

To serve with low carb whipped cream: in a clean and dry mixing bowl, insert butterfly whisk. Place 340 g heavy whipping cream and 1-2 tsp monk fruit sweetener into mixing bowl and whip without setting a time/speed 3, until desired stiffness is achieved, watching carefully to avoid overwhipping. Remove butterfly whisk.
To reheat: place tarts on a baking sheet and bake 10 minutes at 190°C/375°F.

title: Low Carb Mushroom Gravy
ingredients: 200 - 225 g cremini mushrooms, trimmed and sliced
115 g yellow onions, cut into pieces
340 g liquid turkey stock  o 340 g chicken stock
⅛ tsp ground black pepper, to taste
steps: Place water into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket, weigh in mushrooms and steam 3 min/Varoma/speed . Remove simmering basket with spatula and set aside. Discard remaining water in mixing bowl.
Place reserved steamed mushrooms and 30 g cold butter (see Tip) into mixing bowl and sauté High Temp. . Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place almond flour, onions, garlic, 30 g butter and thyme into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and without measuring cup, cook 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add, stock, cream, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and start Thicken /100°C.
Insert measuring cup and start Blend /45 sec. Add reserved sautéed mushrooms and cook 3 min/90°C//speed 1. Transfer to a gravy boat, garnish with thyme leaves and serve hot.
tips: To ensure success with this recipe the butter must be cold and added as much as possible in one piece. Cut butter in large chunks (approx. 2.5 cm/1 in.).

title: Quinoa, Nut and Dairy Free Muesli Slice
ingredients: 70 g apple (any type) (approx. 1 small apple), core removed and cut into quarters
70 g crisped rice breakfast cereal, plain
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F. Line a rectangular baking pan (30 x 20 cm/12 x 8 in.) with parchment paper and set aside.
Place quinoa, linseeds (flaxseeds) and chia seeds into mixing bowl and grind 20 sec/speed 9. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place apple into mixing bowl and grate 2 sec/speed 5, until even consistency is achieved. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add dates, apricots and cranberries and chop Turbo/1.0 sec/3 times or until all fruit is evenly chopped. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add all remaining ingredients, including reserved seed mixture, and combine 30 sec//speed 3.
Transfer mixture into prepared baking pan. Press mixture down evenly and smooth surface with spatula.

Bake for 15-20 minutes (180°C/350°F) or until lightly browned. Allow to cool in pan for 15 minutes, then remove and allow to cool completely on a wire rack (approx. 1 hour). Cut into 16 bars and serve.

title: Cold Brew Olive Iced Coffee
ingredients: 450 g coffee, brewed, cold brew, chilled
30 - 60 g vanilla syrup, to taste (see Tip) (optional)  o 30 - 60 g white sugar or cane sugar, to taste
steps: Place coffee, olive oil and vanilla syrup into mixing bowl and start Blend /40 sec. Serve over ice.
tips: Search Cookidoo® for the Vanilla Bean Syrup recipe in our TM Basics -Condiments collection to make your own.

title: Bannock Bread
ingredients: vegetable oil, to grease or brush
170 g whole milk, plus extra to brush
steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F. Grease a cast iron frying pan with oil and set aside.
Place milk and water into mixing bowl and warm 3 min/40°C/speed 1.
Add flour, baking powder, sugar and salt and mix 45 sec/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Transfer dough from mixing bowl into prepared cast-iron frying pan and smooth edges with spatula. Brush surface of dough with milk or oil. Bake 30 minutes (200°C/400°F), or until golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped on the underside. Transfer Bannock Bread to a wire rack and allow to cool for 15 minutes. Serve warm or cool.
tips: Bannock is a traditional Canadian Indigenous survival bread. When food was scarce and rations were low, this bread could be made with almost anything. The ancestors would use crushed wheat, dried berries, bitterroot or pemmican. These ingredients would add sustenance to their diet. Today, it’s a treat and it can be baked, fried or grilled.
Serve with your choice of soup, meat, fish or jam.
Search Cookidoo® for our Saskatoon Berry Jam in our O Canada collection.
Bannock is traditionally eaten torn by hand.

For barbequing, place dough in well-oiled cast-iron skillet. Cook on grill at 200°C/400°F over indirect heat for 20 to 25 minutes, or until golden. For a nice golden crust, flip over bread and cook for 2-3 more minutes.

For baking over an open fire, find a 5 cm/2 in. diameter wood stick, remove about 25.5 cm/10 in. of the inner and outer bark at one end, hold that end over the fire until it’s hot but not burnt. Take a piece of dough and roll it with your hands (adding some flour if it is too sticky) to form a rope and wrap it around the bare end of the stick. Hold the stick wrapped with Bannock over coals, turning until golden, about 10 minutes.

Bannock is often fried in small batches in skillet with a little oil: In a large frying pan on high, heat 5 cm/ 2 in. of oil. As soon as the piece of dough is dropped into the hot oil, turn it 3 times so that it puffs up evenly. Repeat with several pieces at a time and fry until golden brown for 3 minutes on each side until all the dough has been fried.

title: Montreal Steak Seasonning Blend
ingredients: 1 tbsp paprika  o 1 tbsp smoked paprika
steps: Place salt, black peppercorns, dill seeds, coriander seeds, mustard seeds into mixing bowl and grind 7 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add paprika, garlic powder, onion powder and red pepper flakes and mix 10 sec/speed 5. Use immediately or transfer to a sterilized (see Tip) jar with airtight lid for later use.
tips: Coat protein of choice with as much of the seasoning as you'd like immediately before cooking or up to 2 hours before. Leaving the rub for more time will draw the moisture out, leading to a dry meat.

To prepare jar, place 500 g water into mixing bowl. Place jar and lid upside down in the centre of the Varoma and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Leave to drain - do not dry or touch the inside surfaces. Alternatively, thoroughly wash jar and lid in hot, soapy water. Rinse by pouring over boiling water. Prepare for filling, if needed, by placing on a clean tea towel in a roasting pan and heating in the oven at 100°C/212˚F until required.
Montreal steak seasoning Blend can also be made into a marinade. Add ½ tsp of the mix to 2 tbsp vinegar, 45 g oil and 45 g water.

title: Maple Taffy on Shaved Ice (Maple Taffy on "Snow")
ingredients: butter, to grease the mixing bowl
150 g maple syrup preferably dark (see Tip)
steps: Place ice cubes into mixing bowl and shave 10 sec/speed 7. Using spatula, spread "snow" into a square pan (20 cm x 20 cm/8 in. x 8 in.). Press into a firm compact layer with spatula and freeze until ready to serve. Meanwhile continue with recipe. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Grease the inside walls of the mixing bowl (see Tip).

Place maple syrup into mixing bowl, place Varoma dish (dish only, no lid) instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 25 min/115°C/speed . Check for doneness by spooning a drop of taffy into a glass of cold water. The drop should set and not dissolve in the water. If necessary, replace Varoma dish (dish only, no lid) on mixing bowl lid and continue cooking a further 3 min/115°C/speed . Remove mixing bowl lid and allow taffy to cool for 5 minutes before continuing.

Remove pan with "snow" from freezer. Pour reserved hot taffy over "snow", forming long ribbons (approx. 10-15 cm/4-6 in.), and let set 15-20 seconds. Then, place the tip of a wooden stick or fork on the end of a taffy ribbon, turn to twist taffy around the stick while pressing. Repeat until all Maple Taffy is used. Enjoy immediately.
tips: Before shaving, ensure the ice cubes are not clumped together in large blocks. If necessary, separate by quickly running them under water.
When shaving ice, ensure not to exceed the 1 L. mark of the mixing bowl.
To obtain a larger amount of shaved ice, repeat the steps a second time.
Use a freezer-safe container. A shallow square or rectangular serving dish or pan is ideal.
To avoid overflowing, carefully butter the mixing bowl and do not exceed the requested amount of syrup.
Store any remaining Maple Taffy Sticks in an airtight container lined with parchment paper and freeze. Can be kept several weeks in the freezer.
The longer you leave the taffy on the snow, the harder (crunchier) it will become.

title: DIY fruit dippers
ingredients: sugar pearl sprinkles, any colour, for dipping
coconut, dried, grated, unsweetened, toasted, for dipping
plain biscuits, crumbled, for dipping (see Tip)
1 - 2 apples, red, cut into 16 wedges (see Tip)
1 - 2 apples, green, cut into 16 wedges (see Tip)
steps: Place butter, whipping cream, sugar, maple syrup and vanilla paste into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 12 min/Varoma/speed 2. Transfer into a small bowl and set aside to cool and thicken (see Tip). Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place strawberries into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and purée 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add cream cheese and syrup and blend 40 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and blend 40 sec/speed 5 or until smooth. Transfer into a bowl, cover with cling film and refrigerate until ready to serve.
Place all dipping ingredients into separate small bowls. Skewer each apple wedge on a small toothpick and arrange onto a serving platter.
Allow guests to dip apples in either caramel or strawberry sauce, and coat in their choice of toppings.
tips: You can use any cookies you have on hand or make a batch of your favorite recipe from our Consultant Favourites -Cookie Exchange collection on Cookidoo®.
To prevent apples from turning brown, brush with lemon juice or a carbonated drink such as ginger ale.
Caramel sauce will thicken if stored in refrigerator; bring back to room temperature before serving.
Caramel vanilla sauce (double quantity): Double all ingredient quantities of sauce and cook 14 min/Varoma/speed 2, placing simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid. Proceed as per recipe.

title: Garlic Tahini Dip (Tarator)
ingredients: ½ tsp salt, plus extra to taste
100 - 120 g freshly squeezed lemon juice, to taste
steps: Place garlic into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add tahini, salt, water and lemon juice into mixing bowl and start Blend /30 sec. Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with parsley leaves and serve.
tips: For a thinner dip, increase the amount of water.
Try serving this dip with grilled or steamed fish or with falafel. Refer to the recipe on Cookidoo® to make it fresh in your Thermomix®.

title: Acai Nice Cream
ingredients: 285 g frozen acai purée, broken into pieces
5 sweet banana, ripe, frozen, in pieces (approx. 450 g bananas) (see Tip), plus extra to garnish
steps: Place acai into mixing bowl and chop Turbo/2.0 sec/1 time.
Add bananas and chop 15 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add coconut oil and agave an blend 1 min/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and blend a further 1 min/speed 4, until creamy. Transfer to an insulated serving bowl or freezable container, cover with lid and freeze until needed or serve immediately topped with sliced bananas and berries.
tips: Fruit should be frozen solid, at least 2 hours or overnight. Cut bananas into pieces as needed, spread out on a tray, freeze, then use frozen in recipe or transfer to a freezer bag for later use.

title: Apple Mousse Crumble with Rosemary Ice Cream (Matthew Kenney) Metric
ingredients: 1020 g apples, type Granny Smith (approx. 6 apples), peeled, cored, halved, each half cut into 4 wedges
2 tsp vegan whipping cream, e.g. Silk®
1 tsp fresh rosemary, leaves only, chopped
steps: Place oat milk and rosemary into mixing bowl and simmer 15 min/90°C/speed 1. Set aside and allow to steep 30 minutes.
Strain steeped milk through a fine-mesh sieve into a large bowl. Discard solids.
Place strained milk, sugar and simple syrup into mixing bowl and blend 20 sec/speed 5.
Heat Kettle /85°C. Add xanthan gum and start Blend /30 sec. Transfer into ice cube trays and allow to cool. Once cool, freeze overnight or until frozen. Rinse mixing bowl and continue with recipe.

Place water into mixing bowl. Set Varoma dish into position and weigh in apples. Transfer 12 apple wedges onto Varoma tray, insert Varoma tray over apple wedges in Varoma dish, secure Varoma lid and steam 16 min/Varoma/speed 2. Carefully, remove Varoma tray and reserve for garnish. Secure Varoma lid and continue cooking apples in Varoma dish a further 8 min/Varoma/speed 2. Remove Varoma and set aside. Empty mixing bowl.
Place 570 g steamed apples and 115 g sugar into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and start Blend /40 sec. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add agar and mix 10 sec/speed 5. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 8 min/100°C/speed 1. Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool slightly. Meanwhile, clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place a small bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in 100 g sugar and set aside. Lightly grease 12 ring molds with non-stick spray, place on a tray and set aside.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place aquafaba, vegan whipping cream and cream of tartar into mixing bowl and without measuring cup whip 2 min/37°C/speed 3.

Add xanthan gum and without measuring cup, whip 7-10 min/speed 3.5 until stiff peaks form, while slowly adding reserved sugar through hole in mixing bowl lid. Remove butterfly whisk. With spatula, scoop out one-third of the whipped mixture and gently fold into the reserved apple mixture until incorporated. Make sure to start folds from the bottom so all is mixed. Once incorporated, add in another third of the reserved whipped mixture. Gently fold in to incorporate and then fold in the final third whipped mixture until very light and airy and there are no visible white streaks.
Spoon mixture into prepared ring molds and freeze until firm. Meanwhile, make the crumble.
Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment and set aside.

Place rosemary, brown sugar, oats, flour, salt, and vegan butter into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and mix 10 sec/speed 5.5. Evenly spread onto prepared baking sheet and freeze at least 20 minutes.
Bake 20-25 minutes (180°C/350°F). Set aside to cool. Once cooled break into pieces and allow to cool completely. Then, store in an air-tight container until ready to use. Meanwhile clean mixing bowl.
When ready to serve, place frozen Rosemary Ice Cream cubes into mixing bowl and with aid of spatula start Blend /1 min.

Insert butterfly whisk. Insert measuring cup and whip 3 min/speed 3.5. Remove butterfly whisk. Remove a frozen Apple Mousse from ring mold and place into a bowl. Cut reserved steamed apple wedges into pieces. Place a small scoop of Rosemary Ice Cream next to the mousse, add 1-2 pieces of reserved steamed apple. sprinkle with Toasted Oat Crumble and repeat with remaining servings. Serve immediately.
tips: To make your own simple syrup place 395 g water and 395 g sugar into mixing bowl and without measuring cup, cook 20 min/100°C/speed 2. Transfer into a jar and place in refrigerator to cool completely (approx. 15 min.). Any leftover syrup can be stored in a sealed jar in the refrigerator and used in other recipes.

title: Butternut Queso (Matthew Kenney) Metric
ingredients: 170 g butternut squash, peeled, deseeded and cut into pieces (5 cm)
450 g vegetable broth  o 450 g water, plus 2 tsp vegetable stock paste
1 ½ tsp dried cayenne pepper flakes
fresh jalapeño chilli, sliced, to garnish
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in cashews, cover with water and soak for at least 4 hours to overnight. Drain and rinse nuts through a fine-mesh sieve, rinse and set aside. Discard soaking water.

Place butternut squash, reserved drained cashews, vegetable stock, nutritional yeast, olive oil, apple cider vinegar, chilli powder and chilli flakes into mixing bowl and cook 20 min/85°C/speed 1 and blend 20 sec/speed 10.

Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Season with salt to taste and mix 10 sec/speed 6. Place chips on a plate and drizzle with warm Butternut Queso. Layer with guacamole, pico de gallo and sliced jalapeños. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve immediately.
tips: Serve over vegetables and potatoes. Use to make nachos, smothered burritos, bean dips, or use to top enchiladas.

Nutritional yeast is not to be confused with brewer's yeast or baking yeast. It is a natural flavour booster that lends a cheesy, nutty or savoury flavour to many dishes. Available in the natural food section of your supermarket or in health food stores.

title: Ground Bison Meat
ingredients: 450 g bison, boneless chuck or shoulder, cut in pieces (3 cm), partially frozen (30-40 min.) (see Tip), divided
150 g pork fat, from butcher, cubed (3 cm) frozen (60 min.) (see Tip), divided
steps: Place 225 g partially frozen bison and 75 g frozen pork fat into mixing bowl and grind 5-8 sec/speed 6 or until desired consistency is achieved. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place remaining 225 g partially frozen bison and 75 g frozen pork fat into mixing bowl and grind 5-8 sec/speed 6 or until desired consistency is achieved. Transfer to bowl with reserved ground bison and mix to combine. Use ground bison as needed.
tips: Bison is very lean, so the addition of fat is necessary for flavour. Pork fat must be completely frozen as it has a soft texture. However, make sure bison meat is only partially frozen.

To freeze bison and fat before grinding: line 2 baking sheets with parchment and set aside. Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in 150 g pork fat and cut into cubes (3 cm). Transfer to prepared baking sheet and spread out into a single layer over parchment. Freeze 60 minutes or until completely frozen. Meanwhile, clean and slice 450 g boneless bison, chuck or shoulder into cubes (3 cm). Transfer to prepared baking sheet, spread out in a single layer over parchment and freeze 30-40 minutes or until partially frozen (firm but not frozen solid).
To achieve a uniform result, cut meat into evenly sized pieces.
To grind beef, replace both bison and fat with 450 g beef, sinew free, cut in pieces (3 cm), partially frozen in a single layer for 30-40 minutes.
Replace pork fat with bacon, cut into pieces (3 cm), frozen and chop with bison as per recipe.

title: Antonio Bachour: Chocolate Caramel Pudding Tarts (Metric)
ingredients: 340 g all purpose white flour, plus extra to dust
155 g Valrhona chocolate, dark chocolate 70% (see Tip)  o 155 g dark chocolate 70%, high quality chips or chunks
130 g butter, unsalted, cold in 1 cube
mango, ripe, thinly sliced, to garnish
steps: Place all purpose flour, icing sugar, almond flour, cocoa powder and salt into mixing bowl and mix 20 sec/speed 10.

Add butter and eggs and mix 20 sec/speed 5. Transfer pastry to a clean surface and shape into a disk. Divide pastry in half, wrap in cling film and refrigerate 1 hour. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl. Line a baking sheet with parchment and set aside.
Place chocolate into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add milk, sugar, cornstarch and egg yolks and cook 12 min/90°C/speed 3.
Add butter and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and cool completely. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl and make the caramel.

To ensure the success of caramel recipes the ingredients must match exactly in quantity and description given. The recipe should be cooked immediately after placing sugar with other ingredients in the mixing bowl. The bowl must be filled for Pre-cleaning immediately after the finished caramel is transferred from mixing bowl and the mixing bowl edge cleaned with spatula before the Pre-cleaning is started.

Place sugar, butter, 30 g water, lemon juice and salt into mixing bowl and caramelize Sugar Stages . Add whipping cream, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 3 min/120°C/speed 2. Transfer to a bowl and set aside to cool. Immediately clean all caramel residues from edge of mixing bowl with spatula, so mixing bowl lid closes properly for Pre-cleaning.
Place 1000 g water and 1 drop dish soap into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and start Pre-clean . Meanwhile, proceed with recipe.

On a lightly floured surface, roll out one half of the chilled pastry dough to 3 mm thickness. Line 12 perforated tart rings (8 cm) by pressing ring molds into rolled out pastry to create the bottom. Transfer to prepared baking sheet. Roll out remaining chilled pastry and cut into thin strips slightly larger than the height of the rings (approx. 2-3 cm wide). Line the inside walls of the tart rings with pastry strips, trimming as needed. Gently press the bottom dough and wall strips together with your finger to seal. With a small paring knife, trim off any dough that is above the tart rings. Use a fork to prick holes in the pastry and refrigerate (approx. 30 min.). Meanwhile, preheat oven to 325°F/160°C.

Line chilled pastry shells with parchment and baking weights (e.g. dried beans) and blind-bake 13 minutes (325°F/160°C). Remove parchment and weights and bake a further 2-5 minutes (325°F/160°C) until pastry is dry to the touch. Set aside to cool.
Once cool, spoon reserved caramel into bottom of tart shells. Refrigerate until set (approx. 30 min.).
Once set, spoon reserved chocolate pudding over top of caramel layer in each tart shell and refrigerate to set, 2 hours to overnight. Garnish with thinly sliced mango and serve cold.
tips: For best results we recommend using Valrhona or other couverture chocolate. The recipes will work with other chocolates but the results may be different. Valrhona is a high-quality couverture chocolate. Couverture is the name given to a certain class of high-quality chocolate. Couverture chocolate, unlike regular chocolate, is ground to a finer texture during the production process and contains a greater percentage of cocoa butter relative to the other ingredients. These two differences produce a superior flavour and texture that makes couverture the preferred chocolate for tempering and enrobing truffles, bonbons, and other fine candies.
Valrhona chocolate can be found at specialty markets or purchased online.

title: Sea Salt Caramel Cookies (Metric)
ingredients: 1 lime, zest only, no white pith, plus 1 tbsp juice
225 g icing sugar, plus extra to dust
30 g butter, unsalted, cold, in 1 cube (approx. 2.5 cm x 2.5 cm x 2.5 cm)
115 g icing sugar, plus extra to dust
steps: Place marshmallows and 1 tbsp lime juice into mixing bowl and heat 4-5 min/65°C/speed 2 or until melted. Remove 2 tbsp mixture and set aside to use as "glue" to adhere the fondant to the cookies.

Add icing sugar, lime zest, salt and food colouring and mix 1 min/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and knead Dough /2 min. Sprinkle cling film with icing sugar, transfer fondant to centre, wrap tightly and refrigerate overnight. Place 995 g water and 1 drop dish soap into mixing bowl and start Pre-clean /Dough. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.

To ensure the success of recipes with Sugar Stages the ingredients must match exactly in quantity and description given. The recipe should be cooked immediately after placing the sugar with other ingredients in the mixing bowl.
Line a baking sheet with parchment and set aside.
Place a small bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in butter and set aside (see Tip).

Place brown sugar, 70 g water, reserved butter and lemon juice into mixing bowl and caramelize Sugar Stages . Immediately pour mixture over prepared baking sheet. Scrape rim of mixing bowl with spatula to remove any remaining mixture that could prevent lid from closing properly.
Place 995 g water and 1 drop dish soap into mixing bowl and start Pre-clean /Fat or caramel. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Allow Brittle to cool to room temperature and break into pieces. Place Brittle pieces into mixing bowl and grind 1-2 sec/speed 9. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place butter, icing sugar, flour, salt, 50 g reserved ground Brittle, almond extract, vanilla extract, egg and lemon juice into mixing bowl and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Transfer dough to centre of a sheet of cling film, flatten to a disk (0.5 cm thick), wrap and refrigerate 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350°F/180°C. Line 4 baking sheets with parchment and set aside.

Roll out chilled cookie dough to a 0.5 cm thickness. Cut shapes with a round cookie cutter (5 cm). Place on prepared baking sheets and bake 8-10 minutes (350°F/180°C) until golden brown. Let cool on baking sheets 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Dust a silicone mat with icing sugar. Roll out reserved fondant to a 4 mm thickness. Dip a cookie stamp (slightly larger than the one used to cut the cookies) into icing sugar and press stamp (see Tip) into dough, rocking the stamp from side to side to create the imprint and cut the dough. Brush a small amount of reserved fondant "glue" on the baked cookies (see Tip), top with cut fondant and lightly press to secure. Serve right away.
tips: Recipe inspired by Maureen Jaeckel Thermomix® Independent Consultant New York.
To ensure success with this recipe the butter must be added as much as possible in one piece. Cut one chunk (approx. 2.5 cm x 2.5 cm x 2.5 cm) and add a bit more if necessary, to achieve 30 g.
To make your own icing sugar: place 200 g sugar into mixing bowl and grind 20 sec/speed 10. Use icing sugar as needed. For best results, grind sugar in 100-200 g batches.
Lemon juice prevents crystallization and possible sugar burning and it does not change the taste of the caramel.
For even baking with multiple cookie sheets at once, space racks so oven is divided into thirds and switch cookie sheets top to bottom and back to front halfway through baking.
If cookie stamp is sticking, lightly spray with non-stick spray and blot with a paper towel. Press stamp into dough, rocking the stamp from side to side to create the imprint.
If reserved marshmallow "glue" becomes too stiff, add a 1-2 drops of water until thin enough to brush.

If creating hanging ornaments, use a skewer to make the hole while cookies are still warm. After applying the fondant flip cookie, fondant side down, and insert skewer through the hole in the back of the cookie and through the fondant. Thread with ribbon, loop and tie to secure.

title: Gozleme Stuffed Pockets (Paul) Metric
ingredients: 30 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra to grease
315 g all-purpose flour, plus extra to dust
45 g neutral oil, e.g. vegetable, canola, safflower
steps: Place water, yeast and sugar into mixing bowl and warm 3 min/37°C/speed 1. Meanwhile, lightly grease a baking sheet and set aside.

Add olive oil, yoghurt, salt and flour and knead Dough /3 min. Transfer dough to a clean work surface and bring together. Divide dough into 4 equal pieces and shape each into a ball. Transfer to prepared baking sheet, cover with cling film and leave to rest until doubled in size (approx. 1 hr.). Meanwhile, clean and dry mixing bowl and prepare filling.
Place spinach, onions and oil into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and without measuring cup, sauté 5 min/100°C/speed 1.

Add feta cheese and pepper flakes, insert measuring cup and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer spinach mixture into simmering basket and with spatula press to strain and discard liquid. Divide the filling into 4 equal portions and set aside.
Preheat oven to 375°F/200°C.

Roll out risen dough on a lightly floured work surface into 4 very thin squares (approx. 30.5-33 cm). Place reserved portioned filling into centre of each square, fold pastry edges to the centre to form an envelope/pocket, taking care to enclose the entire filling and set aside.
Place pockets onto stoneware pizza stone Paul. Bake 15 minutes (375°F/200°C), turn pockets over and bake a further 15 minutes (375°F/200°C) or until lightly browned.
Cut or tear each pocket into four rectangles and serve hot.
tips: Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.
Brush with garlic butter before baking.

title: Avocado with Egg and Salmon Tartare
ingredients: 6 large eggs, chilled, straight from the refrigerator
water, to fill to the 1L mark
250 g salmon fillet, fresh, skinless, cut into pieces
6 slices white bread, in square, sliced, for toasting
steps: Place eggs and water (to 1 liter mark) into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and start Egg Boiler /Medium soft. Using a slotted spoon, carefully transfer eggs to simmering basket and run under cold water to stop the cooking process. Set eggs aside and dry mixing bowl.
Place dill into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add salmon, lemon juice, oil, ½ tsp red peppercorns and salt and combine 4 sec//speed 5. Divide salmon tartare between 6 serving plates, and using a ring mould (8-10 cm/3-4 in.), form a flat round base.

Cut 3 avocados into halves using a sharp knife. Remove cores, peel and place on a chopping board flat sides down. Cut into stripes (3-4 mm/⅛ in.) beginning from the long side. Lengthen avocado stripes and roll to form a rose. Carefully transfer avocado roses on top of salmon tartare leaving a hole in the centre.

Carefully peel reserved eggs and place one egg in the centre of each avocado rose. Sprinkle with remaining ½ tsp red peppercorns and garnish with microgreens. Serve immediately with a slice of toast (see Tips).
tips: Serve with a simple mixed green salad, if preferred.
If not available, red peppercorn can be substituted for pink peppercorn.

title: Mixed Paella (Hestan Cue™) Metric
ingredients: 85 g red bell peppers, in pieces
115 g chicken thighs, skinless, boneless, cut into pieces
½ tsp kosher salt, Diamond Crystal®
steps: Place garlic into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add red pepper, green pepper and olive oil and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Without measuring cup sauté 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add chicken, squid, tomatoes, saffron, salt and paprika, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 3 min/120°C//speed .
Add stock, insert simmering basket, add mussels, prawns and clams, insert measuring cup and cook 10 min/Varoma//speed .

Remove simmering basket with spatula and set seafood aside. Rinse simmering basket and set aside. Add rice into mixing bowl, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 5 min/100°C//speed .
Continue the recipe in the HESTAN CUE™ induction burner app, search "USA & Canada" to cook the paella in the HESTAN CUE™ frying pan.
Once rested, serve immediately with lemon wedges.
tips: Search "Thermomix" in the Hestan Cue™ app to access all Thermomix® and Hestan Cue™ Smart cooking recipes.

title: Sizzling Jalapeño Cocktail (Metric)
ingredients: 15 g lime juice, freshly squeezed  o 15 g lemon juice, freshly squeezed
2 jalapeño chilli, fresh, destemmed, deseeded, divided, 1 cut in pieces (½ in.), 1 sliced in rings and frozen (see Tip)
steps: Place a cocktail glass in the refrigerator for 3-4 hours to chill before filling.
Place gin, lime juice, ginger beer, agave, jalapeño pieces and ice into mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 4.
Pour into an ice cold glass and garnish with lime wedges and frozen jalapeño rings (see Tip). Serve chilled.
tips: Freeze jalapeño slices in advance, spread sliced peppers on a cookie sheet and freeze for 1 hour. Place sliced jalapeños in freezer bags, remove as much air as possible and seal for future use.

title: Chilli Lime Steamed Corn
ingredients: 4 sweet corn cobs, husks and silk removed and ends trimmed
4 tsp Mexican-style chilli powder with lime, e.g. Tajin
steps: Place water into mixing bowl. Set Varoma dish into position and place in corn, secure Varoma lid and steam 15-18 min/Varoma/speed 3.

Carefully remove Varoma lid, set Varoma dish onto inverted Varoma lid and set aside. Use tongs to transfer steamed corn to a plate, sprinkle with chilli lime and spread with butter. Garnish with parsley and serve immediately.

title: Golden Lassi Smoothie (Matthew Kenney) Metric
ingredients: 115 g coconut flesh, fresh, peeled, cut into pieces  o 115 g coconut flesh, frozen, in pieces, thawed and drained
1 piece fresh turmeric (5 cm), peeled, in pieces
1 tsp MCT oil  o 1 tsp coconut oil
steps: Place dates, almond milk, salt, maple syrup, coconut, fresh turmeric, fresh ginger, cinnamon, ground turmeric, pepper, MCT oil, pineapple and mango into mixing bowl and start Blend /10 sec or until desired consistency is achieved. Pour into glasses and serve.
tips: Coconut flesh (fresh and/or frozen) can be found in most well stocked supermarkets and at most Asian grocers. If using frozen coconut flesh, defrost and drain before using.
For a thinner consistency, add an additional 85-115 g almond milk, scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix 10-15 sec/speed 6, until fully combined.

title: Corn Cake with Eggnog Sauce (Anna) Metric
ingredients: 85 g butter, unsalted, in pieces, plus extra to grease
140 g all-purpose flour, plus extra to dust
sweetcorn kernels, fresh, from 6 corn cobs (see Tip)
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F/180°C. Grease and flour a stoneware baking dish Anna with butter and set aside.
Place butter into mixing bowl and melt 5 min/50°C/speed 1.
Add condensed milk, vanilla, eggs and corn and blend 1 min/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add flour and baking powder and mix 30 sec/speed 5. Pour mixture into prepared baking dish Anna.
Bake 50 minutes (350°F/180°C) or until a toothpick inserted into centre of cake comes out clean. Meanwhile prepare the sauce.
Place milk, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, clove, egg yolks and vanilla into mixing bowl and start Thicken /80°C.
Add rum and mix 30 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a jug and let cool.
Garnish with mixed berries. Drizzle with Eggnog Sauce and serve warm.
tips: Prepare 6 fresh corn cobs in advance, remove the husks and silk and with a knife, remove corn kernels from cobs and transfer to a bowl until ready to use.
Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odors on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.

title: Summer Coleslaw
ingredients: 115 g red cabbage, cut into pieces
225 g green cabbage, cut into pieces
steps: Place red cabbage, green cabbage, carrots, red pepper and green pepper into mixing bowl and chop 4-6 sec/speed 5 or until desired consistency is achieved. Scrape down sides with spatula.

Add mayonnaise, mustard, apple cider vinegar, sugar, celery seed, onion powder, garlic powder and salt and mix 8 sec//speed 3. Transfer to a serving bowl and refrigerate for 15 minutes until chilled. Serve chilled.

title: Creamy Mac & Cheese
ingredients: 140 g butter, unsalted, in pieces, divided
steps: Grease a casserole dish (23 cm x 33 cm.) with non-stick cooking spray and set aside.
Preheat oven broiler on high.
Place cheddar cheese into mixing bowl and grate 7 sec/speed 8. Transfer to bowl and set aside.
Place Monterey Jack cheese into mixing bowl and grate 7 sec/speed 8. Transfer to bowl with reserved grated cheddar.
Place water, butter and milk into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and boil 10-12 min/100°C/speed 1 or until water is boiling.
Once milk mixture is boiling, add macaroni and 1 tsp salt, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook time indicated on package/100°C//speed 1.

Add butter, 225 g reserved grated cheese mixture, 1 tsp salt, pepper, garlic powder and onion powder, mix with spatula to combine and the mix 35 sec//speed 3. Transfer macaroni and cheese into prepared casserole and top with remaining cheese.
Broil for 10 minutes until evenly golden brown and serve hot.
tips: The milk mixture must be boiling (100°C/212°F) before adding the macaroni.

title: Cajun Shrimp and Polenta Waffles
ingredients: 1 ½ tablespoon Cajun spice mix (see Variation)
60 g butter, unsalted, cut into pieces
85 g andouille sausage, pre-cooked, cut into pieces
85 g green pepper, cut into pieces
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F.

Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in 60 g flour, transfer to a baking sheet and toast 18 minutes (180°C/350°F). Meanwhile, place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in grits, 85 g flour, jalapeno chilies, 1 tsp salt and stir to combine. Set aside.

Place water 450 g into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and start Kettle /100°C. Pour boiling water over reserved grits mixture, using a whisk stir to combine. Cover with cling wrap, set aside and continue with recipe.

Place a small bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in shrimp,30 g canola oil and Cajun seasoning, stir to combine, cover and set aside. Place a second bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in cheddar cheese, 30 g canola oil and egg. Stir to combine and set aside.

Place butter, sausage, bell pepper, onions, and garlic into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 5 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add reserved toasted flour, chicken stock paste and 285 g water, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 5 min/120°C//speed 2.

Place Varoma dish into position, add reserved shrimp, secure Varoma lid and steam 13-15 min/Varoma/speed 2 until cooked to your liking. Meanwhile preheat waffle iron according to manufacturer's instructions.
Add reserved egg and cheese mixture to bowl with grits mixture and whisk to combine.

Spray waffle iron with non-stick cooking spray. Spoon ½ cup batter onto preheated waffle iron and cook according to manufacturer's instructions. Repeat with remaining batter. Separate waffle squares into 16 pieces. Divide cooked shrimp onto each piece and spoon gravy evenly over waffles. Garnish with green onions and serve warm.
tips: To grate your own cheese, place 3 oz cheddar cheese into mixing bowl and grate 6-10 sec/speed 7 or until desired consistency is achieved.
To keep waffles warm as you're cooking, set a wire rack inside a sheet pan and place in oven at 95°C/200°F until ready to serve.
The amount of batter you use will vary based on the size of the waffle iron and the thickness of batter.
Replace 1½ tbsp Cajun spice mix with 1½ tbsp Cajun Spice Rub. Search Cookidoo® for our Cajun Spice Rub in our Spice Up Your Life collection.

title: Culinary Demo 1
ingredients: 500 g mixed frozen red berries  o 500 g frozen fruit, any type
10 - 30 g lime juice, to taste  o 10 - 30 g lemon juice, to taste
2 pasteurized egg whites (see Tip)  o 60 g liquid egg whites, pasteurized
100 g fresh mixed red berries, to garnish
30 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra to grease
2 tsp active dry yeast  o 2 tsp dried instant yeast
1 red bell pepper (approx. 150 g), cut into pieces
1 dessert apple (e.g. Granny Smith or Pink Lady), (approx. 150 g), quartered
30 g pine nuts  o 30 g sunflower seeds
15 g fruit vinegar  o 15 g white balsamic vinegar
1 tsp salt  o 1 tsp herb salt
45 g unsalted butter, cold, cubed (1 cm), divided
285 g risotto rice (e.g. Carnaroli, Arborio) with 14-15 minutes cooking time (see Tip)
1 stock cube, vegetable or beef  o 1 heaping tsp stock paste, homemade, vegetable or beef
steps: Place sugar into mixing bowl and grind 15 sec/speed 10.
Add frozen berries, lime juice and pasteurized egg whites (see Tip) and start Blend /1 min.
Insert butterfly whisk and whip 3 min/speed 3.5. Remove butterfly whisk. Garnish with fresh berries and serve cold in dessert bowls.
Place lemons, 500 g water and sugar into mixing bowl and mix Turbo/2.0 sec/1 time.
Add 500 g water. Insert simmering basket, hold it in place with spatula and strain lemonade into a pitcher. Add ice cubes and serve immediately.
Lightly grease a large bowl and set aside. Place water, sugar and yeast into mixing bowl and warm 2 min/37°C/speed 1.

Add flour, olive oil and salt and knead Dough /2 min. Place dough into prepared bowl and form into a ball. Cover bowl with cling film and let dough rise until doubled in size (approx. 1 hr.). Use pizza dough as needed.
Place water and 1 drop dish soap into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and start Pre-clean /Dough. Rinse and dry mixing bowl before proceeding with recipe.
Place broccoli, red pepper, apple, pine nuts, oil, vinegar, honey, mustard, salt and black pepper into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 4. Serve at room temperature. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Place Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onion, garlic, olive oil and 30 g butter into mixing bowl and sauté High Temp. . Insert measuring cup and chop 3 sec/speed 5.
Add rice and without measuring cup sauté 3 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add wine and without measuring cup cook 1 min/100°C//speed 1.

Add water, stock cube and salt. Scrape bottom of mixing bowl thoroughly with spatula to loosen rice. Place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 13 min/100°C//speed 1. Check for doneness and if necessary, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook a further 2 min/100°C//speed 1.
Allow risotto to rest in mixing bowl for 1 minute, then transfer into a serving bowl. Using spatula, combine risotto with 15 g butter and reserved grated Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.
tips: Berry Dream

To pasteurize eggs: wash eggs. Place 1135 g water into mixing bowl and boil 15 min/60°C/speed 3. Insert simmering basket and place in eggs. When temperature reaches 60°C, pasteurize 3 min 30 sec/60°C/speed 0.5. Immediately remove eggs and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking process.
Look for pasteurized eggs right next to the regular eggs in your grocery store.
Raw eggs are not recommended for infants, the elderly, pregnant women, or people with weakened immune systems.
Lemonade
Choose smaller lemons with smooth shiny peel, as these are juicier and have less white pith.
For sweeter or tarter lemonade, adjust sugar to taste.
Replace lemons with either 2 small oranges or 1 grapefruit, quartered.
Pizza Dough
The cling film can be lightly oiled to prevent it from sticking to the rising dough.

Use dough to make 1 large rectangular pizza or 4 individual round pizzas. To shape pizza: place dough on a baking sheet (approx. 40 cm x 35 cm) lined with parchment or greased with olive oil. Press it out with fingertips from the centre to the edges, and gently stretch into shape. Alternatively, you can roll it out with a rolling pin on a floured surface and transfer to a baking sheet lined with parchment.
To bake pizza: form a small ridge around the edge and spread lightly with desired toppings. Bake for 20-25 minutes in a preheated oven (230°C/450°F/).
Broccoli Salad with Red Pepper and Pine Nuts
Make the broccoli salad ahead and chill in the refrigerator.
Parmesan Risotto
Adjust cooking time according to time indicated on rice package.
Liquid absorption can vary according to type of rice. If risotto seems dry before it is cooked through, add more liquid.

Rule of thumb for creating your own risotto recipe: for every 100 g risotto rice you will need 285 g liquids (water and wine) combined with stock paste. The maximum quantity of rice that can be cooked at any one time for this basic recipe is 500 g. Note that adding other ingredients (e.g. mushrooms or sausage) will increase overall volume of the dish, so adjust rice quantity accordingly.
Saffron Risotto: while adding rice add 2 pinches saffron.

Mushroom Risotto: after high heat sauté and add 250 g fresh mushrooms (cut into pieces if too large) or 60 g dried mushrooms (soaked in water for 30 minutes, water squeezed out). Insert measuring cup and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Proceed as directed by recipe. Saffron can also be added in this variation.

Vegan version: replace butter with olive oil, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook without high heat mode 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Replace Parmesan with vegan Parmesan. To make vegan Parmesan: place 110 g cashews, 2 tsp nutritional yeast and ½ tsp salt into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and grind 10 sec/speed 6.
Pine nuts can be replaced with other nuts in the Broccoli Salad.

title: Vegetable pasta soup, Pork roll with vegetables, Puddings, Muffins
ingredients: ½ tsp natural vanilla extract  o 1 tsp vanilla sugar, homemade
200 g fresh raspberries  o 200 g frozen raspberries
150 g fresh blueberries  o 150 g frozen blueberries
500 - 600 g boneless pork shoulder, in one piece, butterflied to approx. 1.5 cm thick
300 g onions, of which 100 g cut in slices, the rest in pieces
130 g carrots, peeled, cut in slices (5 mm)
70 - 80 g mixed vegetables (e.g. red or green peppers, celery), cut in pieces
1 heaped tsp vegetable stock paste, homemade,  o 1 vegetable stock cube (for 0.5 l)
250 g potatoes, cut in slices (5 mm)
160 g courgettes, cut in slices (1 cm)
150 g ripe tomatoes, cut in slices (1 cm)
60 g short dried pasta (e.g. elbow macaroni), for soup
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C. Line a muffin tray with paper muffin cases and set aside. Distribute jam among 4 individual silicone or aluminium muffin moulds (Ø 7 cm, 4 cm height, see tips) and set aside.

Place eggs, sugar, butter, milk, vanilla extract, flour and baking powder in mixing bowl and mix 30 sec/speed 4. Using spatula, scrape down and stir in any remaining flour on sides of mixing bowl. Pour enough batter over jam in the 4 individual moulds to come up to 5 mm below the rims and set aside on Varoma tray.

Distribute remaining batter between prepared paper muffin cases, filling to 1 cm from the top as many as the batter yields (7-9 muffins), and arrange raspberries and blueberries over the muffins. Bake for 30 minutes (180°C) (see tip). While baking, continue with step 4.
Place butterflied meat on a sheet of heat-resistant cling film or baking paper (30 cm x 50 cm), sprinkle with salt and pepper and cover with bacon slices.
Place sun-dried tomatoes, Parmesan cheese and parsley in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl using spatula.

Add egg and mix 10 sec/speed 3. Spread mixture evenly over bacon slices and roll up the meat, wrapping it tightly with the heat-resistant cling film or baking paper. Place roll in Varoma dish and set aside.
Place garlic clove, 200 g onion pieces, 50 g carrots, mixed vegetables and olive oil in mixing bowl, chop 2 sec/speed 5, then sauté 5 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add white wine and reduce without measuring cup 1 min/Varoma/speed 1 to help alcohol evaporate.

Add 1 tsp salt, vegetable stock paste and water. Insert simmering basket and weigh in potatoes, remaining 80 g carrots, 100 g onion slices, courgettes and tomatoes. Season with dried oregano and ½ tsp salt, then set Varoma dish in position. Insert Varoma tray with puddings, close Varoma and steam 40 min/Varoma/speed 1. Set covered Varoma aside on a plate to keep puddings and pork roll warm and remove simmering basket using spatula. Transfer vegetables from simmering basket to a serving dish, cover to keep warm and set aside.
Add pasta to mixing bowl and cook time indicated on packet/100°C//speed 1. Transfer soup to a serving bowl.

Serve soup as a starter. After serving soup, remove cling film from meat roll, cut roll in slices, arrange on serving dish with vegetables and serve as the main course. Turn out steamed puddings onto plates and serve for dessert.
tips: If cooking an all-in-one three-course meal isn’t enough of a culinary challenge, why not make some delicious muffins for breakfast while you’re at it? Tasty pasta and vegetable soup, a pork roll filled with flavourful bacon and sun-dried tomato stuffing, served with Mediterranean vegetables, followed by delightful steamed raspberry puddings, the batter of which, when baked instead of steamed, produces completely different but equally wonderful berry muffins. Thermomix® makes it all possible - and easy!

For the muffins, use an 8-hole or 12-hole muffin tray, leaving some holes unfilled depending on how much batter you have left. For the puddings, use any heat-resistant individual muffin or pudding moulds that fit 4 on Varoma tray.

After baking, allow muffins to cool for 5 minutes in the tin, then transfer to a cooling rack. Once at room temperature, sprinkle with icing sugar, store in an air-tight container and serve within 24 hours. For a special treat, serve a spoonful of whipped cream or crème fraîche with the steamed puddings.

If you have room in your refrigerator, you can prepare this recipe the night before. Proceed until step 9, stopping just before steaming. Place prepared Varoma, mixing bowl and simmering basket in the refrigerator. When ready to finish, continue recipe from steaming in step 9.
Use different berries or small pieces of mango or banana for the muffins.
Use other jams or marmalades in the steamed puddings instead of raspberry jam.

title: Cider-brined pork chops with apple dressing
ingredients: 1 apple, type Granny Smith, peeled, cored and cut into quarters
6 sprigs chive, fresh, cut into quarters
steps: Place cider, salt, rosemary, sage, thyme and pepper into mixing bowl and heat 5 min/100°C/speed 1. Transfer into a jug and set aside for 30 minutes to cool.

Place pork chops into a large snap lock bag. Carefully transfer cider mixture into snap lock bag with chops, press the air out and seal tightly. Place into a large bowl and place into refrigerator for 1½ hours, turning every 30 minutes. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Remove pork chops from brine, rinse under running water and pat dry with paper towel. Discard brining liquid. Lightly brush both sides of chops with oil and set aside to come to room temperature.

Preheat barbecue to medium heat or place a grill pan over medium heat on the stove top. Place chops onto barbecue or into grill pan and cook for 10-15 minutes, turning once, until cooked to your liking. Transfer onto a plate and allow to rest for 3-5 minutes.
Place all dressing ingredients into mixing bowl and blend 20 sec/speed 7 or until smooth. Serve dressing with pork chops.
tips: You can use apple or pear cider to make the brine. Pear ciders are typically sweeter than apple ciders.

title: Black Lemonade
steps: Place water, lemon juice, sugar, activated charcoal and apple cider vinegar into mixing bowl and blend 6 sec/speed 5. Pour into a glass bottle, close and leave to ferment for at least 6 days at room temperature, protected from light (see Tip).
tips: Powdered activated charcoal is available in supermarkets and health food stores.
For sparkling lemonade without the fermentation, replace still water with sparkling water.

title: Black Rice Pudding
ingredients: 200 g rice, brown, type black Venus, soaked overnight then drained and rinsed
steps: Place mango and lime juice in mixing bowl then blend 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Insert butterfly whisk. Place rice, coconut milk, water, salt and vanilla pod into mixing bowl and cook 25 min/90°C//speed 1. Place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook a further 10 min/Varoma//speed 1.
Add maple syrup and stir 5 sec//speed 1. Divide between serving bowls, top with reserved fruit purée and squeeze half a passion fruit over each bowl to serve.
tips: Black rice is a naturally gluten-free grain full of antioxidants. The addition of vitamin-rich coconut milk and mango makes this a healthy yet exotic start to the day.

title: Scandinavian Brunch Roll
ingredients: 220 g white bread flour, plus extra for dusting
10 g fresh yeast  o 5 g dried yeast
70 g oat flakes  o 70 g sesame seeds, any colour
2 pinches Sichuan peppercorns, or to taste
6 slices smoked salmon, cut in strips
6 slices haddock fillet, smoked, cut in strips
steps: Place sesame seeds into mixing bowl and grind 30 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add flour, water, yeast, milk, sugar, egg and squid ink, then knead Dough /5 min.

Add butter and salt, then knead Dough /2 min. Transfer the dough to a floured work surface. Bring the edges of the dough into the centre 3-4 times, roll into a smooth ball, place in a bowl, cover with a damp tea towel and leave to rise for 1-2 hours or until doubled in size. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl.

Once risen, transfer dough to a floured work surface, then knead firmly for a few seconds. Form a long rope out of the dough, then divide it into 8 balls. Place the balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, ensuring they are 5 cm/2 in. apart. Cover with a tea towel and leave to rise for another hour.
Shortly before the end of the rising time, preheat oven to 210°C/410°F.

Brush the rolls with water using a pastry brush, then sprinkle them with oats. Bake in oven for 20-25 minutes at 210°C/410°F. Once baked, remove rolls from oven and leave to cool completely on baking sheet.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place cream, cream cheese and lemon juice into mixing bowl and whip 30 sec/speed 3. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add chives, salt and pepper, then whisk 10 sec/speed 1.5. Remove butterfly whisk, transfer mixture to a bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place dill, parsley, basil, cilantro leaves, arugula and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Cut bread rolls in half. Spread one half of the roll with chive cream, then top with herb salad, slices of smoked salmon and haddock. Place remaining half of the roll on top and serve.

title: Mussels with Thai Green Curry Sauce
ingredients: 15 g fresh cilantro leaves, plus extra for garnishing
60 g green chillies, fresh, cut in pieces, plus extra for garnishing (opcional)
15 g ginger, fresh, peeled, cut in round slices (3 mm/⅛ in.)
steps: Place coriander in mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 7.
Add chilli, garlic, shallot, ginger, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, pepper, zest of 1 lime and juice of 2 limes and grind 2 sec/speed 7.
Add olive oil, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 3 min/120°C/speed 1.
Add soy sauce, coconut milk and sugar and mix 1 min/speed 7.

Place Varoma dish on mixing bowl lid and weigh mussels into it. Cover Varoma and steam 14 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove the mussels, drizzle over the sauce, sprinkle with chopped coriander and chilli then serve.

title: Steamed Turkey Breast with Ricotta, Spinach and Walnut Filling
ingredients: 150 g fresh spinach leaves, rinsed (see Tip)
10 g Parmesan cheese, cut in pieces (2 cm)
700 - 800 g turkey breast, skin on, boneless, boned and rolled
steps: Place spinach in mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and wilt 3 min/100°C//speed 2. Transfer to a sieve and squeeze out excess water then set aside. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Place garlic and Parmesan in mixing bowl then grate 5 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add walnuts, basil and reserved wilted spinach then chop 3 sec/speed 5.
Add ricotta, salt and pepper and mix 15 sec/speed 3.

Place turkey breast on a work surface and make a horizontal incision with a sharp knife along thick side of breast, being careful not to cut through it. Open cut side, spreading breast out, cover with cling film, then flatten slightly with a meat mallet or rolling pin until an even thickness, being careful not to break the join.

Cover one half of breast with ricotta mixture then fold over other half. Place a large sheet of parchment paper on a work surface. Lay 4-6 slices of Parma ham on parchment paper in a single layer, overlapping slightly. Place turkey breast on top then wrap ham around, covering the top with remaining 2-3 slices ham. Roll turkey breast in parchment paper (see Tip) then place in Varoma dish.

Place water in mixing bowl. Place covered Varoma into position then steam 80 min/Varoma/speed 1 or until turkey is fully cooked (see Tip). Set covered Varoma aside on a plate and leave turkey to rest for 20 minutes (see Tip).
Unwrap turkey then slice and serve with accompaniments of choice.
tips: A twist on roast turkey, this recipe is steamed in the Varoma, freeing up oven space on Christmas Day. Wrapping the turkey in Parma ham keeps the meat deliciously moist, and the flavourful stuffing complements the traditional Christmas lunch trimmings.
If spinach has already been washed, add 2 Tbsp water to mixing bowl before wilting.
The turkey breast can be refrigerated for up to 24 hours at the end of step 6 and cooked when needed.
To ensure the turkey is fully cooked, use a food thermometer - the temperature at the centre of the thickest part of the meat should be at least 74°C/165°F after cooking.
While the turkey is resting, discard the steaming water and make a gravy.

title: Cranberry Bacon Stuffing
ingredients: 50 g back bacon, sliced, cut into pieces
20 g butter, unsalted or salted (from cows' milk)
1 - 2 tsp verjuice, of white wine vinegar
100 g bread, slightly stale (approx. 2-3 slices), torn into pieces (3 cm)
steps: Place garlic, onion, bacon and butter into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then cook 2 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add cranberries, sage and verjuice or vinegar and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then cook 2 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add all remaining stuffing ingredients and chop 10 sec/speed 7. Transfer stuffing into a bowl and set aside to cool completely before use.
tips: Ensure your stuffing is completely cool before using.

Use this stuffing in the Whole steamed chicken or as a substitute to the apple and sage stuffing in the Turkey roulade. You can also bake your stuffing in the oven alongside any roasted meats. You can find these recipes on Cookidoo®.
Stuffing can be made in advance and frozen for up to 2 weeks. Defrost overnight in the refrigerator before using.

title: Camembert with Cranberries and Almonds
ingredients: 50 g yellow onion, peeled and cut into halves
cracker, any type or other savoury biscuits, to serve
steps: Place onions into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with aid of spatula.
Add cranberries, butter, sugar, vinegar and port and cook 5 min/100°C//speed 1 or until cranberries are soft.
Add almonds and cook 1 min/90°C//speed 1. Transfer into a small thermal serving bowl or other bowl and cover to keep warm.

Without cleaning the mixing bowl, place water into mixing bowl and place Varoma dish and tray into position. Line Varoma tray with a layer of aluminium foil, then top with a layer of parchment paper. Poke 3-4 holes in the paper and foil, then place wheel of Camembert onto parchment paper. Secure Varoma lid and steam 14-20 min/Varoma/speed 1 or until cheese is soft and melted in the middle (see Tips). Allow cheese to cool for 2-3 minutes, then transfer onto a serving plate. Top with cranberry mixture and serve with crackers or savoury biscuits.
tips: Do not use reduced-sugar dried cranberries in this recipe. The sugar in the cranberries helps caramelise the onion and almond mixture.

The amount of time needed when steaming the cheese will vary depending on the age, quality and temperature of cheese when cooking starts, so you may need to adjust accordingly. Older (riper) cheese at room temperature will melt more quickly.
If you purchase cheese that's already in a wax/foil packaging, you can steam your cheese in its packaging, just unwrap it and poke a few holes in the wrapping before steaming.
The cheese can also be baked in the oven (180°C/350°F) on a baking sheet for 10-15 minutes.

title: Spicy Honey
ingredients: 2 - 3 tbsp dried red chilli flakes, to taste
steps: Place chilli flakes, honey and garlic (optional) into mixing bowl and cook 3 min/80°C/speed 2. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cider vinegar and without measuring cup, mix 30 sec/speed 1.
Strain Spicy Honey through a sieve over an airtight glass jar and set aside to cool completely before closing with lid. Store at room temperature up to 2-3 months. Use as desired.
tips: Spicy Honey made with dried peppers or chili flakes can remain unstrained. Straining the honey will result in a smoother honey.
If the Spicy Honey is left unstrained, it will progressively increase the spice level.
Drizzle Spicy Honey on pizza, biscuits, fried chicken, roasted veggies or use on a cheese plate, the possibilities are endless!

title: Barbecue Onions (500 g)
ingredients: 500 g onions, cut in halves, then cut into wedges (1.2 cm/½ in.), divided
⅛ tsp ground black pepper, to taste
steps: Place 15 g oil and 255 g onions into mixing bowl and brown High Temp. . Transfer to a bowl, scrape off any caramelization from bottom of mixing bowl and add to bowl with onions.
Place remaining 15 g oil and 240 g onions into mixing bowl and brown High Temp. .
Add beer, salt, pepper, mustard, honey, Worcestershire sauce and reserved onions and without measuring cup cook 8 min/Varoma//speed 1. Serve or use as needed.
tips: Serve barbecue onions over burgers, hot dogs, steaks or sandwiches. Store any leftover onions in a sealable container and refrigerate for up to 2 days.
Replace beer with a hard cider.

title: Fermented beetroot dip
ingredients: 500 g beetroots, raw (approx. 3 beetroots), peeled and cut into pieces (approx. 3 cm/1 in.)
2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for covering dip
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in cashews. Add salt, cover with water and set aside to soak for 3-6 hours. Drain soaked cashews through simmering basket, discard soaking water and set aside.
Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F. Line a baking sheet (30 x 40 cm/12 x 16 in.) with parchment paper.
Place prepared baking sheet onto mixing bowl lid. Weigh beetroot onto baking sheet, season with salt, pepper and drizzle with olive oil. Roast 20-25 minutes (200°C/400°F), until tender.
Place garlic, contents of probiotic capsules, drained cashews and roasted beetroot into mixing bowl and start Blend /30 sec. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Carefully transfer mixture into sterilised airtight jars, filling three-quarters full. Gently tap bottom of jar on kitchen countertop. Pour olive oil over dip to completely cover (see Tip). Seal and store in a dark place away from direct sunlight for 24-48 hours or until small air pockets start to appear (see Tip). The dip will taste tangy and tart. Serve as desired or place into refrigerator until ready to use (see Tip).
tips: If you do not have time to soak/activate your cashews, soak nuts in boiling water for 30 minutes, then drain and use as directed.
You can store this dip in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Be careful to keep the jar topped with a layer of oil whenever you use some of the dip.

To increase shelf life, dehydrate drained cashews in oven (50°C/120°F) or dehydrator for 12-24 hours, until nuts have completely dried out. By using dehydrated, activated cashews, it will increase the shelf life of your dip to 12 days when dip is covered with oil.

Probiotics are live micro-organisms that can support digestive health and immune function, including improving resilience to infections and improving digestion of lactose. You can find them in the refrigerated section of most drug stores and health food stores. We recommend purchasing chilled probiotics, to ensure the organisms are most effective.

To avoid the lid popping off during fermentation, do not fill jars more than three-quarters full. When filling the jars, take care not to get any dip on the sides of the jar as if left exposed (not covered by oil), it may get mouldy and spoil the dip.
In colder climates, dip may take up to 4 days to ferment.

title: Smoked Mackerel Watercress Dip
steps: Place mackerel, baby watercress, cream cheese, yoghurt, ground mustard, nutmeg, lemon juice and sea salt into mixing bowl and blend 10 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides and lid of mixing bowl with spatula and blend again 10 sec/speed 7. Transfer to a bowl and serve or cover and refrigerate until needed.
tips: Delicious on toast or served as a dip with pita bread or crudités.

title: Steamed White Bread
ingredients: 230 g all-purpose flour, plus extra to dust
steps: Place 150 g water and dry yeast into mixing bowl and, heat 2 min/37°C/speed 2.
Add flour and salt and knead Dough /2 min 30 sec. Transfer to a floured work surface.

Lightly flour dough to prevent sticking, roll into a ball and place onto a greased shallow bowl or dish that fits into Varoma. Cover with a tea towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour).
Place remaining 1500 g water into mixing bowl, place dish with dough into Varoma dish, place Varoma dish into position, secure Varoma lid and steam 45 min/Varoma/speed 1.
Transfer to a cooling rack and allow to cool completely (see Tip). Once cooled, slice and serve immediately or toast before serving.
tips: This recipe allows you to make bread without the use of an oven. It is ideal for making toast.
Allowing the bread to cool completely in an open-air environment will allow a thin crust to develop.
To increase the nutritional value and fibre content of this bread, instead of 230 g all-purpose flour, use 75 g whole wheat flour and 155 g all-purpose flour.

title: Clam Boil
ingredients: 4 sweet corn cobs, cut into rounds (2.5 cm/1 in.)
340 g linguica sausage, cut into pieces (5 cm/2 in.)  o 340 g andouille sausage, pre-cooked
910 g mussels, in the shell, rinsed, scrubbed and beards removed
steps: Place shallots, garlic, thyme, bay leaves, water and white wine into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 4.
Insert simmering basket and weigh in potatoes. Place Varoma dish into position, weigh in corn, sausage and clams, secure Varoma lid and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 2.

Carefully remove Varoma lid and add mussels, secure Varoma lid and steam 10 min/Varoma/speed 2, until shells open. Remove Varoma. Remove simmering basket with spatula, set potatoes aside and keep warm.
Strain cooking liquid through a fine mesh sieve over a bowl and discard solids.
Place butter into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and melt 5 min/70°C/speed 2. Transfer to a bowl.

Transfer shellfish, corn, sausage and potatoes onto a large serving platter and drizzle with half the cooking liquid. Serve hot with lemon wedges, melted butter, remaining cooking liquid and crusty bread.
tips: Discard any clams that are open before cooking and those that do not open up after steaming.

Clams are often purged of sand and grit prior to being sold at supermarkets but still require rinsing before using. Wild clams or clams from smaller purveyors should always be purged. If clams require purging, omit ⅛ tsp salt from the sauce.

To clean clams: examine all clams for cracks, chips or broken shells. Discard any clams with broken shells. Completely submerge clams in a bowl of cool, fresh water, then cover with a damp kitchen towel and refrigerate for approximately 20 minutes. As the clams are soaking they will naturally purge any salt, sand and particles. Drain clams, refresh water and submerge clams again. You can repeat this process 2-3 times if desired to ensure the clams are thoroughly purged. Once purged, scrub off any barnacles, sand or other debris which may be on clam shells.
Replace cherrystone clams with smaller clams, like littleneck clams. Littlenecks cook quicker so add them in with the mussels.

title: Duck Confit Parmentier Maple-Scented
ingredients: 4 duck legs, skin on, bone in (approx.1 kg), rinsed and dried
1 tbsp fresh rosemary, leaves, coarsely chopped
30 - 60 g veal fond, or 30-60 g duck cooking juices, divided
30 g veal fond, or 30 g duck cooking juices
200 g leeks, cut lengthwise and sliced (0.5 cm)
700 g floury potatoes, e.g., Yukon Gold, Russet, peeled and cubed (2 cm)
black pepper, freshly ground, to taste
30 g maple sugar granules, to sprinkle
steps: Place 2 duck legs, skin side down, into a large sealable container. Season with pepper and 2 tsp salt. Top with crushed garlic, bay leaves, thyme sprigs and rosemary. Position remaining 2 duck legs on top, skin side up. Sprinkle with remaining 2 tsp salt, cover container with lid and refrigerate a minimum of 12 hours to overnight.
Remove garlic, bay leaves, thyme sprigs and rosemary from duck, transfer aromatics to a bowl and set aside. Rinse duck under cool water and pat dry with paper towel.
Place peppercorns and reserved aromatics in a pyrex baking dish (18 cm diam., 8 cm deep), then place duck legs, skin side down in the dish.

Place 500-550 g duck fat into mixing bowl and melt 4-6 min/90°C/speed 3, until completely melted. Pour melted fat over duck until completely submerged. Cover baking dish with a sheet of parchment paper and aluminum foil to seal.

Place 1500 g water and vinegar into mixing bowl. Place Varoma dish into position, lay 2 wooden skewers (18 - 19 cm long) across the base of Varoma dish and carefully set baking dish with duck on top of skewers to allow steam to circulate. Secure Varoma lid and steam 90 min/Varoma/speed 1 (see Tip). Remove Varoma and set aside.

Add remaining 1500 g water, set Varoma back into position, secure Varoma lid and steam 60 min/Varoma/speed 1. Check if meat pulls away from the bone; if necessary, steam a further 30 min/Varoma/speed 1. Transfer duck to a plate and set aside until cool enough to handle. Meanwhile, clean and dry mixing bowl.

Scrape duck legs to remove skin and meat from bone. Place duck meat, 20 g fat, 30-45 g veal fond or cooking juices and maple syrup into mixing bowl and cook 5 min/70°C/speed 1. Check consistency and if necessary, add 10-15 g veal fond or cooking juices and shred 3-5 sec//speed 1. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place 20 g duck fat, 30 g veal fond or duck cooking juices and leeks into mixing bowl and sauté High Temp. . Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Clean mixing bowl (see Tip).
Place parmesan and hazelnuts into mixing bowl insert measuring cup and grind Turbo/2.0 sec/2 times. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place potatoes, milk and salt into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 25 min/95°C//speed 1. Remove simmering basket and set aside. Check for doneness and if necessary, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook a further 5 min/95°C//speed 1 or until fork tender.
Add butter, nutmeg and pepper and mix 15 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 4 sec/speed 4.
Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F. Grease 4 ring moulds with duck fat, transfer to a baking sheet and set aside.

Place shredded duck meat in prepared ring moulds, cover duck with Sautéed Leeks, spread with Mashed Potatoes and sprinkle with reserved parmesan-hazelnut mixture, then bake 20-25 minutes (180°C/350°F). Sprinkle with maple sugar and serve immediately (See Tip).
tips: Confit is a term used to cook and preserve duck or other meat in its own fat.
Confit is a term used to cook and preserve duck or other meat in its own fat.
If specific size baking dish is unavailable, any small baking dish that fits in the Varoma dish and allows the Varoma lid to close securely can be used.

The amount of duck fat for melting depends on the size of the baking dish. Ensure there is enough melted amount of fat to fully submerge the duck in the baking dish and keep submerge throughout cooking.
Purchase containers of rendered duck fat at well-stocked supermarkets or online.
To clean mixing bowl: place 1000 g water and 30 g vinegar into mixing bowl and start Pre-clean/Brown bottom. Rinse and dry mixing bowl before proceeding with recipe.
Serve with a green salad.

Cover the confit duck with a layer of the strained duck fat and store it in a sealable container in the refrigerator for up to 1 month and use for roasting potatoes, cooking green beans and pan-frying veal.
Freeze strained duck fat in freezer safe containers. Duck fat can be reused 10 to 12 times.
Place shredded duck meat in a baking dish, cover the duck with Sautéed Leeks, spread with Mashed Potatoes and sprinkle with reserved parmesan-hazelnut mixture, then bake 20-25 minutes 180°C/350°F.

To serve duck legs whole: preheat oven to 180°C/355°F, remove the legs from their cooking fat and transfer to a baking sheet. Place them under the grill until their skin is golden and crispy. Serve with mashed potatoes or a purée of your choice and a green salad.

title: Pizza with Cashew Mozzarella (Matthew Kenney) Metric
ingredients: 425 g water, plus extra to soak
ice cold water, for water bath
cornmeal, to sprinkle  o all-purpose flour, to sprinkle
steps: Place water and yeast into mixing bowl and warm 3 min/40°C/speed 1.
Add flour and knead Dough /3 min.
Add olive oil and salt and knead Dough /5 min. Transfer dough to a floured surface, cover with cling film or damp tea towel and let rest 40 minutes.
Place rested dough in a covered container and allow to ferment overnight at room temperature. Meanwhile, continue with recipe.
Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in cashews, cover with water and soak for at least 4 hours. Drain and rinse nuts through a fine-mesh sieve and discard soaking water.
