Place reserved drained nuts and 425 g fresh water into mixing bowl and blend 30 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and start Blend /5 min. Meanwhile, fill a large container or pan halfway with ice water and set aside.

Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Add nutritional yeast, salt and citric acid, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 16 min/105°C/speed 3.5. Carefully remove simmering basket and set aside. Once thickened, transfer to a baking pan (approx. 30 cm x 25 cm x 5 cm). Place pan with mixture into prepared ice bath to chill while mixing with spatula to ensure a skin does not form. Cool until temperature reaches 13°C (approx. 10 min.), then transfer to an air-tight container and refrigerate for at least 8 hours before using.

Once dough has fermented, transfer to a floured surface and divide dough in half (approx. 225 g ea.). Quickly shape each half into a ball and place on a heavily floured baking sheet. Cover with a slightly damp tea towel and let rest and rise 1 hour and 40 minutes. Meanwhile, sprinkle stoneware pizza stone Paul with cornmeal and set aside. Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F.

Working with one dough ball at a time and keeping the other dough covered, flatten into a disk (approx. 30 cm). Transfer dough disk to prepared Paul press dough from centre to the edges with your fingertips, gently stretching into shape.

Evenly spread pizza base with your favourite pizza sauce. Top with dollops of Cashew Mozzarella and bake 15-20 minutes (220°C/425°F), depending on thickness of crust. Repeat with remaining dough. Serve warm.
tips: Vegan Cashew Mozzarella has a soft consistency. Spoon or dollop onto pizza, sandwiches, quesadillas, lasagna and/or caprese salad.

Nutritional yeast is not to be confused with brewer's yeast or baking yeast. It is a natural flavour booster that lends a cheesy, nutty or savoury flavour to many dishes. Available in the natural food section of your supermarket or in health food stores.
Grease stoneware dishes prior to first use (see instructions). The stoneware forms a natural non-stick layer with use, ensuring food can be easily released.

Stoneware dishes are not dishwasher safe. To preserve the natural non-stick coating, avoid using cleaning agents and dishwashing liquids. Instead, clean with hot water and a dish sponge or brush. Any lingering odours on the dishes are harmless. For stubborn food residue stuck to the stoneware, soak in warm water before cleaning. After cleaning, allow the stoneware to dry out completely in a place that is well-ventilated, both from above and from below; only store once completely dry.

title: Chevre (Matthew Kenney) Metric
ingredients: 370 g water, divided, plus extra to soak
2 probiotic capsules, powder only, casings removed
1 bunch fresh chives, chopped, to taste, divided
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in cashews and macadamia nuts, cover with water and soak for at least 4 hours to overnight. Drain nuts and discard soaking water.
Place drained nuts and 115 g fresh water into mixing bowl and blend 3 min/speed 8 (see Tip). Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and blend a further 3 min/speed 8 or until smooth.

Add contents of acidophilus capsules, stir with spatula to combine and mix 20 sec/speed 7. Pour mixture into a glass bowl that fits into Varoma, cover with cling film, place into Varoma dish and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place 255 g water and 30 g lemon juice into mixing bowl. Set Varoma with mixture into position, secure Varoma lid and start Fermentation /12 h/40°C. Remove Varoma and discard water from mixing bowl.

Once fermentation is complete, place a small bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in nutritional yeast, 15 g lemon juice, miso, white wine vinegar, salt and half the chives, fold into cheese mixture. Divide into four portions and transfer each to a piece of parchment. Use parchment to form cheese mixture into logs, twisting ends tightly and refrigerate until firm (approx. 4 hr.).
Once cheese is firm, remove from parchment, roll in remaining chives and slice to serve.
tips: Nutritional yeast is not to be confused with brewer's yeast or baking yeast. It is a natural flavour booster that lends a cheesy, nutty or savoury flavour to many dishes. Available in the natural food section of your supermarket or in health food stores.
The firm Chevre log can be rolled in five pepper spice, mushroom powder, olive tapenade, fresh ground black pepper, or fresh herbs like basil, chives, and dill with a drizzle of olive oil.

Chevre can be frozen. When freezing the cheese, wrap it carefully in waxed or cling film and place into a freezer bag. Use within 1-2 months. When ready to use, allow to thaw gradually; leave in the fridge for one or two days to slowly thaw.

title: Kabocha Squash Dumplings in Dashi Broth (Matthew Kenney) Metric
ingredients: 450 g fresh mushrooms, e.g. nameko, stems trimmed
500 g kabocha squash, peeled, deseeded and cubed (2.5 cm)
1 ½ tsp fresh ginger, grated, to taste (opcional)  o 1 ½ tsp ginger paste, to taste (opcional)
steps: Place cremini mushrooms and water into mixing bowl and chop 2 sec/speed 6.5. Place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 60 min/95°C/speed 1. Carefully remove simmering basket and set aside.

Add kombu, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 10 min/95°C//speed . Carefully remove simmering basket and set aside. Strain broth through a large fine-mesh strainer into a bowl. Discard kombu and reserve mushrooms for a later use (see Tip).
Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in nameko mushrooms and set aside.

Place 1360 g Mushroom Dashi Broth, tamari and cinnamon sticks into mixing bowl, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 8 min/95°C/speed 1. Carefully remove simmering basket and set aside. Add toasted coconut, remove mixing bowl, set aside and allow to steep 20 minutes.

Strain steeped broth through a fine-mesh strainer over reserved fresh mushrooms in bowl. Discard solids. Place strained broth with mushrooms into a large pot on stove top and bring to a simmer. Once simmering, remove from heat, cover with lid and continue with recipe.

Place 680 g water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma dish into position, weigh in squash, secure Varoma lid and steam 18-20 min/Varoma/speed 1 or until squash is tender. Remove Varoma and set aside. Empty mixing bowl
Place steamed squash into mixing bowl, add tamari, rice vinegar, coconut oil, ginger and agave, insert measuring cup and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Transfer to a bowl and allow to cool to room temperature.

Place 1 tbsp reserved filling in the centre of each wonton wrapper, wet the edge of half the circle with a little water, then carefully fold dough over filling to create a half-moon shape enclosing the filling. Pinch edges with fingertips to seal. Repeat with remaining ingredients. Transfer dumplings into Varoma dish and tray, standing dumplings to fit if necessary.

Place 570 g water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma with dumplings into position, secure Varoma lid and steam 20 min/Varoma/speed 1. Divide steamed dumplings between bowls, ladle in reserved broth, garnish with microgreens and serve.
tips: Use leftover mushrooms in stock or fry with garlic and olive oil and spread on toast.
Toast cinnamon sticks in a dry cast iron skillet.

Select a squash that looks heavy for its size, has splashes of golden or grayish hues on the exterior. The lighter gray the exterior, the sweeter it will be. Adding the optional ginger and agave will brighten the flavour of a less flavourful squash.
Not all flowers are edible, some are poisonous. Flowers should be purchased from a reliable source.
Those that suffer from pollen allergies, should not consume edible flowers.

title: Spicy Udon Noodles with Tempeh (Matthew Kenney) Metric
ingredients: 85 g dried shiitake mushrooms, thinly sliced
1 - 2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil, to fry
steps: Place a bowl onto mixing bowl lid, weigh in cashews, cover with water and soak for at least 4 hours to overnight. Drain and rinse nuts through a fine-mesh sieve and discard soaking water.
Place olive oil and paprika into mixing bowl and heat 3 min/70°C/speed 1. Strain through a coffee filter, allowing mixture to strain completely without stirring. Transfer to a jar and set aside.
Place hoisin, chickpea miso, tsuyu, agave, togarashi powder and reserved drained cashews into mixing bowl and blend 40 sec/speed 8. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place water and mushrooms into mixing bowl, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 20 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add kombu, insert measuring cup and cook 15 min/90°C//speed 1. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve into a large bowl, set broth aside and reserve mushrooms separately.

Place 1420 g water into mixing bowl and heat, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and Kettle /100°C. Meanwhile, heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat, add the tempeh and cook, stirring frequently, until lightly browned on all sides (approx. 5 min.). Transfer to paper towel, set aside. Heat chilli crisp oil in frying pan, sauté reserved mushrooms until golden and set aside.

Add udon noodles and, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook for time indicated on package/100°C//speed 1. Drain through simmering basket and rinse noodles with cold water. Divide between 6 bowls and set aside.

Place reserved Shiitake Dashi and Spicy Cashew Tare into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and heat 15 min/90°C/speed 1. Pour into bowls with reserved noodles, garnish with reserved sautéed mushrooms, reserved tempeh, edible flowers and a drizzle of Paprika Oil and serve.
tips: Chickpea miso can be found in better health food stores, or purchased online.
Not all flowers are edible, some are poisonous. Flowers should be purchased from a reliable source.
Those that suffer from pollen allergies, should not consume edible flowers.

title: Peanut Milk (Metric)
steps: Place peanuts into mixing bowl and grind Blend /30 sec. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add cardamom and vanilla and mix 10 sec/speed 7. Add water and start Blend /1 min.

Line simmering basket with a nut milk bag and place into a large bowl. Pour mixture into prepared simmering basket. Strain mixture through nut milk bag (squeezing to extract all liquid). Transfer to a bottle (approx. 1135 g), cover and refrigerate until ready to serve (see Tip).
tips: Shake well before drinking, as it tends to separate.
For additional sweetness, add 2 dried pitted dates with water and blend as per recipe.

title: Cinnamon Macadamia Nut Milk (Metric)
steps: Place macadamia nuts, water, date sugar, cinnamon and vanilla paste into mixing bowl and start Blend /3 min.

Line simmering basket with a nut milk bag and place into a large bowl. Pour mixture into prepared simmering basket. Strain mixture through nut milk bag (squeezing to extract all liquid). Transfer to a large carafe, cover and refrigerate until ready to serve (see Tip).
tips: Shake well before drinking, as it tends to separate.

To make your own vanilla paste: place 6-10 whole vanilla bean pods into mixing bowl and grind 20 sec/speed 10 or until pulverized. Add 3 tbsp pure vanilla extract and 2 tsp xanthan gum. Stir 3 sec/speed 3. Transfer into a glass jar and use as required.
Vanilla paste can be substituted measure-for-measure with vanilla extract.

title: Antonio Bachour: Chocolate Passion Fruit Bonbons (Metric)
ingredients: 115 g Valrhona chocolate discs, Jivara milk chocolate 40% (see Tip)  o 115 g milk chocolate 40%, high quality chips or chunks
300 g Valrhona chocolate discs, Jivara milk chocolate 40%, divided (see Tip)  o 300 g milk chocolate 40%, high quality chips or chunks, divided
185 g Valrhona chocolate discs, Jivara milk chocolate 40%, divided (see Tip)  o 185 g milk chocolate 40%, high quality chips or chunks, divided
steps: Polish a Pavoni bonbons chocolate mold (21 heart forms) and set aside (see Tip).

Place a microwave safe bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in red cocoa butter. Heat the red cocoa butter in the microwave until partially melted (approx. 20 sec.), then stir until fully melted (or shake if cocoa butter is in a squeeze bottle). Allow to cool before using (to approx. 30°C). If cocoa butter sets between coating molds, gently reheat bowl over warm water (see Tip).

Paint the mold cavities with red cocoa butter (see Tip). Use a bench scraper to scrape off any excess cocoa butter from top of mold before it sets. Repeat 1-2 times until cavities are completely coated, allow to dry between each application (see Tip).
Place passion fruit purée and glucose into mixing bowl and heat 3 min/60°C/speed 2.

Add 115 g chocolate and without measuring cup mix 1 min/speed 3. Transfer ganache to a bowl and let cool until firm and cool enough to handle (approx. 30 min.). Meanwhile thoroughly clean and dry mixing bowl and continue with the recipe.
Place 225 g chocolate into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and chop 8 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and heat 3 min/50°C/speed 2.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and heat a further 1 min/50°C/speed 2.
Add 75 g chocolate and without measuring cup mix 1 min/speed 3. Transfer to bowl and stir until a thermometer reads 30°C-32°C.
Generously pour chocolate into cocoa butter lined mold. Tap mold on counter to release any air bubbles. Turn mold upside down on parchment and tap to drain excess chocolate.

Use a wide bench scraper to scrape off excess chocolate from the molds. Place the mold upside down on a cooling rack over parchment and let drain a further 5 minutes. Then repeat the scraping process. Refrigerate for 5 minutes.

Once reserved Passion Fruit Ganache is cool enough to pipe, transfer to a piping bag. Fill the chocolate lined cavities, leaving a thin space on top to later seal with chocolate. Let ganache set at room temperature 1½ hours or until firm.
Place 140 g chocolate into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and chop 5 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and heat 3 min/50°C/speed 2.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and heat a further 1 min/50°C/speed 2.
Add 45 g chocolate and without measuring cup mix 1 min/speed 3. Transfer to bowl and stir until a thermometer registers 30°C-32°C.

Pour chocolate over the mold. Tap mold on counter to release any air bubbles. Once all cavities are filled and covered with chocolate, use a wide bench scraper to scrape the top of the mold in a fluid motion to create a smooth surface. Let chocolates set until firm (approx. 5-10 min.). Then refrigerate 10 minutes.
To unmold, flip mold onto a clean surface and tap to release any remaining bonbons and serve.
tips: Before first use, hand-wash molds in warm water (do not use soap); rinse and dry thoroughly with a soft cotton cloth. Polish the insides with cotton balls, so they are dust and grease-free. Moisture ruins melted chocolate, so be sure to thoroughly wipe and dry everything to remove condensation. Pavoni bonbons chocolate mold (21 heart forms) can be ordered online.
If a Pavoni bonbons chocolate mold is unavailable, a polycarbonate heart shaped candy mold can be used.

For best results we recommend using Valrhona or other couverture chocolate. The recipes will work with other chocolates but the results may be different. Valrhona is a high-quality couverture chocolate. Couverture is the name given to a certain class of high-quality chocolate. Couverture chocolate, unlike regular chocolate, is ground to a finer texture during the production process and contains a greater percentage of cocoa butter relative to the other ingredients. These two differences produce a superior flavour and texture that makes couverture the preferred chocolate for tempering and enrobing truffles, bonbons, and other fine candies.
Valrhona chocolate can be found at specialty markets or purchased online.
Red or other colour cocoa butter can be purchased at specialty bake shops or online.

If cocoa butter sets between coating molds, gently reheat bowl over warm water. When ready to use, fill a saucepan halfway with water. Place on stove top over medium heat and bring to a simmer. Position the bowl with red cocoa butter in the simmering water without submerging (water should be ½ of the bowl's height) and stir until fully melted and temperature reaches 30°C.
Glucose is a simple syrup used in baking that can be found at well stocked supermarkets, specialty and craft stores.

To make your own glucose syrup: place 45 g water and 45 g sugar into mixing bowl and heat 5 min/100°C/speed 1 until sugar is dissolved. Transfer into a jar and place in refrigerator to cool completely (approx. 15 min.) before using. Leftover syrup can be stored in the refrigerator in a sealed glass jar.

If red cocoa butter is unavailable, make the Passion Fruit Ganache as per recipe and set aside. Line a baking sheet with parchment. Place 115 g cocoa butter, in pieces into mixing bowl and with aid of spatula chop 8 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Add 170 g red chocolate buttons, i.e., candy melts and ½ tsp red gel food colouring and melt 8 min/45°C/speed 1. Once melted, turn Thermomix heat and timer off and stir speed 1 until temperature on Thermomix reaches 37°C. Working over parchment, pour melted chocolate mixture into the molds swirling to completely coat the cavities. Pour excess chocolate back into mixing bowl. Use a wide bench scraper to scrape the top of the mold with a fluid motion to create a smooth surface and refrigerate mold to set (10 min.). Then, without heat and timer off, stir speed 1 to keep chocolate fluid and repeat the processes, refrigerating the coated mold to set (10 min.). Once set, fill the chocolate lined cavities with reserved ganache, leaving a thin space on top to later seal with chocolate, place in the refrigerator to set (15-20 min.). Then, pour remaining melted chocolate over the mold (if chocolate sets up reheat 5 min/37°C/ speed 1). Once all cavities are filled and covered with chocolate, use a wide bench scraper to scrape the top of the mold with a fluid motion to create a smooth surface and refrigerate to set (20 min.). To unmold, flip onto a clean surface and tap to release any remaining bonbons.

title: Antonio Bachour: Passion Fruit Fondue with Brioche and Tropical Fruit (Metric)
ingredients: 210 g bread flour, plus extra to dust
90 g butter, unsalted, diced, chilled, plus extra to grease
1 egg yolk, from a large egg, whisked
85 g Valrhona chocolate discs, Jivara milk chocolate 40% (see Tip)  o 85 g milk chocolate 40%, high quality chunks or chips
30 g Valrhona chocolate, Manjari 64% dark chocolate (see Tip)  o 30 g dark chocolate 64%, high quality chunks or pieces
30 g apricot liqueur  o 30 g apricot nectar
tropical fruit, to serve (e.g. mango, banana, pineapple, starfruit, kiwi, dragon fruit, papaya)
steps: Place flour, eggs, egg yolks, sugar, glucose, yeast, milk and salt into mixing bowl and knead Dough /7 min. Meanwhile, grease a large bowl and set aside.

Add butter and knead Dough /2 min. Transfer dough to prepared bowl, (dough will be very sticky, this is normal) cover with cling film and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1-2 hr.). Meanwhile, grease a loaf pan (20 cm x 10 cm) and set aside.

Transfer dough onto a lightly floured surface and gently flatten with floured hands to form a rough rectangle. Roll the rectangle of dough into a log shape the length of the loaf pan. Place dough into prepared pan, seam side down and cover with cling film. Let loaf rise again in a warm place until doubled in size (approx. 1 hr.). Meanwhile, preheat oven to 350°F/175°C.
Brush surface with whisked egg yolk and bake 30 minutes (350°F/175°C) or until dark golden brown. Remove brioche from pan, transfer to a wire rack and allow to cool completely.
Place milk chocolate and dark chocolate into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add whipping cream, passion fruit purée and apricot liqueur and heat 5 min/85°C/speed 1.5. Transfer to a small serving bowl.
Cut the brioche into cubes, slice tropical fruits into bite sized pieces and place on a serving platter. Serve with fondue for dipping.
tips: For best results we recommend using Valrhona or other couverture chocolate. The recipes will work with other chocolates but the results may be different. Valrhona is a high-quality couverture chocolate. Couverture is the name given to a certain class of high-quality chocolate. Couverture chocolate, unlike regular chocolate, is ground to a finer texture during the production process and contains a greater percentage of cocoa butter relative to the other ingredients. These two differences produce a superior flavour and texture that makes couverture the preferred chocolate for tempering and enrobing truffles, bonbons, and other fine candies.
Valrhona chocolate can be found at specialty markets or purchased online.
The brioche dough is very sticky, this is normal.
Glucose is a simple syrup used in baking that can be found at well stocked supermarkets, specialty and craft stores.

To make your own glucose syrup place 45 g water and 45 g sugar into mixing bowl and heat 5 min/100°C/speed 1 until sugar is dissolved. Transfer into a jar and place in refrigerator to cool completely (approx. 15 min.) before using. Leftover syrup can be stored in the refrigerator in a sealed glass jar.
Replace Valrhona milk and dark chocolates with 115 g Valrhona white chocolate Ivoire 35% and continue as per recipe.

title: Checkerboard Sablés (Metric)
steps: Place sugar into mixing bowl and grind 15 sec/speed 10. Transfer half the ground sugar to a bowl and set aside.
Add flour, butter, egg, vanilla and mix 25 sec/speed 5.
Transfer dough to cling film, quickly shape into a flat square and refrigerate 20 minutes.
Place flour, butter, reserved ground sugar, egg, cocoa, vanilla and salt into mixing bowl and mix 25 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 5 sec/speed 5.
Transfer dough to cling film, quickly shape into a flat square and refrigerate 20 minutes.

On two pieces of parchment, roll out the vanilla and chocolate doughs separately into large rectangles (approx. 15 cm x 25 cm x 6 mm). Place dough with parchment into freezer for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, see Tip before proceeding to next step.

Place the chilled chocolate dough on top of the vanilla dough. Gently seal the two doughs together by lightly rolling over the top with a rolling pin. Cut the stacked rectangle lengthwise into thirds (5 cm wide), stack the 3 strips on top of each other and refrigerate 30 minutes.

Cut the stack in half lengthwise, then cut each strip in half lengthwise once more, creating four 1.25 cm strips. Lay each strip with the striped pattern facing up and stack with alternating edge colors. Chill briefly in freezer to firm dough. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 325°F/160°C and line 2 baking sheets with parchment.
Remove the checkerboard log from freezer and place on a cutting board. With a sharp knife cut the chilled log into thin slices (6 mm) and place on prepared baking sheets, 2.5 cm apart.
Bake 15-18 minutes (325°F/160°C). Let cool before serving.
tips: Recipe inspired by Jocelyn Bérubé Thermomix® Independent Consultant Québec, Canada.
Brush each layer of dough with whisked egg white so the layers adhere and seal together.

title: Bourbon Ginger Fizz (Metric)
ingredients: 30 g vermouth, dry, e.g. Noilly Prat Rouge
steps: Place bourbon, vermouth, ginger syrup, lemon juice and water into mixing bowl and mix 6 sec/speed 5.
Pour over ice, garnish with thyme, candied ginger and lemon slices and serve.

title: Mystery Soup
ingredients: 150 g smoked bacon, sliced, cut into pieces (approx. 13 mm/½ in.)
200 g yellow onion, cut into quarters (approx. 1 onion)
3 garlic cloves  o 3 garlic cloves, confit (see Tip)
700 g winter squash flesh, cut into pieces (approx. 2.5 cm/1 in.) (see Tip)
¼ tsp ground black pepper, to taste
steps: Place bacon into mixing bowl, evenly distribute in mixing bowl with spatula and sauté High Temp. . Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place onion, garlic, carrots, rosemary, and thyme into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and paprika, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Remove simmering basket from mixing bowl lid and set aside.
Add winter squash, insert measuring cup and chop 10 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add water, stock paste and pepper, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 25 min/100°C/speed 1. Remove simmering basket and set aside, insert measuring cup and start Blend /30 sec.
Transfer soup into serving bowls (see Tip) and garnish with reserved bacon and cream. Serve immediately.
tips: Please refer to Cookidoo® for the Vegetable Stock Paste recipe in our Tm Basics-Stocks & Pastes collection.
Please refer to Cookidoo® for the Confit Garlic recipe in our Tm Basics - Condiments collection.

To serve soup in a pumpkin tureen (as in image), place a large saucepan or stockpot over high heat, fill about halfway with water (enough to cover pumpkin) and bring to the boil. Cut a lid from the pumpkin and scoop out seeds. Immerse pumpkin into boiling water (top up with water as needed to cover) for 5-10 minutes, then carefully transfer pumpkin into a large container of cold water to stop cooking. Place the pumpkin upside down on a wire rack to drain. To serve, fill the pumpkin with soup, garnish with bacon and sour cream and serve immediately. The pumpkin flesh will not be cooked enough to eat and should only be used for decorative purposes.

The skin of most varieties of squash is edible. It is full of fibre and nutrients and can be left without peeling to save time and reduce food waste. The orange or pale skin of Red Kuri and Butternut squash can be left on and won't affect the final colour of the soup.
Vary the flavours of this soup by using different varieties of winter squash: butternut, acorn, kabocha, red kuri, etc.

title: Green Smoothie Bowls (Matthew Kenney) Metric
ingredients: 385 g bananas (approx. 3 med.), cut into pieces and frozen (see Tip)
hemp seeds, to sprinkle, to garnish
steps: Place coconut water, salt, lime juice, ginger, spirulina, spinach, kale, banana, mango and ice into mixing bowl and blend 20 sec/speed 8.

Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and blend a further 30 sec/speed 8. Divide smoothie mixture between 3 bowls. Garnish each serving with blueberries, sliced strawberries and kiwi. Sprinkle with hemp seeds and serve.
tips: Other topping options: banana, almond slivers, pumpkin seeds, berries, coconut flakes, pomegranate, granola or any of your favourite toppings.
Cut bananas into pieces, spread out on a tray, freeze, then use frozen bananas in recipe or transfer to a freezer bag for later use.

Acai Smoothie Bowl: Place 225 g almond milk, 1 pinch salt, 2 tbsp date paste, 1 packet (100 g) frozen acai, 1 banana, cut into pieces, 115 g frozen strawberries and 60 g frozen blueberries into mixing bowl and blend 20 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and blend a further 30 sec/speed 8. Divide between bowls and garnish with your favourite toppings.

Dragon Fruit Smoothie Bowl: Place 225 g coconut water, 1 pinch salt, 1 packet (100 g) frozen dragon fruit, 225 g frozen pineapple chunks and 115 g frozen mango chunks into mixing bowl and blend 20 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and blend a further 30 sec/speed 8. Divide between bowls and garnish with your favourite toppings.

title: Plant-Based Alfredo Sauce (Matthew Kenney) Metric
ingredients: 115 g extra virgin olive oil, divided
500 g vegan whipping cream, e.g. Silk®, Flora™
pasta, any type, cooked, to serve
steps: Place 100 g olive oil and garlic into mixing bowl, evenly distribute in mixing bowl with spatula and start High Temp. . Remove mixing bowl, open mixing bowl lid and allow mixture to cool in mixing bowl until temperature reaches 100°C (set mixing bowl into position to check temperature).
Add vegan cream, vegan butter, 15 g olive oil, nutritional yeast and thyme, insert measuring cup and heat 30 min/90°C/speed 1. Then, start Blend /30 sec.
Season with salt to taste and serve hot over pasta.
tips: Nutritional yeast is not to be confused with brewer's yeast or baking yeast. It is a natural flavour booster that lends a cheesy, nutty or savoury flavour to many dishes. Available in the natural food section of your supermarket or in health food stores.

title: Fattoush with grilled haloumi
ingredients: 250 gram water, plus 1 extra tbsp for dissolving
2 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil, for brushing and frying
200 gram cherry tomato, cut into halves
2 Lebanese cucumber (approx. 235 g), deseeded and cut into pieces (2 cm)
1 red bell pepper (approx. 225 g), deseeded and cut into pieces (2 cm)
1 green pepper (approx. 180 g), deseeded and cut into pieces (2 cm)
½ red onion, cut into thin slices
4 radish, red, then cut into thin slices
7 sprig flat-leaf parsley, leaves only, torn into pieces
7 sprig cilantro, fresh, leaves only, torn into pieces
1 - 2 pinch black pepper, ground, to taste
steps: Place milk into mixing bowl and heat 10 min/37°C/speed 1.
Place junket tablets and 1 tbsp of the water into a separate bowl and stir to combine.

Add junket mixture into mixing bowl and combine 1 min/speed 1. Transfer milk into a warmed thermal serving bowl or warmed large ceramic bowl, then cover and set aside for 1 hour. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Leave curds in warmed bowl and cut curds into strips (2 cm) both ways at a 45° angle (into diamond shapes). Allow to sit for another 10 minutes to develop the curds and whey.
Place curds and whey into mixing bowl and heat 30 min/37°C/speed .

Place simmering basket over a jug and line with a nut milk bag or 2 layers of muslin cloth. Transfer curds and whey into lined simmering basket. Cover curds and whey with top of nut milk bag or excess cloth, then place a heavy weight on top of curds and whey. Set aside for 30 minutes, allowing whey to drain (do not discard whey).
Set simmering basket with curds aside, transfer whey into mixing bowl and heat 5 min/90°C/speed 1.

Remove curds and cut into slices (1 cm thickness). Place curd pieces back into unlined simmering basket. Insert simmering basket with curds and cook 30 min/90°C/speed . Remove simmering basket with aid of spatula and set haloumi aside to cool. Transfer whey into a jug and set aside.
Place water and salt into mixing bowl and heat for 3 min/100°C/speed 1.
Add 250 g of the reserved whey and cook 5 min/100°C/speed 1. Transfer into a sealable container and set aside to cool. Discard excess whey.
Add haloumi to cooled brine mixture and place into refrigerator until ready to serve. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place garlic into mixing bowl and chop 3 sec/speed 7. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add all remaining salad dressing ingredients and mix 10 sec/speed 6. Transfer into a jug and set aside until ready to serve.

Preheat oven grill. Place pita breads onto baking tray (30 x 40 cm) and toast both sides for 1-2 minutes each, until puffed and starting to crisp. Carefully remove baking tray from grill, slice pita breads into halves horizontally and open into 4 separate pieces. Brush with a little oil, return to grill and toast the inside until golden brown (approx. 1 minute). Carefully tear into bite-size pieces and set aside to cool.

Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh cherry tomatoes into it. Add cucumber, capsicums, onion, radish and herbs into large bowl. Add pita pieces and reserved dressing and stir to combine. Season to taste with salt and pepper, then divide between 4 serving plates.
Drain haloumi and pat dry. Place a frying pan over medium-high heat and add oil. Fry haloumi until golden (approx. 1-2 minutes each side).
Arrange over salad and drizzle with extra lemon juice, if desired. Serve immediately.
tips: Junket tablets contain rennet, which helps form milk curds to make cheese. You can buy junket tablets at most major supermarkets.
To warm a thermal serving bowl or ceramic bowl, fill with hot water, let stand for a few minutes, then discard water and dry bowl.
You can store haloumi in the refrigerator for 1-2 weeks in the brine mixture. The longer it is soaked in the brine, the saltier it will taste.
This dish is a good source of both vitamin C (used for iron absorption) and calcium.

title: Grilled Pork Skewers with Turmeric
ingredients: 5 g ginger, fresh, peeled, cut in round slices (2 mm)
½ stick lemon grass, fresh, tough outer layer removed, cut in pieces (2 cm)
680 g pork tenderloin, cut in large pieces (4 cm)
steps: Place coriander seeds and cumin seeds in mixing bowl and toast 10 min/120°C/speed 3.
Add ginger, oil, garlic and lemon grass then grind 20 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then grind again 20 sec/speed 10.
Add turmeric, curry powder, salt, sugar, and coconut milk then mix 5 sec/speed 3. Transfer to a bowl.
Place bowl with marinade on mixing bowl lid then weigh in pork. Stir well then cover with cling film and marinate in fridge for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Soak skewers in warm water for 30 minutes. Towards the end of soaking time, preheat grill to 230°C/450°F.
Thread marinated pork onto skewers (approx. 3 pieces per skewer).
Place skewers on grill tray lined with foil then grill for 15-20 minutes turning occasionally. Serve hot.

title: Creamy Potato Salad
steps: Place celery and ½ onion into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 6. Transfer to bowl and set aside.

Place mayonnaise, mustard, onion powder, garlic powder, celery seeds and salt into mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Add relish and mix 3 sec//speed 3. Transfer to a large bowl, cover with cling wrap and refrigerate. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.

Place water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma into position, weigh in potatoes and eggs, secure Varoma lid and steam 27 min/Varoma/speed 3. Remove Varoma, carefully remove eggs and set aside. Return Varoma with potatoes into position, secure Varoma lid and steam a further 8 min/Varoma/speed 3, until potatoes are cooked through. Meanwhile, peel eggs under running water. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.

Place peeled eggs into mixing bowl and chop 4 sec/speed 3. Immediately transfer potatoes into bowl with reserved mayonnaise mixture. Add chopped eggs and reserved celery-onion mixture, toss to coat potatoes, refrigerate to cool (approx. 1 hr.). Transfer to a serving bowl. Dust with smoked paprika and serve.
tips: For extra flavor, add a splash of pickle juice to the dressing mixture.
Use Yukon gold potatoes for a creamier texture or russet potatoes for a firmer bite.

title: Culinary Demo 2 (Sensor)
ingredients: 500 g mixed frozen red berries  o 500 g frozen fruit, any type
10 - 30 g lime juice, to taste  o 10 - 30 g lemon juice, to taste
2 pasteurized egg whites (see Tip)  o 60 g liquid egg whites, pasteurized
100 g fresh mixed red berries, to garnish
60 g unsalted butter, softened to room temperature, plus extra to grease
395 g bananas, cut into pieces (approx. 4 bananas)
170 - 200 g brown sugar (see Tip)  o 170 - 200 g granulated sugar
1 red bell pepper (approx. 150 g), cut into pieces
1 dessert apple (e.g. Granny Smith or Pink Lady), (approx. 150 g), quartered
30 g pine nuts  o 30 g sunflower seeds
15 g fruit vinegar  o 15 g white balsamic vinegar
1 tsp salt  o 1 tsp herb salt
45 g unsalted butter, cold, cubed (1 cm), divided
285 g risotto rice (e.g. Carnaroli, Arborio) with 14-15 minutes cooking time (see Tip)
1 stock cube, vegetable or beef  o 1 heaping tsp stock paste, homemade, vegetable or beef
steps: Place sugar into mixing bowl and grind 15 sec/speed 10.
Add frozen berries, lime juice and pasteurized egg whites (see Tip) and start Blend /1 min.
Insert butterfly whisk and whip 3 min/speed 3.5. Remove butterfly whisk. Garnish with fresh berries and serve cold in dessert bowls.
Place lemons, 500 g water and sugar into mixing bowl and mix Turbo/2.0 sec/1 time.
Add 500 g water. Insert simmering basket, hold it in place with spatula and strain lemonade into a pitcher. Add ice cubes and serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 175°C/350°F. Grease a loaf pan (23 cm x 13 cm), (see Tip) and set aside.
Place butter, banana, sugar, eggs, yogurt and vanilla into mixing bowl and mix 10 sec/speed 4.
Add flour, baking soda and salt and mix 10 sec/speed 4. Scrape down sides and bottom of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 10 sec/speed 4.
Transfer to prepared loaf pan and bake 60-70 minutes (175°C/350°F) or until a wooden skewer inserted in centre of the bread comes out clean.
Allow to cool in pan 10 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack. Serve warm or allow to cool completely then wrap in foil until ready to serve.
Place broccoli, red pepper, apple, pine nuts, oil, vinegar, honey, mustard, salt and black pepper into mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 4. Serve at room temperature. Rinse and dry mixing bowl.
Place Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl and grate 10 sec/speed 10. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place onion, garlic, olive oil and 30 g butter into mixing bowl and sauté High Temp. . Insert measuring cup and chop 3 sec/speed 5.
Add rice and without measuring cup sauté 3 min/120°C//speed 1.
Add wine and without measuring cup cook 1 min/100°C//speed 1.

Add water, stock cube and salt. Scrape bottom of mixing bowl thoroughly with spatula to loosen rice. Place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 13 min/100°C//speed 1. Check for doneness and if necessary, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook a further 2 min/100°C//speed 1.
Allow risotto to rest in mixing bowl for 1 minute, then transfer into a serving bowl. Using spatula, combine risotto with 15 g butter and reserved grated Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.
tips: Berry Dream
Look for pasteurized eggs right next to the regular eggs in your grocery store.

To pasteurize eggs: wash eggs. Place 1135 g water into mixing bowl and boil 15 min/60°C/speed 3. Insert simmering basket and place in eggs. When temperature reaches 60°C, pasteurize 3 min 30 sec/60°C/speed 0.5. Immediately remove eggs and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking process.
Raw eggs are not recommended for infants, the elderly, pregnant women, or people with weakened immune systems.
Banana Bread
Brown sugar gives a more caramelized flavour, darker colour and moister texture.
Color and time may vary based on oven calibration and type of pan used. Glass and anodized pans will create a darker crust.
Fan-forced ovens circulate the hot air, resulting in a faster cooking time, as well as quicker browning.
Bake on the middle shelf of the oven to ensure even heat distribution. Minimize opening the door during baking, as this will decrease the overall temperature of the oven.
Lemonade
Choose smaller lemons with smooth shiny peel, as these are juicier and have less white pith.
For sweeter or tarter lemonade, adjust sugar to taste.
Replace lemons with either 2 small oranges or 1 grapefruit, quartered.
Broccoli Salad with Red Pepper and Pine Nuts
Make the broccoli salad ahead and chill in the refrigerator.
Parmesan Risotto
Adjust cooking time according to time indicated on rice package.
Liquid absorption can vary according to type of rice. If risotto seems dry before it is cooked through, add more liquid.

Rule of thumb for creating your own risotto recipe: for every 100 g risotto rice you will need 285 g liquids (water and wine) combined with stock paste. The maximum quantity of rice that can be cooked at any one time for this basic recipe is 500 g. Note that adding other ingredients (e.g. mushrooms or sausage) will increase overall volume of the dish, so adjust rice quantity accordingly.
Saffron Risotto: while adding rice add 2 pinches saffron.*

Mushroom Risotto: after high heat sauté and add 250 g fresh mushrooms (cut into pieces if too large) or 60 g dried mushrooms (soaked in water for 30 minutes, water squeezed out). Insert measuring cup and chop 3 sec/speed 5. Proceed as directed by recipe. Saffron can also be added in this variation.

Vegan version: replace butter with olive oil, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook without high heat mode 5 min/120°C/speed 1. Replace Parmesan with vegan Parmesan. To make vegan Parmesan: place 110 g cashews, 2 tsp nutritional yeast and ½ tsp salt into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and grind 10 sec/speed 6.
Pine nuts can be replaced with other nuts in the Broccoli Salad.

title: Miso Mushrooms Toast with Tahini Yogurt
ingredients: 170 g silken tofu, any type, cut into pieces
395 g shiitake mushroom, fresh, thinly sliced
2 tsp mirin  o 2 tsp sherry wine, dry
1 tsp sweet soy sauce (Kecap Manis) (see Tip)
1 pinch white pepper, ground, to season
steps: Place tofu, yogurt, tahini, honey, vinegar, salt, garlic powder and pepper into mixing bowl and mix 20 sec/speed 3.5 Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and heat Warm Up /60°C/speed 1. Transfer to a serving bowl and keep warm. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place water into mixing bowl. Insert simmering basket, weigh in mushrooms and steam 3 min/Varoma/speed . Remove simmering basket with spatula and set aside. Discard remaining water in mixing bowl.
Place butter and 200 g of steamed mushrooms into mixing bowl and start High Temp. .
Add mirin, soy sauce (kecap manis) and remaining 200 g mushrooms and start High Temp. 
Add miso and pepper and cook 2 min/50°C//speed 1. Meanwhile toast sourdough bread.
Spread Tahini Yogurt onto Sourdough Toast and top with Miso Mushrooms. Serve warm.
tips: You can use a mixture of fresh mushrooms.
This recipe is great served with wilted spinach, poached eggs, feta and arugula. Find the recipes for Poached Eggs on Cookidoo®.
Kecap manis is a type of sweet soy sauce and can be found in Asian markets. Replace kecap manis with half soy sauce and half honey.
Refrigerate Tahini Yogurt for up to 1 week. Use as a dip or spread.
Tahini Yogurt can be served warm or cold.

title: Cheat's Sriracha Sauce
ingredients: 500 g red chillies, fresh, trimmed and cut into halves
1 - 2 tbsp golden brown sugar, plus extra to taste
steps: Place salt and water into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and heat 2 min/100°C/speed 1. Set aside to cool.

Place a sterilised sealable jar (approx. 1L) onto mixing bowl lid and weigh in chillies. Add garlic, pushing down tightly to compact chillies. Cover with reserved cooled salt water, seal jar and store at room temperature for 7 days.

Place simmering basket over a large pitcher and pour chillies and garlic into it. Set aside to drain, reserving fermenting liquid. Place vinegar, brown sugar and drained fermented chillies and garlic into mixing bowl and without measuring cup, cook 10 min/100°C/speed 1, until slightly reduced (see Tips).

Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then blend 1 min/speed 9. Strain mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a bowl; discard any solids. Adjust thickness with reserved fermenting liquid and adjust sugar to taste. Transfer into a sterilised sealable jar, and serve as desired.
tips: Traditional Sriracha sauce is made with red jalapeño chillies; they aren't easy to find, so we used long red chillies.
We recommend cooking in a ventilated area as there may be strong fumes from the chillies as they are cooking.
You can store this sauce in a sealable container in the refrigerator for up to 3 months.

title: Ghostly Pizza
ingredients: 2 tsp dried yeast  o 20 g fresh yeast, crumbled
370 g all-purpose flour  o 370 g white bread flour
30 g extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for greasing
250 g chopped tomatoes, canned  o tomato passata
125 g fresh mozzarella, in one large block
steps: Place water, sugar, activated charcoal powder and yeast into mixing bowl and heat 3 min/37°C/speed 1.

Add flour, oil and salt and knead Dough /3 min. Meanwhile, grease a large bowl. Transfer dough to prepared bowl and shape into a ball. Cover bowl with reusable wrap or a cling film and leave dough to rise until doubled in size (approx. 1 hour).
Preheat oven to 230°C/450°F and line a baking sheet (approx. 40 x 35 cm/16 x 14 in.) with parchment paper and set aside.

Place dough on prepared baking sheet and shape into a rectangle the size of the baking sheet by pressing with fingertips and stretching it gently. Form a small ridge around the edges and let proof for 20 min.
Spread chopped tomatoes or passata on top of dough then bake pizza for 15-18 minutes (230°C/450°F). Meanwhile, continue with recipe.

Halve 5 olives lengthways, trim nicely to create 5 bodies of spiders. Cut another 5 olives lengthways into very thin slices to create 8 legs for each spider. Cut block of fresh mozzarella into 5 mm/¼ in. thick slices. Using scissors, cut a piece of thin cardboard into a ghost shape which is a bit smaller than each mozzarella slice. Place cardboard ghost shape onto a mozzarella slice, then, using small, sharp knife, cut mozzarella slice into ghost shape (see tip). Cut 3-5 olives into very small pieces or squares. Using a sharp knife, make 3 small holes in mozzarella ghost, then insert 3 small pieces of cut olives into these 3 holes to create eyes and mouth of ghost. Repeat with remaining mozzarella slices. Place mozzarella ghosts between two double sheets of paper towel then press slightly to dry them.

Remove pizza from oven, arrange olive spiders all over pizza, then place mozzarella ghosts between olive spiders. Bake 3 minutes (230°C/450°F) or until cheese just starts to melt. Use paper towel to soak up excess liquid from mozzarella ghosts on pizza and bake a further 1-2 minutes (230°C/450°F) until cheese is melted.
Remove pizza from oven, sprinkle with dried oregano (avoiding mozzarella ghosts), slice and serve.
tips: Activated charcoal is a food-grade ingredient and can be added to various food and non-food products, from ice cream to toothpaste. This ingredient can be ordered through many online retailers.
Use leftover mozzarella in another recipe.

title: Pineapple and Orange Glazed Ham
ingredients: 5000 g ham, cured, whole leg on the bone
steps: Place all glaze ingredients into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 20-25 min/100°C/speed 3, or until glaze is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon. Transfer glaze into a ceramic or glass bowl and set aside to cool.
Place an oven shelf into the lowest possible position and remove all other shelves. Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F and set aside a rectangular baking dish (35 x 30 cm).
Using a sharp knife, cut a circle around the leg bone of the ham through the rind (approx. 10 cm from the end).

Very carefully cut a horizontal line through the centre of the ham, from the top end of the ham to the leg bone, ensuring you only cut the rind and not into the fat. Run your fingers underneath the rind and lift one half of the rind from the layer of fat underneath, then discard rind. Repeat with remaining half of the rind.
Score the fat of the ham approx. 5 mm deep in a diamond pattern, then transfer ham into rectangular baking dish.
Brush ⅓ of the reserved glaze over the ham and stud the centre of each diamond with 1 whole clove (optional), pushing the clove into the fat.

Bake 30 minutes (180°C/350°F), then reduce oven temperature to 160°C/320°F and cook for a further 45 minutes-1 hour, re-brushing the ham with the glaze every 20 minutes, until the glaze has caramelized and the ham is cooked through.
Transfer ham onto a serving plate, carve and serve.
tips: To serve as part of a cold lunch, allow ham to cool for 15-20 minutes, then transfer into the refrigerator to cool completely. Serve ham sliced on a cold meat platter.

title: Meat Stock Paste
ingredients: 300 g meat, sinew free, boneless, cut into pieces, partially frozen
300 g roots and vegetables, mixed (e.g. celery, carrots, onions, garlic, tomatoes), cut into pieces as needed
4 sprigs fresh mixed herbs (e.g. sage, rosemary), leaves only
steps: Place meat pieces into mixing bowl and grind 10 sec/speed 7. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place mixed roots and vegetables and fresh mixed herbs into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add coarse salt, red wine, bay leaf, whole clove and reserved ground meat. Place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 25 min/Varoma/speed 2. Mixture will thicken and become fairly dry.
Remove simmering basket. insert measuring cup and blend 1 min/speed 4-7 increasing speed gradually. Transfer into a sealable container and allow to cool before using or storing in the refrigerator.
tips: 1 tbsp stock paste is roughly equivalent to 1 store-bought meat stock cube.
To make meat stock, use 1 tbsp per 500 g water.
You can store stock paste in a sealable container in the refrigerator for several months.
The salt in this recipe is used as a preservative. When mixed with water as described above, the stock does not taste too salty.
If you wish to decrease the salt in the recipe, we recommend you store the stock paste in the freezer (freeze using ice cube trays to portion the paste).
Small quantities of sea vegetables, such as dulse, wakame or kombu, can be added to the stock for extra flavour and nutrients.
Use a mixture of red and white wine for this recipe if desired.
Adapt this recipe using any leftover vegetables in your refrigerator. Weigh into the mixing bowl to ensure quantities are consistent with the recipe.

title: Fish Stock
ingredients: 300 - 500 g fish bones, cut into pieces (approx. 5 cm/1 in.) (see Tip)
300 - 350 g Spanish onions, cut into pieces
steps: Place water. fish bones, onions, salt, bay leaves and peppercorns into mixing bowl. Place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and cook 30 min/100°C//speed 1.
Using a fine-mesh sieve, carefully strain stock into a large air-tight jar and set aside to cool. Discard solids. Once cool, use as needed or cover and store in refrigerator for up to 3 days.
tips: You can buy fish bones from your local fishmonger. You can also use fish heads; it will give the stock a darker colour.

title: Bacon-wrapped turkey leg with potatoes
ingredients: 150 g bacon slices  o 150 g ham slices
800 g turkey leg, skinless, bone in  o 800 g chicken legs, skinless, bone in
20 g extra virgin olive oil (2 tbsp)
600 g potatoes, cut in pieces (4 cm)
steps: Place garlic cloves in mixing bowl and chop 5 sec/speed 5.

Place a large sheet of baking paper (approx. 40 cm x 60 cm) on the work surface. Arrange rosemary sprigs on baking paper, then arrange 50 g bacon slices side by side. Place turkey leg on bacon and rub meat with chopped garlic. Season with ½ tsp salt and black pepper, then wrap turkey in the bacon on which it is resting and cover with remaining 100 g bacon slices. Drizzle with olive oil. Fold baking paper to form a parcel, twist ends tightly to retain the cooking juices and place parcel in Varoma dish.
Place water and remaining ½ tsp salt in mixing bowl. Set Varoma in position and steam 50 min/Varoma/speed 1. Meanwhile peel and cut the potatoes in pieces (4 cm).

Set Varoma aside. Insert simmering basket in mixing bowl and add potatoes to it. Set Varoma back in position and steam 30 min/Varoma/speed 1. Remove Varoma and check that turkey leg is cooked. If necessary steam a further 3-10 min/Varoma/speed 1 (for every 100 g additional weight of turkey leg, add approx. 3 minutes).

Remove Varoma and carefully open parcel, reserving collected juices. Transfer turkey leg to a serving dish and cut meat in slices. Drizzle cooking juices over turkey slices and serve hot with potatoes.
tips: This dish is as festive as any roast, moist and flavourful, and very easy to prepare. You can enjoy your guests’ company while it steams in the Varoma, and the clean-up after they leave is quick and simple.

To make sure a few holes in the Varoma dish remain unobstructed for steam to circulate, you can place the butterfly whisk in the centre of the Varoma dish underneath the meat parcel to raise it off the bottom of the Varoma dish.

title: Macadamia Ricotta (Matthew Kenney) Metric
ingredients: ice cold water, for water bath
steps: Place macadamia nuts and water into mixing bowl and start Blend /5 min. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add salt, citric acid and nutritional yeast and cook 8 min/90°C/speed 6. Meanwhile, fill a large container or pan halfway with ice water and set aside. Line simmering basket with a nut milk bag and place into a large bowl.

Once thickened, transfer loose ricotta mixture to a baking pan (approx. 30 cm x 25 cm x 5 cm). Place pan with mixture into prepared ice bath to chill while mixing with spatula to ensure a skin does not form. Cool until temperature reaches 13°C (approx. 10 min.), then carefully pour ricotta mixture into prepared simmering basket. Strain through nut milk bag (squeezing to extract all liquid). Transfer ricotta to a container, cover and refrigerate at least 8 hours before serving.
tips: Refrigerate Macadamia Ricotta in an air-tight container and consume within one week.

Nutritional yeast is not to be confused with brewer's yeast or baking yeast. It is a natural flavour booster that lends a cheesy, nutty or savoury flavour to many dishes. Available in the natural food section of your supermarket or in health food stores.
The colour of Ricotta may vary depending on the nutritional yeast and type of macadamia nuts used.

title: Seared Scallops with Carrot and Ginger Sauce (Hestan Cue™) Metric
ingredients: 2 ½ cm ginger, fresh, in pieces
1 stalk lemon grass, fresh, in pieces (2.5 cm)
1 lemon, thin peel only, no white pith
½ tsp kosher salt, Diamond Crystal®
12 Atlantic deep-sea scallops, fresh, designation U10  o 12 scallops, large or jumbo, previously frozen
kosher salt, Diamond Crystal®, to taste
1 tbsp oil, e.g. grapeseed, vegetable or canola, as needed  o 1 tbsp butter, unsalted, as needed
steps: Place ginger, lemongrass, serrano pepper, shallot, garlic and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop 10 sec/speed 10. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, place simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid and cook 8 min/120°C/speed 1. Carefully remove simmering basket and set aside.

Add lemon peels, cilantro, mint, carrot juice, coconut milk, and white wine and without measuring cup cook 18 min/120°C/speed 1. Strain sauce into a bowl through a fine mesh sieve. Add lime juice and salt and set aside while searing the scallops.
Continue the recipe in the HESTAN CUE™ induction burner app, search "USA & Canada" to sear and baste the scallops in the Hestan Cue™ frying pan.
Finish scallops with a pinch of fleur de sel. Spoon Carrot and Ginger Sauce into the centre of each bowl and top with Seared Scallops. Garnish with cilantro and serve with lime wedges.
tips: Search "Thermomix" in the Hestan Cue™ app to access all Thermomix® and Hestan Cue™ Smart cooking recipes.

title: Antonio Bachour: Crème Fraîche Cheesecake with Strawberry Sherbet (Metric)
ingredients: 425 g cream cheese, cubed, room temperature
½ lime, zest only, no white pith
steps: Preheat oven to 230°F/110°C. Place a Pavoni pastel mold (see Tip) onto a baking sheet and set aside.
Place cream cheese into mixing bowl and mix 1 min/speed 3.5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 1-2 min/speed 3.5 until smooth.
Add sugar, eggs, egg yolks and milk and mix 1 min/speed 4.5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add crème fraîche and mix 1 min/speed 5.

Carefully pour cheesecake batter into each rectangular cavity, approximately ¾ full and gently tap the mold on the countertop to remove any air bubbles. Bake 40 minutes (230°F/110°C). Do not open oven door. Turn off oven, allow to sit in closed oven for another 20 minutes. Check to see if centres are set by gently shaking. Remove from oven and allow to cool (approx. 30 min.).
Cover with cling film and freeze 8 hours to overnight. Clean mixing bowl.
Insert butterfly whisk. Place whipping cream and sugar into mixing bowl and without measuring cup and without setting a time whisk speed 3, until desired stiffness is achieved.
Add lime zest, insert measuring cup and mix 20 sec/speed 3. Remove butterfly whisk. Transfer to a piping bag with nozzle and refrigerate until needed.

Place water and sugar into mixing bowl, place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and heat 5 min/100°C/speed 1, until sugar is dissolved. Transfer the simple syrup to a bowl and quickly chill in freezer (approx. 10 min.).
Place frozen strawberries and 85 g chilled simple syrup into mixing bowl, insert measuring cup and chop 15 sec/speed 8. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add Greek yoghurt and mix 30 sec/speed 5. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix a further 30 sec/speed 5. Transfer to a freezable container and freeze until set (approx. 30-60 min.).
Unmould frozen cheesecakes onto serving plates and let thaw (approx. 8-10 min.).
Pipe reserved Lime Chantilly Cream on top of cheesecakes. Place a scoop of Strawberry Sherbet on the side and garnish with fresh strawberries.
tips: Pavoni Silicone PASTEL molds can be found online and have dimensions of 125 mm x 28 mm x 28 mm H, 14 cavities. Each cavity is 96.4 g
If pastel molds are unavailable, use 2 silicone éclair molds (8 cavities each).

When the sound of the cream being whipped starts to change (approx. 30 sec.), check for doneness and continue to whip until desired consistency is achieved. The time required to obtain a stiff consistency for whipped cream depends on the temperature of the cream, its fat content and the amount of cream used. Approximate whipping time is 1-2 minutes.
